column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Kalembar
`7Subj`6:`7 I Am.  Canadian.
Dammit.  That's the last time I try to download two songs
simultaneously, using a 56k connection.  :P  Y'see?  Big
cities rock.  High-speed connections and all.  *sighs dreamily*
Anyway.  I wrote my background!  Well, a third of it.  I guess
it will do for the time being, though.  I will expand upon it
later, until it's roughly 30000 lines long.  Mua hahaha!
That's the cool thing about small towns.  Nothin' else to do,
really.  :)  *smooch*  Seeya.  :)

column7: A wee bit of war and a wee bit of mud stuff

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Aratan
`7Subj`6:`7 A wee bit of war and a wee bit of mud stuff
Well, war stuff first, as that was first on the Subject

Tal and I have been discussing various plans to get stuff moving for the legion, and to (ultimately) get them in on a trip to the Andoran area to hang around there on a semi-permenant basis, for the sake of centralized rp.
save

We've come up with a plan for it, though I still need to speak with Varulv to get his okay, but the main thing I wanted to do before that, was see if some method of regrouping forces could not be established before hand. Of the several plans Tal and I worked out, all but one (which wasn't very viable) would require casualities on the side of the Legion, and probably more than a few. To avoid becoming a phased out entity without any force, we wanted to see if we couldn't work out some method that would ensure our restocking of men beforehand, even though there is no Economy out there to purchase such troops and training.
Now, on to the second thing,

Several months ago I suggested to you the possibility of our linking with wotmud.org and combining forces. Unsuprisingly, (especially considering the number differences) they didn't much seem to care for the idea.
After looking around though, I still think the idea is not only a sound one, but a neccesary one, albeit with a targeted audience somewhat closer to home.
save

Going through the muds on topmudsites, there were some fourteen viable wotmuds that were RP based and at least on the surface, similiar to us (though there could be others, wotmud was the only one I checked)
Most disturbing of all, I found every last one of them to be in a similiar prediciment as we are. -none- had so many as twenty indivuals online.
Its akin to one big mud with rp in a dozen cities when its got support enough for perhaps one.
My sugestion would be to innitiate talks with these other muds about the possibility of merging our muds.

Concessions would no doubt have to be made to do such things like that, we can't just say "Hey, come to us!" and expect everyone to happily jump on board. But luckily the negotations at this point are your trouble as owner and imp, rather than mine *halo*
But the point is the same. If at all possible, I believe we ought to attempt to contact the admin of these MUDS and see how we could best combine all of us together.

In addition to the other 14 rp muds around though, I would also suggest we speak with the admin of roleplaying boards, While they aren't live rp, we could perhaps (and probably even more easily) encorporate our and their groups.

Who knows though, the sad thing is, it probbably won't work. I figure its worth a try, but I know how reluctant I'd be to move to another place, even with the right carrots, or to dangle carrots to others. But I figure consolidating rp, Both for us in Caemlyn, and us as a wheel of time community would probably be the best plan.

If you'd like, I'll draw up the initial greeting mail or whatever to speak with 'em, and give 'em to you to send, but that's only if you agree to think about pursuing this idea and don't want to spend the time to do so yourself innitially.  Anyhow, these are just my thoughts, and since I can't find you while you're online, I'm offerin' 'em up in a mail.
Mac

`7From`6:`7 Faulen
`7Subj`6:`7 Times =)
Hi hon!
I got mail! I'm so excited. =)... But anyway, here are some of my work schedules to give
you a better idea of when I might be online. (I live in Indiana, so we're EST... err is
it Central?... Doh, Indiana changes timezones every time I change underwear.)
Monday: 1pm - 9pm  (Playtime: After 10pm)
Tuesday: Same as above -or- Off. (Playtime: All day! Yay!)
Wednesday: 9am - 5pm  (Playtime: After 6pm)
Thursday: Ususall have this day off, but must attend band practice at 8pm. =( Gotta love
us musicians. =)
Friday: See Monday
Saturday: See Wednesday
Sunday: Work every alternate sunday, band practice at 7. Probably wont be able to play on
this day. =(
There ya go! I hope this helps... My schedule fluxuates weekly, so sometimes I work the
9-5 shift, other times its the 1-9. <shrug>. Any questions, lemme know!
Fauly

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Shai'tan
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Alicia
`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Duren Cormac Shai'tan Fredrik \
Ah, forgive the severely delayed response, but I never received
notice I had mail waiting. Apparently I have my prompt set improperly
or some such thing like that... hopefully I'm not beating a dead horse
with my response.
Yes, MiT is stagnating. I think we can all agree on that.
I do not, however, agree that Alicia's late payment (a whole 10 days,
the horror!) is a sure sign of her 'disinterest' ... She has a real
life and doesn't think of the game 24 hrs a day, it's easy to lose
track of time. Plus, I don't think MiT was in any danger of disconnection
from only 10 days of lag time in payment, I seem to recall a certain
time period a few years back in which MiT had not paid for 4-6 months,
yet was still up and running.
Sure, there are always people that think they can do a better job,
or think they know precisely where the problem lies and how to fix
it, but generally... those people don't know all of the story or
all of what has led up to that point. You are entitled to your thoughts
and opinions, Fredrik, no one can fault you for them. But, unless you've
got a better arguement and a better plan than jsut "be more active than
Alicia" I think a regime change at this point will only do more harm
than good. The mud needs to rebuild stability, not change even more
drastically.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Aratan
`7Subj`6:`7 Owl and Heron Ball, announcement
There is something written upon it:
* * * * The Queens Royal Mail System * * * *
Date: Sat Jan 25 09:06:18 2003
To: cormac
From: aemini
Owl and Heron Ball
The first of it's kind, the Owl and Heron Ball is being
carefully planned to cater to the variety of cultures
currently represented in Haven. The theme of the Owl and Heron Ball has been chosen to
be springtime. Elaborate costumes depicting animals
and flowers are already being constructed inside the
keep. The Lady Caoilin an'Shinowa, put in charge of
the festivities, has taken careful attention to having
only the most skilled seamstresses and tailors
employed to create the look of the Ball.
The Great Hall and Haven Square are to be transformed into
a springtime wonderland of trees and flowers. All of the elements
of an evening stroll beneath the stars will be employed.
The wives of the nobles currently in Haven are all a
buzz about what to wear and further, how to be certain
no one else is wearing it.
Prizes will be given out for the best and most creative
costumes. Gleemen and Illuminators will be on hand to
provide entertainment in and outside of the keep so that
all may enjoy.
Regardless, the evening promises to be enjoyed by all and
a well deserved respite before the campaign to retake
Malkier officially begins.

`7From`6:`7 Ealasaid
`7Subj`6:`7 Stuff
/* Simple example MUD */
/* Copyright 1994 Jon Leonard
* Released to the public domain.
* Minor warnings cleanup 2000
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include "net.h"
#define MAX_PLAYERS MAX_CONNECTIONS
static char *progname:
void usage(void)
fprintf(stderr,"Usage: %s\n",progname):
exit(1):
void say(char *str)
int loop:
for (loop=0:loop<MAX_PLAYERS:loop++)
if (real_connection(loop))
parsed_put_string(loop,str):
void parse_input(int which, char *buffer)
char output_buffer[160]:
if (strncmp(buffer,"say ",4) == 0)
sprintf(output_buffer,"Player %d says: %s", which, buffer+4):
say(output_buffer):
else if (strncmp(buffer,"quit",4) == 0)
sprintf(output_buffer,"Player %d quit.\n",which):
say(output_buffer):
close_connection(which):
else /* unrecognized command case */
parsed_put_string(which, "What?\n"):
void new_player(int which)
char output_buffer[160]:
sprintf(output_buffer,"Player %d", which):
sprintf(output_buffer,"Welcome, %d! (%s)\n", which, connection_name(which)):
say(output_buffer):
void end_player(int which)
char output_buffer[160]:
sprintf(output_buffer,"Bye, %d!\n",which):
say(output_buffer):
int main(int argc, char **argv)
char read_buffer[80]:
int which:
/* save the name we were invoked as */
progname = argv[0]:
/* complain if bad arguments */
if (argc > 1)
usage():
/* initialize the networking */
setup_socket(2121):
while(1)
read_buffer[0] = 0:
while ((which = get_message(read_buffer,80,1,0)) == -1)
if (*read_buffer)
parse_input(which, read_buffer):
} else {
if (real_connection(which))
new_player(which):
else
end_player(which):
/* and clean up */
cleanup_socket():
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

to vote on.  There needs to be a link added somewhere

from there, no matter what user/pass you enter, it just redisplays that same page.

`7From`6:`7 Guy
`7Subj`6:`7 here ya go
`7CC`6: `7Duren Guy
Tyme's Needs:
1. Working fighting system.
- Move away from the turn-based combat system
o Perhaps hold a vote as to which type of system players would like
to see put in place.
2, Craft a Channeling System afterwards to match the fighting system.
- Perhaps continue with the dynamic channeling system.
3. Evaluation of Current Imm's:
o Rhiannon
o Shai'tan
o Bethany
o Syrah
o Varulv
o Aidan
o Faerid
o Cormac
4. Get the guilds going again.
- Have a reapplication of current guildleaders.
- Only open guilds if they have at least five people to be in that guild.
5. Get compotent book players back in the game.
6. Get an event department.
- put quest equipment back like it was
7. Re-write policy.
- short, less restrictive, common sense.
8. Get our playerbase back.
o post on various sites.
- perhaps pay for an advertisement on mudconnector and kyndig
o do not do this until we have a working system again.
9. Building
- go back to the equipment we had before and just get the fighting system
to work with the things we had.@l

o Rhiannon
o Shai'tan
o Bethany
o Syrah

o Aidan

o Cormac
4. Get the guilds going again.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Guy
`7Subj`6:`7 my post
I would just like to start this with a bit of good news (of course all of
it could be good news to some of you, but we won't go into that)....
Player pages are in. Go to http://tyme.envy.com/players.php and you will
find a link to Create/Alter your personal player page. To have picture up
you will need to link it to the site from somewhere else (unless you can
convince someone to upload it on to the server for you). I have put in a
forced size on the pictures, which is 130 pixels by 130 pixels. So as long
as your picture is a perfect square it should size down right. If you do
not want a picture then just leave it blank and a No Photo Available pic
will be put up in it's place.
So now on to the fun part of this post. I'm leaving, plain and simple. Here
are my reasons why. It is no longer fun to be here. The upper levels of the
staff can't make up their mind on what they want to do, nor can they get
things done in a reasonable amount of time. It's been close to a month since
the vote closed and Duren can't even say where in the timeline we will be
because he says he is waiting on Alicia to log in and discuss it. Sure that
is reasonable if she ever logs on, but it's been almost a month as well since
she last logged on. (Alicia, please don't try to tell me you log on every
day again and ask Duren if I want proof. I am a coder, I have access to syslogs
and the mysql database. I know when people have been on last if I want to talk
to them.)
Another problem I have with this place is it isn't going anywhere. To put it
in Alicia's own words, "Stagnation is better than change just for the sake of
change." this was in regards to what she believed was my putting up the vote
on a whim. No no, while yes I did push for it to go up, I did take it to an
imp before I spent all that time writing the php to handle web voting.
So you ask, why don't I do anything about it. I tried. I asked Alicia if I
could take the mud (as well as a number of other people in the past month
or two.) All she did was laugh and ruffle my hair as if I was some kid. Well
guess what, I'm gone now, ruffle someone elses hair for a while.
So basically I'm tired. I've got no real time to devote here, but I gave up
sleeping many a time in the past to work here, and if it were worth it now
I would do it still. I was inspired a few weeks ago when I thought things
might happen and busted my ass to get that website up, wrote up the design
for the channeling system, and talked to plenty an older player who I keep
in contact with to get them to come back. Alot of them considered it if the
changes that we all thought were needed were going to happen. Well my hair
got ruffled. Thanks. You log on for one hour in a month and a half and just
ruffle my hair. yeah.....
So ladies and germs, I've taken it into my own hands, being the prankster that
I have always been, and have changed the Legion and Male Channelers guilds back
to the Band of the Red Hand and the Asha'man guilds respectively. The tags (channels
and such) for those are now RH and AM respectively as well. I say go play in the
book timeline, right around the end of book 6, which is where both of those guilds
would have come back in. It's a good place. There isn't too much open for question
at that point in the timeline and all the major players are in place for a fun time.
Of course I can't make such a deciscion, but it was damn fun to change the code.
Take it easy, I'm off to work on a mud where things change, I get to make the changes
I feel are nessecary, and my co-workers are just as inspired if not more so to make
things work.
Guy
Also known as: Janus, Vallyn, Radim, Harin, Armein, S

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Than
`7Subj`6:`7 Timeline
`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Bethany
Timeline, I suggest Book 4.  Probably the end, so as to let the Aiel back into
the world.  Since the shift is supposed to bring back these guilds, yes?
* Reason 1)Andor and Cairhien are still free, allowing the DD to still have some
wiggle room before the Iron Hand of Rand comes crashing down like a
sledge hammer.
* Reason 2)Rand and Mat are still powerful enough at this point to begin both
the BotRH as well as the Asha'man.  The amnesty can be declared in
Tear, and men can go there for training.  Mat can also reform the
Tairen army into the beginnings of the BotRH (as it was in part
founded this way anyway).
* Reason 3)Rand can have his bastion of power, a bit away from the central
RP zones (Cairhien/Andor/Tar Valon) and those following him would
still have enough of a reason to be in these RP zones.
* Why?     Because this way, there are still enough PC driven forces to allow
for some PC driven initives, as well there is enough Rand sloppily
gaining power that things can be done there as well, from an admin
standpoint.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Varulv
`7Subj`6:`7 The fall of Saldaea
`7CC`6: `7Shai'tan Duren Nicodemus Varulv
This isn't something I'd expected to find myself doing, but I'm
writing this mail to make a case for the fall of Saldaea, a la Malkier.
ICly, of course, here is my reasoning.  I posted on the update board
quite some time ago that Saldaea was in danger of being overrun by the
shadow.  I personally warned the ruler of Saldaea, who has made no calls
for help from other borderland nations.  Regardless, the truth of the
matter is on the update board for any and all to see.  The legion, well
aware of Saldaea's plight (this came about partly at aratan's request),
has left for Aringill for OOC reasons, leaving Saldaea helpless.
This went unnoticed by me for the better part of a month, because of my
shitty internet connection.  But the fact is that the Shadow has been
building up troops and making preparations for the Malkier campaign.
Saldaea was originally intended as a feint to draw troops and attention
away from Malkier and into Saldaea, but now that the legion has all but
withdrawn from the borderlands as a whole, there is no reason to hold back.
At the very least, I would like to see the shadow break through Saldaea's
walls.  What happens from there would of course depend on the IC reactions
of other nations.  Saldaea doesn't have to fall like Malkier did, if more
troops are committed.  But I believe the possibility should be left open.
-- Varulv

`7From`6:`7 Valoc
`7Subj`6:`7 Mud Status
I attempted to mail you earlier and dont know if it went thru because i lost connection.
I am worried about the status of the mud. I have seen it going down hill for awhile now and it bothers me.
I realize it is not your fault, it was going down before you even obtained it. I have seen however the stress it has put on you. And am only assuming this is why you rarely log in anymore.

What I propose is to remove some of that stress if you allow. I would like to take payment over and attempt to turn the downward spiral around. I am able to log in from work (10 hours a day) give or take laptop recharge time of a couple hours, and am willing to put the time needed in.
I have been trying to get ahold of you for awhile now with no luck, so please email me at: burdett@covad.net

when you get the message. I would email you but forgot what your email was. I know you have been asked by others to have them take over payment. I am asking because i feel i can turn this around. I have been here as long as you if not longer, since april 95, and really think if this place as a second home. Recently however things have  not been to good here as we all know. I would like to change that. Please let me know what you think, and if you do decide to do this, do not feel that you have to leave, I do not want to change anything with staff. Thanks in advance.
Valoc

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Layne
`7Subj`6:`7 TMC
Heya,
I want to do this so it doesn't sound like I am being rude.  In an August posting
on the proj show board (#12 I think) you mentioned the mudconnector as
a place where the people would not understand Tyme's rp.   While I respect
your opinion I have to disagree with it.  Several people who post regularly on TMC
have rped (in some cases for years) on Tyme and other WOT muds.   Many of
the posters have coded for Tyme or been a staff member.  Lack of knowledge on
rp or how Tyme's rp works is not the problem.
Unfortunately (if you are looking for good staff) TMC is not the best place to hunt.  Most of the
regulars are hip-deep in their own coding, building or rp projects and can't find the time
(no pun intended) to take on another.  The 'mud staffing' board is overrun with want ads and
it is difficult to wade through them.
Tyme is at a disadvantage as Narsil (I am agreeing with Narsil-gawd someone shoot me) and
other have said in that your (in the mud sense) vision is not clear.   Most good staff will not
take on the responcibility with a clear idea of where the mud is going and how they
are expected to fit in to help the vision along.
I realize some of my comments are not timely.  Your post was made in August and I
can see some changes are already being made.
I have hated watching Tyme's decline.  Several months ago a friend talked me into considering rping
here again.  Unfortunately his work schedule increased and I found myself trying to figure
out what was for all purposes a new mud.  Unlike when I began mudding, I simply don't have the time
to spend several hours a day at it.  (my problem, not a mud problem)
I just wanted to wish you luck in getting things back on track.   (well, okay..I wanted to clarify a bit
on TMC too...(grin)
Layne

are expected to fit in to help the vision along.
I realize some of my comments are not timely.  Your post was made in August and I
can see some changes are already being made.
I have hated watching Tyme's decline.  Several months ago a friend talked me into considering rping
here again.  Unfortunately his work schedule increased and I found myself trying to figure
out what was for all purposes a new mud.  Unlike when I began mudding, I simply don't have the time
to spend several hours a day at it.  (my problem, not a mud problem)
I just wanted to wish you luck in getting things back on track.   (well, okay..I wanted to clarify a bit
on TMC too...(grin)
Layne
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Layne
`7Subj`6:`7 TMC
Heya,
I want to do this so it doesn't sound like I am being rude.  In an August posting
on the proj show board (#12 I think) you mentioned the mudconnector as
a place where the people would not understand Tyme's rp.   While I respect
your opinion I have to disagree with it.  Several people who post regularly on TMC
have rped (in some cases for years) on Tyme and other WOT muds.   Many of
the posters have coded for Tyme or been a staff member.  Lack of knowledge on
rp or how Tyme's rp works is not the problem.
Unfortunately (if you are looking for good staff) TMC is not the best place to hunt.  Most of the
regulars are hip-deep in their own coding, building or rp projects and can't find the time
(no pun intended) to take on another.  The 'mud staffing' board is overrun with want ads and
it is difficult to wade through them.
Tyme is at a disadvantage as Narsil (I am agreeing with Narsil-gawd someone shoot me) and
other have said in that your (in the mud sense) vision is not clear.   Most good staff will not
take on the responcibility with a clear idea of where the mud is going and how they
are expected to fit in to help the vision along.
I realize some of my comments are not timely.  Your post was made in August and I
can see some changes are already being made.
I have hated watching Tyme's decline.  Several months ago a friend talked me into considering rping
here again.  Unfortunately his work schedule increased and I found myself trying to figure
out what was for all purposes a new mud.  Unlike when I began mudding, I simply don't have the time
to spend several hours a day at it.  (my problem, not a mud problem)
I just wanted to wish you luck in getting things back on track.   (well, okay..I wanted to clarify a bit
on TMC too...(grin)
Layne
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Duren
`7Subj`6:`7 Your mail

Heya,
I want to do this so it doesn't sound like I am being rude.  In an August posting
on the proj show board (#12 I think) you mentioned the mudconnector as 
a place where the people would not understand Tyme's rp.   While I respect
your opinion I have to disagree with it.  Several people who post regularly on TMC 
have rped (in some cases for years) on Tyme and other WOT muds.   Many of 
the posters have coded for Tyme or been a staff member.  Lack of knowledge on 
rp or how Tyme's rp works is not the problem.
... What the heck are you talking about?  I never said peple on TMC would not
understand Tyme's RP.
As far as having a clear vision... I'm sorry, this one makes me laugh.
You people go around touting "We need a vision."  I've made it very clear,
countless times, what our goals are, and yet I still get people like you
who complain because there is no 'vision'... What the hell are you talking about?
How many times do I have to state our goals and objectives?  And I realize TMC is
not a good place to look for staff, but it's the best place that exists right
now.  Our goals and objectives have been stated countless times, not only by me,
but by the imps before me.  It doesn't change the fact that w/out coders, they
will never be accomplished.
I appreciate the mail, don't get me wrong, but I've got tons of people telling me
what they think we (or I) are doing wrong.  And everyone has a different
opinion and everyone has a different idea for how to fix it.  So
it really doesn't do me, or the mud any good.
-Duren

`7From`6:`7 Layne
`7Subj`6:`7 tmc - not tyme
OKay, lets see if I can do this so it doesnt look weird...
***The only other place to find staff is on sites like mudconnector.  But folks
from there usually have no idea how things work here, no idea about the style
of roleplay.***
(from proj show 12 12)
I am sorry.  I should have been clearer.  My point was many of the people on TMC -have-
immed or played on Tyme in the past.  The problem with TMC is number of good
people available and getting the message to them, rather than them not being
qualified.   (in general)
As for being one of the 'you people', I think you have me confused with someone else.
I have never mailed, nor posted about the muds problems to you or to
anyone else.  I only mailed you because I felt your characterization of TMC was
in error.
As for the rest, maybe you are tired of hearing 'vision'.  Maybe all the mud needs is imms and
players willing to put a lot of effort into it.  I don't know.  I never claimed to know.  I do know
that this is probably the lowest I have ever seen Tyme.  (and I started playing it over 8 years ago)
And I really hate to mention this but you guys have had some of the best coders.   Do they
burn out?  You say people do not want to imm here.  In the past people wanted to imm here so
badly they would often give up posts on other muds.  It was considered an honor to -get- to
imm here.  If you could find a way to make it feel that way again you would likely
have all the active staff you need.  Of course, (cough) i have no clue how to do that.  But,
I never said I did.  I am sorry you are frustrated but I am really not the cause of that.
I will refrain from any comments about the mud and perhaps you will not be so annoyed at me.
Thanks again,   -Kat (Layne)

`7From`6:`7 Starin
`7Subj`6:`7 Rp log
Starin shakes his head sadly. "No...." Instead of leaving, he sat down next to the man staring at the fire. "Whats so strange?" he said. He didn't see any reasone to call the fire strange.
Starin raises his eyebrow. "I still don't get it." He looks at the man expectantly. "What's wrong?"
Starin blinks. "Woah. Light, thats strange....." He shook his head and went to join Niamh. "Hey. How are you fairing?"

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Dugoth
`7Subj`6:`7 Wolfkin Guild Membership
Well, you went linkdead on me so I'll drop you a mail to explain the
details of your guilding :) Firstly, since I mentioned the goldeneyes
in your desc before, I'll clarify that, even though you're guilded
now, you still wouldn't experience any of the yellow eyes changing
or a Wolfkin's special abilities (like enhanced smell) until you have
had some sort of RP involving the wolves talking to you.
You'll also need to ask me next time you see me to get you set up with
the actual goldeneyes talent as well. You'll need to be relevelled
once this is done (is resets your practices from your stats more or
less) because the talent changes your levelling modifier, but it's not
a big deal. There -are- code benifits to being a Wolfkin, and they're
tied in with this talent.
Now, other details. To speak on the wolfkin guild channel you type
'wk text', like you would 'ooc text' or something. There is also a
guild board which you should read (yes, some long posts but you
should be familiar with all of em mostly). To see the guildboard
you can type 'glboard wk show' and to see specific posts you type
'glboard wk show #'. Comments to threads can be seen with
'glboard wk show post# comment#'. It works like the public project
board (proj show). That should get you started at least, and feel
more then free to ask me or another wk any questions you may have.
You can see which Wolfkin (wk) are online by typing 'who -m wk -r'
Have fun :)
Dugoth

column7: You know, I hate to even ask this since I have had so many arguments with

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Talavin
`7Subj`6:`7 You know, I hate to even ask this since I have had so many arguments with
-grumble-
Ignore the subject line.
You know, I hate to even ask this since I have had so many arguments with
War Council over the years but I would like to double the size of the Band
maintaining the same proportions. This is to maintain the Banner General ranks
already held by the current guildees and to give the Band more of a punch
for a possible plotline we have in mind.
The original Band at the time of Merone (they grew after that) was,
3k infantry under Dearid (75% pike / 25% archers)
1.5K Cavalry under Talmanes (Light or Heavy not specified)
1.5K Cavalry under Nalesean (Light or Heavy not specified)
I would like to propose another Banner (3K) of Infantry under Rayse. These would
be mostly Tearians, Cairhienins and Andorans much like the cuurent Banner.
I would also like to propose 3K of Shienarans Heavy Cavalry under Aratan and
Tallyn (Talavin) giving them each a Banner of 1.5k each.
My IC explination of them is that they were a force originally of 4K sent south
by Agelmar Jagad to stem the invasion of the Shaido who linked up with Mat and
the Band after the battle of Cairhien. (Jagad fought at the Shining Walls and
didn't want to see that destruction again so he sent this expeditionary force
under two of his most trusted Captains.
Tal

column7: Things Needed for an Equipment System

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ranulf
`7Subj`6:`7 Things Needed for an Equipment System
Header One:  Things needed for a suffecient Equipment System -
Coding aspect - Debugg info when Wielding. - Fixed?
Change in code so that AC values can be 1-100, not just 1-20.
Tax and Price Systems based off material composition Values.
Building aspect -
Going through zones 37 and 38, and making stats fit to the WATrialerror.DOC sheet
Creating shop(s) in caemlyn to sell zone 37 and 38 equipment.
- Things that can be gotten around for now, but really ought to be done. -
Make certain weight value is read by the system so that an entered value of 10 is equivelent to 1 pound, not ten pounds

Make the AC value mean a percentage of the sustained damage that is blocked (say hit for 75, you have ac of 10(%), then 7.5 is blocked) instead of how it is currently, (you have ac of 10 and hit for 75, then you're dealt 65 damage)
Check the manner in which Hit Roll is handled.
Balance the equipment.
Make certain that Composition values can be applied to every item, No matter what "Type" flag.
Check to see how well 'range' on items works. (it seems to be slightly screwy right now)
Go through -all- items and set their stats according to current system
Make a different flag for bows than crossbows, and make ranged weapons handle differently than just being a contact weapon with an ungodly range.
Over-haul craft system.
That's about all I can think of for the moment, but there's probably more.
Like I've said here and earlier. Getting equipment in fully is going to be an ungodly task, but getting equipment in partially/suffeciently is very possible.
Best way to do this, is to follow what's under the 1rst header. But there are two other points to consider. First. Give people Tool, and when its completed, Craft.

Second, if you can find a way to make the cost of items be determined in the shops you set up for zone 37/38 equipment, by their composition costs, and all the other shops by their "Value" flag costs, it would make all shops work and sell things at a reasonably appropriate price. (Players getting equipment that does nothing, if its non 37/38 battle eq, isn't an issue, as even if a player has an item created, tooled it, etc. Oediting it will still change its stats.

The third and last piece is an appropriate tax system. Very few people will want to buy equipment with our current tax system on items. It'll make them go broke quickly, make it so they will have to upkeep their charachters, if they want to keep the items (ie, preventing people who check in fairly regularly, but don't get to rp regularly) and generate a general apathy and distaste

For now, Making a timer on equipment that will make it wear out (and have them fix it once its broken (use the old (Broken) flag) or have the items break during combat, is probably a much more desirable format. Also, money should be taxed more heavily than items, and some items should be exempt from taxes (my damnable warder cloak, for instance!)
I think that's about it, though it probably isn't.
Mac

Well - you lost your link, so I can only assume that your father made you switch off your computer or something

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Garen
`7Subj`6:`7 Tyranus's background

Tyranus Degrevaunt was born in Aringill of Andoran and Cairhienin stock. Genetic worked in the man's favor, and his appearance combines the best of both nationalities -- black hair and pale skin, combined with strong Andoran features, hazel eyes, and a stature that hides any Cairhienin blood.

His father, a reasonably well-off merchant, moved the family to Cairhien when Tyranus was just a boy. But the lad always missed Andor and never really settled in Cairhien. Finally, his father shipped him off to live with an uncle in Caemlyn when Tyranus was 14 years old.

Tyranus came into his own then, helping around his uncle's shop and gaining a reputation as a hard worker, if a little on the dull side. He grew up into a large, strong man with very handsome features. At a young age, he decided on the Queen's Guard as his means to advancement. Particularly in the uniform, Tyranus cuts a dashing figure.

Over the years, he has proven a capable soldier and, later a reasonably capable officer. He is as popular with the ladies as ever, and his men find him equally good company -- if in a different manner, of course.

It is Tyranus's superiors who generally find fault with the man. He has a reputation for doing things strictly by the book -- a reputation that leads further to the idea that the man has little imagination. In other words, a fine fellow to call when reinforcements are needed, but not the sort you want attempting to solve a mysterious crime. Behind his back, some oficers occasionally suggest he would have made an excellent Child of the Light.

Of course, there is an upside to that too. He is unswervingly loyal, a good Queen's man, and the men he commands, now that he has risen to the rank of senior file leader, recognize that quality in him and often follow through with loyalty and high morale of their own.

As a result, Tyranus has risen to his current height in the Queen's Guard -- arguably a height that a man of his mediocre capabilities should not have. Still, despite his lack of imagination, he is a skillful soldier, loyal, and brave almost to a fault. For ten years now, he has served the Queen with nary an eyeblink or question -- and therein lies both his strength and his weakness.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Avian
`7Subj`6:`7 Avian's Background
--Character Name Avian
--Email address: niamhbt@earthlink.net

--Physical Description Avian is near six foot tall. Her hair is fire red it hangs low on her back, though she keeps it held back with a dark scarf. Her eyes are a blue sapphire, that sparkle when she's angry, which isn't very often.
--Place of Birth/Raising: Naikai Clan Black Cliffs Sept
--Character History

Avian was born sixteen naming days ago. She never knew her father, for he had went off to fight against the Tree Killers when Lamen sinned. He never returned from the dance. Her mother had been a simple woman, one who had cared for Avian, along with her fellow Sister wife. Avian grew up a happy child, learning about blood feuds, clan wars and lack of water. She rarely fussed or acted out as a child, though most Aiel children don't.

On her fifteenth naming day her mother learned that Avian, was destined to be a wise one. She could channel. This made her mother filled with pride, her not becoming a Maiden. The woman didn't see anything wrong with Maidens, but Avian was the last thing she had on this earth, and despit being Aiel was protective of her only daughter. When the Wise Ones at her Sept had taught her what they could they sent her off to the Wise Ones that guard Rhuidean to be tested.
When the Car'a'carn came and broke them, the Aiel moved out of Three Fold Land. She followed the Wise One's hoping to finish her lessons. And hopes to go back to Rhiudean one day to become Wise One.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Bertram
`7Subj`6:`7 Update for Andor
Lord Coelan has recently announced the engagement of his Daughter, Lady Emilia to Lord Kolthis Traemane,
High Seat of House Traemane, and Captain-General of the Queen's guards.
There have been whispers that the union is more political than romantic, these comments fueled, no doubt,
by the age gap between the two.  No date for the wedding has been set as of yet, but it seems that the lady
Coelan is keen to have the wedding sooner, rather than later, as she has already engaged a number of well known
seamstresses to work on a gown.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Gestahl
`7Subj`6:`7 re-mail about SS-control ablity
`7CC`6: `7Shai'tan Varulv
Hello,
As requested, here's a slightly more elaborate description of the ability
that I am applying for.
As we know, Aginor was the main actor behind the creation of Shadowspawn.
Trollocs and Myrdraal are the most common shadowspawn that are related to
humans.  Myrdraal are however not "lesser" SS, but trollocs are.  So the
Trollocs are the shadowspawn that the requested ability concerns.
We also know that groups of Trollocs can often be connected (or bonded)
to a Myrdraal.  The connection is so strong that the death of a Myrdraal
usually results in the deaths of all trollocs who are connected to that
Myrdraal.  This connection would be precisely the topic of my study, and
the ablility that I would gain from the study would allow me to "overtake"
the ownership of the connection from a Myrdraal, or establish a new one
if none exists.  In effect, it's about taking the control of arbitrary
Trollocs, within reasonable limits.  After all, my ability is merely a
simulation of what a Myrdraal does, so I would be limited to controlling
at most 3 Trollocs, for example.  Breaking a connection between a Myrdraal
and his Trollocs would be limited as well - say, at most 2 Trollocs could
be "overtaken".
The degree of control is subject to limitations as well.  There would
always be a limit on how precise the orders could be.  Due to the compulsive
nature of orders, things like "everyone who wears white must die" would be
possible to implant, but "find and kill Joe", or "pick up the spoon" would
be impossible.
The details of how the research would have been conducted can be discussed
separately.
Regards,
Gestahl

but not me personally, the SC guild was allowed a small cache of

to using any of them in the end as no-one ICly did anything worth
rewarding that much but the GLs had 4 'slots' for things they could

pretty much okay as long as you're not silly'.

with the GLs since I argued so damn long to get them in the first
place :P

by a motorbike! See how you like that!
Savvy, who did actually get run over by a bike on Thursday and went
to casualty to get some stitches in his head, but is okay now, it being
made of solid bone and all :>

Savvy, who did actually get run over by a bike on Thursday and went
to casualty to get some stitches in his head, but is okay now, it being
made of solid bone and all :>
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Kolthis
`7Subj`6:`7 Meldorf et al
`7CC`6: `7Matylena Cashel
This message is mostly OOC.
On the Matter of Meldorf - since he's already arrested - there's no need
for Kolthis to be involved, since another Magistrate (Maty) is already on
the case.
On the matter of Lannes Andronic, as Maty said - he will be tried under
Andoran Law, though since he's a noble it is unlikely he would be 'formally'
arrested as such, rather cordiall invited (read demanded) to come to a
hearing.
For Alaura Reesad things are a little different - since she's a foreign
noble - or at least Claims to be, since she has nothing with her to back
it up ICly at the moment, as far as I'm aware.
However, since she at least claims to be a noble, I would be wary of
actually arresting her, since that could cause more of an incident - so I
would go with the same 'cordial invitation' to a hearing.  If you want
Kolthis to be there - let me know when it is and I will see what I can do
just remember I live in a different time-zone to most people (Meldorf
excepted ...)
Kolthis

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Meldorf
`7Subj`6:`7 Daes Daemar
`7CC`6: `7Alaura Meldorf Starin
As the subject says, thats what I think we should do to gain more
information.
Today, as Alaura has already been informed, I saw Taregan, Princess
of Saldaea.  Why is she here?  What is her perpose here?  Such a
high figure would not be here unless there was a reason.  I have
reason to link that to Lord Hawek, or perhaps some Daes Daemar that
might gain us some good information.  Because Alaura is a noble, I
think I could contact Tarefan again and get a meeting for Alaura
and her.  I believe if we gave her false information about Lord
Hawek or a few other things we can make up, then maybe she will
take that information in exchange for hers.  Though hopefully her
information will be real.  i.e. We have reason to believe Lord
Hawek has links with the Children of the Light, and with gaining
control of the throne he can get a foot hold into the highest of
royalty, gaining even more information for the Whitecloaks.
For all I know, that could be true, but it's something we can make
up for now, and hopefully we can gain the info we want from
Taregan.  OK, if you feel like talking about this, reply, best send
to all three of us with CC's so you don't need to send the same
message three times.
Meldorf

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Meldorf
`7Subj`6:`7 Information
25th December 2003
The Crow's Nest
ic  Maeldrin (Balcion) takes on the image of a working man as a
disguise.
ic  Balcion (ooc Maeldrin) has a group called Black Lions, they
hire for an unknown reason.  His men disguise themselves
with cloaks and shadows.  They carry many weapons.  Balcion
always tend to take threats to people to get them to join.
He told Lakkam to strongly consider his offer and when he
agrees, to meet him at the Lion's Den and leave word with
the bartender and he will find Lakkam.
ic  Deion asked about Lord Hawek at the table of Simwen (my:retainer), Maeldrin and Lakkam.  Maeldrin (Balcion) replied,

I have read his proclamations and heard some rumors, but
that is all I care to learn for the moment. Such strife
within a nation promotes business, and as long as he exists,
I shall prosper, as shall my brethren.
ic  Simwen (retainer to Meldorf) spread a made up rumor about
Lord Hawek having connections with Whitecloaks.  This rumor
was spread to Lakkam and Deion (he called himself Roic).
Frodlem
**This message was sent by pigeon mail**

board.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
`7Subj`6:`7 Black Lion Division Ranks
Ebony Claws of the Lion:
Unblooded Claw of the Lion, known as a Pale Claw
Bloodied Claw of the Lion, known as a Crimson Claw
Rending Claw of the Lion, known as a Sunderer (title could be tweaked)
Raking Claw of the Lion, known as a Reaver
Ebony Claw of the Lion, title of one who leads a select 'division'
Ebony Claws of the Lion: Painful Truth, Black Wrath, Looming Noose
Painful Truth are the 'Inquisitors' of the Black Lions, torturing for information
Black Wrath are the extortionists of the Black Lions
Looming Noose are the black-mailers of the Black Lions
Those leading each division bear the title of the division as their own
Crimson Eyes of the Lion:
Blind-Lion of Caemlyn, known as an Untried Eye or the Unseeing
Alley-Eye of Caemlyn, known as a Slinker
Tavern-Eye of Caemlyn, known as a Prowler (not the same as general rank)
Stalking Lion of Caemlyn, known as a Stalker or Night-Hunter
Crimson Eye of the Lion, title of one who leads a select 'division'
Crimson Eyes of the Lion: The Unseen, The Unheard, The Weighted Scales
The Unseen are the smugglers of the Black Lions
The Unheard are the thieves of the Black Lions
The Weighted Scales are the fences of the Black Lions
Those leading each division bear the title of the division as their own
Silent Roar of the Lion:
Quiet Blade, referred to as Reborn
Whispered Struggle, referred to as Initiate
Silent Dispatch, referred to as Assassin
Swift Release, referred to as Death's Scythe
Shadow of Death, referred to as Hand of Death
Master Assassins of the Black Lions: Bloodless End, Brutal Slaughter, Last Breath
Bloodless End deal with accidental appearing deaths
Brutal Slaughter are used for intimidation assassinations
Last Breath are specialty assassinations
All that rule over the entirety of a division: Ebony Claws, Crimson Eyes, Silent Roar
are known as Balcions of 'said division' or just Balcion.
Work needs to be done on some of these, but this is a rough draft of what I
had in mind. Ranks are open to be filled, and there is room for NPCs should such
a need arise.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Lyana
`7Subj`6:`7 stuff
1] I generally dislike commenting on boards, especially about such things
2] as the topic of this thread.  I have enough posting to do with my alt
3] and enough dealings with problematic players to last me a life time,
4] but one adjusts to it.  First, please learn to read previous posts.
5] While it's all well and good to want to defend your friends, be sure
6] your response actually makes sense in light of the discussion and
7] doesn't deteriorate into useless finger pointing. *peer Meldorf* Second,
8] I would like to say that while "just guild 'em and get rid of 'em if they
9] screw up" seems like a nice idea - it never works that way.  Much more
10] difficult to remove someone once their guilded - rules to follow, etc.
11] This is especially true when one's GL is a softy. *peers duggie*
13] Okay, now on to the actual topic of the thread - Tria.  I'm going to
14] have to say "Nay" to her guilding often for several different reasons.
16] Activity is not a good indicator of a good guildee for any guild. The
17] most active people can actually make the worst guildees - Perhaps they
18] are too attached to their characters or forget this is a game. I'm not
19] sure and I really don't want to go into the finer details.
21] Wolkin are suposed to be the most special and rare group on the Game.
22] In part this is because of the rarity in the books - but it also has to
23] do with our abilities and the difficulty in playing someone whose very
24] soul is in the wild.  We have to accept consequences for our actions
25] on a much deeper level than many other groups.  Our eyes and odd tics
26] set apart... what one does, draws attention to the rest.  Though it's
27] often not played up, Randland is not modern America/Canada/Europe were
28] differences can be exhaulted.  Fear, hatred, distrust... just because
29] we've got funky eyes and even unease in the open-minded.  That's just
30] because we have funky eyes and before they even realize we talk to
31] animals - animals with lots of superstition and hatred (misplaced)
32] about them.  Tria has shown an unwilliness to accept consequences for
33] her actions, icly and oocly.  I'm sorry but "They all hate me" and "I
34] didn't know" aren't reasons that hold a lot of weight with me.
36] That very trait makes the idea of her being in a guild that is at first
37] glance so vastly independent and on so many deeper levels intimately
38] connected ICly.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Makenna
`7Subj`6:`7 Guild Application
`7CC`6: `7Lafargo Lyana Bertram
Dear Daes Dae'mar GLs,
Thankyou for taking the time to consider my application. Though
I would like to keep my previous record of alts within the guild
confidential I would like to tell you that I have been in and
out of this very guild for six years, however currently I do
not hold any position within the Daes Daemar guild at present
I have held prestigious positions in the past. Below is a copy
of my description and background for your approval. If anything
should cause a descrepencey I would appreicate any help you
could offer to insure it meets your high standards. The speed
in which you would reply affects how soon I can begin seeking
my sponsors so I would appreicate any information as soon as
possible. Thankyou for your time and I look forward to discussing
this further at your convience.
The intricate braided pattern of honey coloured hair gathered beneath
a golden net appears glossy when the light touches it. Her sunkissed
face could belong to any goodwife except the complicated style of the
woman reveals otherwise. Dressed in a rich burgundy dress of Andoran
cut it is evident by the metalic sheen of her belted waist that she
is slender, however there is nothing fragile about this woman. Blinking
blue eyes drink in her surroundings framed by transparent bleached
eyelashes and eyebrows. Her cheeks are unnaturaly touched with a bit
of rouge and the glossy shine of her pink lips also appears unnatural.
Several whisps of hair fall onto her long graceful neck uncaught by
the golden net and intricate braid. Though youth still clings to her
simple features she is no longer a child, but a woman who could have
already celebrated her 30th nameday.
Makenna Trakand is the youngest and only daughter of the prestigious
Willard and Tarasita Trakand. With 7 older brothers she was a favorite
of her fathers and still adored by her brothers, her mother, who she
bares striking respeblence to fell sickly shortly after her birth and
did not survive her daughters first year of life. Without a mother and
with a royal bloodline aswell abundant wealth she was induldge even as
a young child. She adored arts, fashion even then and was a prize pupil
of her tutors. She was introduced to Penelope Avery at the age of six.
Penelope was the daughter of a minor Andoran House hold, however the
two girls became instant friends. When Makenna came into her 25th year
studying was simply not enough for her any longer. She desired to see
all that she had learned about for herself. Asking Penolope to accompany
her was an honor the unimportant house of Avery could not pass up and
so with her friend and a small accompany of men her father has specificaly
chosen she set out to discover the world. Her adventures took her
from place to place, funded by her father of course untill the tragic
news of her fathers sudden passing brought an overwhelming grief and
sense of guilt to Makenna. Instead of returning home to her brothers and
the 'wives' as she called her seven sister-in-laws who disapproved of
Makenna's freedom to roam the world or were rather envious of it she
returned instead to Andor, taking up residence in the Royal Palace with
her fathers youngest and widowed four times sister. Her brothers approved
of her sudden desire to settle down hoping she will at long last find
a suitable husband on her own, none of them wanting to saddle their
beloved little sister with a planned marriage and unwanted husband. Her
oldest brother Wilfred now in his 54th year tends to her funds and
property of the lands origionaly her mothers before wedding her father
that was left to her. Also Wilfred manages the substantial dowery of
another considerable property that will become hers and her husbands
upon marriage. Makenna has seen neither and seems to care little, holding
her propority very dear and never seen in the presence of a man without
her trusted Penelope. Those who like her would say Makenna is witty,
charming and educated. Those that do not would see her as a gossip,
a fake or perhaps self rightous. She is a woman accustomed to getting
her way using compliments or information as she sees fit, however her
generosity to a begger on the street or kindness toward an orphaned
child has won the hearts of those common and royal alike.

chosen she set out to discover the world. Her adventures took her
from place to place, funded by her father of course untill the tragic
news of her fathers sudden passing brought an overwhelming grief and
sense of guilt to Makenna. Instead of returning home to her brothers and
the 'wives' as she called her seven sister-in-laws who disapproved of
Makenna's freedom to roam the world or were rather envious of it she
returned instead to Andor, taking up residence in the Royal Palace with
her fathers youngest and widowed four times sister. Her brothers approved
of her sudden desire to settle down hoping she will at long last find
a suitable husband on her own, none of them wanting to saddle their
beloved little sister with a planned marriage and unwanted husband. Her
oldest brother Wilfred now in his 54th year tends to her funds and
property of the lands origionaly her mothers before wedding her father
that was left to her. Also Wilfred manages the substantial dowery of
another considerable property that will become hers and her husbands
upon marriage. Makenna has seen neither and seems to care little, holding
her propority very dear and never seen in the presence of a man without
her trusted Penelope. Those who like her would say Makenna is witty,
charming and educated. Those that do not would see her as a gossip,
a fake or perhaps self rightous. She is a woman accustomed to getting
her way using compliments or information as she sees fit, however her
generosity to a begger on the street or kindness toward an orphaned
child has won the hearts of those common and royal alike.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7CC`6: `7Lafargo Lyana Bertram
Dear Daes Dae'mar GLs,
Thankyou for taking the time to consider my application. Though
I would like to keep my previous record of alts within the guild
confidential I would like to tell you that I have been in and
out of this very guild for six years, however currently I do
not hold any position within the Daes Daemar guild at present
I have held prestigious positions in the past. Below is a copy
of my description and background for your approval. If anything
should cause a descrepencey I would appreicate any help you
could offer to insure it meets your high standards. The speed
in which you would reply affects how soon I can begin seeking
my sponsors so I would appreicate any information as soon as
possible. Thankyou for your time and I look forward to discussing
this further at your convience.
The intricate braided pattern of honey coloured hair gathered beneath
a golden net appears glossy when the light touches it. Her sunkissed
face could belong to any goodwife except the complicated style of the
woman reveals otherwise. Dressed in a rich burgundy dress of Andoran
cut it is evident by the metalic sheen of her belted waist that she
is slender, however there is nothing fragile about this woman. Blinking
blue eyes drink in her surroundings framed by transparent bleached
eyelashes and eyebrows. Her cheeks are unnaturaly touched with a bit
of rouge and the glossy shine of her pink lips also appears unnatural.
Several whisps of hair fall onto her long graceful neck uncaught by
the golden net and intricate braid. Though youth still clings to her
simple features she is no longer a child, but a woman who could have
already celebrated her 30th nameday.
Makenna Trakand is the youngest and only daughter of the prestigious
Willard and Tarasita Trakand. With 7 older brothers she was a favorite
of her fathers and still adored by her brothers, her mother, who she
bares striking respeblence to fell sickly shortly after her birth and
did not survive her daughters first year of life. Without a mother and
with a royal bloodline aswell abundant wealth she was induldge even as
a young child. She adored arts, fashion even then and was a prize pupil
of her tutors. She was introduced to Penelope Avery at the age of six.
Penelope was the daughter of a minor Andoran House hold, however the
two girls became instant friends. When Makenna came into her 25th year
studying was simply not enough for her any longer. She desired to see
all that she had learned about for herself. Asking Penolope to accompany
her was an honor the unimportant house of Avery could not pass up and
so with her friend and a small accompany of men her father has specificaly
chosen she set out to discover the world. Her adventures took her

that was left to her. Also Wilfred manages the substantial dowery of

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Deruthias
`7Subj`6:`7 Deruthias Everin (BG)
`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Varulv Shai'tan Faerid Syrah
Special Authorization Request: Three piece mail, most likely spliced
into several due to the length. My apologies from the beginning. The first
piece deals with Deruthias' current background, and bears no real connection
to the past I shall be submitting. In essence, each piece shows a greater
depth into his History, thus easily removed from his background should they
not be found worth authorizing.
Present Situation Regarding Deruthias:
Deruthias was born late in the year 978, his parents near the age is he
now. Both his grandparents and great-grandparents remain alive, though
they have become separated by distance: each living in a different
village. This follows the tradition of their free lands: When a woman
marries, their family pays a dowry to the man's family: in turn, the
husband moves to his wife's village. Material items are traded, slightly
weakening the village: in return the village gains a new worker, someone
to aid in bringing 'wealth' to the village. So it came that Deruthias
Everin was born in a nameless village near to the Black Hills, his home
set between the Rivers Ivo and Haevin. There were three choices to those
living within the village: mining, farming, or herding. The Everin family
chose sheep, and as such, lived upon the western fringes of the village,
their own small home perched upon the first of many levels upon a rather
large, wooded hill. It was an ideal location: the area open for the sheep,
the forest nearby for firewood and rough lumber, and a beautiful view
of the village. Though the Black Hills rose higher to the east than their
lesser brethren to the west, Deruthias' home stood at least 500 feet over
the town and a mile away. It was a relaxing home, and Deruthias was raised
in a calm environment. The people of the Caralain and Black Hills, while
a touch rough with outsiders, when they did come through, they were polite
and respectful toward each other. There was no need for violence, or even
verbal floggings: instead, each festival (thrice a year all the local
villages gathered at alternating locations) they would hold 'competitions'
for wit. It was here that polite quips and slander were exchanged, all in
good humor. It was through this tradition that Deruthias learned his quick
wit, his humor, and his pleasant demeanor. The child grew up slowly, time
seeming less important here than in most parts of the lands: the reason
Deruthias seems unhurried with life, seeming to prefer a more relaxed
pace for all things in life. So it went that Deruthias was raised, a few
lessons in horsemanship here and there when neighboring villagers would
visit to barter for some Everin mutton or wool. Though Deruthias' mother
was nowhere near the best or most creative of the weavers, she did good
solid work. At the age of 9, Deruthias' (or Thias as he is more often titled),
father bartered with one such horse-rancher for a mare and a colt that
was almost of age. It was then that Deruthias was taught how to ride (nothing
fancy or worth a rock in battle) and subsequently put to work as a courier
for his village. It was his own service, as his family had the only horse
in town that wasn't used for carting the resources mined to the east to
town. This became a routine for him, once a month he would ride between the
villages delivering messages as well as collecting them for his return home.
Even with all the written word he dealt with, Deruthias never learned to
read or write. His vocal ability, like so many from the area, seemed all
that was needed in such a relaxed village. The child had an imagination
though, or perhaps a sight of the past: images of great battles with other
men, the Shadow, anything that could be drawn into existance with his
thoughts ran rampent through Deruthias' mind. When not running messages,
Deruthias would stand watch over his father's herd: often this led to the
youth making his way into the nearby forest to roam idling along the fringes.
Wolves were known to wander the forest, but none were ever seen by the Everin
boy, though he did sight a man time and again over the years. He never spoke
with him, but often they would share a connection, eyes meeting and held for
moments that lingered into hours. Always curious, yet seeming unwilling to
spark a conversation, Deruthias often redirected his thoughts concerning the
silent meetings. They remain, though, rising to take his attention every few
months if not years. The ethereal tradition between Deruthias and the forest-
lord (as Thias came to regard him) dwindled as the Everin boy grew older,
coming into adulthood. He life was sedate, a tranquil passage of time: a
stream mean

was almost of age. It was then that Deruthias was taught how to ride (nothing
fancy or worth a rock in battle) and subsequently put to work as a courier
for his village. It was his own service, as his family had the only horse
in town that wasn't used for carting the resources mined to the east to
town. This became a routine for him, once a month he would ride between the
villages delivering messages as well as collecting them for his return home.
Even with all the written word he dealt with, Deruthias never learned to
read or write. His vocal ability, like so many from the area, seemed all
that was needed in such a relaxed village. The child had an imagination
though, or perhaps a sight of the past: images of great battles with other
men, the Shadow, anything that could be drawn into existance with his
thoughts ran rampent through Deruthias' mind. When not running messages,
Deruthias would stand watch over his father's herd: often this led to the
youth making his way into the nearby forest to roam idling along the fringes.
Wolves were known to wander the forest, but none were ever seen by the Everin
boy, though he did sight a man time and again over the years. He never spoke
with him, but often they would share a connection, eyes meeting and held for
moments that lingered into hours. Always curious, yet seeming unwilling to
spark a conversation, Deruthias often redirected his thoughts concerning the
silent meetings. They remain, though, rising to take his attention every few
months if not years. The ethereal tradition between Deruthias and the forest-
lord (as Thias came to regard him) dwindled as the Everin boy grew older,
coming into adulthood. He life was sedate, a tranquil passage of time: a
stream mean

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Deruthias
`7Subj`6:`7 Deruthias BG (2nd mail)
`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Syrah Faerid Shai'tan Varulv
The words were taken to heart, and with a
change of clothes, a bag full of rations, and another bearing the case (heavily
padded with blankets and woven wool), Deruthias set off the next morning. He
rode with the other three young men, each insulting the other in good humor,
and telling stories of their lives. This lasted only a fortnight, as Deruthias
overslept one morning and awoke (possessions untouched - theft between those
of the caralain was unheard of but for the rarest of cases), Deruthias started
out on his own seeking to catch up with his lost companions. He did not follow
the same course as they, and as such, spent three fortnights traveling alone,
undisturbed. He just recently arrived upon the road leading north to Tar Valon,
and will be there in short time even with a slow pace.
OOC Note: I am going to be sending this to DD (authorization of ancient nobility,
WK (for the Forest-Lord, as I would like to have him be an WK NPC, thus I seek
their approval), Nicodemus (to authorize the case and contents), and the Shadow
as it will come into play within the Family History I intend to craft and submit.
If authorization does not come, then the case is ebony wood with simple steel
hinges and lock and contains nothing within it: the Forest-Lord but a strange
man wandering the woods with no connection to the Wolves: and Deruthias' family
not bearing a touch of ancient noble blood. ICly he knows nothing of the Shadow
and his Family History with it, so that will not come into play until the role-
play has been fleshed out down the road if indeed the connection is authorized.
Last Years of House Everin:
512 NE is the year, the final tremors from the fall of Caralain
having rippled across the Grass. The rolling plains of the river
valley (between the Ivo and Arienelle) near to the forests that
claimed the lands between the Mountains of Mist and Arienelle.
A mixture between rugged forested hills and rolling, cultivated
plains, the parcel of land was ruled over by House Everin. Nearer
the rugged forests than the cultivated farmlands, the center of
the House of Everin rose to the side of a town ringed by isolated
villages: their fortified manor (appearing a castle to those that
called the 'frontier' home), watched over the town from a recessed
circle upon the hill. Three sides the hill stretched around the
manorhouse: seeming to paint the picture that it was both a part of
the town whilst appearing apart from the village. The eldest of
House Everin had dwelled in the manorhouse generation after
generation, seventh in line of succession and sharing blood with
the now deposed King. It was here that the last three of House
Everin ended their old lives and set out to begin new ones.
Lord and Lady Everin were preparing their departure from the manor,
servants milling through the dwelling as the men-at-arms of House
Everin were holding a tense vigil. The populace was beginning to
rise against the final remnants of nobility, most having fled to
family in other realms, many not surviving the journey. Something
had stirred the populace under the protection of House Everin,
a Friend of the Dark sent to incite riots within the crumbling
realm. It had been more powerful here, as for years beyond count
the family had set itself to rooting out Darkfriends and foiling
their plans. They sought to protect all against the manipulations of
the Dark One's minions, going to great lengths to set fire to their
webs of deception. The House of Everin slowly dwindled over decades,
the Shadow actively seeking to wipe out those of the blood of
Everin. It came to pass that they almost succeeded in 512 NE, the
Lord and Lady - with their 3 year old son and entourage of servants-
into the night. The villagers their keep watched over filled the
streets of the village, their angry forms barring exit from the town.
Lord Stefhen Everin ordered his men to do them no harm, but part the
crowd so they might pass. The guards complied, the villagers seeming
to obey as the Lord and his family departed: a voice rose through the
crowd, a hiss of anger and wrath, inciting the populace into a riotous
mass. The Lord fled with his family, the soldiers of House Everin
attempting to withdraw from the battle. Blood was spilled, and many
of the soldiers were taken to the ground, a handful all that was able
to free themselves from the frenzied mass. Eight soldiers followed
after the Lord Everin, days turning into weeks as the mounted company
traveled east across the rolling plains. They neared the Black Hills
and turned south, crossing the river Ivo. So it came to be that
the b

the same course as they, and as such, spent three fortnights traveling alone,
undisturbed. He just recently arrived upon the road leading north to Tar Valon,
and will be there in short time even with a slow pace.
OOC Note: I am going to be sending this to DD (authorization of ancient nobility,
WK (for the Forest-Lord, as I would like to have him be an WK NPC, thus I seek
their approval), Nicodemus (to authorize the case and contents), and the Shadow
as it will come into play within the Family History I intend to craft and submit.
If authorization does not come, then the case is ebony wood with simple steel
hinges and lock and contains nothing within it: the Forest-Lord but a strange
man wandering the woods with no connection to the Wolves: and Deruthias' family
not bearing a touch of ancient noble blood. ICly he knows nothing of the Shadow
and his Family History with it, so that will not come into play until the role-
play has been fleshed out down the road if indeed the connection is authorized.
Last Years of House Everin:
512 NE is the year, the final tremors from the fall of Caralain
having rippled across the Grass. The rolling plains of the river
valley (between the Ivo and Arienelle) near to the forests that
claimed the lands between the Mountains of Mist and Arienelle.
A mixture between rugged forested hills and rolling, cultivated
plains, the parcel of land was ruled over by House Everin. Nearer
the rugged forests than the cultivated farmlands, the center of
the House of Everin rose to the side of a town ringed by isolated
villages: their fortified manor (appearing a castle to those that
called the 'frontier' home), watched over the town from a recessed
circle upon the hill. Three sides the hill stretched around the
manorhouse: seeming to paint the picture that it was both a part of
the town whilst appearing apart from the village. The eldest of
House Everin had dwelled in the manorhouse generation after
generation, seventh in line of succession and sharing blood with
the now deposed King. It was here that the last three of House
Everin ended their old lives and set out to begin new ones.
Lord and Lady Everin were preparing their departure from the manor,
servants milling through the dwelling as the men-at-arms of House
Everin were holding a tense vigil. The populace was beginning to
rise against the final remnants of nobility, most having fled to
family in other realms, many not surviving the journey. Something
had stirred the populace under the protection of House Everin,
a Friend of the Dark sent to incite riots within the crumbling
realm. It had been more powerful here, as for years beyond count
the family had set itself to rooting out Darkfriends and foiling
their plans. They sought to protect all against the manipulations of
the Dark One's minions, going to great lengths to set fire to their
webs of deception. The House of Everin slowly dwindled over decades,
the Shadow actively seeking to wipe out those of the blood of
Everin. It came to pass that they almost succeeded in 512 NE, the
Lord and Lady - with their 3 year old son and entourage of servants-
into the night. The villagers their keep watched over filled the
streets of the village, their angry forms barring exit from the town.
Lord Stefhen Everin ordered his men to do them no harm, but part the
crowd so they might pass. The guards complied, the villagers seeming
to obey as the Lord and his family departed: a voice rose through the
crowd, a hiss of anger and wrath, inciting the populace into a riotous
mass. The Lord fled with his family, the soldiers of House Everin
attempting to withdraw from the battle. Blood was spilled, and many
of the soldiers were taken to the ground, a handful all that was able
to free themselves from the frenzied mass. Eight soldiers followed
after the Lord Everin, days turning into weeks as the mounted company
traveled east across the rolling plains. They neared the Black Hills
and turned south, crossing the river Ivo. So it came to be that
the b
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Deruthias
`7Subj`6:`7 Deruthias BG (2nd mail)
`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Syrah Faerid Shai'tan Varulv
The words were taken to heart, and with a
change of clothes, a bag full of rations, and another bearing the case (heavily
padded with blankets and woven wool), Deruthias set off the next morning. He
rode with the other three young men, each insulting the other in good humor,
and telling stories of their lives. This lasted only a fortnight, as Deruthias
overslept one morning and awoke (possessions untouched - theft between those
of the caralain was unheard of but for the rarest of cases), Deruthias started
out on his own seeking to catch up with his lost companions. He did not follow
the same course as they, and as such, spent three fortnights traveling alone,
undisturbed. He just recently arrived upon the road leading north to Tar Valon,
and will be there in short time even with a slow pace.

play has been fleshed out down the road if indeed the connection is authorized.

`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Duren
Hi,
I'm kind of curious...have you settled on what kind of battle
you want yet? Months have passed and I'm beginning to wonder
what's up... Last I heard, the deal was to have turn based
combat with automation options, no grid and everyone in the
room being in the same fight...
/Fredrik

column7: Part 2, ask and ye shall receive

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ranulf
`7Subj`6:`7 Part 2, ask and ye shall receive
`7CC`6: `7Duren Nicodemus
The Skills that would be good to have back, and given at
something above 25% (which the majority of our skills are
currently limited to) Direct Combat skills have been nixed
from the list, as well as a few other things that would simply
cause problems in our current system. What remains are the
skills (although some have disappeared and some would be
useless) that'd it'd be good to be able to use, and good to be
able to point to on a skill sheet.
save
lockpick, grasp, sneak, steal, hide, track, peek, swim,
sword, spear, dagger, axe, mace, flail, polearm, bow,
detect trap, disable trap, set trap, dream, wolfdream,
endurance ballad, warder combat, veil, tool, fix, leash,
osing, ogier healing, wolfkin, wolf call, march, identify,
powersense, tie, read comm, read old tongue, read ogier,
read trolloc, write common, write OT write ogier, write trolloc,
grolm, guidance, knowledge, perservernece, locate,
teaching, rumour, fatigue resistance, tower trained, ,
fly, create, modify, travel, need, wdfly, wdcreate, wdmodify,
wdtravel, wdneed, perform, forage water, forage food,
search, sail, coach (would essentially be recall),
escort (see coach), poison, mix poison, mix antidote,
scowl (if its ddglare, then have it for the halfmen, sets paralysis,
or wrap or somesuch), listen, link, release, blockbreaking,
Riding, advanced riding, break shield, conceal trail,
guildleader -echoes, deathwatch guard conditioning,
bond drain, trolloc summon, plant, signal, tainted weapon,
handtalk (requires updating from the old code), scribe,
stalk, damane training, deckwork, repel, simulation,
damane summon, make potion, medic, advanced medic,
bandage. Shadowmeld
And finally, the spell system. Unlike above, all the spells but
compulsion still exist. Not all work properly, however. Only
a few (the noted ones) fail to work at all. A good number
however, work, but don't work properly (weaves to change
stats, for instance, say they affect them, but don't affect you
under the new system) All spells that would cause problems
(those that inflict damage and would start the combat system)
have been removed.
Aid, protection,  air blindness, blindness(target),  slice weaves,
invert weaves, compulsion, continual light,
control weather('weave what?'), create airsword(goofed),
create flamesword(goofed), create food, create spring (goofed),
create water, cure blind, cure disease, cure wounds,
detect poison(no affect), gag, gentle, heal, invisibility, pain,
pick lock with air, pick lock with earth, refresh,
remove poison(no affect), shield source, sleep, strength (no affect),
project voice(doesn't work), water walk, weaken(no affect), wrap,
probe ter'angreal, duplicate ter'angreal, (works, but should be
cautious of handing out to anyone beyond Egwene)  heal gentling,
heal stilling, bond, still, mask channeling, saidar mend,
endure (no affect), twist fate, glamour, invigorate, mirror of mists,
sap energy, turn fate. (last ones work, but don't
actually affect the current stats)
If you re-enabled grasp, and set only these spells, there wouldn't
be a great deal of problems with allowing them to channel. It would
be useful, though if someone went through and changed the flow
save
requirements and minimum maximum amount of casting points.
(it uses endurance, by the way) Similar to the skills, not all have code
affects, but would still add spice to rp) The other, extremely good
advantage about this, is that spells that have saves, (for example,
sleep, or spells between chans) removes the necessity to bicker about whether it would
work or not.
