create water, cure blind, cure disease, cure wounds,
detect poison(no affect), gag, gentle, heal, invisibility, pain,
pick lock with air, pick lock with earth, refresh,
remove poison(no affect), shield source, sleep, strength (no affect),
project voice(doesn't work), water walk, weaken(no affect), wrap,
probe ter'angreal, duplicate ter'angreal, (works, but should be
cautious of handing out to anyone beyond Egwene)  heal gentling,
heal stilling, bond, still, mask channeling, saidar mend,
endure (no affect), twist fate, glamour, invigorate, mirror of mists,
sap energy, turn fate. (last ones work, but don't
actually affect the current stats)
If you re-enabled grasp, and set only these spells, there wouldn't
be a great deal of problems with allowing them to channel. It would
be useful, though if someone went through and changed the flow
save
requirements and minimum maximum amount of casting points.
(it uses endurance, by the way) Similar to the skills, not all have code
affects, but would still add spice to rp) The other, extremely good
advantage about this, is that spells that have saves, (for example,
sleep, or spells between chans) removes the necessity to bicker about whether it would
work or not.

column7: Part 2, ask and ye shall receive

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ranulf
`7Subj`6:`7 Part 2, ask and ye shall receive
`7CC`6: `7Duren Nicodemus
The Skills that would be good to have back, and given at
something above 25% (which the majority of our skills are
currently limited to) Direct Combat skills have been nixed
from the list, as well as a few other things that would simply
cause problems in our current system. What remains are the
skills (although some have disappeared and some would be
useless) that'd it'd be good to be able to use, and good to be
able to point to on a skill sheet.
save
lockpick, grasp, sneak, steal, hide, track, peek, swim,
sword, spear, dagger, axe, mace, flail, polearm, bow,
detect trap, disable trap, set trap, dream, wolfdream,
endurance ballad, warder combat, veil, tool, fix, leash,
osing, ogier healing, wolfkin, wolf call, march, identify,
powersense, tie, read comm, read old tongue, read ogier,
read trolloc, write common, write OT write ogier, write trolloc,
grolm, guidance, knowledge, perservernece, locate,
teaching, rumour, fatigue resistance, tower trained, ,
fly, create, modify, travel, need, wdfly, wdcreate, wdmodify,
wdtravel, wdneed, perform, forage water, forage food,
search, sail, coach (would essentially be recall),
escort (see coach), poison, mix poison, mix antidote,
scowl (if its ddglare, then have it for the halfmen, sets paralysis,
or wrap or somesuch), listen, link, release, blockbreaking,
Riding, advanced riding, break shield, conceal trail,
guildleader -echoes, deathwatch guard conditioning,
bond drain, trolloc summon, plant, signal, tainted weapon,
handtalk (requires updating from the old code), scribe,
stalk, damane training, deckwork, repel, simulation,
damane summon, make potion, medic, advanced medic,
bandage. Shadowmeld
And finally, the spell system. Unlike above, all the spells but
compulsion still exist. Not all work properly, however. Only
a few (the noted ones) fail to work at all. A good number
however, work, but don't work properly (weaves to change
stats, for instance, say they affect them, but don't affect you
under the new system) All spells that would cause problems
(those that inflict damage and would start the combat system)
have been removed.
Aid, protection,  air blindness, blindness(target),  slice weaves,
invert weaves, compulsion, continual light,
control weather('weave what?'), create airsword(goofed),
create flamesword(goofed), create food, create spring (goofed),
create water, cure blind, cure disease, cure wounds,
detect poison(no affect), gag, gentle, heal, invisibility, pain,
pick lock with air, pick lock with earth, refresh,
remove poison(no affect), shield source, sleep, strength (no affect),
project voice(doesn't work), water walk, weaken(no affect), wrap,
probe ter'angreal, duplicate ter'angreal, (works, but should be
cautious of handing out to anyone beyond Egwene)  heal gentling,
heal stilling, bond, still, mask channeling, saidar mend,
endure (no affect), twist fate, glamour, invigorate, mirror of mists,
sap energy, turn fate. (last ones work, but don't
actually affect the current stats)
If you re-enabled grasp, and set only these spells, there wouldn't
be a great deal of problems with allowing them to channel. It would
be useful, though if someone went through and changed the flow
save
requirements and minimum maximum amount of casting points.
(it uses endurance, by the way) Similar to the skills, not all have code
affects, but would still add spice to rp) The other, extremely good
advantage about this, is that spells that have saves, (for example,
sleep, or spells between chans) removes the necessity to bicker about whether it would
work or not.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
`7Subj`6:`7 Variety of Matters
`7CC`6: `7Lafargo Lyana Bertram
Firstly: My apologies for the lack of role-play I have been
maintaining. Several affairs have been piled upon my plate, and
I am working on quite a few threads currently. I intend to remedy
the situation as soon as possible.
Secondly: Regards to Maeldrin and his role-play. Maeldrin is using
the alias 'Ceril Laucion', as Ceril was the name of eldest son of the
House of Laucion that was exterminated. There is the youngest son of
the House currently alive and in possession of the truth. I have worked
out a listing of House Laucion, but have as of yet to offer first names
to all involved. In essence, the structure of the House places Maeldrin,
as Ceril Laucion, heir to his immediate House - an actual Lord rather than
simply a Noble - and thirteenth in line of succession for High Seat of
House Laucion of Murandy. I would prefer to role-play the rising to Lord of
House Laucion in the wake of /his father's death/. The family is not on the
greatest of speaking terms, and visits between occur only once every few years,
as each is preoccupied with finding a way to raise House Laucion onto a higher
tier, and perhaps wrench control from the current High Seat by such actions,
meaning that Maeldrin (it helps he is a Theatre Supplier - though he looks
the part of Ceril Laucion without any additions of wigs/powders/etc.) could
easily pose as his alias, and be titled Lord of House Laucion, and actually
set himself in line for High Seat. With his merchant dealings, as well his
lack of morality concerning the 'removal' of obstacles, he could rise to the
position of High Seat, and perhaps bring House Laucion to a higher tier within
Murandian nobility.
Thirdly: The situation concerning Jayl as a captive of the Queen's Guard. Mael
have taken a personal interest in this matter, as he ICly cares little for the
Asha'man, and as such, will do what he may to spoil their plans for Jayl Elehar's
demise. I have spoken to you, as well as Jerod (Medaku having been idle more often
than naught) concerning the matter of an escape attempt, or even freeing Jayl
while being transported. With an in-prison hanging, that would leave the first
open to role-play. My intentions, with IC connections as a Theatre Supplier, are
to have tailored uniforms so that a few thieves may enter the prison, get the proper
keys and try to bluff the guards (or knock them out if such seems wiser at the
time) while stealing Jayl away to freedom. However such would work out, I would
like to get something concrete set up, unless you have already executed Jayl, and if
that is the case, I apologize for bringing this up.
Lastly: The Black Lions of Andor (Thieves Guild) are growing a touch, and hopefully
will continue to do so. I posted on my own trying to elicit at least one response,
and Lyana had suggested some role-play concerning Thieves outside of Andor. I have
heard nothing regarding anything as of yet, and would like your help - or at least
authorization to have a Guild Immortal run Quests regarding this matter - to set up
the role-play and get this rolling. The entirety of the Thieves Guild are great role-
players, and I think we should try our best to get them some 'action', as it /will/
benefit all guilds around OOCly, though it may draw some IC hostility.
Maeldrin. GL of the CotL. Liason to the Thieves Guild. Amadician Lord gone Murandian.

Darren

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Eirik
`7Subj`6:`7 Log
Jerod peers around himself intently.
Molleigh raises an eyebrow.
(OoC)-> Jerod says, 'uh.. hello?'
You send 'A Quiet Man sidles into the room and stands by the door.' to Jerod.
[DD] *|Princess [Saldaea|Kazadi] Taregan : Eirik are you still here?
[My other car is a Gate!] Jerod : I suppose some explanation would be in order... about A Quiet Man?
[ Beonca [66.82.160.118] has connected. ]
[Eirik] A Quiet Man : Hi Beo
You tell Beonca, 'any chance of a brief chat about the 'taint character' thing we were talking about doing with Jerod?'
I'm here this is my tell catcher through all the spam.
Your message has been saved in Beonca's playback buffer.
(OoC)-> Jerod says, 'can I have some explanation?  After all this is a private residence..'
You tell Beonca, 'since I've finally caught Jerod in RP - but he's going to complain about the character - though the whole Idea was that he didn't know who or what it was.'
I'm here this is my tell catcher through all the spam.
Your message has been saved in Beonca's playback buffer.
You tell Beonca, 'could you just tell him that it's part of what he wanted - more development for his character.'
I'm here this is my tell catcher through all the spam.
Your message has been saved in Beonca's playback buffer.
[ Vallara [65.2.107.20] has connected. ]
Molleigh closes the glass.
You send 'Out of the corner of your vision A Quiet Man shakes his head.' to Jerod.
[GI] Nicodemus's [Grouch] Beonca : Now what's the problem quite man?
[GI] Nicodemus's [Grouch] Beonca : Quiet sorry.
[ Closing link to: Aleya. ]
[ Aleya [81.100.159.212] has reconnected. ]
[GI] Mad Dog [Englishman] Eirik : You know the 'Taint character' thing we were going to do with Jerod?

[GI] Mad Dog [Englishman] Eirik : well - he's finally in RP with someone ... so I've 'moved in' so to speak. He want's an explanation of what 'Quiet Man' is .. which would, of course, make his very being there pointless.
[GI] Mad Dog [Englishman] Eirik : so, of course, he and Molleigh have stopped their RP anyway.
[GI] Mad Dog [Englishman] Eirik : would you be able to tell Jerod that it's all part of what he asked the imms for - something to help develop his character further?
[GI] Mad Dog [Englishman] Eirik : and hopefully he'll be happy with that?
[GI] Nicodemus's [Grouch] Beonca : He asked the Imms for this? *btw jerod and I don't get along*
Molleigh sighs.
[GI] Mad Dog [Englishman] Eirik : he asked Nico for some direction for his character to go in.
[GI] Nicodemus's [Grouch] Beonca : Ahh ok, well they are upset because you walked into thier rp without asking first.

[GI] Mad Dog [Englishman] Eirik : this is what was come up with - I was to play a character that only Jerod could see - hence Jerod has a trust of 2 and I'm Wizi 2 at the moment - that was a 'personification' of the Taint.

Letting her take the teacup from his hands, Jerod shrugs faintly at her question, "Very well, under the circumstances.."  He grins slightly, his eyes upon her softly as she sips her tea, "It brought back some memories, and those felt strange.. from another time, Im sure you understand..."  He falls into silence as the door to his chamber opens and closes, admitting not one of his servants, but a stranger alltogether.  A moment later, his emotions are but a distant thought, the firey power of Saidin flowing into his body, along with the stomach-wenching taste of the taint.  As Saidin fills him, flows of air reach out, ropes dancing with a mind of their own to wrap and entangle the stranger, binding him tightly.  [Jerod]
[GI] Nicodemus's [Grouch] Beonca : Eirik I've been requested to ask that you leave that room for now.
[GI]
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Taregan
`7Subj`6:`7 Taregan and Justus
After a surprise visit to King Ranet Togita in Shienar,
the ever unpredictable Princess Taregan of Saldaea was
spirited away just as quickly as she arrived Lady Naliya
Bashere. The whispers surrounding the departure are linked
heavily to none other than Prince Justus of Kandor leaving
with the Saldaean entourage. It is rather unclear what the
headstrong Princess has been up to, but it would be safe to
assume none of it would please her older sister, the Queen of
Saldaea.
(how's this?)
-Tare

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ghasra
`7Subj`6:`7 andor, news(or rumour) dissapearence
least that's what I figure the title might be, you can
come up with a better one if you like.
Rumors among the merchant class of Caemlyn speak of the kidnapping
of a young Saldaean seamstress known as Dryler, from the shop where
she worked on Caemlyn Street.  Without witnesses, all that is known is
that sometime between closing time and opening in the morning, the front
door was shattered open, and the woman is no longer to be found.

`7Subj`6:`7 Questioning
Has it been two weeks real life? - I've tried to catch you online,
but when I saw you, you're connection failed or you dropped link.
Either way, I've no problem with releasing you if we can meet, but
most likely Willem would be best to contact.. Myself, I intend to
leave Tyme behind, so I will not be on too much longer, and shall be
gone completely within the month.
Hope this gets resolved. Best of luck to you.

`7From`6:`7 Jaise
`7Subj`6:`7 Orders
*This note is delivered to you by a small child, a ward of the
Tower who has not yet reached sufficient age to begin training
but still is pledged to the Tower for some amount of years.*
Lieutenant,
You are allowed to take a full company of the guard of up to
one hundred men. Your charge will be to travel to Cairhien and
rendevous with the Runaway Accepted Analinde Riatin. She is to
return to Tar Valon to complete her training and your soldiers
are to offer escort.
If the Runaway Accepted resists, you are to remain in place
in Cairhien until aid comes.  Report back to the Tower at all
all stages of your mission. Your command will include a number
of pigeons sufficient to this task.
Also note that you will need to choose a route other than
the most direct one.  Travel due East, after leaving the city,
or proceed South by boat to Alindaer and then move overland to
Cairhien.  Avoid the Braem Wood area.
You will be joined by Aes Sedai, either in Cairhien or on the
way.
(insert name of TG Commander here)

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Sachi
`7Subj`6:`7 Sachi's Background
`7CC`6: `7Yoshida Klentira

Born the second child in a large family of five kids, Sachi and her family owned a small but tidy inn on the eastern side in the port city of Noren M'Shar.  Though it wasnt exactly the life of a Blood, it was by no means an uncomfortable existance for the first twelve years of her life.  She, and the other children, learned the family business at a fairly young age and were expected to help out around the place to keep the costs of paying out for help down.

Unfortunately for Sachi, she never felt like she belonged in their family.  All her siblings and her parents were dark haired with olive complexions, their bodies tending to be on the heavier side.  Sachi was born with white blonde hair that eventually faded into a golden honey color.  It caused quite a bit of teasing from her siblings and from other children that lived nearby.

It was around the same night of a Feastday being held in the honor of  a sul'dam coming to test the young girls around the area, that Sachi found out the truth about her heritage and why it was that her father never really paid her all that much attention.  It was a few months before her twelfth birthday that the celebration was to be held, the inn was prepared for the festivities as well as a large number of guests who might be staying over.  For some reason, the Imperial Sul'dam also picked the Bakuun's inn to stay in as well for the celebration.

The activities were just starting to get on their way when Sachi accidently dropped a plate on the floor while washing dishes in the kitchen.  Her father, who happened to be standing behind her at the time, was angered and backhanded the girl against the back of the head.  It caused an argument to start between her parents, much to the mortification of the guests who could hear in the common room and to the other children in the family

After a few moments of red-faced screaming, her father blurted out that Sachi wasn't really his child anyway and that she had been an embarassment on the family name.  The Sul'dam came into the room to break up the argument and then gently pulled young Sachi into the private dining room so that they could have a talk.  She tried to explain that sometimes people said things when angry that weren't exactly true, but the damage was already done to the poor girl.  In an effort to try and cheer her up, the Sul'dam allowed Sachi to wear the silver bracelet that had been connected to her own wrist.

To everyone's disbelief and relief, Sachi could actually feel the woman on the other side of the silvery leash.  This changed everything for their family, atleast in the way that they looked at the young girl.  Her things were packed that night and she travelled back to Seandar so that she could be trained.  Her mother came into her room that night, while she was packing, and explained to Sachi that she had been attacked twelve years before by some men on the outskirts of town while getting some supplies for the Inn.  It was in that attack that Sachi had been concieved though the family had tried to convince themselves otherwise.  It saddened and answered a lot of questions for the young girl, as well as brought her some relief before she was sent off.
***special note***
I left the end of the background open but could include where she might have gotten some training for being a Sul'dam.  Let me know if there needs to be any changes made.

`7From`6:`7 Sionet
`7Subj`6:`7 Desc
One can't help but notice that this man is tall, easily breaking six feet by
another hand or so. A pair of eyes of a pale green are slightly sunken and
give him an intense look even when his face is neutral. All along his jawline
is a blonde covering that makes up a beard that is worn forked. Each fork is
about eight inches in length and an inch from where it starts has a band of
silver to hold it. Bright blonde hair is worn long, most of it tied in back
with a single leather cord. The only distinction on his head is a single
weaving scar that runs from the front of his hairline to the back of his
cranium. Fair skinned and gangly the young man, perhaps just twenty summers,
has a whispy look to him that even graces his flowing movement. The only other
visable marks on his body a criss-crossed scar that rests, much darker than
his skin tone, on his left forearm near the elbow.
Adorning his left ear is a single stud earring made of fine silver. A very dark
red shirt that almost seems of a muted tone is tucked loosely into a pair of
black riding breeches that seem to hug his long, muscular legs. The top of the
shirt always seems to be undone to reveal a wirey build of lean muscle. The
breeches are tucked into a tall pair of worn riding boots of a earth brown tone
with silver spurs. Over his shirt is an unbuttoned coat of black that has three
precious silver chains looped across his chest. Worn about his waist is a
double-belt that seems a little thinner than normal made of well-used leather.
The belts are worn snuggly and seem to make the rest of his clothes follow his
body when he moves. Visablely worn like a third belt, and connected at the right
hip to his doubled one, is a heavy swordbelt connecting to the sheathe of a
hand-and-a-half sword. The sheathe is plain black leather banded with silver
inlay. Sewn into the center of his sheathe is a large stag made of a dark red
thread.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Rionn
`7Subj`6:`7 Annonymous

I am hoping to play a darkfriend.  My background has been approved by shai'tan.  I need my retainer not to tell who it is the retainer of.  (it says Rionn's retainer.)  This means that if I send my retainer off to do evil things, people will know ooc'ly that Rionn hired that retainer and this will affect actions towards Rionn IC.  Everyone will know ooc'ly that Rionn is a darkfriend and this is no good.  The retainer and Rionn need to have no links between each other, either IC'ly or oocl'y.  Could you take off the 'Rionn's' bit in Rionn's retainer in his title?

I can imagine why this could not be allowed.  Because people need to know the situation before a battle.  they would need to know if me and my retainer were both emoting in the same room so they know who to fight but this does not really matter because if I were going to fight with both, I would either tell them he is my retainer or pretend he is just a friend who feels like helping me and that me and the retainer had never met before.  I see no real reason why you can't take the relating name off the title of the retainer.  It is not unfair to anyone and more realistic.  I am sure Shai'tan wants me to remain annonymous ooc'ly as well as IC'ly and so do I or its no fun, and unrealistic.  Please get back to me as soon as you can with your decision. Thank you.

Everyone will know ooc'ly that Rionn is a darkfriend and this is no good.  The retainer and Rionn need to have no links between each other, either IC'ly or oocl'y.  Could you take off the 'Rionn's' bit in Rionn's retainer in his title?

I can imagine why this could not be allowed.  Because people need to know the situation before a battle.  they would need to know if me and my retainer were both emoting in the same room so they know who to fight but this does not really matter because if I were going to fight with both, I would either tell them he is my retainer or pretend he is just a friend who feels like helping me and that me and the retainer had never met before.  I see no real reason why you can't take the relating name off the title of the retainer.  It is not unfair to anyone and more realistic.  I am sure Shai'tan wants me to remain annonymous ooc'ly as well as IC'ly and so do I or its no fun, and unrealistic.  Please get back to me as soon as you can with your decision. Thank you.

`7From`6:`7 Jhevon
`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Asha
Jhevon was born in Andor, to a rather poor family who lived on the outskirts
of Caemlyn.  His father worked as a blacksmith until he got his hand stepped
on by a horse he was shoeing, injuring his hand to the point he could no
longer hold the tools needed for his craft.  His mother works at a seamstress
shop, but doesn't make enough money to feed her large family.  Jhevon is
the oldest child of eight... with five brothers and two sisters.  His sisters
are aged 5 and 10 respectively, and even though they are learning to sew like
their mother, they are too young to be of much use.  His brothers, aged 1, 3,
6, 8, and 12 respectively, are also too young to support the family, although
the two older ones, Jasen and Jhaele, have become apprentice blacksmiths.
Jhevon, being light of build, was never really cut out to be a blacksmith, and
had dreams as a child of being the Captain-General of the Queen's Guard.  He
is now 15.  Though he no longer has delusions of grandeur about being a highly
ranked officer in the Guard, he realizes that with his father's recent injury,
he needs to find a way to support his family, and soon.  He is currently in
the city, looking for work so he can at least support himself, even if he
cannot support the rest of his family.  His father, though injured, is still
cannot support the rest of his family.  His father, though injured, does what
he can to help his wife in her sewing business.  Jhevon's family will not go
hungry, even if he does not find a job, but yet he still feels the need to at
least not be a burden.
Jhevon does have the ability to channel, though he does not know it yet.  With
the prominence of the Asha'man in Caemlyn, and their role as law enforcement, he
has become interested in them, and is willing to submit to the tests to see if
he can become one of them.
If you need further information, please let me know.
Jhevon

`7From`6:`7 Genevra
`7Subj`6:`7 Aiel Guildleader Application
Dear Beonca,
How are you. I am making my offical request to place my interest
in the Aiel Guildleader position. To tell you a little bit about my
past here on Moments in Tyme. I have been with the mud since it opened
in various forms. In the days of Mikki and Dini I played Pheodora
the DD GL, as well as Selina the Illuminator GL. Then moved to becoming
Shaidar to help the Shai'tan at the time handle Dreadlords and I also
played Semirhage to help with the roleplay at that time. I then got
accepted into college and had to leave my postions to focus on that,
while I played Narissa a Brown Ajah, and the bookie Verin when I was
not studying while Kane had taken over. When I was on spring break
and weekends, I became Matthias (shoots her typist) helper taking
requests, complaints, reports from the imms and send him weekly
reports for him to be kept well informed and less spammed in mail.
I then took a leave of absence from mudding killing off Narissa, and
given up Verin when bookies were taken out. I have returned about
4 months now back to the mud, with Calina the Blue whom was killed by
a Red Sister because she was a rebel. I then renamed as Genevra to
keep up with rp, just taking Trelsendra to help encourage the Ogier
roleplay. I have/had in the past expressed an interest in the Aiel
however gave up those interest because the GL and I could not hook up
or discuss character concepts. Now that the postion is open, I think
a largely needed presence of the Aiel are need because it is an
important guild for the theme of the books, and the roleplay of the
timeline we have here.
What kind of plans would I have for the guild? One...ROLEPLAY! I would
deguild Genevra, rename her and make her a channeling Wise One who
can dreamwalk so I can help with roleplaying for those Wise One's who
one are channelers, and two for those who are dreamwalkers who need
training. Two, I would then review the current ranks within the guild
and research them to the books to make sure they are as exact as they
can be...three, I would then speak with Rand and Jerod on possible
inter-guild relations being we have an active Rand for Maidens, WO and
Spears to roleplay and back up. Four, speak with Jerod about possible
relations and plots that we could run as guilds that would be linked
to Rand since we are the two guilds that need to be linked to him the
closest. Finally, be online as a presence to show the mud they have
someone who will help answer their questions, show them structure,
and be a leader they need for them to ensure the Aiel have roleplay as
well as someone to work with the imms on plots, events, and overall
gaining a better name that they Aiel need.
I guess in the end what I feels will make me qualified as the Aiel
GL is my experience, my passion to get it off the ground like I have
done my guilds in the past, and give me something to do when I am home
then watch TV and burn my brain cells there. I can burn my brain cells
doing something that will improve the environment of the game.
If you have any questions please feel free to speak to me as Genevra or
Trelsendra or email me at Graendal2004@aol.com
Thank you for your time
Gen

`7From`6:`7 Sionet
`7Subj`6:`7 Tonight

Sorry that I couldn't stay up but it's about quarter to 1am my time and I'm just beat.  Gavin came home with three stitches.  They said it was pretty deep but the wound was narrow enough to not need inside stitche.  No concussion either, which is good.  Anyway.. I logged on Shang while you were gone and went to Xanadu to try and not be bored.

When I left, some guy followed me out and struck up roleplay.  Nothing happened sexually though he did ask if you would lend me out to him.  I told him you were the possessive type and that I was pretty happy with you so I had no desire to switch Masters.  He went on to tell me to relate to you that you had excellent taste in clothing for me to be paraded around in.  That I was subserviant enough to make him want me and that he was sure my voice was a shrill scream when being pleasured =p  Wierd people.  Anyway, I wanted you to know though.  Not keeping anything from you at all *hugs*  I thought you might get a kick out of knowing someone else wants me but can't have me.  Oh, and ic'ly they struck up a conversation because Carine was looking at piercings at a place right outside the square.  Thinking about getting her tongue or nipples pierced.  Whatcha think?

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Oswald
`7Subj`6:`7 Lessons
I have thought up some lessons for each rank.
Lessons for Private:
1. Basic sword training with shields  stances, how to hold weapon and shield, defensive, offensive moves.
2. Etiquette and image importance of making us look good, being polite to the client.
3. Scouting and tracking search and rescue scenarios, locating someone, ways to sneak through an area undetected (lesson probably out in the forest.)
Lessons for Corporal:
1. Archery  improving aim, trying different bows, including crossbow, correct technique.
2. Basic hand to hand combat Kicks, correct punching, block and dodge.
3. Daes Daemar (dealing with nobles.) Subterfuge, disguises, spying, the power of rumour.
4. Practice with another weapon of choice ( quarterstaff, axe, knives.)
Lessons for Sergeant:
1. Advanced sword  further practice with the sword.
2. Advanced martial arts palm heel strikes, how to roll properly, flying kicks, spinning kicks, low spin tripups.
3. Hostage situations, protect the hostage.  Bodyguarding.
4. Battle tactics. (The hedgehog, the importance of higher ground, forming a shield wall by linking shields, pincer attacks, terrain, retreat and regroup etc.)
Lessons for Lieutenant:
1. Command training  how to organise men, assertiveness, punishment, responsibilities, never leave a man behind!
2. Shadowspawn briefing. includes how to kill fades, their connection with Trollocs, the danger of the black blade, the danger of looking at a fades face for too long.
3. Challenge the current Lieutenant Commander to a spar to become a Lieutenant Commander too.  Only if you win can you be one.  The Captain watches and judges the fight. ???
And then the Lieutenant Commanders do not have any lessons, but thier duties increase, (intelligence gathering, advisor to the captain, seeking out new jobs.)
So what do you think Kheldon?  Quite a broad range of things to learn here right?  I think it should do nicely but if you have any other suggestions let me know. :)

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BP
I set you up with the stuff I could think of - on BP,
you have grant (so you can grant other people the following
OLC commands), set (for set <player> <zone number that you're
giving them access to>), zedit, redit, oedit, and goto.  When
you grant a player a command, make sure you only give it to them
on BP - do:
grant Rasridim goto 9696
If you don't do the port argument, then it gives them imm
commands on this port if they're using their mort's name.
I'm not sure what it takes to create a new zone - we're gonna
have to ask Ranulf (the old head builder) or syrah, if she
knows.  Right now zone 407 is the active one that Kinje and
Ranulf are working on.  Faerid is about done with the eq ones
(I think they were 37, maybe 38 and 39, but I don't remember
for certain).  Oh, come to think of it, you may have to grant
them things like show, for zone info, and vstat and such.  But
what I gave you is the essentials, I think.
If you need anything else, beep me. :>
Thanks,
-Nico

column7: Lesson credit for Tavik and Belfor.

`7From`6:`7 Esrahd
`7Subj`6:`7 Lesson credit for Tavik and Belfor.
Aight I'll do this in order.
Tavik... Credited with Alternate Weapon style (Archery).
It was appaerent that Tavik has prior knowledge in archery IC, so with a bit of twisting I pushed a lesson
defining the appropriate use, situations for use and tactics for Archery.
Balfor... Credited with Alternate weapon style (Archery) and basic tactics.
As with Tavik, Balfor displayed a prior knowledge of archery and so was included into the lesson with Tavik.
Ontop of this, Balfor was taught varying basic knowledge of ambush techniques within covered terrain and
appropriate useages of both Bow and Sword within these situations.
(Note)- Timothy also participated in the lesson, but my connection dropped before I could find out just what
he did and didn't have. Stay tuned and I'll make the appropriate mails when I speak to him next.
Ta muchly, and if these mails should be going elsewhere, tell me asap :)
Essie.

`7From`6:`7 Sean
`7Subj`6:`7 Mapping Caemlyn
OK, I've mapped all of Caemlyn but for the Theatre in the north-east cornner,
and the guild centre west of the Oval Plaza.  I have my reasons.  I don't
like bad links, and links that take you instantly from one room to another,
unless it brings some advantage, like going strate to Cairhien via the
visitors centre.  If you want .gif's, just ask, I'll send them to your addy.
There are four, levels -1, 0, 1 and 2.
***Sean Berator
NOTE:  You think my choice for a last name is ok?

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Policy Inquery
I've either talked or received mails from everybody involved,
now, and given what people are telling me (unless anyone
of you guys can provide me with a log to prove that someone
is lying), I've pretty well established what was most likely
to have happened.  The conversation you referred to that
occured early in March was not snooped in any way - the
sole way for any of those gsays to have been overheard
without the use of an imm code snooping would be a mischan.
No imm (besides the exceptions of Boris and Varulv, who
both had permission on an unrelated bug issue) has snooped
any one of you or any of the people involved in this as
far back as syslog goes (Feb 10).  I've concluded that
the people who found out about it discovered the information
through other means, and from the accounts I'm hearing,
that information has become a fairly obvious connecting of
the dots based on information that was shared or guessed
at by a number of players.  My investigation leads me to
believe that none of this information was obtained through
the illegal use of code or through actions that constitute
policy violations.  As for Tavik's identity, I'm not sure
how people found out about that.  His identity appears to
be considered, contrary to his own belief, common knowledge
to players that play (or have played) on Fang and here, but
I cannot prove how that info was determined by the people
involved here.  There is no evidence to suggest policy
violations or code abuse in obtaining any of this information.
As for the possible unacceptable conduct of some of the
players involved in this, the other players are offering
radically different versions of each of the related
conversations.  In order to justify the use of policy action
against any individual for inappropriate behavior towards
you or anyone else involved in this, I'll need a log to
show it, because absolutely everyone involved has such
a great difference of opinion of what happened in each
conversation (especially including parties who don't much
care) that I cannot look at this as anything more than
a 'he said, she said' matter.  Not only do the details
not agree with each other, but all players I've questioned
disagree on many of the basic facts, up to and including
I never did that and "I never heard so and so say anything
about this".  I'm sorry, but this is as much as I can do
without logs to prove who was acting inappropriately and
how.  From the facts and the evidence, my conclusion is
inappropriate behavior was likely involved on several
people's parts, but I lack sufficient evidence and witnesses
to say that as a certainty, or to say who started what.
Other players involved in this logged their own complaints
as well.  Without logs from any of you or them, no policy
action is legal.
I'm sorry for what happened, and for the embarrassment.
I wish I could have cleared things up further, but the
conflicting testimonies of everybody prevents me from
doing so.  If you or anyone else is ever harrassed or
otherwise the victim of inappropriate behavior, please
log it immediately.  In situations where there is no
evidence, and where no players at all can agree on what
they heard or said, I can't do squat without either a
log or something in syslog to indicate to me what happened.
I'm sorry, but this is all I can unless you can prove what
was said in one of the conversations to you or anyone else
involved.  I really don't have anything else to go on.  From
what I believe happened, as I said, given that more people
knew who Tavik was than he thought (and I've been unable
to determine how - they just say they've known forever),
and some conclusions that were fairly easy to assume by
most people in the tower guild, how this got out was
largely a connecting of the dots.  I'm sorry, but a lot
of people were aware of this, and I can't find any evidence
to show that someone broke policy to find out.
Again, if you can find someone with a log, I'll continue
to look into this, but otherwise, I've concluded the
investigation.
-Nico

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Tells I missed
Hey, I guess I missed some tells you sent me while I was
mailing last night - yes, we can add rooms to the
test ports without adding them to the live port.
You would construct them on the builderport, and
then:
from  /../builderport/lib/world
cp wld/407.wld /../mudback/lib/world/wld
cp zon/407.zon /../mudback/lib/world/zon
cp obj/407.obj  /../mudback/lib/world/obj
etc, for each of the file types.  Obviously
there should have been a tilda in front
of each of the /../ in the destination
directory, but you get the idea.  I think
that's right, anyhow, but you can always
doublecheck before you start copying files
over.  Stuff done on the builderport
has to be implemented manually to the
live port, so we simply just don't
import it if we don't want it here yet.
That help?
-Nico
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 Policy Inquery
I mailed this to Afton yesterday, not realizing you'd
been deleted, and forgot to forward it.  Sorry.
I've either talked or received mails from everybody
involved now, with the exception of Mishaela and Eilana,
because I didn't think they were witnesses to any of
the conversations in question (beyond being present in
the gsay conversation with Sionet and yourself).  If
they've got any logs to present or can present some
compelling argument as witnesses, I'll talk to 'em,
otherwise I've done all I can.  Since the only proof
I was able to find without logs from anyone at all was
what definitely didn't happen, this is what I've
established is most likely to have occurred.
The conversation you referred to that happened in early
March was not snooped in any way - the sole way for
any of those gsays to have been overheard without the
use of the imm snoop code is a mischan.  No imm (besides
the exceptions of Boris and Varulv, who both had
permission by Sionet on an unrelated bug issue) has
snooped any one of you or any of the people involved in
this as far back as syslog goes (Feb 10).  I've concluded
that the people who found out about it discovered the
information through other means, and from the accounts
I'm hearing, that information was probably a fairly
obvious connecting of the dots based on information
that was shared or guessed at by a number of players.
My investigation leads me to believe that none of this
information was obtained through the illegal use of
code or through actions that consitute policy violations.
As for Tavik's identity and the fact that she's female,
I'm not sure how people found out about that.  Her
identity appears to be considered, contrary to her
own belief, common knowledge to players that play (or
have played) on Fang and here, but I cannot prove how
that info was determined by the people on this mud.
I simply have no evidence to pinpoint who was involved
in any policy violations or code abuse, if there was
any, in obtaining this information.  Players appear
to have made the conclusion drawn based on rumor and
what they knew/saw between Tavik and your OOC
relationship, probably use of the where command
when you were RPing, and went from there.
As for the possible unacceptable conduct of some of
the players involved in this, the other players are
all offering radically different versions of a number
of related conversations.  They differ from your
accounts, and each others, to the extent that I
can't do anything with any of them without logs on
any of your parts, because it's entirely a case of
'he said', 'she said', now.  In order to justify
the use of policy action against any individual for
inappropriate behavior towards you or anyone else
involved in this, I'll need a log.  From the facts
and the evidence, my conclusion is that inappropriate
behavior was likely involved on several people's
parts, but I lack any evidence and collaborating
witnesses to say that as a certainty (especially since
some of the participants claim they were never
involved in any such conversation, or that what
they heard was drastically different from what the
previous player I talked to told me), or to say
who started what.  Other players involved in this
logged their own complaints as well.  Without logs
from you or any of them, no policy action is legal.
I'm sorry for what happened, and for the embarrassment.
I wish I could have cleared things up further, but the
conflicting testimonies of everybody prevents me
from doing squat without evidence, since I can't even
get two witnesses to agree on anything.  I've posted
a change in how I'm dealing with policy matters from
now on in the hopes that it will make it easier to
crack down on problems like this when they occur.  In
the future, if someone is acting inappropriate to you
and it's serious enought to warrant policy action,
just make a log and forward it as I outlined in the
post to the appropriate person, and it should be taken
care of then and there.  I'm hoping that my harsher
stance on this will firstly keep it from happening so
much in the first place, and get rid of problem players
here that can't keep their mouths shut.
Unless you can find a log or you have a witness to
something, this is as far as I can go with what I've
got.
-Nico

I'm sorry for what happened, and for the embarrassment.
I wish I could have cleared things up further, but the
conflicting testimonies of everybody prevents me
from doing squat without evidence, since I can't even
get two witnesses to agree on anything.  I've posted
a change in how I'm dealing with policy matters from
now on in the hopes that it will make it easier to
crack down on problems like this when they occur.  In
the future, if someone is acting inappropriate to you
and it's serious enought to warrant policy action,
just make a log and forward it as I outlined in the
post to the appropriate person, and it should be taken
care of then and there.  I'm hoping that my harsher
stance on this will firstly keep it from happening so
much in the first place, and get rid of problem players
here that can't keep their mouths shut.
Unless you can find a log or you have a witness to
something, this is as far as I can go with what I've
got.
-Nico

`7CC`6: `7Jerod Jake
We noticed that Ralidan (Previously Valoc's alt) was renamed to Coehin.  During
the rename, the player was connected from Valoc's ISP.  The character then logged
off, and relogged on, from your IP.  You then proceeded to have Varulv transfer the
exp from Valoc's pfile to the pfiles of your alts.
This exp has been deducted from your pfile, as well as an additional
100k.  If I catch you doing anything like this again, it'll be a site-ban.
-Duren

`7From`6:`7 Laeona
`7Subj`6:`7 BG for Seeker Laeona Tibra
`7CC`6: `7Melinda Samir
Laeona Tibra grew up in the southern part of Saldaea, for the better half of
fifteen years of her life. She had a mostly normal life her father Darmon was
a farmer of one of Saldaea's famous crops the Ice Pepper, as well as a little
bit of hunting for furs for his wife. Her mother Diedeadra was a seamstress,
she took the few furs that Luna's father got and made them into warm clothing
she also made some of the most wonderful clothes that anyone in the area had
seen. But this life was not for Luna she never picked up on any of the sewing
that her mother tried so hard to teach her. Instead she spent most of her life
following her dad around, and trying hard to pick up every bit about hunting
that she could, from the time she was eight till she was about thirteen she
wanted to be a hunter and sell furs for a living. But all that changed once
she was able to have some freedom, and she began to see the world, the local
inn mostly, she liked to go there and talk to the local hunters. But one day
as young minds are feeble, she found a profession that she truly wanted she
wanted to be a Gleemen. She watched how the Gleemen attracted so much
attention, and drew large crowds, so she began to observe the woman Gleeman's
actions as much as she could. After the Gleewoman left town Luna began to pursue
this talent as much as she could, she began to learn how to juggle the knives
that her father gave her, and then also picked up on playing the harp, and
she began to play for the local inns. Bored with the daily routine of life
she set out to find a real Gleeman so that she could apprentice and become
a full Gleeman.
Upon her travels she met a group of women who were traveling
to Tar Valon. These women were very interested in Laeona, and found her
talents very interesting, so interesting that they persuaded her into going
to Tar Valon with them. Later on when she folowed them she began to find out
thier stories as each revealed a little more the longer they went. One of the
women was an Aes Sedai, who had just found out that the other girl could channel
and was escorting her to Tar Valon to get trained. The other woman, who was going
to get trained had came from a small village in Saldaea not to far from Laeona
herself. Come to find out the Aes Sea had been staying in the village, for what
reason Laeona could not gather, when she had noticed that the woman was about to
spark. The Aes Sedai then persuaded the woman to come to Tar Valon to be trained.
As the two women spoke to Laeona she became curious, and excited at the same time.
She began to beg the Aes Sedai to test her to see if she could go to Tar Valon
and learn too. Reluctantly it seemed the Aes Sedai tested her, and seemed
surprised at the potential Laeona had, and at that moment she made Laeona
promise that she would continue her journey to Tar Valon with them and to begin
her training as well. Leaona willingly agreed, and the three women continued thier
travels to Tar Valon.

`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 IC report from Caemlyn
Spies report:

Two disturbances reported early night on (recent date).  Believe assassination
attempts, targets unconfirmed.  First outside Saucy Wench, southwest Caemlyn,
believed to target Aes Sedai and Warder pair in disguise (unconfirmed), possible
 additional male target, descriptions attached.  Warder injured, all survived.
 Unlikely three were together.  No reliable descriptions of assailants.  Believe
 likely local street toughs, at least two skilled bowmen, total numbers between
 four and seven from conflicting witness reports.  No arrests made by Guard or
 Asha'man police.  One casualty, local homeless man, involvement unknown.  No
 arrests made by Guard or Asha'man police.  Asha'man were dispatched to investigate,
 intereviewed several witnesses, believe carried similar report back.

Second attack on man of similar description to 3rd target of first attack,
 approximately one hour later.  Presumed same man, believed escaped west gate
 of Caemlyn.  Note possible but unconfirmed use of One Power - nearby lightning
 strike during probable natural heat lightning storm.  No arrests, no casulaties.
 No arrests, no casualties, believe Guard is investigating.  Intend wait for
 them to make conclusions, please advise.
Man, that's the third time I had to type that damned thing - keep losing connection.
OOC note to follow before I crash again :p

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 AL
Anastasia,
After reading your last letter to Beonca and myself, I wanted to sit down
and speak with you in person about the status of the guild, and how we
could improve activity, as well as address the points you raised about Aviendha.
Fael has guilded me into the guild so I can help out, and I've spoken with
a number of players about the guild and your role in it.  I have to admit
that I am disappointed with what I've found and been told.  It appears that
you've taken little active role there and no initiative to get the guild started
up again, going back t only a couple of weeks since you were hired.  You don't
log on enough to carry out the basic requirements of keeping a small guild
active, and you haven't done so for a very long time.  In the body of your
last mail, you basically blamed me for the current status of the AL.  I feel
it's necessary to point out that the only reasons you gave for why Aviendha
would generate RP all went back to her connections with the tower - which is
already flooded with bookies and does nothing to address the A guild, or any
of the other points that I gave you that must be satisfied before I auth
another bookie.  Furthermore, your note that yo uhad to take a week off just
to cool down to the point where you could blame me for the guild indicates
to me that either you're not even-tempered enough to handle this job, or
you don't care enough about it to act with more maturity.
I can find only minimal evidence of your activity anywhere - a post on
the template board - but most players tell me that you haven't doen much of
anything at all.  I also note that you don't read the boards, like proj
show, whic his frankly unacceptable for a GL.  I don't feel that you're
willing to put in the effort or professionalism required to do this job,
and consequently, after speaking with Beonca, Fael and some of your
guildmembers, I've decided to remove you from your position and replace
you with someone else.  I GLed the Seafolk for a number of years, and I
quite understand that sometimes no amount of effort will turn a guild
around during a dry spell - but you've made none at all, and in your last
mail, all you did was threaten to quit if I didn't do what you wanted.
That's unacceptable.  I'm sorry we weren't able to make more of a difference,
but I stand by my reasoning for denying the Aviendha character.  Given the
current state of the AL guild, it cannot handle the bookie, it won't
generate RP for anyone but towerites and it will cause more of the problems
I'm already seeing with the number of bookies we have already.  I am
taking more of an active role in the guild, however, and hope that we'll
be able to make some progress with it when the finals-crunch-time slump
ends and we get more active as a whole.
Sincerely,
Nicodemus

to cool down to the point where you could blame me for the guild indicates
to me that either you're not even-tempered enough to handle this job, or
you don't care enough about it to act with more maturity.
I can find only minimal evidence of your activity anywhere - a post on
the template board - but most players tell me that you haven't doen much of
anything at all.  I also note that you don't read the boards, like proj
show, whic his frankly unacceptable for a GL.  I don't feel that you're
willing to put in the effort or professionalism required to do this job,
and consequently, after speaking with Beonca, Fael and some of your
guildmembers, I've decided to remove you from your position and replace
you with someone else.  I GLed the Seafolk for a number of years, and I
quite understand that sometimes no amount of effort will turn a guild
around during a dry spell - but you've made none at all, and in your last
mail, all you did was threaten to quit if I didn't do what you wanted.
That's unacceptable.  I'm sorry we weren't able to make more of a difference,
but I stand by my reasoning for denying the Aviendha character.  Given the
current state of the AL guild, it cannot handle the bookie, it won't
generate RP for anyone but towerites and it will cause more of the problems
I'm already seeing with the number of bookies we have already.  I am
taking more of an active role in the guild, however, and hope that we'll
be able to make some progress with it when the finals-crunch-time slump
ends and we get more active as a whole.
Sincerely,
Nicodemus

`7From`6:`7 Ranulf
`7Subj`6:`7 Take two
if a first copy went through, i'm sorry, my comp stalled out in the middle of writing
anhow, muds name is shadows of Isildur, address is
aman.middle-earth.us port 4500
save
You'll be able to see most of it with the guest login, though going through the creation system (gotta get approved which blows) gives alot of interesting stuff
Things to look at are as follows
Method of knowing other fellas (you don't, except through your own memory. Probably not a wise idea here, but definately fairly cool
The hood system (if you're wearing a hood and type hood, or wearing a faced helm, it disguises your long-description, unless someone uses 'study'
save
their movement system (would be -very- useful if we're still using our grid system. People would complain at first, but its a great idea and solves alot of the problems, particularly with combat
Their combat system, not so much to take, but to look at, its kinda cool

their health system. Half is awesome, half is sketchy. The six stars and bars for health and stamina are interesting although not the cool part. The cool part is the complex injury system they have beyond that. (go get hit by something or spar someone)
save
Last, their interactive emote system. Something i've been drooling for as long as i've been here. Their objects, people, all can be tied into the emotes, (help newbie once you're there)
oh, and one last thing. Interactive furniture.
Mac

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 Troop movement
`7CC`6: `7Varulv Duren Eliana
Varulv, Duren and I briefly discussed a new option for
implementing troop movement in the new war system.  It
entails ripping out the existing 'meandering trails'
between major cities, and replacing them with straight-shot
zones coded to scale.  Because of the scaling, PCs and
troops could only move a few rooms per day, IC, so we'd
have to have OLC recognize outdoor terrain types (the
existing ones may be sufficient - not sure offhand), and
movement between these rooms would have to cost a lot of
endurance in code.  I think this eliminates all the problems
we have with the previously examined options, though it
does require some extra work.  Here's what we'd need:
Eli and V, please look at your milage estimates between
cities and decide how many rooms we'd need to place
between existing cities (those zones would remain untouched).
My initial guess is that something like 3 code rooms
would be about as much as a marching army can handle
per day - much more, and we'd have to code way too many
rooms, and much less and people who accidently stepped
out of a city would be unable to get back to it in a
reasonable amount of time :p Once we get an idea of how
many rooms we'd need, we'll decide if this is doable.
Provided the room numbers aren't too great, we put together
a set of generic room descs for the major terrain types.
We'd repeat them over and over, and make all zones out of
these generic descs.  We could even do this to make a
'template' zone, copy if into multiple zones, and then
connect the dots around the edges and add important
features as necessary.
This would allow us to really enforce code=IC in all
instances I can think of, and allows for a maximum of
PC interaction with traveling and camped armies.  We
can implement scouting, sneaking away from cities, trade
embargoes and IC mailing this way, and it'd all be
totally representable IC.  Codewise, as far as the zones
go, the only major adjustments need to be the movement
costs to PCs and troops depending on the terrain type,
which obviously has to be hard coded.  I don't think that's
a big deal, is it, Duren? I think this about hits the
major points of this.  Zones should be giant squares, also,
to allow for people skirting around army bodies and the
like (everybody needs to be able to move in all 4 cardinal
directions all the time, though moving through dense forest
should be harder than following the trail).  We'll just
add trails to connect the cities through the template zones,
and as we get more players, we'll rewrite the descs to
make them better, down the road.
Thoughts?
-Nico

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 Memo below
Hey, thought you'd be interested in this.  We're thinking
about replacing all the unscaled zones between cities with
zones that better represent travel time, for the war code.
They'd be square zones of generic descs, but we'd add higher
movement costs to represent traveling greater distances
per room (armies would only be able to go a few outdoor
rooms per IC day).  The zones would be square so you could
hack your way through any direction, but it'd obviously
be fastest/easiest to follow the trails.  Since presumably
nobody would RP in these areas for the most part, we'd
just make basic descs and use them over and over again.
We could make a template zone of 10x10 rooms, and just
copy it into different zone numbers, then connect them
around the edges and place in any absolutely necessary
trails or landmarks.  The staff mail is forwarded below.
-Nico
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 Update: Building Task Force
`7CC`6: `7Beonca Ranulf Boris Varulv Eliana
Ok, we're each on the building team for this - we're jokingly
calling it the 'Meanding Trails" project.  As of right now,
here's the plan:
Varulv and Boris are drawing up a grid map of Randland.  We're
going to use that to establish what scale to use, soon as they're
done.
Duren says that there is no max we need to be concerned with
on the number of zones we're adding.  However, we will be removing
(not deleting!) the out of date zones that no one uses, because
they are sucking up a lot of our memory.  We'll keep them backed
up (they already are) so we can recycle some of them at a later date.
After we establish how many zones we're going to need to map
Randland, we'll be doing the following:
*disconnect all the existing 'travel' zones that nobody
uses - trails, wierd areas, etc.  We'll disconnect the
exits and then delete their entries from the index file
so they aren't loaded when we reboot anymore.
*leave existing cities and RP centers as they are, and reconnect
them to our new zones
*the new zones will be square (10 rooms x 10 rooms).  We'll create
a template zone that we'll just copy over and over again onto
the grid, then connect the edges so that the entire world exists
as a generic grid.  Then, we'll go through and overwrite generic
descs with specific ones.
*generic descs will be overwritten with specific ones - this means
we'll be placing the major roads and rivers first, followed by
landmarks, and someday we'll be able to rewrite all descs to
make them unique again, as well as add mobs (some day we'll
have scripting in place for most mobs).
We'll decide how many zones we're going to put in between cities
based on the map Varulv and Boris are drawing up.  This will
probably be the last 'big' building project we ever do, until
we put in special procedure mobs.
-Nico

`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 Update: Building Task Force
`7CC`6: `7Beonca Ranulf Boris Varulv Eliana
Ok, we're each on the building team for this - we're jokingly
calling it the 'Meanding Trails" project.  As of right now,
here's the plan:
Varulv and Boris are drawing up a grid map of Randland.  We're
going to use that to establish what scale to use, soon as they're
done.
Duren says that there is no max we need to be concerned with
on the number of zones we're adding.  However, we will be removing
(not deleting!) the out of date zones that no one uses, because
they are sucking up a lot of our memory.  We'll keep them backed
up (they already are) so we can recycle some of them at a later date.
After we establish how many zones we're going to need to map
Randland, we'll be doing the following:
*disconnect all the existing 'travel' zones that nobody
uses - trails, wierd areas, etc.  We'll disconnect the
exits and then delete their entries from the index file
so they aren't loaded when we reboot anymore.
*leave existing cities and RP centers as they are, and reconnect
them to our new zones
*the new zones will be square (10 rooms x 10 rooms).  We'll create
a template zone that we'll just copy over and over again onto
the grid, then connect the edges so that the entire world exists
as a generic grid.  Then, we'll go through and overwrite generic
descs with specific ones.
*generic descs will be overwritten with specific ones - this means
we'll be placing the major roads and rivers first, followed by
landmarks, and someday we'll be able to rewrite all descs to
make them unique again, as well as add mobs (some day we'll
have scripting in place for most mobs).
We'll decide how many zones we're going to put in between cities
based on the map Varulv and Boris are drawing up.  This will
probably be the last 'big' building project we ever do, until
we put in special procedure mobs.
-Nico

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 Ubermap
`7CC`6: `7Varulv Beonca Boris Ranulf Eliana
I spent some time working on zone estimates for the continental
map, and came up with two options for zone size.
Option 1:
Tar Valon is 25 rooms north, 9 rooms east of Caemlyn.  This
gives a movement rate of 5 rooms per day for troop mobs.  By
comparison, Aringill is 10 rooms east and 1 room south of Caemlyn.
This makes the continental map 13 zones wide and 11 zones high,
or 143 areas (14300 descriptions).  In other words, you can
walk north across the entire continent in 105 rooms, and east
for 130 rooms.
Option 2:
Tar Valon is 38 rooms north, 14 rooms east of Caemlyn.  Troops
move 8 rooms per day (Aringill would be a trip of 17 rooms, in
this case).  The continent would be 20 zones wide by 16 zones
high, giving an area of 320 zones and 32000 descriptions.
What do you guys think? Any smaller scale than option 1, and
troop mobs will only be moving a couple rooms a day, which
gets lame for tactics and then there's just plain not enough
rooms from one end of the world to the other.  Any larger
scale than option 2, and we pass the point of getting old
and having the internet be outdated before we finish.
I vote option 1.  It's most doable workwise and still gives
us tons of rooms to work with.  However, option 2 is perfectly
feasible, too, but it's the upper end of what we can do provided
lots of us work on it.
-Nico

143 areas total, cuz I think 320 is just too unwieldy,
and we'll never finish it.  I emailed you the map I'm

C? Vnums are listed on the right of the map - C0 is
zone # 240, C1 is 241, etc.  I numbered 'em right to
left cuz we'll eventually code the ocean, but I doubt
we'll ever do the Shara like we're doing the rest of
Randland.  Thanks!
-Nico, can't sleep

301, globally.  I just did row F of the .wld files in a
couple of minutes :p
I'll be on this evening.
-Nico

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Caemlyn-Aringill
`7CC`6: `7Henry Eliana Ranulf Mat
Hey guys, we're ready.  I went ahead and titled the
rooms between Caemlyn and Aringill so the cities line
up, so all you have to do is write descs for those
rooms.  I believe, from the east gate of Caemlyn,
it's 2 e, 1 s, 8 e to get to Aringill.  Aringill is
only half placed atm - what you'll see is a room that
says 'Aringill goes here', but you don't need to worry
about filling that in.  It turns out the Aringill zones
are fairly messy, but I've almost got them sorted out.
The east side of Aringill connects right, but the west
side (the one you're on) isn't connected yet.  I'll
finish Aringill tomorrow.
Hopefully see you guys tomorrow :> Thanks again!
-Nico

`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 Change of plan
Hey, after we hit some snags with scaling with the current
continent map, we decided to up the size and make it larger.
Cormac's agreed to as much work on it as we need (he said
he's willing to put in whatever time it takes cuz he feels
it's important to do this right, so *shrug*).  The new vnums
for the zones are gonna be 0 - 729.  We're keeping what we
coded so far, and just adding to it.
-Nico

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 Update on the continent
`7CC`6: `7Mat Beonca Eliana Ranulf Henry
Ok, Caemlyn and Aringill are both marked out on the map
and connected by the road (which is identified by titles
in the rooms, but no descs yet).  From room 44043 (what
will be the east gate of Caemlyn), it's 2 e, 1 s, east til
you hit the west gate of Aringill.  Both Aringill and
Caemlyn occupy 9 squares of the big map (3 rooms x 3 rooms).
What we need are:
Descs for the road.
Descs for the rooms immediately surrounding Caemlyn.  Maybe
a small scattering of houses/farms?
Somebody to go through the current list of zones (show zone)
on the live port and pick out which ones are total junk,
which ones we can steal descs from and which we'll be
importing exactly as is (like Caemlyn).
About 500 more zones. :p Hopefully Eli and I can do these
before we get old and die.
That's about it for the moment.  Beonca, I think I need
your email again - I don't have it saved on this machine.
Everybody else, I'm sending you the updated map now.
-Nico

`7From`6:`7 Ranulf
`7Subj`6:`7 Thought
Hey, instead of bothering with lockers for dropping cities
why not create an object in the zone with keywords city, (and which one)
that way where city works, as does where (name). Also, if you put it to load into the
zedit, it'll always show up.
Also, I had an idea of how to place smaller homesteads. I've only been using the new 'enter' and 'climb' object code this far for secret rooms.
at this risk of exposing that we have this code. We can start making smaller hamlets, roadside inns, etc, as this sorta thign.
Mac

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Sitrep
`7CC`6: `7Ranulf Duren Serai
Hey guys, I'm around but since this place has been dead I've
been spending my free time in the real world.  Duren said that
he thinks we should keep working on our projects as we get time,
but  I mostly feel that I'm gonna keep doing what I'm doing until
we get a small group of people together with some more free time
than anybody's had lately.  In the meantime, if you guys want
to pick at stuff we need, here's the list:
Serai, on creation, with the last version of the talent lists we
sent.  We'll do the final version of those further down the road.
Duren, on the OLC-style interface for bodypart lists.
Mac, on the continent.  For my part, I'll add some more zones
and I guess the other priority (as always) is combat.
These all need to be finished before we can get the mud on its
feet again.  I just don't want to be a solo act anymore - but as
soon as you guys are up for some more activity and we can
beat on these projects as a group, I'll be here.  Lemme know
what you wanna do.
-Nico (and /don't/ send replies to Nico.  Mail Jake. *glare Mac* :p)

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicolas
`7Subj`6:`7 BG for Daes Daemer Guidl
Born into the nobility of the ruling line of Mayene, Nicolas was named one of the
half dozen that carry the title the Second of Mayene should the First fall to the numerous
assassination attempts of the Tairens.  His father had passed away through one of these
attempts a few months before his death, a Tairen assassin trying to thin out the line of
Mayene's ruling house.  His mother was depressed after this, and was lost in conceiving
the boy, who was at birth considered an orphan.  This did not seem to weigh to heavily on
the child's extended family who took him in to live at the palace with his uncle who was
at the time the First of Mayene.
His uncle saw the boy as an opportunity to tie the small country to one of the most
powerful forces in the land.  At the age of twelve Nicolas sur Paendrag Paeron was sent
to the White Tower to train under the tutelage of the Gaidin.  His journey across the land
was spent with two young girls, and an Aes Sedai who had spent the last few years as an
advisor to his uncle but had to return to the Tower to deliver the two girls for training
after she'd discovered their abilities to channel.
His training only commenced soon after his thirteenth birthday, when they finally
arrived through their long journey.  His time with the warriors of Tar Valon, only lasted
seven years at first, when after his training was complete he served as a Sergeant in the
Tower Guard for a little over two years before taking a leave of absence to return home at
the news of the death of the First of Mayene.
The choice to return to Mayene was not his, as all of those who hold the title of
Second must return for the choosing of a new ruler of the small country.  Though the
thought of ruling the small nation wasn't the most exciting thing the man had on his
mind, he was still slightly disappointed to see his younger cousin appointed.
He was left a highly trained man, with little to do.  While still being a noble in
Mayene, he'd never really grown accustomed to the lifestyle there after growing up
through most of his young adulthood in Tar Valon, and the provocativeness of his home
land honestly made the man a little nervous.
He traveled far in his youth, staying in inn's across the world but never gaining
much recognition from others because most of the major nobles would not have much to
do with a Mayener noble who would not be very valuable to advance their own status in
the Daes Daemar.  It seemed that the man's days were spent more wandering, picking up
knowledge of the world and getting older as his time went on.
In time he was compelled back to what was home for Nicolas, the isle of Tar
Valon, where after his almost five year absence where he took up where he left off with
the Gaidin.  He severed his connections with the Tower Guard and took up a post as an
instructor, looking to further the training of the new students that would grace the training
yards.

In time he was compelled back to what was home for Nicolas, the isle of Tar
Valon, where after his almost five year absence where he took up where he left off with
the Gaidin.  He severed his connections with the Tower Guard and took up a post as an
instructor, looking to further the training of the new students that would grace the training
yards.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Couple things
Hey, you gotta leave the Mikki and Dini credit in the wizlist - that
was one of the 'forever' agreements from MM1 and it's also a large
part of the reason there was such a shitstorm the last time it got
deleted.
I'm still working on the BP.  I'm waiting on one piece of help info
from somebody (anybody who knows) and then Mae/Rhia can go to town
linking things together.
I've been thinking about the Craig/Lynn thing.  What I'm worried
about is that after you leave, Craig will set Lynn up at some point
and she'll end up owning the mud, or at least having a high ranking
imm.  I not only don't trust her, but her behavior in the past has
been iconic of some of the worst garbage we've ever had to deal with.
She likes to be vocal, rude and immature, and tries to disguise it as
being more aware of 'what needs to be done' than the rest of us.
She's one of the people who has bitched about everything most of us
have ever done here, and some of the stuff she's said to other
people here is IMO inexcusable.  She's entitled to her opinions,
but she's not the sort of person that would run a mud fairly or
well.  Like I said, I used to think we were friends, but if you
want what she thinks about me, look at some of her live journal
entries about me and the rest of us - when things weren't going
her way, she passed those around so that I would know about them but
couldn't really do anything about cuz it was her right to say
whatever she wants about me so long as it wasn't technically here.
Far as I'm concerned, she's one of the people that was very close
to a perma siteban because she was causing so much unrest in
several guilds, and just generally ruining all the fun for the
rest of us.  While I've always been cool with Craig from the SF,
we both know he's wrapped around her and I do not want him to be
her way in to the staff.  It's another Kane/Giulietta disaster
waiting to happen, and I'm really worried that her influence is
going to affect the personality and general atmosphere of the mud.
If it comes down to it when you need to go, I'd be more willing
to pay the bill again than to let either one of them be imps.
I hope this didn't sound like a rant, but the woman really ticks
me off, especially since I've always been very fair and listened
to her whenever she wanted and all it's ever gotten me is cussed
out to anybody who'll listen.  Half the people on staff used to
be very good friends with her (I've heard the 'like sisters' thing
you mentioned before), and now I don't know anybody besides Faerid
that likes her at all.  Some of the stuff she's done/said around/to
is, as far as they're concerned, flat out betrayal and backstabbing.
Please, please, please don't set either one of them up in a position
where she can get into staff after you're gone.  It'd be like giving
Giuls the mud, only Lynn still has friends here she hasn't stabbed
in the back yet.
Anyways, I'm sorry to talk bad like this about someone you're friends
with.  Just be careful - she's eventually turned on just about
everybody that ever liked her here, and some of the other women
still feel hurt by it.
Anyway. :/ How'd your date go?

`7CC`6: `7Rhiannon Shai'tan Varulv
I think Maelyn and B are talking things out so I'm
just mailing us for now.  The first part of the
project is to finish getting Caemlyn and Aringill
cleaned up, linked to the new world map, and re-
descripting the surrounding countryside.  I'll do
the location stuff so we know exactly what rooms to
link between the existing cities and the new map,
so if you guys wouldn't mind, we need somebody to
go through Caemlyn and Aringill and decide what to
keep, and to remove what you don't want and to update/
pretty up what you don't like.  Aringill has extra
rooms in its zone that aren't part of the city, and
they need to be removed.  Also, starting to write
descs for the road that connects them would be great.
I think it's about 17 rooms long.
I'm gonna be uberbusy tonight, but I'll do the shell
linking real soon - won't take me long, I just need
to get time between classes to do it.
-Nico

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: building shit.
Mostly it's writing descs for the countryside surrounding
Caemlyn and Aringill, and the road that connects the
two.  What I did was rip out the old trails and replace
them with a big rectangular area (30 rooms east-west,
10 rooms north-south).  The entire city of Caemlyn
is inserted into one room towards the west side
of this big map, and the entire city of Aringill is
inserted into one room on the east side.  If you're
interested, the descs are generic and need to be
changed so that the road between the two cities
doesn't have the same desc as the surrounding countryside,
like it currently does, and as you/anybody else
gets time, the rooms around the two cities should
be updated too.  The vast majority (something like
1200) exits are connected and correct, but Boris
is reloading the whole map so the breaks between
the zones need to be connected around the east-west
edge, and the city exits need to be reconnected.
I already wrote up all the vnums and links - I
just need somebody to go through and punch them
in.
This has been a fun project when you're not
working on it by yourself all the time.  If you can
talk a friend or two into doing it with you, it's
more fun than being on the live port most of the time.
You'll see why when you start running circuits
around Caemlyn and using the new ethereal marker
system to bounce between cities :p It's kinda funny.
Anyway, if you're up for it, lemme know.
-Nico, who almost died last night cuz he really
is totally allergic to beer now.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 K
K.  I can't do it today but tomorrow I probably can.  Help me harrass Duren or
Boris into fixing the raid bug, and Boris into finishing the script.  In case
they go 'what's the raid bug', it:
Crashes the BP and corrupts the zone you were rediting.
Has something to do with raid and redit.
Crashes when you redit a room with the 'raid' flag on.
Crashes when you redit a room with a raided desc that has
somehow gotten corrupted (when you type redit, you'll notice
that suddenly the raided desc is all fubared - crash follows
shortly after).
Requires the reboot file to be removed and the corrupted zone
to be either removed or reloaded from scratch in order to reboot
properly.  Otherwise, it goes into a recursive loop and
monopolizes envy's server.
There's only limited stuff we can do on the BP until these two
things get done.  Soon as they are done, though, it won't take
much to get lots of the rest of things finishes.
-Nico
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
