`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 *SLAP*
`7CC`6: `7Hale Duren
For crap's sake bro, we've gone over this so many times I can't believe
you're asking me again.  It happens for a bunch of reasons - mess with
redit in any room where the raid desc is enabled, or just edit a raided
desc in redit until it crashes.  It happens pretty much no matter how you
screw with raid, but I suspect it's directly linked to a problem with redit.
It's pretty easy to make happen - just about any way you play with, edit
or adjust raid causes first obvious corruption, then an inevitable crash
shortly after.  The crash can't recover until the zone (now corrupted) is
either restored or removed, and sometimes you have to remove the
reboot.txt file (1 in 15 times or so, in my experience - I'd forgotten all
about it til you found it this time).
There are no error messages in game, and I can't remember off the
top of my head what syslog says.  The first evidence is usually file
corruption - the room you're working in starts to look like random text
mixed in with spliced room descs.   The crash happens at different
times - sometimes it's as soon as you type redit in a corrupted room,
sometimes it's while you're rediting the room (as you work thru the
menus all the sudden the raid desc is messed up, crash follows shortly).
I don't think it's ever crashed when I was saving the room, though,
always either in redit or after I'd redited the room, after obvious
corruption has occured.  It's real easy to get to happen, just do anything
to the raid desc and redit repeatedly until it goes down.  It affects any
room you do this to - adding new raided descs causes it, playing with
existing raided descs causes it, turning the raid desc on and then
rediting that room causes it.  Also, if you try and reboot without removing
or restoring the corrupted zone, it can't recover and we just eat up
all of the CPU until envy goes down :p
-Nico

I looked at your zone, B - except for the crash Serai reported shortly
after, the zedit new command (is that what you used?) did create all
four files for the zone and it updates the index files properly.  The only
thing I noticed was that your versions of 3.obj and 3.mob didn't have
the exact same data as our original accepted 'template' files for blank
zones, so I overwrote yours with those but I don't think it should have
made a difference.  As far as the crash goes, no idea.  I did a copyover
after playing with the files and it came up just fine.  I renamed your
zone on the show zone list, and it saved fine.  It's not lagging now,
so I dunno - it may have just been your link. *shrugs* You guys can
try and create zones this way if you like - if it keeps crashing, then
we know there's a bug in it still, but it looks ok.
Syrah, I'll import zone 1 with the other 'keeper' zones once we get
a list together.  It's kinda less tedious to do them in groups.
-Nico

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Boris
`7Subj`6:`7 Be Prepared
`7CC`6: `7Duren Varulv Nicodemus
I'm sending this to all of you because I'm not sure who Kahn will try to go to first.  I was reading the sudo
man file (do XYZ as root) and I thought it was telling me I could use sudo to execute commands as other users,
so instead of uploading the files to my dir and then re-uploading them to the tyme directory, I could just
switch permissions for a second and make a link to the worldfile backup.  Well, appearantly either you can't
or I got the syntax wrong.  So it mailed the sysadmins (I think I tried about 3 times before it gave up).  And
I was logged into the Tyme useraccount, so it may look like someone from Tyme was trying to break root.
Just a heads up.  If you check the history you should see something like:
sudo -u klentira ln -s /Muds/Tyme/home/klentira/worldbacksup""
-Boris

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Sudo and ubermap
`7CC`6: `7Boris Duren
Re: Sudo - k. :p
For the world files, I looked 'em over carefully and there's a
couple things.  Firstly (not your fault), the template file you
had was missing something, so I added it and resaved it as
200.wld.  When we do this for real, use 200.wld as your template.
Secondly, your loop for file creation appears to be off in a
couple of minor ways.  For instance, row A needs to consist
of znums 200-225, not 200-224.  Row B is 230 - 255, not 231
to 244.  Every row is 26 rooms, and columns start at #00,
#30, and #60 for #'s 2 - 8.  The last row is just 900 - 925.
Also, don't save 'em as .wld.bak files in the final version - they'll
have to be straight .wld files.  We'll also need the accompanying
index file (see  /../builderport/lib/world/wld/index) with all
the new zone numbers added.
For the remaining file types (.obj, .mob and .zon), use the
template 240 (not 200).  240.obj, 240.mob and 240.zon will
work for all, and we need them numbered exactly the same
as the .wld files.  Also, each of those 3 file types has an
accompanying index file that's exactly the same as the
world index file except every reference of .wld is changed to
.obj, .mob or .zon, respectively.
Otherwise, this is perfect.  Just need you to use the new
200.wld template and to get the loop working correctly, and
we're gold.  The text in the files is 100%.  Nice work :>
-Nic

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Boris
`7Subj`6:`7 Areafiles
Check  /areafile_test .  It should be there by the time you log on, it's uploading
to my directory now.  I went ahead and fixed the loops, and checked the numbers.
It should be right.  I didn't check out the new 200.wld template, so if I missed
and instance of the vnum, let me know.  Other than that, I've included the .zon,
.obj, and .mob files as well as .wld, each in their own directory.  All that
remains is for you to check them for correctness, and then fix the index files.
The index file is in each directory.  You go in there and add whichever zones
we're keeping aside from the ones I just made, and then go ahead and copy the
files over.  I've made them in .bak format so there's no risk of overwriting
(I think for example we have a new and good 300 area that shouldn't get over-
written.)  All you have to do is mv (or cp) *.bak * and it should do them.
That's why it's 200.wld.bak, for example
Boris

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Wee
Dude, we're soooo close.  All four file types are 100% - I
used diff -u on each of them against my originals and they
came out perfectly.  Your file creation loop is still wrong
tho - one row out of every 100 znums is short by 10 zones.
For the second row, it should create files for 230-255, and it
only does it for 230-245.  The index file is also missing
these 10 zones for every hundred znums.  That is - your first
and third row are fine, but your second row (and every
respective row beginning at #30 needs to go to #55 so that
it's 25 rooms wide.  Currently they all stop at #45).
Also - don't save them as .bak files, seriously.  Duren doesn't
know of a way to mass-convert them to just .zon or whatever
files and neither do I, so the BP won't recognize them at all.
Don't worry about overwriting - the zone you mean is zone 3, not
300.  There is no overlap between what you're uploading and
what's currently there that doesn't need to get overwritten.
Just leave 'em as .mob and .wld, etc.
:p

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Elaena
`7Subj`6:`7 Wolfkin Seeker.
I plan to seek the Gleemen...but only after my background has been
Approved by you.
Elaena Harshare grew up in the southern part of Saldaea, for the better half
of eighteen years of her life. She had a mostly normal life her father Darmon
was a farmer of one of Saldaea's famous crops the ice pepper, as well as a
little bit of hunting for furs for his wife. Her mother Diedeadra was a
seamstress, she took the few furs that Elaena's father got and made them into
warm clothing to help the family out as much as possible during the harsh
winter months. But this life was not for Elaena she never picked up on any of
the sewing that her mother tried so hard to teach her. Instead she spent most
of her life following her dad around, and trying hard to pick up every bit
about hunting that she could, from the time she was eight till she was about
thirteen she wanted to be a hunter and sell furs for a living, of course her
being an only child, and her father who had always wanted to ahve a boy allowed
this, but only when her mother could not discover what he was teaching thier
daughter. But all that changed once she was able to have some freedom, and she
began to see the world, the local inn mostly, she liked to go there and talk to
the local hunters. But one day as young minds are feeble, she found a profession
that she truly wanted she wanted to be a Gleemen. She watched how the Gleemen
attracted so much attention, and drew large crowds, so she began to observe the
man's actions as much as she could. After the Gleemen left town Elaena began to
pursue this talent as much as she could, she began to learn how to juggle the
knives that her father gave her, and then also picked up on playing the harp,
and she began to play for the local inns. Her family soon found out what she was
doing, and both mother and father were disappointed in her for even thoguh they
held different views on how to raise her and what she should become, they both
agreed that the life of a Gleemen was not a life that they wanted for thier child.
Elaena, angry with her parents, and wishing to find a gleemen to apprentice under
to further master her skills set out to find a real Gleeman so that she could
apprentice and become a full Gleeman.
On her journey she spent a lot of nights camped out in the woods, and one night
when it was time for her to put up camp she saw a camp fire already made up.
Introducing herself to her strange company she told her life story to the man
and woman in the campsite, and then they told theirs. Apparently they were both
Wolfkin, and lived in the wilderness with wolves, Elaena thought this a very odd
thing, but kept listening, because perhaps someday she could tell a story about
it. It is that night that she was told that she could speak to the wolves herself,
she of course didn't believe them, but upon thier instruction however doubtful she
was about it, she did make an atempt to 'feel' for the wolves as they called it.
That is when she found herself able to 'feel' a wolf at the edge of the camp that
she had not seen there before, this wolf shortly after her discovery, entered the
camp, to share dinner with the strange couple. Freaked out by the encounter Elaena
fled from the camp just as soon as she could, despite the couples warnings that
she should stay with them, to learn more about her 'gift'. The wolves aptly named
her RushingWind for this, for her music that she played upon her harp reminded them
of the music the wind made when it flowed through the woods, and her quick escape
from them only added to this new name they had for her. Still in pursuit of her
dream she came to Caemlyn, but by time she arrived at Caemlyn her eyes were already
starting to change, and despite the strange couples warnings about her soon to be
changing eye color Elaena, has discovered that in the cities there are no wolves to
torture her thoughts, so now she hides in Caemlyn away from the wolves where she can
persue her dreams.

thing, but kept listening, because perhaps someday she could tell a story about
it. It is that night that she was told that she could speak to the wolves herself,
she of course didn't believe them, but upon thier instruction however doubtful she
was about it, she did make an atempt to 'feel' for the wolves as they called it.
That is when she found herself able to 'feel' a wolf at the edge of the camp that
she had not seen there before, this wolf shortly after her discovery, entered the
camp, to share dinner with the strange couple. Freaked out by the encounter Elaena
fled from the camp just as soon as she could, despite the couples warnings that
she should stay with them, to learn more about her 'gift'. The wolves aptly named
her RushingWind for this, for her music that she played upon her harp reminded them
of the music the wind made when it flowed through the woods, and her quick escape
from them only added to this new name they had for her. Still in pursuit of her
dream she came to Caemlyn, but by time she arrived at Caemlyn her eyes were already
starting to change, and despite the strange couples warnings about her soon to be
changing eye color Elaena, has discovered that in the cities there are no wolves to
torture her thoughts, so now she hides in Caemlyn away from the wolves where she can
persue her dreams.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jake
`7Subj`6:`7 BP
`7CC`6: `7Beonca Nenae Syrah
The BP's back up with the ubermap fully imported.  It took a fair
bit of doing, because the number of rooms was bigger than circle
was coded for, so Duren and I had to go through and upgrade
everything - thank him, cuz no way I could have gotten it to work
by myself.  Incidently, Marek's a moron.  His code was some of
the most annoying, and it doesn't work right anyways.
B, I'm real sorry, but I lost any changes you made to zone 3
between Wednesday when I imported it and Thursday when
I started upgrading the BP.  I was able to restore it to the version
that's on there now (same as the live version), but apparently
the daily backup system does not do anything for the BP.  I'm
sorry!
We can do the next two stages of the project at the same time - I'm
going to continue to port over cities and zones as Syrah identifies
the keepers.  Currently, Caemlyn and Aringill are in, as well as
some essential zones that the BP won't run without, and that's it.
I'll be bringing over TV, Cairhien, and other major zones ASAP.
Syrah, any other zones you see that're keepers, recommendations
are helpful and would speed things up as you get time.
At the same time I'm doing this, Syrah can be overseeing the
first real 'builder' phase of the project, where you guys link Caemlyn
and Aringill into their zones, and add in the descs of the surrounding
countrysides.  I sent Syrah a detailed writeup on how to do all of
this.  It includes vnums and specific instructions on exactly what
goes where and what to change.  Mort builders can do any of it.
The descs need to be appropriate to the color coded terrain map I
sent Syrah, and most importantly, the descs for the road between
Caemlyn and Aringill need to be changed from their current generic
desc to unique road descs.  All of this is written out much better
in the files I sent.
Nenae and Beonca, you guys can continue your inns and newbie
zone - I'm very sorry about anything I lost.
I should stress that this is a project that absolutely anybody can
handle - no real building is required anymore, since all the zones
are designed and linked.  All it needs is people, preferrably a
group of them, to go in and write better descs for each of the
existing rooms around the cities.  We're not going to do this for
the entire continent - right now, we're on Caemlyn and Aringill,
and when I import the other major cities, we'll do them similarly.
Any questions, feel free to beep me.  Thank Boris and Duren
for a hell of a job - our world isn't just bigger than other circle muds
now, it's a whole version ahead of them codewise. :p
-Nico

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Simion
`7Subj`6:`7 The Asha'man.

My apologies if you have tried to talk to me whilst I was on the mud, regarding the issues I brought up in mudmail.  I have not recieved any tels from you and thought you were ignoring me... Perhaps I simply forgot to check my playback buffer or it was at a time when I was linkdead.. Anyhow, I am Oswald as well as Simion.  I should have just mailed from one alt to avoid confusion, again, my apologies.  I was surprised to hear that I am the first to bring up the guild being low on activity, as I know Mandi also feels strongly about it.  I know that the whole mud has been lacking with activity, and was unaware of your recent efforts to improve Asha guild activity.  Thats good news though. I would be willing to become a co-GL as I proposed, to help out the guild.  I am on usually in the evenings.  Thats around 5pm-9pm GMT.  I do not know where you are from but I am from the UK so you'll have to work out the time difference from where you are at.  I hope to speak with you soon.
I would send you an application for the position as a GL, but I am unaware of your email address, so here is some information about my past experience with the Asha'man here and on TTA:

I first played Lakkam as a Recruit but grew tired that the character was not going anywhere and deleted him.  Then I created this character (Simion) Early this year.  I am nearly ready to take the test for Soldier rank with him, but he is still a Recruit.  On TTA, I had numerous lessons and reached the rank of Soldier with a character called Aubren.  I rped alot with him and was one of the most active members on that mud.  I reached the rank of Dedicated with Aubren and by that time, I had a great deal of rp experience with the Asha'man.

As I disliked the code system on TTA, I left and came back here to Tyme, hoping to carry on with my character Simion.  I think I have a desire to better the muds I visit and keep coming up with useful things that can be done to improve them, whether the GL's take my advice and use it is another matter though.  I am rather tired with rping too much on muds where the character cannot really go anywhere because of lack of activity, so I feel that now I would be best suited to assume an administrative role whilst still rping to better the Asha'man guild.
Once the guilds on Tyme are functioning better I believe it will draw more players.

`7Subj`6:`7 Cairhien To-do #1
Probably the first of several memos.  Zone 131 is part of Cairhien
but appears to be almost entirely junk - of the majority of the 53 rooms
I looked at, I could find only 4 that were a) part of the city and b) were
connected right.  Almost the entire zone is a total loss.  The keeper
rooms I found were 13148-13152 (ok, so 5 rooms).  Rather than port
over a whole zone of totally mislinked and corrupted garbage, can
you look into patching these five rooms into one of the other zones?
I want to junk zone 131, but if you want to keep those 5 rooms we can
append them to an empty spot in another Cairhien zone or something.
What do you think?

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Oswald
`7Subj`6:`7 The Final Draft?
Nobody -> Private
1. Express wish to join and have it approved by the Captain.  Sign an agreement to serve a specified amount of time.  Agree to rules and to obey the captains orders.
Private -> Corporal

1. Introduction to weapons - Stances, practice with a sword and shield, practice with other types of weapon (quarterstaff, axe and spear.)  At end of lesson, must choose a weapon to specialise in. (not bow since all good mercenaries need to be rather skilled with a bow.)
2. Basic hand to hand combat  Flame and Void, Kicks, punches, blocking and dodging.
3. Etiquette and Image - Teaching the importance of making us look good, being polite to clients, how to act correctly.
4. Scouting, tracking and trailing - How to follow and locate someone, training in the woods.
5. Leadership of a small party  Command responsibilities, assertiveness, small group tactics in urban and rural terrains.
Corporal -> Sergeant
1. Archery - Improving aim, trying different bows including crossbows, correct technique.  Assasination.
2. Focused Weapon Training - Weapon training with the weapon of your choice.
3. Instructing small groups - Teaching of how to teach efficiently.  Guidelines and procedures.
4. Intelligence gathering - Training and put into practice.
5. 1 Field mission.
Sergeant -> Lieutenant
1. Advanced Weapon Training  Training with specific weapon and also with others.
2. Advanced Martial Arts  Palm heel strikes, how to roll properly, spinning kicks, tripping.  Deathblows.
3. Hostages/Bodyguarding  Detailed training about how to protect people.

4. Leadership of a large party  Organising men, punishing men, guidelines and rules with training of how to handle them in battle.  Battle tactics ( The hedgehog, importance of higher ground, shield walls by linking shields, pincer attacks, terrain, retreat and regroup.)
5. 2 field missions.
Lieutenant-> Lieutenant Commander
1. Decision to raise rank further is at the discretion of the Captain.  Proving yourself by accomplishing a difficult mission or impressing the Captain will help!

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Dugoth
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Dreamwalking
Well, as no one informed me or consulted me on the "policy" changes
described in help dreamer I've been handling WK and Dreaming as I
always have, and it's been done, for the last 5-6 years or so since
dreaming has been implemented. There is a general guide for "average"
levels of ability on the guild board, based on guild rank. This is
assumed to be knowledge gleaned from experience and from the guidance
of the wolves, which is significant as can be clearly evidenced by
Hopper's guidance of Perrin and his method of learning T'A'R.
Additionally the skill is taught by Wolfkin to other Wolfkin through
RP (no WK can teach a Dreamer, nor vice versa...I've always been of
the viewpoint that there are some difference in how the interaction
with T'A'R happens between WK and Dreamers. Dreamer's take the more
logical, systematic approach to manipulating T'A'R where for WK it
is more instinctive and intuitive, a tapping into the Wolfkin's
lupine nature as wolves themselves exist as much within T'A'R as
out fo T'A'R). I'd also received approval from Alicia and Nicodemus,
before loosing Faerid, to set the skills as appropriate on those
Wolfkin who could justify the knowledge and ability, due to the
numerous timeline shifts and manipulations, and the scrapping of
skills during the wipe, and have asked Varulv to take that in
my stead, though I'm not sure he heard me the first time :)
Basically, I'm not certain Wolfkin Dreaming should be under the
purview of CM or channeling at all...neither being Wolfkin, nor
the ability to enter the wolfdream have any connection to channeling.
The Goldeneyes talent automatically confers the dreaming ability
and the ability to access and use the Wolfkin dreamskills. It's
always been handled more or less internally within the guild,
and I would like it to stay that way. I am and have been firm in
my stance that no Wolfkin can ICly or should ICly be able to
teach or learn any significant points of dreaming from a non-WK,
so there is no bleed over or leakage in training for you to worry
about having to control or manage.
Dugoth

out fo T'A'R). I'd also received approval from Alicia and Nicodemus,
before loosing Faerid, to set the skills as appropriate on those
Wolfkin who could justify the knowledge and ability, due to the
numerous timeline shifts and manipulations, and the scrapping of
skills during the wipe, and have asked Varulv to take that in
my stead, though I'm not sure he heard me the first time :)
Basically, I'm not certain Wolfkin Dreaming should be under the
purview of CM or channeling at all...neither being Wolfkin, nor
the ability to enter the wolfdream have any connection to channeling.
The Goldeneyes talent automatically confers the dreaming ability
and the ability to access and use the Wolfkin dreamskills. It's
always been handled more or less internally within the guild,
and I would like it to stay that way. I am and have been firm in
my stance that no Wolfkin can ICly or should ICly be able to
teach or learn any significant points of dreaming from a non-WK,
so there is no bleed over or leakage in training for you to worry
about having to control or manage.
Dugoth

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Calabos
`7Subj`6:`7 Wolfkin application.
Howdy, I'd like to, you guessed it... Apply!
*drumroll*
Here is my background as it came across in RP:

Calabos lurches into the telling more than continues for the elaborance comes to his lips haltingly, almost as if he were reluctant.  Still, he goes on.  "`&In this clearing there were signs of a very recent skirmish: Broken weapons, broken bodies and many tracks.  Two dead men were there, the mark of the Children on clothing and armor, as well as was the carcass of a wolf.`7"  Falling silent then, the prisoner raises his focus and slowly revolves towards you and for but the blink of an eye, something appears to gleam within that nightmarish dark.  No, it was nothing.  "`&The men had died fighting, I will give them that.  Their bodies were sullied, one man was barely identifiable as such, the other had his throat removed... there was blood everywhere.`7"  Snorting a hint of amusement as an internal aside unfolds, the man continues.  "`&Being the opportunistic sort that I am, I figured I'd be able to more easily get food, get a bed if I wore the trappings of the Children.  I salvaged what I could and left the men were I found them.`7"

Okay, the story is that Calabos here is a homeless opportunist and has been masquerading as a Child of the Light.  This has all been okay'd with Varulv but I wanted to send you my application asap.  Here is my character's description, if needed.

Your eyes take in a young man of less than twenty years, dark of color with a rough texture to his skin. Deeply set within his skull, Twin vents of deep brown, near black, bore out from his skull.  Never appearing at ease,  those avenues of attention are ever in motion, unceasing repetitions of inspection and scrutiny.  Once a solid birch, the figure's hair now lies atop his head in a solid mass of tangled strands as if styling were an unknown luxury.

Indeed the rather severely planed facial features are well reinforced by his attire, the latter quite simply folds of pristine white underlayed by gold and steel.  Most eye-catching is the immaculate cloak, the garment streaming from the front the shoulders the back of his mirrored marching boots.  No less of note is the vivid sunburst boldy situated upon the left breast of the garment itself, the bordering of the cloak embroidered in gold.

Snugly nestled beneath the hems of the cloak lies a steel cuirass, the straps of the breastplate dutifully hidden by the snowy tabard that loosely guards the flanks.  The armor itself is dented and tarnished, hardly worth the name.  Wreathing each forearm is a sheath of steel, such protection not confined to the upper body as greaves of silver, surely once polished, also guard his legs.  Oddly, the various sections of armor are quite motely as if they are members of several different sets of protection.  A simple longsword rides the soldier's hip, the visible hilt and crossguard conspicious in their absence of adornment.

Of course, he is not really a WC and not a WK, yet.  I would very much appreciate your consideration in this as I have a lot of enthusiasm for this characer idea and am looking forward to a lot of RP.
Thanks.
rfc02@hotmail - Email me if you desire.

`7From`6:`7 Syrah
`7Subj`6:`7 Guild zones
`7CC`6: `7Beonca Varulv
Hey there, I need you two to give me a list of what zones your guilds are currently using as guild
zones so I don't accidently have them deleted with the area switchover.  There are a few guilds that
appear to have more than one area, but are really only using one of them, which is why I am asking
this of you.
Thanks!
Syrah
PS: the sooner I get these lists, the sooner I can submit my list to Nico so we can get the BP
zones to where they should be.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Syrah
`7Subj`6:`7 Building Stuff
`7CC`6: `7Varulv Beonca Nicodemus
`7I got the list of current zones that I want/don't want to use for the new area revamp.  The
areas we keep will have to be incorporated into Nico's large map.
Please review and send me any changes.  Once it's 'finalized', I will send this to whomever gets
the task of porting everything over to the BP.
Please note that most areas that are to be 'ported' do not yet have assigned numbers for the new
Revamp (under the heading "BP#), since I don't want to reassign zones until I know what I am
keeping.  The few that are assigned are becasue they are already on the BP.
Also Note that MP# stands for 'main port' number. Ie: the number of the zone on this port.
This list can be viewed at:  `#http://www.geocities.com/vwinters@swbell.net/MITZones12-14-04.htm`7
Syrah
PS: Items highlighted in blue (except the two noble houses) are guild areas that I'm not sure
are being used or not, hence the mails I sent out to Varulv and Beonca asking for used
guild zones.

`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BP note - saving
Hey, went over this with Nenae and Carissa but here's how to
save.  After everybody is done rediting (trying to do this while
somebody is can crash the BP, so wait til you're all ready),
type 'olc'.
This'll bring up a list of zones that need to be saved.  This is
separate from the 'save zone internally?' question you answered
when quitting redit, btw - you have to do this every so often too,
else the next time we reboot/crash everything is lost.
From the list that gets brought up with 'olc', it'll say something
like '640 needs saving'.  To save zone 640, type 'redit save 640'.
I think you can save all zones at once by typing 'OLC save', as well.
-Nic
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Mini mod
I've got the mud running under mini mode now, but I had to remove zone 51 from
all the index files - I'm clueless as to why we can't boot with that zone, but it
was causing a seg fault.  51 is the aiel area - i removed it and we rebooted
just fine.  I haven't enabled valgrind cuz I don't know what to do with it :p
Also, we can still shave more zones off this lift if we have to.
-Nic

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Amra
`7Subj`6:`7 BP project
Hey Nico,
I wanted to let you know what I did while you weren't looking.  :)

road square is complete in all three zones on the to do list.  The only things left on the whole list is the completed description of the general stuff in the overworld.  (Exactly, the green, blue-green, and blue vnums)
In case anyone starts working on Zone 638 before I start in on it again, FYI, the fork of the river on the RIGHT is the River Alguenya, and the one on the LEFT is the Erinin.

Please feel free to walk the roads and make sure they are what was requested and the descs are good enough.  I will be more than happy to change anything that needs changing - I'm new at this, so I wouldn't be surprised if I didn't do it exactly right.

One possible problem:  the last thing I did during my first session of building was to fix the West Gate of Aringill (vnum 16522).  When I logged back in later, it had reverted back to the way it was before I changed it.  I don't know if it just didn't save correctly, or if I put a West Gate of Aringill in the wrong place somewhere.  I searched around and couldn't find a duplicate in an erroneous vnum, but you never know.  Thought you should be aware either way.

If you have any questions, comments, concerns, or if you need to yell at me for screwing something up, please let me know.  My alts are Amra, Phaedra, and Embeth.  I'm on almost all day.  (It's 6 am now, and I'm going to bed, but I'll be back tomorrow afternoon.)

This has been long enough, hopefully I'll be able to talk to you later.  BTW, my husband (alts Janthin and Rowen) is also interested in helping out.  He's off work all day and will be on, too, if you could still use some more volunteers.
thanks!  Carissa

`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BP update
`7CC`6: `7Syrah Beonca
Hey Syrah, I've got a good group of people working on the Caemlyn/Aringill
areas now - they've already knocked out the vast majority of it and are just
writing descs for the rest of the rooms now.  I added Phaedra and Caleb to
the builders guild (they're Ming and Carissa on the BP - they've been kicking
serious ass over there).  Nenae is doing a lot of the descs as well.
Also, regarding your zones - I told you I can't renumber 2 digit zone
numbers - can't do it.  The automated command will mislink half the exits
and doing it by hand takes effin forever - I had to do it to fix Aringill and got
so pissed off I eventually just unloaded everything in it that wasn't
working properly.  Otherwise, tho, which city do you think we should
port over next? Cairhien I've already done detailed recon for, but
Tar Valon is used more - but it's more junk zones too.  I havne't looked
at TV at all beyond noting that there are about a dozen zones reserved
for it for some reason.
-Nic

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BD Update
`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Builders Dept
This is for the builders and staff.
I'm dazzled by how much everybody's getting done.  Phaedra
just finished the last of the zone 639 descriptions, and
everybody's putting a lot of work into the whole Caemlyn/Aringill
group of zones.  I think next I'd like to add some objects to
the zone to mark things better - like wagon ruts, for example.
For my part, I've been cleaning up Caemlyn some - try it out.
I've added a quick navigation system on the ubermap so you can
teleport to any finished city by typing "goto <city name>".
If you type 'goto caemlyn', you teleport to a marker 'above'
the city zone, in a room labeled 'Ethereal Caemlyn'.  If you
go in any cardinal direction from there, you enter the actual
world at the respective gate of Caemlyn (w,n,e, or s gate).
I'm gonna do this for all the cities we port over.
If you guys have any ideas or projects you'd like to do, please
let me and Syrah know.  I personally am interested in adding
a thieves guild entrance for the Caemlyn Black Lions.  Also,
Ranulf showed me a neat way to place small towns on the map
by using enterable objects, that basically act like gates into
other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys
think?
-Nic
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!

other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys
think?
-Nic
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BD Update
`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Builders Dept
This is for the builders and staff.
I'm dazzled by how much everybody's getting done.  Phaedra
just finished the last of the zone 639 descriptions, and
everybody's putting a lot of work into the whole Caemlyn/Aringill
group of zones.  I think next I'd like to add some objects to
the zone to mark things better - like wagon ruts, for example.
For my part, I've been cleaning up Caemlyn some - try it out.
I've added a quick navigation system on the ubermap so you can
teleport to any finished city by typing "goto <city name>".
If you type 'goto caemlyn', you teleport to a marker 'above'
the city zone, in a room labeled 'Ethereal Caemlyn'.  If you
go in any cardinal direction from there, you enter the actual
world at the respective gate of Caemlyn (w,n,e, or s gate).
I'm gonna do this for all the cities we port over.
If you guys have any ideas or projects you'd like to do, please
let me and Syrah know.  I personally am interested in adding
a thieves guild entrance for the Caemlyn Black Lions.  Also,
Ranulf showed me a neat way to place small towns on the map
by using enterable objects, that basically act like gates into
other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys
think?
-Nic
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!

Ranulf showed me a neat way to place small towns on the map
by using enterable objects, that basically act like gates into
other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys
think?
-Nic
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BD Update
`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Builders Dept
This is for the builders and staff.
I'm dazzled by how much everybody's getting done.  Phaedra
just finished the last of the zone 639 descriptions, and
everybody's putting a lot of work into the whole Caemlyn/Aringill
group of zones.  I think next I'd like to add some objects to
the zone to mark things better - like wagon ruts, for example.
For my part, I've been cleaning up Caemlyn some - try it out.
I've added a quick navigation system on the ubermap so you can
teleport to any finished city by typing "goto <city name>".
If you type 'goto caemlyn', you teleport to a marker 'above'
the city zone, in a room labeled 'Ethereal Caemlyn'.  If you
go in any cardinal direction from there, you enter the actual
world at the respective gate of Caemlyn (w,n,e, or s gate).
I'm gonna do this for all the cities we port over.
If you guys have any ideas or projects you'd like to do, please
let me and Syrah know.  I personally am interested in adding
a thieves guild entrance for the Caemlyn Black Lions.  Also,
Ranulf showed me a neat way to place small towns on the map
by using enterable objects, that basically act like gates into
other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys
think?
-Nic
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Amra
`7Subj`6:`7 Dreaming Talent application (long)

1) I designed my Wise One (currently apprentice) to be a Dreamer because I wanted to help fill out the Aiel WO ranks with a Dreamer.  I was informed the guild had no current, active Dreamers, and because Dreaming is not as rare a Talent among Aiel, I wanted to help flesh out that aspect of the Wise Ones.  Additionally, I have played every other general type of character: channeler, weapon master, performer, noble, etc.  I have not played a character with the Dreaming Talent previously and wished to explore that avenue of character development.

2) OoCly, I know as much about Tel'ara'rhiod as anyone who has read the series up through Crossraods of Twilight over three dozen times, though somewhat less for the later books.  T'a'r is translated as 'The World of Dreams' or 'The Unseen World,' and it is believed to be of and apart from each potential Weaving of the real world.  Though anyone can 'touch' T'a'r in their sleep, generally it is for only moments and is only remembered as a vivid dream.  One key difference between T'a'r and a personal dreamscape, however, is that T'a'r is an actual place. It -can- be entered into physically, though this is said to be an extremely dangerous undertaking.  (In the books, we see three characters manifest themselves physically into T'a'r with no obvious ill effects, but the warnings against doing so are severe).

Because it is a real place, things that happen there are reflected in the real world, much as dreams themselves are a reflection of life.  Should one be hurt in T'a'r, one would awake with the wounds to show for the damage.  If one dies in the Dream, one does not wake.  It is not a Talent connected inherently to the ability to channel, as Aiel Wise Ones have been able to walk the Dream since time before memory, and not all the Dreamwalkers have been able to channel.

In terms of its reflection to the real world, all permanent objects are seen as they are in the waking world.  Non-permanent objects are ephemeral: doors are open or closed, chairs are pushed in or left out, a bowl may sit on a table and vanish in an instant.  Because these things have no permanent place in the real world, their reflections in T'a'r are inconsistent as well.  Additionally, though a Dreamwalker can be physically affected in T'a'r, the reciprocal statement is invalid.  A Dreamer ripping a door off its hinges in T'a'r would not wake to find the door gone in the real world.

Unlike the waking world, those same ephemeral objects that have no permanent reflection can be manipulated or created by a well-trained Dreamwalker.  Clothing can be whatever one wishes, a pot of steaming tea can appear in one's hands, one's face can look like another's.  The only limitations are those that come of the Dreamer's level of training and control in T'a'r.  A well-trained Dreamer will never find her clothing changing as she moves unless she wishes, while an untrained or poorly trained Dreamer might discover that every breath or errant thought dresses her in new clothing.

As an addition to being able to roam T'a'r, Dreamers can manipulate the realm of dreams in other ways.  They are able to look into other people's regular dreams: a well-trained Dreamer can even interact with the dream of the person they are watching.  Each person's dreams can be located by the Dreamer if she has identified that person's dreams previously.
Some, Aes Sedai and Warders prominent among them, shield their dreams against access from the outside.  Even a talented Dreamwalker cannot enter the dreamscapes of a person with warded dreams.
3) Following is my character's background, approved by acting Guildleader Beonca, for initial explanation of character motivation for obtaining Dreaming.

**At 34, Amra is as atypical in her apprentisheship as she is in her appearance.  Once a weaver married to a trader, her journey toward becoming a Wise One was a surprising one.  Her late husband, Torin, was facing a journey east to the lands of Shara.  The night before his departure on a trip he had made many times, Amra had an excrutiatingly vivid dream.  In the dream, she envisioned her husband being beset by a massive dark swarm and falling dead to the cracked earth.  In the morning she told him of the dream and implored him to take any extra spears he could.  Thinking his normally stolid wife was simply worrying overmuch, he did not heed her request.

Three weeks later, Amra had the same dream and woke with a certainty that her husband had fallen.  When word arrived after another three full weeks that her husband had indeed been killed, along with all the other traders and several algai'd'siswai.  She had told no one of her dreams up to that point, but hearing her fears confirmed, Amra mar

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BP update
`7CC`6: `7Syrah Duren Varulv Beonca
Maelyn expects to have the final version (I already approved it) of TV posted
by Sunday at the latest, and as soon as it is I'm putting several of the
builders on it to construct it, minus descs.  As soon as it's built, we're
going to insert it where it belongs on the ubermap.  They can continue
to add descs at their leisure, but this way the city will at least be
functional.
I ported over Alindaer and did most of the required renovations (it was
built sideways, courtesy Mikki, who can't read a map).  I'm gonna hook
it, Tar Valon, and the bridges up over the Erinin at the same time,
but Alindaer at least is pretty much good to go, minus some prettying
up.
Syrah, I realized that I didn't port over your Cairhien zones yet, so I
sat down last night and set that up, but I think (hope) I left the files at
hope cuz otherwise I lost them somewhere and they're very gone.
Next chance I get, I'll port them over correctly and you can do whatever
you want to them.
Big picture: These are the major cities that I care about.  Beyond
these, it just comes down to some zones that players particularly
want and use.  Most of those can be added later.  Once we get the
major ones in and done, I'm going to start looking at porting over
the ubermap.
-Nic

`7From`6:`7 Eivan
`7Subj`6:`7 Farewell

Ugh, I hope you get this before you leave. :p  I really did have a great time with you Beo, you certainly are an amazing woman, and a dear friend.  I know that the Navy has gained a well-needed asset by taking you in, and I know that Basic Training is going to be a breeze for you.  Remember, Drill Instructors  have a job to do, and it is never anything personal, they just have to instill that military discipline that was instilled to all of us.  Well, guess that's all I really have to say...  Oh one more thing. :p  I'm very proud to serve with you in our nation's defense, and who knows...  Maybe someday we'll visit each other :)  Kristin, realize that your doing something most people never could do...  You chose to fight instead of hide, and for that...  I salute you, Seaman. :)  Lots of love, and hope to hear from you soon. *hugglesnugglecuddlesmoochies*

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Asher
`7Subj`6:`7 Plotting.
Hey,
I have a couple of ideas for plots. First of all, we should abuse the fact
that if we are both going to make characters that we should make them
either both come from different nations or both have heritage in other
nations, so we can use those heritages for scheming. When we schemed in
Cairhien, we had characters which pretty much limited us to working there.
I think we should be more bold and exciting this time.
For example, I still want to play a Mayener so... I could make a noble that
is of both Mayener and Cairhienin lines. Eg. A Lord Paeron father and a
Damodred mother, or vice-versa. Then you could create a Cairhienin from a
different house and perhaps with noble history in Aringill or maybe even
Andor. That gives us together quite a large tract of land that we can try
and scheme and assert sovreignty over :p
My suggestion is we both try and scheme and help each other to get into
power in different countries and then use each other's power to form a
block against someone, eg. Rand or Morgase (is Morgase Queen of Andor or
do we have a player playing that role? I don't know.)
In terms of how you and I would link together to make us such great plotters
we could have either us 1) Linked by family 2) have some common cause, eg. Rand
or 3) we could be Darkfriends.
TymeRandland is ours!!!! Mahwhaha. :p
What do you think? Let me know so I can start fleshing things out like descs
and BGs.
Ooops. Yeh, and this is Ilusha, i've renamed to this char this will be the
name I use when I start RPing again.
-Tristan. Ilusha/Marrick/etc.etc.

many years ago that 'sense to Vicki' often means total
chaos to other people.  :)

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 TV
Ok, looks good and we're good to go.  It's your city so you're in
charge of coordinating the descripting efforts of anybody you
can get to help - I'd ask Nenae, Phaedra and Quinlan for
starters - they've all worked on the ubermap - and maybe
Bethany as well (she's been bored during the day).  Here's
where we're at:
I constructed all of zone 90 and 91 (all numbered rooms on
your map) - the city should be fully working except for the
missing tower and the missing descs.  It's connected to
the bridges, which connect to the ubermap.  I also redid
Alindaer (a half assed job but it's ok), and imported it as
well - the bridge to Alindaer connects to your city like it
should.  The other bridges just pop out at the squares on
the ubermap where the towns would go (see the website:)
`^http://www.engr.umd.edu/ maeillo/index2.htm`7  and
`^http://www.engr.umd.edu/ maeillo/TV_city2_feb_7.bmp`7
Please come up with a color scheme for the city, and use it
in the title of the red rooms on your map.  Like `3T`#a`2r V`2a`#lo`3n`7
or something, but pretty :p All the cities have all their gates
marked that way, and each city has its own color scheme.
Lemme know what it is, cuz we'll have references to it outside
the city, as well.  Up to you what colors you want :>
If you find any mistakes, lemme know.  I may have to do some
additional pfile setting for everybody to be able to edit the city,
but I can't remember everybody's BP names offhand so just
let me know or get another imm to set you.  I can do it offline
if you send me a list of names, too.
There is one mistake that I fixed - but just so you know, the way
it's built right now is correct, so don't change it :p On your map,
there are two adjacent rooms numbered 9084 - the one of the
right is now 9011, since there is no 9011 anywhere else.  There
is another 9085 tho, so I kept it where it was and just recycled
9011.  It should be right.
I adjusted the 'goto tv' and 'goto al' (alindaer) markers.  Alindaer
works exactly like caemlyn's does, and tv just pops you out at
in the yellow squares on your map.
Besides just the city itself, the river around the city also needs
to be descripted, as do the bridges and the one-room villages
around the city.  They can stay one room for now, but they do
need a desc and the name from the books.
You can do all new descs if you so desire, but you can also
pirate some of the current TV ones if you like.  Ranulf mentioned
the Silver Swan (never looked at it), but it'd be cool if you could
reconstruct it as one of the inns as well, since there's a couple
people that RP there on the main port.  Also, start deciding how
to use the white tower - if you want to just slap it as is in the
middle of the city, or if we need to adjust it, or what.  It's your
guild area and your call what you want to do with it.
Umm.  I think that's it.  I'll be around off and on for large chunks
of time to help, but mailing me is fastest.  Feel free to beep me
if you guys need anything. :> Have fun, and thanks :)
-Nic

Color code is white and cyan. Ex  `&T`6a`7r `&V`6al`7on

the island is simply `&T`6a`7r `&V`6al`7on `&W`6a`7y.

Thanks for all your help! I truly appreciate it!

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Alzer
`7Subj`6:`7 Background

Alzer was born in a farming village in Arafel called Tifan's Well.  His mother lived and worked in the town as a seamstress.  She was a strong and kind woman.  His father fell in battle before he was born and so, Alzer never saw him.  Even from when Alzer was very little, his life was dominated by thoughts of fighting at the Blight, and he learned, as any child in the borderlands does, about their nations greatest single enemy.  While Tifan's Well, being more to the south of Arafel, was safer than villages of the north, the threat was still real, reports of raids coming all the time.

Like most young men in the borderlands, Alzer was taught rudimentary warcraft.  At age 11 he went north to train with Lord Kaslar and was given a place to stay at his fort near the Blightborder.  Amongst other youths, Alzer was one of the few to show fast learning and extraordinary skill.  He was dedicated to his cause -training to be able to fight at the Blightborder and defend his nation, and when he was deemed old enough, he put his hair in braids and went northwards.

When Alzer  fought Trollocs for the first time, his assignment by his Lord, was to investigate a village that had gone silent one month prior.  It was the middle of Winter and the snow was a trouble to get through in order to reach the location.  What Alzer and the men with him found was only the burned remains of buildings and of people, and soon after they had arrived, they were attacked by not only trollocs, but a fair few fades as well.  Luckily the borderlanders outnumbered the Shadow's forces and they were defeated but Alzer will never forget that first look that he got of the eyeless which froze him to the spot with fear.

Since that event, Alzer has helped fight off many Trolloc raids into Arafel, but the Blight takes more and more of Arafel's territory every year.  With news of the Dragon Reborn appearing in the southlands, Alzer and the few men now under his command rejoiced.  Others were skeptical, yet many felt hope that the Light may finally have delivered the man to them.  At first, hearing the news of the Amnesty for male channelers in Andor, Alzer was appalled, but if the Dragon Reborn is training them for battle against the Shadow, such power would give the forces of the Light at Tarmon Gaidon a great advantage and he sees this.  If he can learn, he would be willing to.  At the moment, Alzer is back at his home village of Tifan's Well visiting his family with the chance he has been given, now that the Blight has grown suspiciously quiet.  He is remaining in the borderlands at the moment in case the armies of the Shadow are building up for a large attack, which is his suspicion.

It was the middle of Winter and the snow was a trouble to get through in order to reach the location.  What Alzer and the men with him found was only the burned remains of buildings and of people, and soon after they had arrived, they were attacked by not only trollocs, but a fair few fades as well.  Luckily the borderlanders outnumbered the Shadow's forces and they were defeated but Alzer will never forget that first look that he got of the eyeless which froze him to the spot with fear.

Since that event, Alzer has helped fight off many Trolloc raids into Arafel, but the Blight takes more and more of Arafel's territory every year.  With news of the Dragon Reborn appearing in the southlands, Alzer and the few men now under his command rejoiced.  Others were skeptical, yet many felt hope that the Light may finally have delivered the man to them.  At first, hearing the news of the Amnesty for male channelers in Andor, Alzer was appalled, but if the Dragon Reborn is training them for battle against the Shadow, such power would give the forces of the Light at Tarmon Gaidon a great advantage and he sees this.  If he can learn, he would be willing to.  At the moment, Alzer is back at his home village of Tifan's Well visiting his family with the chance he has been given, now that the Blight has grown suspiciously quiet.  He is remaining in the borderlands at the moment in case the armies of the Shadow are building up for a large attack, which is his suspicion.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Christa
`7Subj`6:`7 Hunter of the Horn
Stupid Mud mail. Sorry, i've had a bit of trouble sending this so I don't know what you recieved.
You glance around your gaze falling upon her, her ice blue eyes shimmering softly.
On the right side of her beautiful face there appears to be an odd red design painted
on, covering most of it. Her long dark brown hair hangs down her back in an intricate
braid that reaches slightly past her waist. She wears a tight black coat embroidered
in silver. Under the coat she wears a loose white blouse tucked into her tight fitting
black leather pants.  Her black boots come up over her pant legs and end just
below her kness. A black leather strap trimmed in silver hangs over her shoulder
and across her chest. The strap connects to a long slightly curved black leather
scabbard trimmed in silver, on her back. A foot long hilt extends from the scabbard
up over her shoulder, the hilt and cross guard are wrapped in black leather strips.
Well crafted silver work can be seen from beneath the leather strips, on the pommel,
and over the cross guard. On her right forearm is a black steel parrying bracer also
wrapped in black leather strips with a small bit of silver work showing inbetween the
strips. Worn on the ring finger of her right hand is an odd ring of silver which appears
to be a dozen serpents entwined together with small emeralds inset for their eyes,
Christa was born into house Damodred about twenty years ago. Her father was a
minor noble of the house and her mother was a noble of a smaller house, House Kaer.
She grew up with two older brothers a three or four off from her own age. Her mother
died from natural causes during child birth with her. Having no real female role-model
she turned out to be a tom boy. Her nurse tried her best to keep her in dresses and
teach her the things she would need to be a lady in Cairhien. She excelled in her
studies be it history, court intrigue, or anything else. Only having to be shown or told
something once she would remember it without any problem. As a child she was found
more often out playing with her brothers and the other boys well they practice the sword,
which is where she learned what skill she has, then with anyone her own age or sex.
Often causing trouble or playing pranks, she was a mischievious child. At about the age
of eighteen her father arranged for her to marry. In secret she hired a blacksmith to make
her the sword and bracer she now carries and a silver smith to do the silver work on bracer
and sword. After the completion she gathered a few belongings, changes of clothes and
her mothers ring, and some coin. She ran away to become a Hunter for the Horn. Traveling
to Illian to take the oaths. She reached Illian in time to take the oaths using her mothers
maiden name she traveled far and wide searching for the horn to no avail ending up in the
Two Rivers area during the time when the Trollocs attacked(the second time). She came
across a lone trolloc who attacked her. She was saved when a young Two Rivers boy put
an arrow through the beast. Realizing her own in-ability to protect her self she set off for the
Tower in Tar Valon to learn from the warders. Her only goal, next to that of finding the Horn,
to become a blade master.
going on at the time. Some I would like to try to reestablish even with the lack of the players
from then. She was a distinguished Hunter for the Horn and had recieved training from two
warders/blade masters from the tower. One was the Aiel blade master Tarkan(sp?). The other
I can no longer remember his name after so long. She had also been inducted into the
Companions of Illian by Lord Brend/Sammael himself unknowing that he was one of the
forsaken. She had considerable training from the two warders in emote fighting. As well as I
have had years of experience emote fighting before even coming to A Moment in Tyme on
Prodigy's RP chat. If you need any other information just e-mail me back I will do what I can.
The background is fairly rough I wrote it in about a half an hour so it may need a little work.

myself.
Thanks!
Syrah

`7Subj`6:`7 Regarding Gav's and her Foretellings
`7CC`6: `7Syrah Varulv
Hey, sorry I didn't reply back sooner but I haven't had time to
go through my mail til now.  If Gav's is doing her own foretellings,
feel free to slap her down.  She knows she needs to get her
foretellings approved by the IC Imp (me back when she started,
and now it's Varulv), and she damned well knows it.  Do whatever
you need to - I'm prepared to tell her to fuck the hell off if she
complains to me about it.  The 'detailed' instructions on what
she's allowed to do are up to V, entirely.  Her policy with me
was that she would receive her foretellings from me, not make
them up herself.  If she needed something, she'd come to me
to get it.
Syrah, far as the importing zone 1 goes - I can't until valgrind
goes off.  Til we enable the 'real' mud, none of that stuff shows
up here - only the small list of old zones are active.  That's
why the new houses aren't showing up, even tho they're technically
there.  Soon as Duren is done with Valgrind we'll put them
in.
Sorry 'bout that.
Nic

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Lamont
`7Subj`6:`7 Damiel BG and Desc:
Background:
Born in 973 N.E., Damiel Tesarin was the son of a Kandori merchant
and his Amadician wife.  They met and fell in love in the spring of 973,
and in the middle of that year's Borderland winter Damiel was born.
Unfortunately, the child knew his father only for a few months before
the elder Tesarin was killed in a fall from his horse.  His mother was
left both grief stricken and bereft of any means of support for herself
and her child.  She sent Damiel south to live in Amador with his
grandfather, an aging and strict Child of the Light.  He was raised from
the cradle following the Children's tenets, his grandfather being of the
old guard of Children, those who encouraged the spirit of Mantellar's
words in pursuing a life of virtue, self-denial, and justice.  The boy
had a keen sense of right and wrong, and was honest to a fault.  At the
age of sixteen he was entered into the Children of the Light and
instructed in the ways of soldiery.  He took to this aptly, probably
because of his height and formidable build, but in comparison to other
recruits he was not eager to fight.  Once his basic training was
complete, he was sent to serve in a legion stationed in Andor.  Through
the years of his service, he distinguished himself enough to earn
several promotions through displays of good character judgement, a
discerning eye, and a rigorous commitment to the Children's tenets, but
never became an officer.  This was likely because of his reluctance to
fight and view of violence as a last resort, the Children at this point
being a largely military organization.
Description:
A tall young man, with a deep chest and shoulders that belong on a
blacksmith: he is a Child of the Light.  Golden curls frame his face,
and his eyes are like cold blue stones.  His cheeks are clean shaven,
and his uniform resplendent.  Everything about him attests to a life of
order and discipline.  A snowy white cloak swathes him from shoulders to
ankles, its voluminous hood thrown back.  A flaring sunburst is stitched
upon its left breast in thread of gold.  His back and breastplates are
unadorned, smooth steel designed to turn away an enemy's weapon, but
they shine like silver when struck by the light.  Gleaming mail covers
his arms and legs, and his black leather boots are both meticulously
clean and polished to a dull shine.  Soft gauntlets of black leather
protect his hands, and a golden-buckled belt encircles his waist.  A
two-handed broadsword is slung across his back.  Its thick, tapered
steel blade is housed in a scabbard of gold worked black leather, its
pommel is a golden sunburst, and the slightly curved quillions bear
lethal points.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7From`6:`7 Demarko
`7Subj`6:`7 MUD crash
I was able to reliably crash the MUD this morning, by being stuck in an endless loop
of the editor.  If I disconnected and reconnected, this problem didn't occur.  If I logged
off and then relogged, it did.
I suspect that the error was located in nanny.c by not cleaning up the editting buffer
when I reconnected, versus when I simply connected normally.  The edit buffer cleanup is
probably located AFTER the "perform_dupe_check" function - that would be my supposition.
In either case, if I tried to save the message, the MUD immediately crashed
Somehow by typing @l enough with Varulvs help, eventually I got a message that said,
Line too long, last line skipped and it kicked me out of the editor.

`7From`6:`7 Tarin
`7Subj`6:`7 test1
`&H`7ow shall we tell of the honourable dead
`&Q`7uidam clad in resplendent black.
`&E`7ffaced from our thoughts, for the prices they pay,
`&U`7nblinking they stare down the Dark.
`&L`7ost to their lives, when they answered His call
`&I`7mmured until death does it's part.
`&D`7aring to dance, just to keep themselves sane
`&N`7ever dreaming of hope in their hearts.
`&A`7rrogance hiding 'midst innocence lost
`&  L`7eaves martyrdom only as fate.
`&R`7ender fair judgement and pity give thanks
`&  A`7ssign to the heroes their due.
`&  N`7one but the True would stand gaint the storm
and None but the soldiers stand proud.
No more to rest, and never to grieve
til `&No bar to the grave`7, is now called.

`7From`6:`7 Rasequin
`7Subj`6:`7 BG Rasequin
`7Name: Rasequin Longaard.
`7Gender: Male
`7Origin: Arafel
`7Height: 6'2"
`7Weight: 210 pounds
`7Hair: Jet Black (with bells)
`7Eyes: Light Blue
`7Physical Appearance: Tall and athletic.
`7Weapons of choice: Bastard Swords

`7Bio: Rasequin was born to a rich family, given the luxuries that came with being rich from birth to his teen years.  `7Enducation was nothing but the best, and his classes included both mental and physical, including sword skills taught to `7every borderland child.
`7His parents were rich because they were close friends to royal members of the royal houses of Arafel, as well as owning a `7lucrative business in service trading.
`7Rasequin would have had a share in this business.  With the education he gained, and his good relationship with his father, `7he would have become a partner and shared in the wealth.

`7During his twenty-first year, it began.  Signs of a channeling nature.  His ability to channel was not so obvious, even to `7himself.  What he knew of channeling already was almost none-existant, and to link it to his own problems would be madness.  `7At first, he could only explain such things like glasses falling from tables as he passed as a coincident.  He would grasp, `7but it would raise the bile from his stomach each time, and each grasp was never one that was meant to happen.  He could not `7grasp at will, nor stop himself when he had.

`7By the age of twenty-Three, his father had offered him a part in the business.  This, he took up straight away.  Soon, his `7talent didn't just come and go now and then, like before.  Now it was getting worst, and almost bad enough for his family to `7see.  It was beginning to control him.  Each time he grasped, it threatened to over run him, and burn him to a crisp, yet `7everytime he did grasp, he only wanted to do it again, and again.  He learned from his lessons of sword fighting, the use of `7Oneness would help him grasp manually, and help with the taint that always twisted his stomach.

`7At the age of Twenty-Six, now three years a knowing channeler, has since learned technics such as weaving.  The ability to `7grasp and release soon became a simple proceedure.  What he thought was a fast rate of learning, was soon discovered to be a `7slow one.

`7Rasequin left home, as part of his business, to expand, and to work in foreign countries.  He would eventually stay in `7Caemlyn, where fate led him into the Asha'man's hands.  His training began, and he did not refuse it, instead, was more than `7willing to learn as much as he possibly could.

`7Just turned twenty-eight, Rasequin's father died.  It was an illness, unknown, but terminal.  The illness struck swiftly, `7starting as a simple cold, then a fever, and finally the stopping of one's beating heart.  It could only be described as his `7time to depart from the world.  Poor health in recent years, resulting in a fast deteriation of the defence mechanisms that `7the body creates.

`7Saddened by the news, all profits were now Rasequin's.  Upon the duties to the Asha'man, he was determined to continue on `7the business his father started, but both seem a task and a half, and often Rasequin could be found to be struggling.

`7Rasequin joined the Aldazar talon when he had the choice.  This seemed most suited.  He could use his business as a front, `7be an Asha'man, and remain almost indefinitely out of uniform.  The perfect spy.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7From`6:`7 Rasequin
`7Subj`6:`7 BG Rasequin (Revised 1st)
`7Name: Rasequin Longaard.
`7Gender: Male
`7Origin: Arafel
`7Height: 6'2"
`7Weight: 210 pounds
`7Hair: Jet Black (with bells)
`7Eyes: Light Blue
`7Physical Appearance: Tall and athletic.
`7Weapons of choice: Bastard Swords

`7Bio: Rasequin was born to a rich family, given the luxuries that came with being rich from birth to his teen years.  Enducation was nothing but the best, and his classes included both mental and physical, including sword skills taught to every borderland child.
`7His parents were rich because they were close friends to royal members of the royal houses of Arafel, as well as owning a lucrative business in service trading.
`7Rasequin would have had a share in this business.  With the education he gained, and his good relationship with his father, he would have become a partner and shared in the wealth.

`7He now worked for his fathers company, learning the ins and outs of the business, and it would eventually lead to brighter things.  It was about the age of twenty-five that he showed signs of a channeling nature.  His ability to channel was not so obvious, even to himself.  What he knew of channeling already was almost none-existant, and to link it to his own problems would be madness.  At first, he could only explain such things like glasses falling from tables as he passed as a coincident.  He would grasp, but it would raise the bile from his stomach each time, and each grasp was never one that was meant to happen.  He could not grasp at will, nor stop himself when he had.  Only luck kept him clean under his fathers watchful eye.

`7By the age of twenty-six, his father had offered him a part in the business.  This, he took up straight away.  Soon, his talent didn't just come and go now and then, like before.  Now it was getting worst, and almost bad enough for his family to see.  It was beginning to control him.  Each time he grasped, it threatened to over run him, and burn him to a crisp, yet everytime he did grasp, he only wanted to do it again, and again.  He learned from his lessons of sword fighting, the use of Oneness would help him grasp manually, and help with the taint that always twisted his stomach.

`7Rasequin left home, as part of his business, to expand, and to work in foreign countries.  He would eventually stay in Caemlyn, where fate led him into the Asha'man's hands.  His training began about the age of twenty-six, and he did not refuse it, instead, was more than willing to learn as much as he possibly could.

`7Just turned twenty-eight, Rasequin's father died.  It was an illness, unknown, but terminal.  The illness struck swiftly, starting as a simple cold, then a fever, and finally the stopping of one's beating heart.  It could only be described as his time to depart from the world.  Poor health in recent years, resulting in a fast deteriation of the defence mechanisms that the body creates.

`7Saddened by the news, all profits were now Rasequin's.  Upon the duties to the Asha'man, he was determined to continue on the business his father started, but both seem a task and a half, and often Rasequin could be found to be struggling.

`7Rasequin joined the Aldazar talon when he had the choice.  This seemed most suited.  He could use his business as a front, be an Asha'man, and remain almost indefinitely out of uniform.  The perfect spy.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

Each time he grasped, it threatened to over run him, and burn him to a crisp, yet everytime he did grasp, he only wanted to do it again, and again.  He learned from his lessons of sword fighting, the use of Oneness would help him grasp manually, and help with the taint that always twisted his stomach.

`7Rasequin left home, as part of his business, to expand, and to work in foreign countries.  He would eventually stay in Caemlyn, where fate led him into the Asha'man's hands.  His training began about the age of twenty-six, and he did not refuse it, instead, was more than willing to learn as much as he possibly could.

`7Just turned twenty-eight, Rasequin's father died.  It was an illness, unknown, but terminal.  The illness struck swiftly, starting as a simple cold, then a fever, and finally the stopping of one's beating heart.  It could only be described as his time to depart from the world.  Poor health in recent years, resulting in a fast deteriation of the defence mechanisms that the body creates.

`7Saddened by the news, all profits were now Rasequin's.  Upon the duties to the Asha'man, he was determined to continue on the business his father started, but both seem a task and a half, and often Rasequin could be found to be struggling.

`7Rasequin joined the Aldazar talon when he had the choice.  This seemed most suited.  He could use his business as a front, be an Asha'man, and remain almost indefinitely out of uniform.  The perfect spy.
Please peruse and inform me on any changes required to WM and CM.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Shai'tan
`7Subj`6:`7 Questy thing
Hey chika. :)
Gavriela and Sayid have asked for a Blightborder quest to get some
IC experience fighting shadowspawn. If you happen to see both of them
on, feel free to run the quest... just toss 10-20 trollocs at them and
let them do whatever, treat it as a minor scouting party along the
'civilized' border. If they choose to go too deep into the blight,
chuck one of the nasty worms at them and make 'em scream like little
girls. Or whatever. I trust you to do what you think is right. Don't
really try to kill them unless they're being stupid, that sort of thing.
If you do run it, make sure to log it and send it to me:
shadowenfold@yahoo.com
If you don't run it, no worries.
And as a quick P.S. Syrah says they aren't allowed to link during it.
*hugs* laters!
-shai'

`7From`6:`7 Tarin
`7Subj`6:`7 test
The plaque is a simple thing, dulled bronze,
set upon an oak mount.  Cut through the metal,
to charred wood beyond, the words read:
`^I`6n `^M`6emoriam`7
`^  H`6ow shall we tell of the honourable dead`7
`^    Q`6uidam clad in resplendent black.`7
`^  E`6ffaced from our thoughts, for the price that they pay,`7
`^    U`6nblinking they stare down the Dark.`7
`^  L`6ost to their lives, when they answered His call`7
`^    I`6mmured until death does it's part.`7
`^  D`6aring to dance, just to keep themselves sane`7
`^    N`6ever dreaming of hope in their hearts.`7
`^  A`6rrogance hiding 'midst innocence lost`7
`^    L`6eaves martyrdom only as fate.`7
`^  R`6ender fair judgement and pity give thanks`7
`^    A`6ssign to the heroes their due.`7
`^    N`6one but the True would stand gainst the storm`7
`6   and None but the soldiers stand proud.`7
`6    No more to rest, and never to grieve`7
`6   til `^No bar to the grave`6, is now called.`7
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
