`7From`6:`7 Eli
`7Subj`6:`7 Vitor's Soldier test

Under the bright, intese heat of the noonday sun, still there are plenty of black coated men practicing alone or in groups all over the yards, the ranking Asha'man giving quiet and sometimes not so quiet instruction as they move among the less experienced men they're training.  Some practice alone, however, Vitor being one of these.  Near the practice yard's southeast corner, he is holding the full rush of saidin's stomach turning flow that he can manage.  He seems to be experimenting with something.  Kneeling to pound a fist on the ground, he sends a braided cord of Fire and Earth into it which dives deep beneath the ground's surface before coming back up some four paces away in a straight line in front of him.  However, it has little effect, only a bit of hot mud and rock gurgling up from the ground.  He frowns and lets the weave vanish, straightening up.  [Vitor]

Jude strides up behind Vitor, his quarterstaff giving his pace an thunking rhythm.  He watches the Recruit attempting his weave for a moment and snorts in derision.  Whether he turns around or not, the old Murandian addresses him sharply. "Recruit, release and follow me."  Fully expecting his command to be obeyed, he turns and walks to a cleared area of the yard where an 'X' has been burned into the ground.  He stands on it and indicates another some fifteen feet away.  "You stand there."  He waits until Vitor has complied before proceeding.

His Power enhanced hearing picking up the sound of Jude's approach even in the none too quiet practice yard, Vitor turns around and salutes with his hand over his heart, his feet coming together as he stands at attention.  Not bothering to waste time with questions, he simply does as Jude commands and falls in behind the older man to follow him over to the marked sparring area.  He nods and moves to the second X, stands over it, and turns to square off against his opponent, saidin as yet remaining out of his reach but the Void lending a cold spark to his eyes.  Setting his feet, he spreads his hands back and opens his shoulders to the warmth the sun casts down on his back, putting himself on the brink of grasping the Source.  [Vitor]

Jude regards Vitor silently for a moment, assessing him and then snickers.  His gravely voice rings out over the yard to cover the distance, and even as he speaks he summons the Void and grasps Saidin, his face contorting into a barely restrained snarl as life and death engage in their delicated dance within his veins.  "Defend yourself!"  Without pausing and drawing only half as much as he is able, he channels a bar of solid Air strengthened with Earth.  He sends it forward quickly, like a tripwire aimed at Vitor's ankles.  Another one quickly follows at the Andoran's knee level, and then a third at the same height as his stomach.  Each is about two feet behind the one that proceeded it, and each is strong and fast enough to knock the Recruit down if he doesn't properly defend himself.

Vitor's fingers curl forward slowly, belying the the eagerness with which he leaps towards the Power.  Saidin rushes into him - a negligible amount compared to what Jude holds even at half his capacity, but it is all that Vitor can control.  He weaves a simple defense, sending a thick flow of Earth down into the ground at is feet.  It rears up in respose, forming a foot thick wall that rushes to Vitor's full height and completely blocks him from few as the three bars thud into its surface, shaking loose dust and rock and leaving a series of imprints.  It crumbles away to dust all at once as soon as Vitor is through with it, and the drifting motes it leaves behind glitter in the reflected red light of the fist sized ball of fire he creates, weaving Fire and Air, and then hurls swiftly in a straight line for Jude's chest.

Jude gives a tight and unpleasant smile at Vitor's first defense, but it turns to an irritated frown at the tiny fireball streaking towards him.  He weaves a small shield of Air, blocking the attack and he too lets his defense dissipate as soon as he is done with it.  His counterattack is nearly the opposite of the Recruit's.  He channels Air and Water in a cone about three feet above his opponent's head.  The tip is pointed at the top of Vitor's skull, and as the last flows fall into place, the weave draws moisture out of the air to fill the cone, and the Air freezes it instantly before it drops.  The sharp icicle is about two feet in diameter at its base and about three feet long.  If Vitor doesn't move or destroy it, it will crush down throught the top of his skull and kill him.
Vitor snarls wordlessly as his first attack is thwarted, then his head snaps upwards at Jude weaves again.  His eyes widen at the suddenly forming, massive icicle, an
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7From`6:`7 Demarko
`7Subj`6:`7 As yet...
As yet, I've been unable to duplicate the original
bug.  I think I screwed up and pasted way too much
into the editor.
That said, the real 'bug' came in the form of my inability
to log in.  Since my editor buffer was bugged, during
my state CON_RECONNECT or the equivellent it was dumping
me right back into the editor.  It told me, "When we rebooted,
you were in an editor.  Trying to recover."  No matter what I did,
the mud would crash.  I had to force-dc, and then I could come
back.

`7From`6:`7 Vivianne
`7Subj`6:`7 Your Background
Thank you for sending me such a complete and wonderfully
written background!  It's much easier to understand in
that format, rather than the bits and pieces I had been
receiving from you previously.
However, there is one thing missing that you have, in the
past, mentioned which is now no longer in the picture,
and I think it made an excellent explanation as to why
you went missing, and why Ranulf became High Seat. That
was the part where you claim that you were stabbed and
presumed dead.  I would like you to keep that part in the
story, because then it will be easier to make connections.
If you keep that in your background, I will approve it,
and you will be allowed to roleplay as a noble and gain
your sponsors.   You will be able to roleplay toward the
restoration of your House, and you may attempt to ICly
take the High Seat from Ranulf.
So, that's the only change you need to make.
Beyond that, you still need to get your seeking score
into the positive range before I can guild you. However,
once your background is approved, you'll be able to roleplay
again, and gain your sponsors.
Vivi
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Narsil
`7Subj`6:`7 WoW!

Well, WoW owns the remnants of my social life, so take that as a review. *grin* It's really good, aimed for the casual player, although it has a lot of depth as well. Lots of very different characters, vast world, well done fighting system, balanced classes (after the last patch, at least).

I play on lots of places, but lately I really enjoy the Scarlet Crusade server - basically, it's a RP server. Yeah. I know. But they try - in fact, they can be more elitist at times since there are that many more morons and 1337 kids around, so people who can type and spell at once get all defensive about it. :p I have Horde alts there, although on RP servers you can have characters on both factions (unlike PvP servers, where you are restricted to one side only).

PvP is also fun. I like the tension of walking in some forest and never knowing when some idiot 23887 levels higher will attack and destroy you. Woo! :p They are also making Battlegrounds for (probably) the next patch, which is like a purely PvP zone with capture the flag, etc events that can land you bonuses and special eq and the such.

That's all! As for school, hmm. I wish I could go back to one. But a) it tends to not pay :p and b) I haaaate exams. Actually, I taught for a while, but man that's hard! You can't slack off, these people are WATCHING you, hungry, waiting to pounce, eager to see you make a mistake. It's scary. :(
Me!
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Narsil
`7Subj`6:`7 Damn subjects! Me hates them!
Well, depends on the character. Basically, it's a game aimed at casual players - two months

at the most and you can easily cap out at lvl 60 if you play just one class. If you are like me, and you get a new alt every time you see something you like (oooh! he can shoot pretty lights!!11) then you might take a bit more. :)

The whole thing is getting what you want. At first I loved PvP, but you tend to get somewhat lower average IQs surrounding you. :p However there is a bigger thrill in everything, since after the newbie zones every time you walk around you can be attacked on sight. I kinda like RP servers also, because then when you _are_ level 60, you still have something to do than run a top level dungeon for the 61th time trying to get a helmet that's gonna make you a little bit tougher.

It's hack'n'slash, yeah. :p But there are also professions and stuff. Some are gathering, some are making (so they compliment each other), and some are just weird (like engineering, you can make bombs, etc - TERRORIST!!!11). The graphics are awesome, of course, and the style is quirky in WC fashion - I love Tauren, myself. Although when the roof is low all you can see is your own @$$!
A TURTLE HEAD?! WHERE???//?
Me.

`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Black Tower
`7CC`6: `7Kinje Yannick
Hey guys, I need to talk to you about the IC location of
the Black Tower.  We're placing everybody's guild areas
where they belong IC - the seafolk area is now a ship that
sails up the Erinin and into the ocean, the Aiel are getting
the waste back, etc.  How do you want to do your area, and
where do you want it? We can keep your existing guild area
and splice it into the map if you like, or we can modify it
or even make a new one if you prefer.  If you would, mail
me back with your preliminary thoughts and we'll discuss it
from there.  The ubermap is moving along pretty fast now and
I'm starting to anticipate bringing it over to the main port,
but I'd like to include all the major areas that belong in
this section now so it all goes live at the same time.
Thanks! Hit me back.
Nic

`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BP updates
Hey, I've got Leara and I think it was Vivianne descripting the
countrysides now (Leara is doing the zone around TV,
Vivianne is doing the zone around Cairhien).  Also, Rasequin
made up a roadmap of what he thought we could do for
Shadar Logoth, posted at:
`^http://www.lenncraft.co.uk/shadarlogoth.gif`7
He showed it to me this afternoon, I liked it, so we went
ahead and built the whole thing (zones 48 and 49).  Yeah,
we're impulsive and efficient :p Anyway, the idea is that
it stresses streets since most of the buildings are collapsed
and all are abandoned - I've run through it quite a few times,
and it comes off a lot like the old SL but nicer.  He's gonna
have a few major buildings, and I'm gonna screw with
some mislinkings and enterable objects to create some
additional tricks.   Oh, and his builder is Aled.
Think that's it for the moment.
-Nic

`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 New Update
I went ahead and created the rooms for both tower
zones only - they've all been set to city, indoors,
of 10x10 room dimensions.  I went ahead and made
all 200 rooms for the two zones that way - obviously
some of the ones we'll have to switch to outdoors
but since I was aliasing it was easier to make them
all the same for now.
I'm looking at the layout stuff you sent again - I
really like it, especially the grounds map (and the
bridge).  I'm still trying to decide how to map out
the ajah floors - I think I'm going to take that home
and work it out this evening.  I think when we said
we'd probably need to add a couple more hallway
rooms to those floors, we were right, but I can't
quite decide how many to add.  Anywho. :p
-Nic

-Nic
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 BP stuff
`7CC`6: `7Vivianne Leara
Hey, couple of things - first of all I wanted to make sure
I've got your zones straight.  Leara, are you doing Tar
Valon? And Viv, you're doing Cairhien, is that right?
I set you both up the same weekend and couldn't
remember for certain :p At any rate, I noticed one of you's
been working on the Tar Valon zone already - thanks :>
I went ahead and hooked up the bridge over the river
in room 46875.  When you're on the road to either
the east or west, you walk over the bridge.  When
you're in the river, you swim through the river room
that is 'under' the bridge, heading north or south.
Lemme know if there're any problems :>
Also, FYI, Rasequin and I started Shadar Logoth
today, and built all the streets, minus descs.
Syrah and I have all 200 rooms of the white
tower created, but not connected yet.
-Nic

column7: Sorry.. Last mail tonight, I promise!!

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Valkaria
`7Subj`6:`7 Sorry.. Last mail tonight, I promise!!
Sorry for all these mails.. I didn't think I would complete as much as I did this
quickly.
I finished all the Rivers, and most of the road ways. The rooms by the rivers need
to be fixed so they don't connect to the ones next to them. Room 46880 and 46896
are two RP spots and I was hoping we could maybe put a minor RPEXP flag in her,
but I don't know how to do that.
I tried to stay consistant with room names and colors. And I know I repeated alot
of rooms, but it will be easier to change it or add to it with something there.
I think I did about 35 rooms, all in the southwest. Could you go over them and see
if I made any mistakes?
Anyway, Im sleepy, see you tommorrow!!
Valk/Sadren

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Lots of mails
Yikes, ok, breaking it down:
Mail doesn't work on the BP - it can crash it if you try and
check your mail there, too, so be careful :p
The bridge is right - it's vnum 4`^8`7618, not 46818.  Basically
the room in your zone is the river, and the other zone is where
the bridge itself is coming from.  They're spliced together.  I
need to give you authorization to edit the bridge zone, too.
RP bonuses are done in game :>
I agree with the river/road exits - there are long stretches
where I'm gonna purge exits along rivers.  I'll do that later
on though, since doing it now is just gonna make it harder
to cruise through the zone to error check.
I like your color rooms - the Fields of Grass and Quaint
Farmland are real cool, and so's the Stand of Trees.
I found two typos and fixed 'em - mostly everything looks
really, really good.  Keep it up, and thanks :>
-Nic

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Volkare
`7Subj`6:`7 IC Report
`7CC`6: `7Kinje Yannick
M'Haels,
Following up on the encounter with the Shadowspawn in the Queen's Blessing, I contacted several
people in Caemlyn to find out what I could.  The Warder who first warned us of the Shadowspawn
evidently has some connections with the Queen's Guard, because he was able to tell me that the
youth the Trollocs chased into the Blessing was indeed involved with the beasts.  Apparently, the
wounded man attempted to turn the youth to the Dark, and when he refused, the Shadowspawn attacked
him.  By the boy's words, the Darkfriend defended him, and the Shadowspawn chased the pair of
them into the city and finally into the Blessing.  The youth stated that the Shadowspawn had been
camped to the Southwest of Caemlyn.  While this information does come from the lips of a lap-dog,
they do seem to fit with the events I saw.  With independent confirmation, this could be very
useful information.
Additionally, I heard from a woodswoman named Elaena Farshere, who looked like <desc Elaena>,
that plants in the north-east section of Braem Wood are beginning to show up that are best
described as "something out of the Blight."  She gave me relatively detailed directions to the
area where these plants are spreading, and warned me that normal blades do not seem to cut them,
and that they seem to spread by floating spores which are dangerous to inhale.  While I do not
know if this report is connected to the previous one, it seems clear that the Shadow is closing
in around Caemlyn.
-Volkare Previn
Dedicated, Baijan Talon.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Time to kick ass, fellas
`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Immortals
Hey all, those of us still at school are between semesters atm
so Duren and I are taking advantage of this time to get as
much done as humanly possible on MM3.2.  This includes
all the major projects, most especially combat.  I want to
get the ubermap online as well, and I'll be logging on to spam-
desc zones whenever I can get into a lab.  If there's anything
you've been asked to do or know you can contribute to,
please weigh in.  These work-icide sessions of ours only
come around about twice a year, and it's important that we
get as much done as we can so that we can get the mud
running for real.
Since the labs are generally locked right now, I'm going
to be doing my own work at home and then when I can
get online I'm gonna bust it out as fast as possible.  I
won't be on all day, but I will be working LOTS.  Please
throw in whatever time you can spare as well.  It's important!
Things to do:
Ubermap: Most especially finishing Tar Valon proper, the
white tower, and the remaining countryside zones.
Combat: All aspects, highest priority.
Channeling: Hale and I still need a large list of all the
weaves and all the things you guys want them to do.  We've
got several partial lists, but I really want a 'This is all we
ever want to see' list of weaves and affects.
RP: Get some RP plots going again.  This place is looking
dead.  Events and fun quests (OOC or IC) would hit the spot
if you can get enough people on.
Everybody else: Find something to do.  I want every imm and
staff member to contribute - whatever way you want or can is
fine.  This is a team effort and we need everybody on board.
-Nicodemus is ready to say 'fuck you' to MM3 and move on

got several partial lists, but I really want a 'This is all we
ever want to see' list of weaves and affects.
RP: Get some RP plots going again.  This place is looking
dead.  Events and fun quests (OOC or IC) would hit the spot
if you can get enough people on.
Everybody else: Find something to do.  I want every imm and
staff member to contribute - whatever way you want or can is
fine.  This is a team effort and we need everybody on board.
-Nicodemus is ready to say 'fuck you' to MM3 and move on
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Time to kick ass, fellas
`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Immortals
Hey all, those of us still at school are between semesters atm
so Duren and I are taking advantage of this time to get as
much done as humanly possible on MM3.2.  This includes
all the major projects, most especially combat.  I want to
get the ubermap online as well, and I'll be logging on to spam-
desc zones whenever I can get into a lab.  If there's anything
you've been asked to do or know you can contribute to,
please weigh in.  These work-icide sessions of ours only
come around about twice a year, and it's important that we
get as much done as we can so that we can get the mud
running for real.
Since the labs are generally locked right now, I'm going
to be doing my own work at home and then when I can
get online I'm gonna bust it out as fast as possible.  I
won't be on all day, but I will be working LOTS.  Please
throw in whatever time you can spare as well.  It's important!
Things to do:
Ubermap: Most especially finishing Tar Valon proper, the
white tower, and the remaining countryside zones.
Combat: All aspects, highest priority.
Channeling: Hale and I still need a large list of all the
weaves and all the things you guys want them to do.  We've
got several partial lists, but I really want a 'This is all we
ever want to see' list of weaves and affects.
RP: Get some RP plots going again.  This place is looking
dead.  Events and fun quests (OOC or IC) would hit the spot
if you can get enough people on.
Everybody else: Find something to do.  I want every imm and
staff member to contribute - whatever way you want or can is
fine.  This is a team effort and we need everybody on board.
-Nicodemus is ready to say 'fuck you' to MM3 and move on

column7: Fwd: greetings, and question about a bg

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Miniver
`7Subj`6:`7 greetings, and question about a bg
Greetings.  I used to be on the mud a long time ago, and there was a couple rps that happened that I would like to keep, if possible.

the first one was a run in with "shadow" wolves, wolves that had been tainted by the dark wind of the ways.  With this run it, Miniver became tainted as well with dark thoughts and urges, which he was doing his best to control.  Wolves felt wary around him, but still accepted his fight.

The other rp was with one of the Chosen, I believe it was Maseama but I can't remember off hand.  She tricked Miniver into a portal and he ended up in t'a'r, for a bit.  Of course, we'd have to come up with another way he was rescued, but it was still an interesting RP to keep.
The only other thing I would ask, if I could also still keep darkfriends as the ones who killed my family and my brother, but it all seems overused.
Thanks
Miniver/jason

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 White Tower Update
I've added more floors and worked out the attachment
for the bridge to the mini-tower.  The vnums don't
always go in order cuz I got sloppy and had to go
back and correct things cuz of the bridge, but what
is there now won't be going anywhere so it's fair
game to write descs for now.  Syrah, if it's cool
with you (I don't have your list on me atm), yellows
can go with the greens on the fifth floor, so they
can go play medic to the men in the warder tower (mae's
idea).  That work for everybody?
I'm gonna keep building the tower down towards the
ground.  Then i'm gonna need to write everything else
out on paper to see how many rooms we've got, then I'll
do the outdoors, the warder tower, and finally the
bridge between the two.  Very last thing will be
connecting the four gates to the Tar Valon island.
-Nic

`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
`7Subj`6:`7 Couple of things
How big a deal is it to add one more integer value field
to zedit? I want to be able to identify each zone as a
certain country or region (Andor, Cairhien, SF, etc).  That
way players make money according to whichever region they're
RPing in, not where they're from originally.  Otherwise
everybody would just choose the richest econ country and RP
being from wherever they want to be.
Also, I'm looking at making containers out of things like
pants and whatnot.  Currently, if you do that, the pants
can't have armor values.  I was thinking about recoding it
somehow (either so they can be both armor and a container,
and the values for each don't overlap).  What do you think?
-Nico
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7From`6:`7 Duren
`7Subj`6:`7 Countries

(00:44:35) FryGuy8093: if we associate each zone with a country, then any RP done in that zone contributes to that country's econ, and the players get paid by the IC amount proportional to their economy.  as it's currently set up, players are just all going to choose the richest country as their own at creation, otherwise
(00:44:43) FryGuy8093: *nod* ok, will do
(00:45:01) FryGuy8093: i'm heading out, then.  catch you tmw
I implemented this exact feature on BoD.  It -may- be easier to just add a vnum range to country
definitions, and use that to determine what country you're in.  That's how I did it.  Advantage
is you don't need to mess with zone files.  Disadvantage is country vnum's need to be contiguious.
-Duren

`7From`6:`7 Cashik
`7Subj`6:`7 Shield Source Lesson: From Cashik
Shield Source

This weave is made entirely of spirit and used to cut another channeler off from the One Power just so that they cannot grasp or embrace Saidar.  It is not permanent but prevents them from channeling while the weave is in effect.

The weave is shaped as a concave disc with a -soft edge- and has to be placed between the target channeler and their connection to the One Power for it to be successful.  Cashik would weave one or two flows of spirit and split them many times, threading the seperated flows between each other in a lattice, then draw it together into a shield shape with a soft edge.  (A sharp edge severs)

Success at shielding a channeler depends on various factors: 1. how strong in the One Power you are compared to the target.  2. whether the target is already grasping Saidin/embracing Saidar - it is easy to shield someone not grasping/embracing (even if they are stronger in the OP than you.)  It is MUCH harder to shield someone who is grasping/embracing already.
Note: Strengthening your connection to the One Power seems to make it harder for someone to shield you too, so if you grasp more of Saidin it is harder for someone else to cut you off.

Since shield weaves from Aes Sedai cannot be seen by male channelers (the same is true for Aes Sedai not being able to see mc shield weaves either), the detection of an uncomfortable itching sensation could be used as an early warning (for males) of a shielding attempt from a woman (as they are channeling).  Extreme caution around women should be the usual response to such a sensation.

Tactics: Force a person who is trying to shield you to be distracted and divert their energy on something else, this weakens their attempt on shielding you, then their shield could be sliced.  Slicing a shield causes disorientation to the person who has their shield sliced, offering a good opportunity for counter-shielding which could be more effective.
Tactics: Tying a shield on a strong channeler is not an ideal idea because tied shields are weaker and can be broken out of easier than ones that are maintained.

When shielded, a channeler can sense the One Power but cannot grasp/embrace it.  Resistance to try and re-form the connection and break through the shield is possible, but takes time.  You can will Saidin towards you as strongly as you can - this causes a shield to weaken somewhat.  If someone is maintaining the shield they can re-strengthen it, and it becomes more difficult to break through it.  It takes effort to maintain a shield on someone, and so, it may be neccesary for other channelers to help.
End of Lesson.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

In Haditha, memories of a massacre
Health: Can You Really Botox the Blues Away?
Attack of the Clones
Boston reports first measles outbreak in 7 years
Most viewed on MSNBC.com
By Ellen Knickmeyer
Updated: 2 hours, 22 minutes ago

BAGHDAD, Iraq - Witnesses to the slaying of 24 Iraqi civilians by U.S. Marines in the western town of Haditha say the Americans shot men, women and children at close range in retaliation for the death of a Marine lance corporal in a roadside bombing.

Aws Fahmi, a Haditha resident who said he watched and listened from his home as Marines went from house to house killing members of three families, recalled hearing his neighbor across the street, Younis Salim Khafif, plead in English for his life and the lives of his family members. "I heard Younis speaking to the Americans, saying: 'I am a friend. I am good,' " Fahmi said. "But they killed him, and his wife and daughters."

The 24 Iraqi civilians killed on Nov. 19 included children and the women who were trying to shield them, witnesses told a Washington Post special correspondent in Haditha this week and U.S. investigators said in Washington. The girls killed inside Khafif's house were ages 14, 10, 5, 3 and 1, according to death certificates.
Story continues below
advertisement

Two U.S. military boards are investigating the incident as potentially the gravest violation of the law of war by U.S. forces in the three-year-old conflict in Iraq. The U.S. military ordered the probes after Time magazine presented military officials in Baghdad this year with the findings of its own investigation, based on accounts of survivors and on a videotape shot by an Iraqi journalism student at Haditha's hospital and inside victims' houses.

An investigation by the Naval Criminal Investigative Service into the killings and a separate military probe into an alleged coverup are slated to end in the next few weeks. Marines have briefed members of the Senate Armed Services Committee and other officials on the findings: some of the officials briefed say the evidence is damaging. Charges of murder, dereliction of duty and making a false statement are likely, people familiar with the case said Friday.

Marines overreacted . . . and killed innocent civilians in cold blood, said one of those briefed, Rep. John Murtha (D-Pa.), a former Marine who maintains close ties with senior Marine officers despite his opposition to the war.

Haditha is one of a chain of farm towns on the Euphrates River where U.S. and Iraqi forces have battled foreign and local insurgents without resolution for much of the war. The first account of the killings there was a false or erroneous statement issued the next day, Nov. 20, by a

`7From`6:`7 Rian
`7Subj`6:`7 Look
Standing at about 6 feet high, this man has clear blue eyes framed by chin length brown hair. His build is somewhat muscular, and the person carries himself in a regal fashion.

He is wearing an obsidian black helm, a shark's tooth suspended from a braided cord, a storm grey hooded cloak clasped with a sapphire dew drop, a deep red mahogany standard topped with a heavy silver hound and bearing an embroidered crimson banner, a journey pack, a deep crimson shirt with billowing sleeves laced closed at the cuff by leather cording, some field plate armor, an enameled tower shield painted with the Andoran royal crest, an emerald green scabbard, some fine black cotton trousers with silver filigree along the seams and a pair of supple leather riding boots with gilded rowel spurs.
He has a black eye and is bleeding from the left hand.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Aelene
`7Subj`6:`7 Aelene's Background
Aelene Theris was born sixteen years ago, the second daughter of
Lord Markev and Lady Jolana Theris of Andor, in the capital city of
Caemlyn.  Her father also engaged in  merchanting, managing estates
and trade routes with ease and as such is considered quite well off
by some.  As a result of this, Aelene was raised in an environment
far above the normal individual.  She received a fine education from
the tutors her parents hired for herself and her three siblings (an
elder sister and brother, and younger brother).
In many ways she was the most left behind out of all of Markev and
Jolana's children, being both the youngest daughter, and the second
youngest of them all.  While she received the same amount of
attention from her family as the others, it was clear that their
main focus was on her elder sister, for marriage to another family
of good standing, and her two brothers in suceeding her father in
his duties.  While some talk of marriage was mentioned for Aelene
herself, she felt no desire to marry for the purpose of making
connections.
Partly to escape the feeling of being forced into a life she didn't
want, and the feelings of being subtly neglected, the girl departed
for Tar Valon.  In some ways, it was the best decision both for her
and the family.  Should she be able to become Aes Sedai, it would
still increase the family honor, while at the same time lessen the
obligation of providing a future for a second daughter.  Her parents
condoned the action, and as such she was sent to the White Tower to
see what fate would hold for her.

Caemlyn.  Her father also engaged in  merchanting, managing estates
and trade routes with ease and as such is considered quite well off
by some.  As a result of this, Aelene was raised in an environment
far above the normal individual.  She received a fine education from
the tutors her parents hired for herself and her three siblings (an
elder sister and brother, and younger brother).
In many ways she was the most left behind out of all of Markev and
Jolana's children, being both the youngest daughter, and the second
youngest of them all.  While she received the same amount of
attention from her family as the others, it was clear that their
main focus was on her elder sister, for marriage to another family
of good standing, and her two brothers in suceeding her father in
his duties.  While some talk of marriage was mentioned for Aelene
herself, she felt no desire to marry for the purpose of making
connections.
Partly to escape the feeling of being forced into a life she didn't
want, and the feelings of being subtly neglected, the girl departed
for Tar Valon.  In some ways, it was the best decision both for her
and the family.  Should she be able to become Aes Sedai, it would
still increase the family honor, while at the same time lessen the
obligation of providing a future for a second daughter.  Her parents
condoned the action, and as such she was sent to the White Tower to
see what fate would hold for her.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Phaedra
`7Subj`6:`7 FYI...
Stuff you would notice post FTB:

-Phaedra's scar.  When describing her assault by the guy in Amadicia, she probably downplayed it somewhat.  The scar runs the entire width of her lower abdomen, from the bottom left part of her hipbone up and across to the top of her right hipbone.  It is relatively straight, but was clearly either caused by a dull/crappy blade or stitched poorly - potentially both (if you ask, she doesn't remember which, and concedes that both may have been the case.  The person who stitched her was a Whitecloak surgeon, used to dealing with men's battle injuries).  It is bright white and smooth, indicating years' worth of healing.

-Phaedra's tattoo.  Yes, she's got one.  Upper right hip at the central uppermost point of the bone there is a small (inch and a half tall, half inch wide) tattoo of a rose in partial bloom with a long stem.  Careful inspection will show that the stem is wrapped in a delicate chain.  The craftsmanship of the piece is remarkable, but the picture itself somewhat disturbing.  If you notice it, she will tell you to ask about it later, and it will clearly kill the mood if you press her on it.  Doesn't take a genius to figure out why she has it...

-Phaedra's... skill...  Whatever else Kinje may have done to her, he certainly trained her well.  No blushing maiden, she.  Responsive and vocal (go figure), Phae is wholehearted and uninhibited, but does not take herself (or you) too seriously.
Just some things I wanted to let you know before I forgot that you would have noticed them, as they are fairly important details that one misses in a FTB.  *smooch*

`7From`6:`7 Sadren
`7Subj`6:`7 Happy to see you back..
I am happy to see that you decided to come back. :>
I was worried that you would have left, and no one wanted that.
As far as the Tower goes, I think it would be nice to have a
classroom to give lessons, a garden/fish pond outside the Tower,
some kind of Plaza, or Square,  where we could RP outside also,
Umm.. And don't forget to build a room where we can give the
Accepted Test! It is located underneath the Tower.
Besides that, the normal Ajah Halls, Amyrlin Sitting Room, Keeper's
rooms, an actual Hall for the Sitters to meet in, Novice/Accepted
quarters, -maybe- a Kitchen (dunno if it's needed, but it would
be nicee to send girls there for chore RP) and.. *thinks* I guess
that is enough for now. =)
Also, most of the Towers I have seen have been more like mazes,
and difficult to navigate. Hopefully, when you lay it out, you
can focus on making it easier to get around. If you need help,
let me know. I am much better at layout and design, mapping and
linking rooms, than I am with descs though. Descs take me forever.
OH! And don't forget a small little area for the Warders. We
can't forget them.
Sads

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Phaedra
`7Subj`6:`7 *Waiting for you at the Crown*

**This letter is written on thick parchment, sealed in gold wax with an imprint of a harp.  The script is recognizably Phaedra's, but is somewhat stilted in places, the ink heavy in some areas and light in others.**
Kinje,

I cannot recall a time at was at such a loss for words.  Part of me is angry at myself for not knowing that you would misinterpret what I wrote for you.  Part of me is berating myself for ever leaving the house, to allow for this to happen in the first place.  Part of me is so angry with you that, were I to dwell on that anger, would harden the love I have for you into a burning hatred.  Part of me cannot help but continue to hold on to the love I have always had for you.

I cannot forgive what you have done, regardless of the cause you feel you had.  I know you love me - and did not need this bond to prove it - but what you did was not for me.  It was for you.  You willfully and forcibly sacrificed my freedom for all of time to capture a single moment of proof that I did not require.

You asked me why I wanted you to go.  The answer has changed, though now it is a moot point.  I want my mind and my free will back.  I do not want either of us to become embittered toward the other, but I am dangerously close to that now.  You have said that you will honor my wishes, but when given the chance to make good on that promise, you not only did not do as I wished, you entwined yourself in my life so deeply that it is now impossible for you to do so.

I am sorry that what I wrote clouded my wishes in your mind and brought my resolve into question.  I am sorry that I am bringing you continual pain, even now, after I had thought it would all be over.  I love you, still Kinje, even though what you have done to me has shaken the foundation of my soul.  I am afraid to see you because I know what this connection is capable of, and while I believe with all my heart, in pieces though it may be, that you will not harm me, I also know that you bonding me in the first place was, to you, an act of love - despite my wishes to the contrary.

Though I have been dismissed from my position from within Lord Traemane's House because he feels I can no longer be trusted, I remain here by request.  I am honoring the request this time and will not be leaving to see you.  Too much has been lost to me for me to risk the rest.  I will remain in contact with you so you know that I am safe, but please do not test my resolve again.  I am walking a finely-honed blade of trust, truth, and sanity.
I am as safe as I can be, all things considered.  I choose to believe I have some free will remaining, though, and if I require your help - should the offer still be valid - I will call on you.
Phaedra
P.S.  Your poem was beautiful, but changes nothing.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Sadren
`7Subj`6:`7 Not so short and sweet...
Alright..
First off, congratulations! Nice to see that we finally got
someone to fill in this much needed position.
Now, I have been pondering everything you've asked. As far as
the things that I am comfortable sticking my nose in.. First of all,
anything dealing with the Tower, Daes, or Aiel are going to be
my strong points. At the moment, I am attempting to use Sadren
to try and reuinte the Tower. I don't like the ideda of a split
Tower on this mud because we simply don't have the player-base
for a single Tower, let alone two.
I would like to see some RP involving the Seanchan take place.
They are the best, but most underused, source of conflict RP
on the mud. However, I know very little about the Seanchan as
a race so I don't think I would be extremely helpful as far as
that goes.
The idea of mort GLs pleases me a great deal. The main attributes
that should be looked for in a GL is activity, and the willingness
and ability to deal with OOC issues. Also, the GLs should have definate
ideas about where they want the guild to go. They should be able to
create an outline of what they want to do with the guild and how
they plan to accomplish those goals.
Nicodemus told me that you would like to work with me.. I'm
not sure what capacity you want to use me in. Whether it is as an
Imm or a Mort GL, either way I will be happy. (Although I have
to admit,  I definately have had my eye on GLing the Tower ever
since I first started GLing).
Things that I think need to be handled.. First, not every guild
will have the players needed to be given a GL. I think that at
least five active members (active meaning log on for RP once a
week at least) should be needed before you make a GL for that
guild. The guilds that I think should definately have GLs are
the Tower, Daes, and Asha'man. The next important guilds would
be Seanchan, Aiel, and guilds that create conflict (ie. CotL).
Secondly,  we need to establish a firm setting for the mud.
By setting, I mean state clearly what regions are under who's
control, where are Seanchan,  where are Shaido, what the weather
is like,  etc. Also, whether or not we have book characters, I
think positions such as the Amyrlin, and the Queen of Andor are
important. I would personally like to see those positions attainable
by PCs, rather than require them to be book characters. However,
since it appears that book characters are done with (for now) we
should still keep those characters in play, either by making them
Imm-controlled when needed,  or allowing GLs to control them. The
entire flow of RP can be affected by a single decision from such
a high authority such as the Amyrlin, or a Queen. It's an RP
tool that should be used more often.
Thirdly, we need to work on recruiting more people.  When our
setting and timeline,  and new GLs get into place, we should go
out and begin advertising on places like mudconnector.com, mudmagic.com
and placees such as that. Tyme was the best WoT mud around for
quite some time,  but it's reputation has sank quite a bit over
the last few years. I have seen reviews stating that Tyme is a
dead mud, or that Tyme is a horrible place because of Imm-Player
problems. We should hand out QPs for people who post positive reviews,
as well as making some kind of reward for voting for Tyme on mudconnector.
Another mud I saw gave double exp for an hour if you voted,  and
you could do it twice a day. Rewards like that will make people go
and review/vote, causing Tyme's reputation to once again stand as
one of the best WoT muds out there.
I don't know what else you'd like to hear, but I am full of
ideas for the mud. Right now, Sadren is planning a return to Tar Valon
to handle the Asha'man threat posed to the White Tower. She is also
doing her best to find allies who will support her if she attempts to
become Amyrlin (which she wants). I think we should do our best to create
multiple RP areas, giving people more freedom to choose what kind of
character they want.
I'm tired and can't think anymore! I am going to lay down for a bit, I
think. Anyways, I'll be waiting for your reply! Ask me more questions,
I'll give you more answwers. Thanks for coming to me for advice, and
including me in helping out. Tyme is my home, and the people are my family.
I just want to see Tyme succeed, and return to it's glory days again. =-)
See you!
Sadren
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Razyc
`7Subj`6:`7 Lady Bard,
Lady Bard,

It has come to my attention that you may know someone I am looking for.  This man has dark, almond shaped eyes, short dark hair, and is of Saldaean or perhaps Altaran decent.  He is pale, though there is a hint of olive to his skin, and in his late twenties, or early thirties.  After speaking with someone we both know, she indicated that the two of you had some connection.  If you could give me this man's name, or any other details, I would be forever in your debt.
Thank you,
The Red Fox
(the above is delivered to Jerod's estates, with Phaedra's name on the front and sealed in red wax a blank seal)
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Razyc
`7Subj`6:`7 Reply
Lady Swan,

It has come to my attention that this man is in some way connected to a mutual acquaintance of ours and I am looking into whom he is, and other facts about him as a safe guard for her.  This is something I am doing because I am concerned about someone very close to me.  Please help me in this.
(this second letter is unsigned and bears the same blank seal)

`7From`6:`7 Maelyn
`7Subj`6:`7 Tower questions
I was wandering around the Tower on the builder port,
and a couple of questions occurred to me. One, is there
a map of the current layout anywhere? If so, that will
make this so much easier. And two, do you realize there
are 6 zones used in TV/Tower rooms??? Good gracious!
Once I either get a map or make one, I'll see what I can do
to cut that down substantially. And three, do you have
a target for how small you want the place? Personally,
I think we could do the Tower in one zone, maybe the grounds
in another. What do you think? Go from 6 to 4? Or 3? TV
itself uses 2, I think. I'll have to check to be sure, might
be 3. Anyway, just a couple of things that popped in my head.
TTYS
Mae

column7: *a letter sealed with the Great Tree of Life*

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Sadren
`7Subj`6:`7 *a letter sealed with the Great Tree of Life*
Razyc,
I am sending this to you with all haste. It appears that
our friend, Jerod Traemane, has had me Gated to Tear instead
of Tar Valon. I am headed to the river so I can charter a
ship heading north to Aringill and beyond.
Lord Jerod Traemane is an Asha'man, poppet. You must avoid
him at all costs. He will do anything to advance his own agenda.
It appears that the Asha'man have entrenched themselves deeply
into Andoran politics. I doubt Elayne has any firm control
beyond what they let her have.
I do not know what I shall do when I arrive in Tar Valon.
There is the threat the black-coats bring lingering over the
Tower, the threat of Tarmon Gai'don lingering over the world.
I have done my best to get things in order, but my best
has been woefully deficient.
Few times in my life before have I been at a loss for what
to do. This is one of those times. The only thing that I can
suggest to you, my sweetling, is that you do your best to
out Jerod Traemane. You must do so in the shadows, however,
and prevent him from knowing it is you. I have a small purse
of diamonds.. the diamonds that studded my hair during your
birthday party. Take them. Use them as payment, if you must.
They are in a secret hole hidden under a wood panel in the
closet in the Queen's Blessing. Use them to help spread the
word and do what you must to bring Jerod Traemane to his
knees. But do not be seen to be connected with it yourself.
I said I shall send word when I arrive at the Tower.. I
still will, but I do not expect you to come. You are not ready
to handle the difficulties that shall exist once I arrive there.
Be patient, be loyal, be steadfast. We shall be together once
more.
I send you love with this letter. The love of a mother over
her blossoming young boy.. the love of a woman for her heart.
The love I send is tenfold now that I have been parted from
you. Be steadfast, my lion. We shall be together again.
*signed simply*
The Blood of Tarabon

`7From`6:`7 Tallyn
`7Subj`6:`7 Greetings!
Hello,
It is my understanding that you have the honor of playing 'all'
of the bookies. Gratz on that. That being the case, I need to talk
with you about setting up an RP between Elayne (who I am led to
believe is in charge in Caemlyn) and either myself or Alaura.
The purpose of the meeting will be to 1) establish a Band embassy
in Caemlyn officially. 2) Gain permission to set up an embassy
location with suitable number of Banders in residence (honor guard).
And 3) Coordinate the defense of the southern border against the
Seanchan. (If you were not aware the Band have been in Maerone for
quite a while now fortifying and preparing for the SC move north.
This is in the interests of providing a link between Andor and
Cairhien so it might be adviseable to have an Andoran military
type in attendance.)
Thanks
Tallyn

`7From`6:`7 Sabrina
`7Subj`6:`7 save
AS vs AM addendum
Hey Luc
Thanks again for talking to me today..
Something I nearly forgot about until Asherly brought it up:

`!Asherly tells you, 'And there are far far far to many AS and Accepted compared to the numbers that Peyton brought, he will have a 1:1 ratio just against the AS, if the Accepted make circles he loses. ' `0

Providing of course there are only 250 AS in the Tower, but even doing the #'s, there would be more than that. There wont be a lot of novices who could be pulled into a link, but the ones who have been able to embrace, can. And the Accepted could be pulled into links as well.
Just one more thing to think about. I dont envy you at all. :)
Sabrina, player of

`7From`6:`7 Belain
`7Subj`6:`7 Touch down
Hye, I've just join and I present myself to you. )ouch missed my first show off(
I wrote a background for a training first character based on a warder from Tear
Within the time I "at last..." finished my training I want to create a male Channeler player
with double personnality and so on.
I over-estimate me as an average-good role player, so I won't bother chores and will try to
lighten the burden of my tutors.
I'm ready to post my IG bio, I did check the site,
Some questions raise yet, where and when do I post my background to be approved, could you direct me
to the Warder's Guild GL then ?
For the newbie part of the mail : How do I connect without the create a new carac every time ? I suppose
it will stop when Belain's account will be registred and I will provide user/pass only then.
Thank you for the post's deciphering,
BBelain, hoping for a Warder's assignement in Tower's school.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Sadren
`7Subj`6:`7 Tower Seige
Um.. why is Peyton telling the Asha'man that they are going to be
occupying the White Tower, and forcing every Aes Sedai to take an Oath
to harm no Asha'man, by action or inaction, and to help no person who
is restrained by an Asha'man.. or STILL them? (Not shield them. The plans
have been changed. STILL them.)
You told me you were not handing the White Tower to them. I trusted you, Luc.
The White Tower had weeks to plan their defenses. They know how to link up to
circles of thirteen. This would not be a cakewalk. And I don't think that just
because Peyton wants to do it that it should be allowed.
I am trusting you to handle this issue, Luc. But I refuse to RP with any Asha'man
until this has been decided. They are trying to force me to teach them how to Link
with women, and things like that. I'm not going to sit around and teach them how
to be even MORE powerful.
Thank you.
Sadren
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Rissa
`7Subj`6:`7 MUD Connector and other matters
Hey sweetie!

If you're still interested in doing a write-up for TMC and other mud connection sites, please let me know.  We've been given the go-ahead for that, just not for Wiki.  There are a few things Nico wants included (and -doesn't- want included), so if you've got something already or have things in mind, I'd love to see them so I can make sure it's all there.

If you're not still interested in doing that, don't worry about it, I just remember you saying you wanted to be on the front lines of PR, and I'm more than happy to let you if you're still hoping to be.  :D
Love and kisses!
Rissa

column7: Fwd: Smash and Grab results (for real)

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Rissa
`7Subj`6:`7 Smash and Grab results (for real)
`7CC`6: `7Syrah Sabrina Kinje Rissa Lucardo
`#Sabrina`7 gets:
One `&angreal`7 of average strength (Sabrina, please get with me regarding what it looks like)

`!C`1ostume `!c`1ube`7: (ter'angreal) Fist-sized cube of a worked greyish metal.  Each side is patterned slightly differently, and when channeled into, each creates a different (pre-programmed and unchangeable) disguise as per Mirror of Mists.  This disguise remains on the channeler as long as the cube is within ten feet of her.  Cannot be used on others.  Saidar only.  (Sabrina, please get with me regarding the six disguises you get so we can hammer it out and have it documented, thanks.)

`7S`8aidinvining `7r`8od`7: (ter'angreal) A small two-pronged rod appearing to be made of a preserved redwood.  When a male channeler is within ten feet, it begins to quiver and, if held by the two prongs, point in the direction of the MC in question.  If Saidin is being held but not channeled, it becomes 20 feet, if channeled, 30 feet.
`#Kinje`7 gets:
One `&angreal`7 of average strength - This appears to be a plain, unworked golden band, large enough to be worn by a man.
One `&sa'angreal`7 of average strength - This is in the form of a belt made of seamless links of polished black material.

`^T`6riage`7: (ter'angreal) This curved, white semi-circle is about a foot in radius, and always appears antiseptic and spotlessly clean.  It is smooth, but covered in slight protrusions and knobs that feel cold to the touch.  When touched with a Healing weave, the knobs grow warm, almost too warm to hold comfortably.  After the Ter'angreal has been 'primed' with a Healing weave, for about a number of hours after, it will reproduce a weaker version of that same weave on anything living placed inside the open portion of the circle.

The stronger and better constructed the original weave, the stronger and better constructed the one that is reproduced, but it is not a perfect ratio.  Relatively weak Healing is reproduced at about half strength, stronger Healing at about one quarter, and extremely powerful Healing at closer to a fifth.  However, the stronger the initial weave, the longer it will work.

Weak Healing can be reproduced for about 12 hours, moderate Healing for about 24, and strong Healing up to 48.  It takes about ten minutes for the ter'angreal to work, during which time the knobs gradually grow cool as the weave takes effect.  It then takes the rest of an hour for them to heat back up to operating temperature, at which point the ter'angreal is ready to be used once more.  Inscribed along the outer curve of the handle in a flowing, elegant script is "Tovya ge Sora."
They also picked up some random trade goods that had been stored, but nothing else of any Power value.
Please see me with questions.

`7From`6:`7 Syrah
`7Subj`6:`7 Male/Female Linking
`7CC`6: `7Syrah Sadren Sabrina Matylena
I know this seems a bit belated (and I have given some of you verbal confirmation), but
the logs that were sent for the male/female linking experiments are approved.  With the
next series of attempts (a bit more practice), you are approved to be able to form a
link with a male as well as a female, within the rules of the world of Robert Jordan
of course (Ie: females need to initiate the  link, circle size limitations, etc.).
See me with questions.
Syrah

`7From`6:`7 Syrah
`7Subj`6:`7 Angreal
`7CC`6: `7Kaerin Lucardo Syrah
The rings ter'angreal from the Bowl of Winds Quest has been changed to conform to the
new angreal 'scaling' standards.  The angreal (3 rings to be worn on the fingers connected
to a bracelet by chains in gold) has a multiplier of 1.86 (86 percent boost) to your OCS.
See Lucardo or myself with questions.
Syrah

column7: Fwd: Guild App - Kadiana (alt of Kaerin)

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Kadiana
`7Subj`6:`7 Guild App - Kadiana (alt of Kaerin)
This is the app to get my alt into the Aes Sedai guild.  I talked with you about her
very briefly last Sunday, and have decided to go ahead and start with her even before
the other issues are cleared up.
I would like to start her as a Newly Raised Red Sister... shawled mere days before the
assault on the White Tower.  She would be resentful of the Red's loss of power, most
likely, which would make for interesting RP.
Background:
Kadiana was born and raised on the city streets of Cairhien.  Her father was a small
time merchant, mostly dealing in rare and hard to find items.  Her mother used to be
a seamstress.  She had an older brother who ran away when she was around 12 years old,
and she found herself heir-apparent to her father's business.  She threw herself into
the task of learning all of the nuances of the merchant buisness, and also learned to
read, write and do numbers as well so she could take over the business.  It was at
that time she met Raja Gallantin, and took a job running errands for him in exchange
for his tutelage not only in the merchant business, but also to improve her skills
with writing and math.
Her brother, she suspected, ran off because he was a male channeler and disappeared
into the ranks of the Asha'man possibly.  It was his disappearance that brought on
the illness that forced her mother into retirement.  Although she likes men, she has
a deep-seated hatred of male channelers, not only for what her brother's
disappearance (if that was the real reason) did to her family, as well as the deep
prejudices that run in her family.  No one has explained WHY her family hates them
more than the average population, even before the days of the Black Tower, and she
has never asked.
She was discovered by an Aes Sedai who traded with her father, and was taken to
the White Tower.  There, she was a model student and advanced fairly quickly through
her training.  Her mother passed away shortly after she left for the White Tower,
the loss of another child too much for the weak woman to bear.  Her father died
shortly thereafter.  Raja Gallantin holds the business in trust until Kadiana's
return, and it was her return to Cairhien that drove her forward in her studies.
Though she knows she can't take over the business and still be Aes Sedai, she is eager
to get all of her father's affairs in order, and to put her past behind her as she
steps into her future ahead.
Let me know if you have any questions.  Raja is a PC, though her brother is not.
Kadi

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Termiane
`7Subj`6:`7 Domani Resistance Connection
`7CC`6: `7Ilorin Rienne
Ilorin,
I wanted to drop you a note as the SC GL, to let you know that Rienne, the daughter of
a prominent Domani merchant house, and Termiane, the sell-sword who brought Valkaria
out of Arad Doman, have exchanged lists of Domani they know who might be interested in
joining the Resistance against the Seanchan. Term would put together a list of other
mercenaries, random people related to his family, and maybe the servant in Philipe
Ankaer's household who helped get him into the house, while I assume Rienne's list would
be centered around her family and their merchant contacts (although she can give more
details). The Seekers would probably hear -something- about some suspicious meetings,
so if you want to do anything about it, you can probably talk to the War Department
about it.
If you have any questions, either of us can undoubtedly answer them.
-Term.

`7Subj`6:`7 TMC stuff
we need all references to our site to be updated to tymemud.com - we're leaving envy and it is vital that people can connect to our new server.

In terms of what to add, Duren says, "I would mention that we are rebuilding combat from scratch.  That the new system utilizes nearly 50 different bodyparts, very realisticially coded forms with special procedures.... Umm, what else can we say.  There is no ETA, of course, since the only people who are working on it are Me and Nico.."
So, write up something pretty.  :)  The combat revamp and the server are the two key points, though.  Thanks again for your work on this.

This is in reference to zones 94/95/96 (mostly 94 and 95 though)
Sads
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Sadren
`7Subj`6:`7 Mudconnector
What do you think?
A Moment in Tyme (MiT) is one of the oldest Wheel of Time
based Muds on the Internet.  Since 1994, our coders and
builders have been working hard to bring in unique new
features and our own original areas.  MiT is currently on
our second major revision of the codebase, and our areas
are all completely original.  At A Moment in Tyme, we have
a dedicated playerbase and an excellent, committed staff of
Immortals.  We have unique systems in place to rank
players' mastery in swordplay and channeling (Wheel of
Time's magic system).
A Moment in Tyme is set on a Timeline that is based on the
first six books. After that, though, Tyme has broken away
to become a mirror world of the books. The Bowl of the Winds
has been found and used, breaking the long winter. Elayne
has returned to Andor and taken the Throne. After a long
struggle, Analinde su Riaten Rie now controls Cairhien
with Rand al'Thor's, the Dragon Reborn, approval.
The White Tower has split, but after a Black Tower raid
against the Aes Sedai, Elaida has been kidnapped and now
awaits trial before the newly reunified Tower. Who will be
Amyrlin now? Already several woman are seeking the title.
And the Seanchan? Tarabon, Arad Doman, and Altara are
all victims of the Ever Victorious Army. The High Lady
Suroth invaded, and conquered Murandy, instead of reaching
into Amadicia. Because of this, High Lady Ilorin Shayndel
Paendrag, fourth in line for the Crystal Throne, has
officially settled into the Panarch's Palace and taken
control of the Hailene. Who will stop them? Word is that
a mercenary group called the Heron Company is being raised
to retake Arad Doman...
A Moment in Tyme is a RP-intensive MUD. We have an RPexp
system which rewards RP by giving EXP based on emotes.
Combat Code is currently offline, as it is being completely
remodified and built from the ground up. It will utilize
50 different body parts as well as have very realistically
coded forms with special procedures.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Lio
`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Lio Ezara

Hi there! Here is a background for Lio Ezara. This background is written to the rank of Accepted, though she has been Aes Sedai on Dragons Fang for over 5 years (real time). I hope you enjoy the reading :) Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
Lio Ezara
DISCLAIMER : This is NOT, repeat, NOT a Sedai-with-a-sword background! That said, please read on... :)

Lio's childhood was somewhat complicated. She was the only daughter of a general in the Shienaran army and her three brothers -- two elder, one younger -- constantly kept her on her toes. And they constantly reminded her of the fact that she was a girl, unable to keep up with their races, unable to best them at anything physical and unable to follow their father's footsteps into the soldier's ranks. Now, granted, a woman of Shienar tends to be able to hold her own when necessary, but there was just something really frustrating to Lio about not being able to fall into place with her brothers and help to protect her homeland. While they looked forward to prestigious military careers, bringing glory to the family name and keeping Shienar safe, Lio was left with suggestions about finding a "nice boy to settle down with" and raise a family of her own... She felt like growling at every person who said that to her.

Eventually, Lio entered the age in which all children naturally rebel against their parents. Somewhere around her 15th or 16th summer, she started wanting to train with the boys but of course her mother disallowed it, saying that she should focus on learning or domestic endeavors. Well, "learning" didn't seem to be the thing that would fulfill her youthful patriotism, given the fact that you can't kill a Trolloc with a book, and "domestic endeavors" were almost entirely out of the question.  What talent she showed in this area -- leatherworking, to a degree -- was something she resented because it might mean that someone, somewhere would try to force her to become a seamstress. And that she could not abide.

As fate would have it, one autumn Lio's mother received a reprieve from her wayward daughter by the passage of an Aes Sedai and Warder pair through the village on their way to some undisclosed location along the Border. The pair brought every eager young soldier in the village to hopefully eye the Gaidin, wishing to observe some secret on how to train better, how to learn faster, how to be quicker... Of course, none dared approach them too boldly, but sufficient was their exposure in the village for the path of Lio and the Aes Sedai to cross. Whatever journey that the Aes Sedai and her Warder had been on was now shelved, and the Ezara family was startled by a solid knock on their door a day or two after the sister had seen Lio.

The rest of the story proceeds as one might expect -- the Aes Sedai was firm on the notion that Lio should be presented to the White Tower at Tar Valon to begin her training, post haste, and she herself was going to escort the girl there. That the sister was somewhat displeased by having her previous task derailed was evident but not so compulsory as to stop her from having Lio packed up and on a horse within the week. The protests began almost immediately from Lio, but then one simple fact was explained to her in detail -- her power, should she refine it, would be more effective against the advance of the Shadow than any sword, pole-arm or projectile, and that she could use that power in defense of Shienar and the rest of the Light-loving world. After that conversation, the trio set out for Tar Valon together, and Lio did everything she could to hasten the journey.

In the arms of Tower discipline, Lio seemed to finally find her calling. The chores and lessons were nothing beside the chance to learn how to weave with Saidar. Once Lio was able to taste it on her own, under the close observation of a strong teacher, she discovered a deep and undividing passion for learning stronger and more efficient ways to manipulate Saidar. At last, it seemed, she had in her hands a solid strength that could stand against the Shadow and bring honor to the Ezara name. With this firmly in mind, she threw herself into her studies, excelling at every task (though struggling somewhat with the BORING history) and chomping at the bit for more. It was even said, from time to time, that she should slow herself and cease the single-minded devouring of all the lessons and instructors assignments that she could get her hands on. Her test to Accepted came four years after her admission to the Tower -- right before her 20th birthday.
During her time as an Accepted, Lio focused herself primarily on studying two things -- battle and diplomacy. She had learned, through her upbringin

`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 dream

There is nothing unusual about the day.  Sunlight is warm at his back and a cool breeze touches his skin, muted where thin fabric shelters his torso from biting insects.  The breeze helps with that, confusing their delicate flight away from a determined path to his sweat and breath.  He might have seen nineteen summers, seven years old almost to the day, and he has all of his height and most of his weight.  In fact, it is not until much later that he loses muscle mass gained from farm work and training, and loses it rapidly at that.  Those things are far away from him now, his senses filled with quiet sounds punctuated by the sharp calls of birds and the occasional blare of nearby rodents' argument over resources.

The most remarkable aspect of the day --of which he is unaware at this moment-- is his complete and poignant lack of discomfort.  He slaps at a fly or gnat that has clung to his skin, more out of irritation than pain as he scarcely notices it.  There are other dangers here, the Blight reaching out under the land and through the waterways into the south, sometimes so far as his family's holdings.  His scent therefore is scrubbed away from him and replaced as well as possible with the smell of leafed and woody plants, dulled by clay and altered by fir.  Although his hair is braided, the bells on strands woven into it are silent, well-spaced and hollow decoration, present for tradition but non-functional.  In the city, he will have to redo the braids and replace the bells.

It is no great disturbance to him that while he walks the quiet forest, he is suddenly not just outside of his familial holdings but at the side of a road as he emerges from the woods, and if he had to guess a position, which he doesn't, he would say he was south of Shol Arbola and not too far away at that.  He takes the road toward the city, the sunlight bright and hot, and the flies thick as they converge to movement, darting away from piles of dung from many sorts of cart and pack animals.

A wagon sits at the side of the road at a bend, both front wheels off, with a guard leaning against the back wheel as a woman in ornate clothing inspects the front axle.  There is nothing odd about this, to his mind, and as he approaches, he nods to Vance, who shrugs at him and gives him a mixed look of long suffering and tolerance both.  Telen says, "You're farther north than I expected you would be," and he isn't sure why he expected Vance to be south, but it is a good thing he caught him before going into the city.  He feels it is a good thing, though how Vance is here south of Shol Arbola with Brienne and Lierna, he could not say.  No, it isn't Lierna, it is Rienne straightening up from her inspection of the wagon's axle, with her inexpert wield of Domani wiles and sloppy execution of Light given graces.  Bloody hell.  He had been looking forward to seeing Lierna.  Resignation combines sickeningly with arousal.

He shrugs off the disappointment.  He is still looking forward to seeing her in the city.  Isn't he? He turns away from Rienne smiling at him to scan the woods and stare down the road toward the south.  Southeast.  No, no, she's here, somewhere.  For an instant, he knows he is dreaming and all his will twists at the fabric of it.  It is a fabric of woven bands of steel, flexible but noncompliant, and his will abrades and bleeds upon it.  Dreamscape resumes as if uninterrupted.  Bright sun beats down upon sandy hair and warms his shoulders.  Light pales the primary colors of noon with brightness, casting deep black shadows in pools below pines thickly carpeted in green grey needles.

What should remain memory is drawn out on silken threads and blends seamlessly with strands of possibility.  It is and it isn't Rienne's hand on his shoulder, one finger laid against the skin of his neck so that from between his shoulder blades to the nape of his neck all of the fine hairs are standing.  By the tingle of it, those at the nape of his neck are bristling as well.  He has walked the forest beside his family's house with only his long dagger and walked the road with a longsword at his hip, but when a dark shape wheels a shadow across the road, he is stepping forward away from warmth like a second sun and drawing twin blades from his back sheath.  His linen and wool are leathers, and there is thin metal plate reinforcing a cuirass and bracers laced to his chest and forearms.

The forest explodes with darkness, hoary and ragged shapes emerging from light and shadow as if the pools below the pines are rearing to shake ham fists, sprouting weapons and charging forward.  A cloud passes over the sun and the land becomes many shades of grey, the distinction between glowing highlight and velvet shadow blurring.  There is a tinny shriek,

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 dream2

He wishes to be still and feign death.  His treacherous body shakes as an aspen leaf shivers in the slightest twist of air, and his back feels as unbending as if he were impaled.  It does not matter now if any of the others live.  He hopes they do not, for it is from here to the cookfires, if the Trollocs are patient enough for cookfires.  Another body rolls into his and he turns to look, eyes glazed as he searches for physical connections.  One hand in the grass, empty, fingers move.  His other hand is around the hilt of a sword or dagger.  A sword.  Pinned under him awkwardly, no movement, and he fears to try to loosen his grip.  A mass of dark hair matted and seeded with sand fills his vision, pale skin under it.  Unnaturally pale.  Drained.

The taloned feet at his side dig into the ground as weight shifts, cartilage grinding against drying dirt, and air moves in a foul, smoky draft trailing a black-beaked head as it swoops down open and buries deeply into the still warm body.  It jerks.  The beak comes up trailing pink and coiling ropes, spraying moisture in a wide spatter.  He gasps and forces his fist behind him several inches along the ground.  A dark and knowing eye connects with his, its flat black wheel of iris constricting on a fathomless pupil.  The Trolloc shakes a massive beak drooping broken innards and dives again, one divided foot rising and planting solidly on his midsection, which does not stop his body's rattling but it does arrest his attempt to wield.

Another sound has intruded, unnoticed until the pulsing grey tones of dream shatter, bringing him into the world halfway, where he hangs and shudders, crying or heaving.  It doesn't matter.  He hates.  As soon as he can move, he is feeling for something to throw, finding nothing edged is of no particular note.  He rolls off his bed to the floor in a half curl, hardly feeling the fall.  Nightmare remains living in him as pain scrapes along his skeleton, wrapping thorny around it and clinging, tangling in nerves.  He can reach the leg of his chair from where he is panting on the floor and he grasps it and lifts it to hurl at the door with all his strength.  The door ceases its unpleasant rapping from the outside as it is pummeled from the inside, a new dent marring the finish as the chair falls and skews to its back.

The reverberations slowly cease their adept wringing, and he comes out of dream into waking as though he has been devoured literally and now is reborn from death.  He still hates but he can feel it bleeding out of him with the need for violence instinctive to stemming pain and horror.  Maybe more horror than pain.  He is used to pain.  Whoever was at his door is gone now.  He should feel gratitude.  He should thank the person later and leave it to the imagination why ever for.  As always, he does a cursory inspection and is surprised to find he is whole and all his joints seem to work properly.  Revulsion hits him again and he fends off an image of Lierna torn and bloodied, eaten.  Seen before.  To function, there is a wall he erects against his memory of nightmare, and he does so now.  It will serve until he again sleeps.

I'm not sure why it calls it the 'large' tho, when it's clearly not
the whole desc.  I'll muse on that.

tower raid, it's certainly possible to have fights happen in the tower
rooms. :P
