`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Myrene
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: My BG
Thanks for the correction! I totally spaced that Salidar was empty.
I just remembered reading about Egwene's string of maids that were
local girls and assumed they had lived there longer than the Aes
Sedai. I guess it's time for a re-read. ^_^ I think the idea
of her being from a nearby town should work just fine. Being
a seamstress for a town of clothes-loving Aes Sedai would be
more profitable than her local yokel job, definitely, and
would make sense ICly for her.
As for the clarifications:
* Myrene is a latent channeler, not a wilder
* She was written into the Rebel's "novice book"
just before they started their journey northeast.
* To make guild lessons fair, I've decided that she hasn't
had any lessons in the One Power yet. So far, her previous
mentors have only helped her try to embrace saidar with
no success so far (she's a slow learner :P) so that I can
RP out all the good lessons still.
I guess that's it. If you need anything else, just send me
a `1tell`7 or mudmail :D
`6- `%M`5yrene`7

happen, and someone put the idea in Isleen's head that Rand
and Elayne could possibly be lovers.  She's deliberately
spreading this rumor, through her connections with the
Black Hand and the criminal underworld of Caemlyn.  She is,
of course, being very discreet about it, merely fanning a
few flames that have already been lit by others. :)
Isleen's player

My e-mail address is perryrs@auburn.edu, and I will be here from time to time to try and catch you on.
Thanks! - Trey

The organization has to be a bit different, or it
will be really hard to see what things are connected.
I generally always keep everything in sequential order..
I just noticed that if you create numbers out of order,
it keeps them in the orderyou create them in.
I need them to be in sequential order, so I don't get
them mixed up. I don't want to have to leave a mobscript
halfway, and then come back and not be sure which
vnums I was working with.
Thanks,
-Sads

column7: Your wish is my command, again

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Duren
`7Subj`6:`7 Your wish is my command, again
Ok, I finally fixed mpedit list so it always lists in sequential order from lowest to highest.
I also made it so you can type:  mpedit list [zone] and see only the programs in that
zones range of vnums (Note that this command works regardless of whether a zone with
that number really exists or not, because mob programs aren't actually tied to zones
in any way.)
Also, my new creation system here is almost finished, and is mostly working, so you shouldn't
have any trouble creating new characters now.
Also, I updated the help files (MPEDIT, MOBPROGRAMS, and added a new one:  MOB LOGIC)
The MOB LOGIC file contains a reference for how to use the if-else statements, as well
as examples, and also includes a reference for how to use the for-loop code I created.
I believe that takes care of all your requests regarding mob progs so far.  :)
-Duren

`7From`6:`7 Duren
`7Subj`6:`7 Stuff
Hey Sadren,
I deleted your latest task on dotproject.  Before you go and get upset, here's why:
1.)  We already have said RP log system.  We've had it for years, just no-one uses it.
2.)  I already have a task on the dotproject board about revamping the RP log system to make it even more feature-complete.
Also, I made another very significant improvement to the mob program code.  You know
how before it would respond immediately to events?  So if you were following someone
and you followed someone into a room, the mob would greet him before you made it into
the room, so you never saw the first greeting?
Well, I changed all that.  Now when an event occurs, it gets added to a list.
And then after all players commands have been processed, the mud goes through
this list, and processes all the events in the order they were received.
Now as part of this same code, I added a delay variable, so each event can
have a different delay.  The delay being how long it will sit in that events
list before it executes.  This also allowed me to create an even better way
of handling delays than with mob pause.
Remember I said mob pause actually leaves your script in memory, and your script just calls the
main game loop a given number of times (depending on how long you delay) ?
So here's what happens:
game_loop calls command_interpreter (Lets say command is 'east' and you walk into a mob)
command_interpreter calls move_character function (to move you 'east'
move_character checks for mob triggers, finds one, and calls mp_greet_trigger
mp_greet_trigger calls program_flow, to execute your script.
program_flow executes your script, encounters a 'mob pause' and begins calling game_loop

game_loop goes through and processes any pending character commands and output.  However, anything the original game_loop was working on (Such as processing people who are following you) won't be taken care of by this game loop.
Notice now we have two game_loops, and when someone else types a command, we'll have two instances
of command_interpreter, and then that may cause another mob trigger, which will cause another instance
of program_flow, and that second script may have a delay in it as well.  And now we have another copy
of game loop running while we wait for that delay.  -Plus-, the original program_flow now has to wait
for the second one to finish before it can ever regain control.  So if player A triggers a 5 second
mob pause delay, and Player B triggers a 30 second delay while program A is in the process of
it's 5 second delay, then player A will end up waiting over 30 seconds, because he has to wait for
the second program to finish (Even if it's in another room or zone).
Basically, even though it's better than the original delay code, it's
still far from ideal.  My new code fixes all this.
I introduced a new command, called 'halt'  It works just like mob pause, only
better.  So you can do 'halt 5', to interupt your program for half a second.
The halt command actually saves all the data about where the script was when it stopped,
and then adds an event onto that events buffer I added, setting the delay for whatever you
specify.  Then once that delay is up, the MUD will re-open the script, jump back to where
it left off, and resume execution from that point.
So halt is definitely the preferred way to pause programs now.
I also changed mprogadd so it expects a delay variable now.  If you want the mob
to continue responding instantly to an event, without ever going on the event list,
you can specify a -1.  You will need to use -1 for some scripts, such as if you want
to have a script that only blocks an exit under certain rules.  If you use the
event buffer, your script won't end before the move_character code needs to know whether
or not you used 'end' or 'end 1'.  So it will assume you just did a regular 'end' and block
the character.
Alright, now next topic.  Brailon sent me a mudmail offering to help build some.  He's
built before but he's probably a little rusty on the commands.  I'll forward the mudmail to you and syrah.
-Duren
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7From`6:`7 Sadren
`7Subj`6:`7 re: Sittable Objects
I need someone to code a flag so that players may sit ON objects, such as chairs, fountains, benches, etc.
I also have an idea for mobscripts that will require and make use of being able to set objects ON object. This will require two things:
One is the SIT flag. Any objects with a SIT flag can be sat upon, such as a fountain, a chair, a bench, a couch, etc.

Also, I will need an ON flag. Any objects with an ON flag will be able to have other objects sat on top of them. I need this ON flag so that I can create quests where I put objects ON other objects to create some desired effect.

Also, there needs to be some sort of way that objects can be both SIT and ON. However, if objects are ON another object, then PCs should not be able to sit on them. They should receive a message saying, "There is already something on the bench/chair/fountain, etc."
This is a list Duren gave me of things which would have to be updated in order to complete this task.
Duren:
At a high level, we need:
*Two new object flags.
*We need two new linked lists on objects, one to store players who are sitting on an object, and another to store objects that are sitting on an object.
*We need to modify the 'sit' command to allow sitting 'on' something.
*We need to modify the 'put' command to allow putting stuff on other things.
*We have to modify commands like 'look', to make them display people or objects that are sitting on an object.

*And then we have to deal with code that expects all objects to be either in the room, or in an object in the room. All of that code will have to be modified to now search -on- objects as well as -in- objects.

`7From`6:`7 Ileana
`7Subj`6:`7 Doors
Okay, I've figured it out. Here are the steps:
1. Choose the exit you want to make into a door
2. Choose option 3 to name the door with "door <direction>"
3. Choose option 5 for "Door Flags"
4. Set it to option 1 "Closeable Door"
5. Back at the door options editor, it should now say
"Is a door"
6. Exit out of the editor and make sure to save as you leave
7. Close the door manually once out of the editor
8. Redit save <zone>
9. Zedit save <zone>
10. Zreset <zone>
Voila! It should work if you did everything above.
- Ileana/Myrene
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7Subj`6:`7 Doors

- Ileana/Myrene
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ethrea
`7Subj`6:`7 Desc
You  can not  quite put an age  to this woman.   At one moment she seems a
youthful 20,  the next she seems older,  wiser, perhaps 50.  She stands at
a willowy five foot eight and moves with a natural grace, as if each step,
each action  were part of  a well planned dance.   Long,  glistening locks
of honey-blonde hair flow from atop her head, framing her oval face with a
myriad of  waist-length braids.   Tiny beads and bells  are woven into her
silken tresses so that with even the slightest movement she is accompanied
by soft chimes.  Rich chocolate colored eyes lined with thick, dark lashes
and full deep red rosebud lips, ever pouting or preparing for a kiss, only
seem to carry on the  enigma of this woman.   She is slender,  with a slim
waist  and long,  shapely legs.   Her small breasts  are high and  firm, a
compliment to gently rounded hips.
Extra descriptions: attire, choker, eyes.
Extra description for attire..
The attire  that this  woman wears is  quite exquisite.   A gown of slightly
opaque silk covers her slender frame from neck to toe,  though it's style is
daring giving well placed hints at what lay beneath while revealing nothing.
A soft pearly grey slashed with cream,  it clings to her body until reaching
her mid-thigh at which point it loosens to float down her long shapely legs.
A delicate,  intricate embriodery of a shimmering silver can be seen looping
and swirling about the hem,  cuffs and high collar of the gown.   Three tiny
rows of miniature pearls  that climb her slim back  hold her gown  in place.
A pair of slippers,  dyed to match,  peek forth from the  airy skirts of her
gown.  About her slim neck is an ornate choker of finely woven gold.
Extra description for choker..
About her slim neck is an ornate choker of finely woven gold.   The pattern
of the choker is intricate and consists of waves, artful swirls and circles
all  inter-linked  to form one  large pattern  that is pleasing to the eye.
Supported by this work of art is a  night-black sheath.   Housed within the
sheath is a thin dagger just as ornate as the choker it bedecks.  There are
several small holes upon the golden hilt,  as if for the placement of beads
or jewels,  however they sit empty in wait.   There are no other adornments
to the knife other than it's simple etchings.
Extra description for eyes..
At first glance this  woman's eyes seem to shine with an unforgotten inno-
cence,  this effect is only enhanced by her  almost doll-face appearance -
her eyes are still as wide as a child's. But upon closer examination those
dark chocolate  orbs glitter and glisten with an inner-light.   A light of
knowledge and  wisdom that  far surpass  the youth  that that  her  smooth
complexion hints at.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ethrea
`7Subj`6:`7 Desc
You  can not  quite put an age  to this woman.   At one moment she seems a
youthful 20,  the next she seems older,  wiser, perhaps 50.  She stands at
a willowy five foot eight and moves with a natural grace, as if each step,
each action  were part of  a well planned dance.   Long,  glistening locks
of honey-blonde hair flow from atop her head, framing her oval face with a
myriad of  waist-length braids.   Tiny beads and bells  are woven into her
silken tresses so that with even the slightest movement she is accompanied
by soft chimes.  Rich chocolate colored eyes lined with thick, dark lashes
and full deep red rosebud lips, ever pouting or preparing for a kiss, only
seem to carry on the  enigma of this woman.   She is slender,  with a slim
waist  and long,  shapely legs.   Her small breasts  are high and  firm, a
compliment to gently rounded hips.
Extra descriptions: attire, choker, eyes.
Extra description for attire..
The attire  that this  woman wears is  quite exquisite.   A gown of slightly
opaque silk covers her slender frame from neck to toe,  though it's style is
daring giving well placed hints at what lay beneath while revealing nothing.
A soft pearly grey slashed with cream,  it clings to her body until reaching
her mid-thigh at which point it loosens to float down her long shapely legs.
A delicate,  intricate embriodery of a shimmering silver can be seen looping
and swirling about the hem,  cuffs and high collar of the gown.   Three tiny
rows of miniature pearls  that climb her slim back  hold her gown  in place.
A pair of slippers,  dyed to match,  peek forth from the  airy skirts of her
gown.  About her slim neck is an ornate choker of finely woven gold.
Extra description for choker..
About her slim neck is an ornate choker of finely woven gold.   The pattern
of the choker is intricate and consists of waves, artful swirls and circles
all  inter-linked  to form one  large pattern  that is pleasing to the eye.
Supported by this work of art is a  night-black sheath.   Housed within the
sheath is a thin dagger just as ornate as the choker it bedecks.  There are
several small holes upon the golden hilt,  as if for the placement of beads
or jewels,  however they sit empty in wait.   There are no other adornments
to the knife other than it's simple etchings.
Extra description for eyes..
At first glance this  woman's eyes seem to shine with an unforgotten inno-
cence,  this effect is only enhanced by her  almost doll-face appearance -
her eyes are still as wide as a child's. But upon closer examination those
dark chocolate  orbs glitter and glisten with an inner-light.   A light of
knowledge and  wisdom that  far surpass  the youth  that that  her  smooth
complexion hints at.

`7From`6:`7 Maelyn
`7Subj`6:`7 Re BG
Have you checked with Etheniel on the noble connection? She will need
to approve your father being the High Lord, as well as the items.
I am also just a little concerned about the idea of a 'cruel' orphanage
in TV where even babies are beaten....the White Tower is -very- much
in control of everything that happens on the island. I have a hard time
believing several hundred AS would ignore something like that.
Particularly the Yellows, who tend to take "care of others" to an
extreme. Could you put the orphanage maybe in a southern borderland
town in Sheinar? The Tower is well-respected throughout the
Borderlands, so the motivations for the character would not need to
be altered at all. Many AS travel through the Borderlands on a regular
vbasis, and quite a few live in those lands as well. The AS your mom was
trying to reach could easily live in Sheinar as opposed to TV.
Let me know your thoughts, and sorry this took so long.
Ah, just realized I forgot to copy Balinor and Etheniel on this. I
will forward them a copy. Reply to them as well, if you need to.
Thanks!
Mae

`7From`6:`7 Sadren
`7Subj`6:`7 Newbie Zone information
I am creating a newbie zone that will be full of history and
events that a newbie would know ICly. I kept most of the old
information there, but changed it slightly. This is what will
be put in for the Seanchan.
`7When Artur Hawkwing's Empire collapsed, a group of his descendants fled
across the Aryth Ocean. There, a new nation grew: the `8S`6e`7a`&n`8c`7h`6a`8n`7. The
seanchan are unknown to most people on the mainland, however they are a
fearsome army. They are very hierarchical, and their society is ruled
by "The Blood", or those who can trace an ancestry back to Artur
Hawkwing. The supreme ruler is the Empress, who has total power of life
and death over every person in the Empire.
`7Recently, the Seanchan have returned to the mainland and invaded at
Falme. The Seanchan armies are a fearsome sight to behold, especially
due to the leashed Damane. Female channelers who wear a collar, they
seem to be at the bidding of mysterious women wearing dresses with
forked lightning bolts embroidered on them.
`7Since the Return started, the Seanchan have taken hold of Tarabon,
Arad Doman, Altara, and Murandy. Besides these few facts, very little
is known of this mysterious remnant of Artur Hawkwing's lost descendants.`0

`7From`6:`7 Sadren
`7Subj`6:`7 re: Things left to do
Ok, Ile.
I got the Sitter's Offices desced last night. I am proud to say
that we have very little left in the way of actual descing left
to do.
This is what is left to be done:
-The classroom wing needs to be desced.
-The skyways leading between the various towers and the White
Tower need to be described. You can find them by typing vnum
room skyway.
-The Yellow Ajah Offices were not desced. Leave those for Syrah.
To be honest, I think that's all that is left. We're almost done.
I have one small project for you.. this seems like it would be
something right up your alley. I was considering putting in a
bunch of books into the shelves in the Great Library. We have
a bunch in zone 3.. why not use those? But I know we could use
extras, and you already have several made.
If you decided to make any more book objects, throw them in zone
three. I will use them all from there. Remember, when you set
any of them, that you need to set the number on the MUD to 0, so
I can set as many books as I want to.
After this, I am going to work on Cairhien. When I was discussing
fixing up Caemlyn on wiznet, Syrah said something along the
lines of, 'I thought I assigned you to Cairhien. :P' I wanna
keep her happy. :P
Of course, I want you to pick a job you are happy with. I was
hoping that you could focus on the shops in Caemlyn, so we can
actually get EQ into the game.
Let me know your thoughts about all of this.
-Sads

`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 Cairhien mislinks
`7CC`6: `7Jaiden Duren
I found two mis-links and several misspellings.  I can fix the mis-links if desired.
Room 13386 needs a south link to 13285
13374 needs a link east to 13225
I found a room name error (I think) 13235 should be named South East Square oor something similar.
It is referred by that in a rdesc to the north and is currently named for a street that is well north
of that room.
There are a few hyphenation errors.  One room should have surroundings instead of surrounds, etc.
The Owl and Heron has a good many grammatical things.  The most glaring is heavy use of contractions.
There's for there is is prevalent.  I can go through and touch up all of those as well.  Or provide a
list which might take longer than fixing them. :)
I did not go through the palace itself, but I can if it is desird.
Brailon

`7From`6:`7 Jasil
`7Subj`6:`7 Thieves Guild
Descriptions
Short yet agile he stands five foot five inches and has nice muscle tone
for his size, looks to be in his early thirties. He has rugged yet handsome features. He
bears a small scar across his left cheek. He has tattoo of a `#Rising Sun`7 on his left arm
the artwork is very bright and detailed.  There is certain darkness about him his face
emotionless most of the time. He has short black hair, light emerald eyes, and tan
skin.
The mans clothing is very dark and covered by a `8black`7 hooded cloak

As he moves you may catch a glance of a `8black`7 leather tunic under his tunic he wears a `8black`7 shirt of silk. On his legs he wears `8black`7 breeches made of high quality material. The breeches are tucked into a pair of nice but worn `8black`7 leather boots.

On his waist he wears a well made `7grey`7 leather belt. A strong gust of wind may reveal two ivory hilts, the carving work on the hilts alone looks to be done very skillfully. Each blade is made with very high grade metal for Jasils purpose. One blade is slightly curved the other straight, each are very well polished and shine as so. His clothing is kept neat but shows signs of wear from the day.
Description 2
Short yet agile he stands five foot five inches and has nice muscle tone

for his size, looks to be in his early thirties. He has rugged yet handsome features. He bears a small scar across his left cheek. He has tattoo of a `#Rising Sun`7 on his left arm, the artwork is very bright and detailed. He always seems to bear a grin or smile of some type and a glimmer of mischief in his eyes. He has short black hair, light emerald eyes, and tan skin.
The mans clothing is covered by a `7grey`7 hooded cloak. As he moves you may catch a glance of a very well made deep mocha leather tunic and dark `4blue`7 breeches

with `#gold`7 stitching. Under his tunic he wears a thin white shirt of fine silk. The breeches are tucked into a pair a very well made polished boots of a deep mocha color. Around his waist he wears a leather belt of fine quality the same mocha color as the

boots. A strong gust of wind may reveal two ivory hilts, the carving work on the hilts alone looks to be done very skillfully. Each blade is made with very high grade metal for Jasils purpose. One blade is slightly curved the other straight, each are very well polished and shine as so. His clothing is kept very neat and clean it is all made of high quality material, it looks very expensive.
Background
Jasil was born in the outskirts of Cairhien in the Foregate, his family was not wealthy.

His father worked as a small time merchant selling many different goods he made to make a living for his family. As a young boy Jasil got to visit the city and as far south as Maerone while helping his father out with his trade. A few years later during the first burning of the Foregate all of his family was killed, Jasil managed to get out of the house in time to seek refuge. He followed like many of the survivors into the city once he realized he had lost his family.

Jasil met a young woman from the Foregate once inside Cairhien walls. They shared the story of loses and kept each other company for some time to. The woman took Jasil in you could say even if the first few months of life was rough in the streets. Not much time passed before she somehow managed to pull in a nice bit of coin to afford a decent if not nice inn for them to stay. She taught Jasil how to use daggers and knifes as well as how to move without being seen or heard for protection.

After a couple years passed Jasil set out on his own to explore the world to see what else may be beyond what he knew. He traveled as far west as Arad Doman, Tarabon as far south as Tear, Illian, and north as far as Maradon stopping to see many things in his journeys. As you can expect that took time, it was well worth it once he was satisfied he returned to Cairhien to seek work with what he learned from the woman and his travels. For many months he worked just to get coin in order to have a place to stay and food to eat, honest or not he did what he had to. Many Houses unknown to Jasil took notice to this, most thinking how well the skills could benefit them.
Jasil has worked with many plotting Lords and Ladies of Cairhien he built wealth fast.

With only being caught once he was given a light sentence for appearance sake as strings were pulled. He served a few short months as a Sun Guard helping with the night watch over the streets. Many thieves would learn that it might be better to fight him rather than flee. After his duty with the Guard was up he was once again back to doing tasks for Houses filling his pockets even more.
Some may call him an assassin, thief, or troublemaker as dark as

`7From`6:`7 Jonah
`7Subj`6:`7 Hey you
Howdy! Just got your tells. :) What's up?
I live in Sweden, so it might be costly to call me. :P And then there's the problem with timezones. *_*
We could handle it over email/mudmail, I check those several times every day. I can also be reached on MSN.
Email: siam@glocalnet.net
MSN: siam_c@hotmail.com
Cheers,
Siam
Jonah

`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 Building
`7CC`6: `7Syrah Duren I am probably going to have a good bit of time on my hands
here and nothing to do from appearances.  If I am going to stay, I need
something to fill some of the time while attempting to find rp.  I finished the
building stuff assigned to me a couple of weeks ago though someone needs to
look it over.  If there is more building to be done, even the 10 x 10 squares
of the wilderness areas, I'd like to be assigned it.  I've also identified
several things to be fixed in Cairhien I can implement.  7 mislinks are the
main thing.
If there are any questions, please let me know.

`7From`6:`7 Matylena
`7Subj`6:`7 Weirdness
`7CC`6: `7Duren Syrah Rissa
I don't know if one of you imms was just pulling some sort
of prank on me or what, but when I got up this morning, my
connection to the game via Maty was lost, and just before it
had disconnected, there was a message that said:
Your character has been deleted.
Now clearly, my character is not deleted, so all is well.
But I also noticed that a new character has been created
with the name Inv.  Inv is short for inventory, which is
the command I use for my idle timer so I don't idle out.
How it managed to make its own character is beyond me.
If y'all have done something, please let me know.  If not,
then I'm letting YOU know that something is fucked up.
Maty

`7From`6:`7 Jaiden
`7Subj`6:`7 Your last zone
Brai,
Sorry I was away, but I had some major RL issues going
on. I am back now, and will be on probably three times
a week or so at least. I'll have time on thursdays to
sit down and deal with building, like I did before.
Duren told me that you finished a zone.. he wasn't certain
but thought you did. I just wanted to check, because I
didn't see any mudmail pertaining to an entire zone, just
the cairhien mislinks.
I will go through the mislinks and grade them (hopefully)
by tonight.
Also, next time I see you on I'd like to assign you a new
area. I have several things in the ubermap I'd like to see
implemented, but I need to sit down and talk with you and
make sure you're interested in doing them all.
Thanks!
Jai

Jai

column7: Serghi and Lucrezia - a previous background,

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Serghi
`7Subj`6:`7 Serghi and Lucrezia - a previous background,
Serghi den Lushenos started life in Cairhein, son of the Lord Argil
and Lady Bradona Damodred. His father Argil and his mother, Lady Bradona
were killed in a freak accident when their coach was crushed as workmen
were repairing on of the Topless Towers of Cairhein. This accident coincided
with Laman Damodred's subseqent rise to power in the House of Damodred.
Fearing for the life of the orphaned son, the Nanny to the young
Serghi took him out of Cairhein under the cover of night by barge to Caemlyn.
Once there, he was given to her cousin who had connections with the Illian
House of den Lushenos.Serghi was given to be raised in Illian, along with
the Lady Bradona's jewels to support the cost of raising him in the manner
of one who was inline to heir the most powerful of Cairheinien Houses.
Serghi's younger years were fraught with hard feelings and resentment
from those of the den Lushenos House. The eldest son, Assario made it quite
apparent that Serghi was unwanted and unwelcome in the tight-knit den Lushenos
House. Although not treated as a true noble of the house, he was given a nobles
education in letters, edicate and protocol. Yet,at the same time Assario and his
brothers would beat and berate the young Serghi setting him up to take punishment
for their foul deeds and cruel behavior of the servants and animals of the manor.
This made the Lord Anigair den Lushenos leary about entrusting any responsiblity or
position of authority on young Serghi. Hence Serghi began his younger years as a man,
bored and hated umoung those in Illian whom he was destined to spend his life with.
Serghi kept to himself, biding his time with cheap thugs and brothel women.
His self loathing breed in him the means of darkness that hid under the surface.
Serghi learned from these thugs the means of torture and abuse especialy to those
who found themselves smaller and weaker than he. He studies the arts of poisons,
and acts of torture, hoping someday he would find a use for them.
Serghi 'talents" were honed to a fine edge and he was given the task of
employing whatever means needed to gain political advantage for the House. Whether
be it, posion, or the explotation of a rival nobles daughter, extortion against a
business or guild who's dealings with the House were less than satisfactory.
One evening a debt the High Lord Anigiar had aquired was not paid with to the
satisfaction of the debtor. The rule of the House was passed to Assario, as the
High Lord's head was crushed by Hooded men in the presence of the whole of the House.
With the Assario's rise to power within the House of den Lushenos, Serghi
had no choice but to leave Illian with a pouch of gold sovereigns and a few precious
gems, they would not last long with Serghi's taste. Enroute through Andor he met a woman,
Lucrezia Rosseau, a domani with enticing beauty and a lack of scruples to match Serghi's.
They travelled through Andor and to Cairhein, finding marks and swindling men who found
Lucrezia's beauty so overpowering they forgot to notice the dark alley she had just led
them into. The two have been more partners than lovers, and have found their association
mutualy benefical.
Serghi is a brute and a boorish advisary. He will always chose intimidation to
physical force. He likes to play one side against the other for as long as he can, and
will always indulge his baser instincts when he feels so inclined.  He has a pention for
torture (always with consent, and only IC) and will always pick prey that are smaller than
himself. He aligns himself with the Council of Nine in Illian and has a hatred of the
Monarchy, and the House den Balgar.  In Cairhein, while still being Damodred,
will avail himself to whoever is in power at the time.
** OOC Stuff and character issues **
Serghi is a male channler, but WILL NEVER use his power in public, it is his dark secret
and is used for df work and RP issues. His training will always be clandestine, and kept
to the utmost secrecy. He is a villain and it adds to his villany, but has almost been
impossible to DF as a non-channeling male unless you are just dying to be subservant to
EVERYONE else. I will not associate with ASHA (or whomever we are calling them in this
timeline) In previous RP only three people knew this fact.
New note: I odn't htink this char was built as a Channeller, but the above still applies
as to the fact that no one will know and it will not be used except to RP to a select
consenting few. I use it as a character device more than a RP device.
Thanks Serghi den Lushenos
aka rsmartin@austin.rr.com

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jaiden
`7Subj`6:`7 re: Brailon's Reward
`7CC`6: `7Duren Brailon Syrah
Brailon found a bunch of mislinks in Cairhien. Some he linked,
a couple I had to go through and do myself. I rewarded him 3
for the ones he did, 2 for the ones he pointed out, for a
grand total of 25.
Brailon, thank you for your hard work and please forgive me
for not getting to it sooner.
Please feel free to do anymore mislinks and report to me as
soon as possible. I will keep giving you QPs for whichever
ones you find.
Syrah, Cairhien is beginning to come together, but still
needs alot of work. It won't be nearly as big of a project
as the Tower was, but it will still take time. Right now,
I am going to focus on severeal things in Caemlyn which
Duren wants me to work on first.
Anyways, thanks bunches Brailon, and I will work on grading zone 537 now.
Jai

`7From`6:`7 Jaiden
`7Subj`6:`7 New Project
`7CC`6: `7Brailon Syrah
Brailon, when you log on Builderport you will find that you
have been giving access to a few new zones.
I gave you access to redit in zones 638, and 608.
You can work on the rivers there. Also, if you want to
go throguh in your spare time and name the rooms 'Dense
Forest' 'Forest' "Farmland' 'Road' I will give you 30 Qps per 100 room zone.
They don't have to have descriptions, just the room names
so it will be easier to build without looking at the ubermap
all the time.
I also gave you redit access to 132 and 133, so if you find any
more mislinks, just mail me after you fix them and I will make
sure you are rewarded.
Thanks!
Jai

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Liahm
`7Subj`6:`7 Rhadian's Background.
I'm responding to this mail in two capacities. In my first, as WM Imm
(Parol), I'm concerned by the claims that Rhadian taught himself the use
of arms. Knowing how to throw a punch, not stab yourself with a dagger,
and not trip over a spear is one thing. But actually teaching yourself
to be a highly effective combatant in any of the three methods is unlikely
and not in keeping with our WM policy. You'll have to cut it back to
familiarity with the methods of combat, but no great skill.
In my second capacity, as Asha'man GL, my main concern is the direct
connection to Emond's Field and the possibility that the character may
have (and given his age, almost certainly would have) known the major
book-characters. I would very much prefer Rhadian come from one of the
other Two Rivers towns. A minor point is that Gleemen very rarely came
through the Two Rivers (as demonstrated by the clamor over Thom in Book
1), but you could have learned your rudimentary knowledge of the flute
during your time watching/talking to Gleemen in Caemlyn.
Your description is a slightly more serious concern to me. On MiT we
don't include actions in descriptions, because it that would mean that
you are doing that action every time someone glances at you, and even if
you are tied up or otherwise immobilized. Chopping the last paragraph
from your description (the one with the actions regarding the dagger and
the book) should satisfy that concern.
I'd like to see another background submitted taking these changes into
account, and I'll try to get back to you a great deal sooner this time.
-Liahm/Parol.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Garin
`7Subj`6:`7 Background for new character.
I was told I needed to send you my background for approval,
so I'm sending it now.  It is as follows:
Garin was born in a small village, named Farin, in Altara.
His family was never rich, but they usually had everything
they needed, and he worked that farm for most of his life.
He remembered staring up at the old short sword hanging
from his father's wall every day, wondering why he had it
and immagining all the wonderful adventures he must have
went through.
Shortly after Garin's 16th birthday, he found out when a
man knocked on the door.  He told of a great battle at
Dumai's wells, and how since then a losing battle was
being fought against the invaders who they now knew as
the Seanchan.  They where organizing all of the local
malitia to fight.  His father protested, saying he wasn't
a soldier, and the little fighting he had done had been
against bandits, not trained soldiers.
But the man would not be turned away and his father left
the next day to join the battle against the seanchan,
leaving Garin as the only man on the farm, even though he
had wanted to join his father.  Within months of his
father leaving, a Seanchan army was seen in the distance.
It was obvious what that meant and as the Sul'Dam
searched the village for channelers, both his sister and
his mother where taken.  He stood by and watched, weeping,
for the last of his family was going away.  The soldiers
confiscated his animals and his crops, and he supposed he
was lucky that they didn't claim the land as well.  He
reallized that there was nothing for him anymore and
decided that he had no choice but to try to find a new
life.  He sold what he could, even selling the land to a
neighboring farmer who had somehow managed to come out
well after the Seanchan took the village, and left with
the little money he had, trying to figure out what to do.
After 2 years of traveling and stopping at every village
and farm along the way, trying to find work or at least a
place that the Seanchan hadn't conquered, he finally found
himself in Andor.  Apparently the village hadn't been
conquered by the seanchan, and neither did the rest of
Andor.
He also heard some wonderful news.  The Dragon Reborn was
fighting the Seanchan, they said, and he had made a call for
male channelers to come to the newly formed Black Tower.  He
heard that there where men channeling everywhere, but contrary
to what most would think, they where doing well and not going
mad.  The problem was, those who had made it clear that they
approved didn't know where the Black Tower was, and those who
didn't wheren't the type he was about to ask.
He found himself going from village to village, asking around
about the rumors.  He figured he could go to the Black Tower and
try to learn to channel.  If he couldn't do that, he might be
able to join the City Guard.  He heard that Caemlyn was very
short of City Guards and they would teach him what he needed to
know.
And so he headed to Caemlyn.  On the way, he was stopped by a
bandit who held a sword up and demanded his money.  He was
frightened, but he couldn't afford to give the bandit his money.
He hadn't eaten in days and what he had would have to feed him and
give him lodging in Caemlyn.  As the bandit approached, he found
himself worried, knowing that he would die, but not wanting to!
In a stroke of luck, it seemed, a strike of lightning came down
from the sky, linking onto the man's upraised hand!  The Bandit
died instantly, flung back by the power of the lightning!  The
bandit's sword sat on the ground, not very good in the first place,
and slightly warped from the lightning.  Even though it wasn't the
best weapon, he decided to keep it.  After all, he couldn't count on
luck every time he ran into trouble.  As he reached Caemlyn, he rented
a room for a week with the little money he had.  What little he had
left he used to eat with.  However, even as the food came he felt
himself getting dizzy and sick.  He forced himself to eat, but he found
this to be bad as no sooner had he finished then he wretched it up.
He was carried up to his room, and laid down in the bed, and the
innkeeper sent for the wisdom.  She was busy, but she showed up a few
hours later.  By the time she arrived however, his fever had broken
and he was better, though he complained of a terrible headache.  By
the morning, he was all better and back on track towards finding the
Black Tower
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

male channelers to come to the newly formed Black Tower.  He
heard that there where men channeling everywhere, but contrary
to what most would think, they where doing well and not going
mad.  The problem was, those who had made it clear that they
approved didn't know where the Black Tower was, and those who
didn't wheren't the type he was about to ask.
He found himself going from village to village, asking around
about the rumors.  He figured he could go to the Black Tower and
try to learn to channel.  If he couldn't do that, he might be
able to join the City Guard.  He heard that Caemlyn was very
short of City Guards and they would teach him what he needed to
know.
And so he headed to Caemlyn.  On the way, he was stopped by a
bandit who held a sword up and demanded his money.  He was
frightened, but he couldn't afford to give the bandit his money.
He hadn't eaten in days and what he had would have to feed him and
give him lodging in Caemlyn.  As the bandit approached, he found
himself worried, knowing that he would die, but not wanting to!
In a stroke of luck, it seemed, a strike of lightning came down
from the sky, linking onto the man's upraised hand!  The Bandit
died instantly, flung back by the power of the lightning!  The
bandit's sword sat on the ground, not very good in the first place,
and slightly warped from the lightning.  Even though it wasn't the
best weapon, he decided to keep it.  After all, he couldn't count on
luck every time he ran into trouble.  As he reached Caemlyn, he rented
a room for a week with the little money he had.  What little he had
left he used to eat with.  However, even as the food came he felt
himself getting dizzy and sick.  He forced himself to eat, but he found
this to be bad as no sooner had he finished then he wretched it up.
He was carried up to his room, and laid down in the bed, and the
innkeeper sent for the wisdom.  She was busy, but she showed up a few
hours later.  By the time she arrived however, his fever had broken
and he was better, though he complained of a terrible headache.  By
the morning, he was all better and back on track towards finding the
Black Tower
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Garin
`7Subj`6:`7 Character Background
I was told that I should send my background to you for approval.
Here it is:
Garin was born in a small village, named Farin, in Altara.
His family was never rich, but they usually had everything
they needed, and he worked that farm for most of his life.
He remembered staring up at the old short sword hanging
from his father's wall every day, wondering why he had it
and immagining all the wonderful adventures he must have
went through.
Shortly after Garin's 16th birthday, he found out when a
man knocked on the door.  He told of a great battle at
Dumai's wells, and how since then a losing battle was
being fought against the invaders who they now knew as
the Seanchan.  They where organizing all of the local
malitia to fight.  His father protested, saying he wasn't
a soldier, and the little fighting he had done had been
against bandits, not trained soldiers.
But the man would not be turned away and his father left
the next day to join the battle against the seanchan,
leaving Garin as the only man on the farm, even though he
had wanted to join his father.  Within months of his
father leaving, a Seanchan army was seen in the distance.
It was obvious what that meant and as the Sul'Dam
searched the village for channelers, both his sister and
his mother where taken.  He stood by and watched, weeping,
for the last of his family was going away.  The soldiers
confiscated his animals and his crops, and he supposed he
was lucky that they didn't claim the land as well.  He
reallized that there was nothing for him anymore and
decided that he had no choice but to try to find a new
life.  He sold what he could, even selling the land to a
neighboring farmer who had somehow managed to come out
well after the Seanchan took the village, and left with
the little money he had, trying to figure out what to do.
After 2 years of traveling and stopping at every village
and farm along the way, trying to find work or at least a
place that the Seanchan hadn't conquered, he finally found
himself in Andor.  Apparently the village hadn't been
conquered by the seanchan, and neither did the rest of
Andor.
He also heard some wonderful news.  The Dragon Reborn was
fighting the Seanchan, they said, and he had made a call for
male channelers to come to the newly formed Black Tower.  He
heard that there where men channeling everywhere, but contrary
to what most would think, they where doing well and not going
mad.  The problem was, those who had made it clear that they
approved didn't know where the Black Tower was, and those who
didn't wheren't the type he was about to ask.
He found himself going from village to village, asking around
about the rumors.  He figured he could go to the Black Tower and
try to learn to channel.  If he couldn't do that, he might be
able to join the City Guard.  He heard that Caemlyn was very
short of City Guards and they would teach him what he needed to
know.
And so he headed to Caemlyn.  On the way, he was stopped by a
bandit who held a sword up and demanded his money.  He was
frightened, but he couldn't afford to give the bandit his money.
He hadn't eaten in days and what he had would have to feed him and
give him lodging in Caemlyn.  As the bandit approached, he found
himself worried, knowing that he would die, but not wanting to!
In a stroke of luck, it seemed, a strike of lightning came down
from the sky, linking onto the man's upraised hand!  The Bandit
died instantly, flung back by the power of the lightning!  The
bandit's sword sat on the ground, not very good in the first place,
and slightly warped from the lightning.  Even though it wasn't the
best weapon, he decided to keep it.  After all, he couldn't count on
luck every time he ran into trouble.  As he reached Caemlyn, he rented
a room for a week with the little money he had.  What little he had
left he used to eat with.  However, even as the food came he felt
himself getting dizzy and sick.  He forced himself to eat, but he found
this to be bad as no sooner had he finished then he wretched it up.
He was carried up to his room, and laid down in the bed, and the
innkeeper sent for the wisdom.  She was busy, but she showed up a few
hours later.  By the time she arrived however, his fever had broken
and he was better, though he complained of a terrible headache.  By
the morning, he was all better and back on track towards finding the
Black Tower.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 RP reply

pemote The two women, much different in appearance, are similar in manner and expression while Cam relates what he will.  In some ways it is more than they expected by a fair margin.  For Jenalla, it is a fair bit less than hoped and raises more questions.  Of course, for her, there is more of a relationship as Delaen, accepting of the 'Mayener's' presence and contributions, rarely dealt with him directly and was doing so on the advice and request of her husband.  The seamstress is not much comforted at Cam mentioning infinite resources as that narrows who he is working with quite a bit- assuming he is being truthful though the thought Cam might not be is slow in forming.  In general, despite misgivings, the merchant decides he is working with the Senachan in some form.  It is the safest belief to hold to in the event Cam is not and things go badly for him, and then those he was known to deal with are questioned.  Delaen is speaking while the seamstress is reaching this conclusion, "A noble cause and a pleasure to know your company will be found with some regularity."  Her smile makes it a sincere statement.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 rp reply 3

Time and distance might, but sometimes only if things are thought on and accomodation made.  Other times the past can lie in wait without fading to spring forth inconveniently.  Jenalla makes a show of thinking, settling back somewhat in her chair and the other woman makes no effort to interrupt the moment.  Finally the seamstress smiles and nods, "I can clear out my schedule for this evening."  Then she allows, "Perhaps another chair or two might not be amiss."  She is not thinking of Crysael joining them though the young woman's presence in the tavern could well prove interesting.  Delaen adds, "Karna will be part of the performance."  As in the first experience Cam had with the Grotto, and maybe with the same sense of almost desparate anticipation, the daughter may follow the mother's lead and not have contact until after the performance ends.  Delaen adds, "One more chair then, unless you mind."  Jenalla has already allowed she does not.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp 5

pemote Whether Jenalla is smiling or no, Telen would take her words to heart --which would a failing if he misjudged her-- unless an obvious jest.  "You are always welcome, mistress.  Thank you for the pleasant morning."  Outside her shop still, he accepts his coat and drapes it over the saddle, shifting the horse's lead to loop over his arm and letting his pack's strap fall off his shoulder, from where he turns his hand to hold it.  He takes the bottles and sample canister of chromium from the pack and hands them to the seamstress.  "You have the merchant's name and address if you should like more of the same quality.  The dyes are common to his region.  I am no expert, but he seemed knowledgeable if you have questions about them."
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp 7th

Telen grins at the walk and speech, sifting it through a mental sieve, which unlike many of the sieves spoken of and referring to processes of the mind, is often quite effective.  He chuckles dryly.  "He sounds like a sailor, and maybe one accustomed to dealing with merchants' or nobles' sons.  Or he would if he kept his questions to his self.  Since he did not, he is either quite a curious chap or interested in the wealth of this one."  Telen would not assume anything, and he is certain Brailon will keep the man in mind in the instance they encounter him later, better dressed and clean shaven or somesuch.  "Do you need aught of me? I will ride ahead to my various destinations, to arrive back at the seamstress Oureen's shop at sunset and from there walk to the Grotto."  Or trot.  It depends on whether Jenalla will ride or no. (afk mins)
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp 3

Telen gives his assent clearly, though each time the woman looks for his answer as well as listens for it.  "No, that is all, and you have my thanks."  If there is irony in his eyes, it does not reach his words:  she has his coin, too.  "Forgive the inelegance of this --" he tells her, and shifts the pack so that the open mouth is at the counter.  He explains, "I have no coin pouch with me."  And he sweeps the silver into the mouth of the pack.  There is little sound as the coins fall onto cloth-wrapped bread and then slide further down into the canvas bottom of the pack, faint clinking as they touch one upon the other.  The flap of his pack is buckled and he sets the strap over his shoulder.  "Light's blessing," he tells the woman, nodding to the man behind the counter as he turns to leave.  The guards appear to be practicing statuary so he does not let on that he sees them as he opens the main entrance and walks out.

Telen thanks Jenalla and at first opportunity, asks a server if she will take coin against whatever Jenalla orders, and he points her out if the server does not know the seamstress.  From there, if he has not seen Gust or Karna, which is possible considering the work to be done and Karna's sometime involvement in the performance, he approaches sailors who have been friendlier to him to greet them and ask how was the last journey and if there have been changes, and when he has the chance, how the bilge rats are faring.  He does not join them to sit, saying he has a table on another platform with a lady friend.

`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 save
...long lags still...
(ha, I got that last with  most of the " and all of the ' replaced by ??? --is parsing off??? hehe)

Telen replies that he is well and chuckles at the last comment.  "Four? Does the ship have a resident cat as yet?" Perhaps Jeald has realized a cat or ferret or some other small animal would return more intelligent and thus more rewarding affection.  Perhaps not.  He has his small pack with him, having forgotten for the third time since leaving the seamstress' shop and arriving at the Grotto to transfer coin from the pack to his pockets.  Not all of it, but enough to cover small costs that crop up here and there.  "Is Bilford here? I thought I saw Hanen earlier, but I cannot see him now."  He does not ask about Founder yet, though he hopes the man's whereabouts will be made known eventually.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 rp reply 5

The man has given over trying to decipher all of Cam's thoughts and actions.  Judging the borderlander a good-hearted and honest man with good intentions through careful observation is enough until something suggests a mistake or a change in Cam's behavior.  A small smile forms, eyes carrying subdued humor, "I would not stay with me long either with the seamstress at your table as well as your friend.  If it were any other port, or almost any other night even in this one, I believe you would have had more of a challenge leaving him.  Business is going well.  We have recovered from the cost of repairs to the ship and some more besides.  Trade strengthens as the disruption and uncertainty caused by the invaders passes.  But with that is a loss of income for goods, so we carry more but get somewhat less for the weight hauled."  The Captain's attention had shifted from Cam to look over the common room, pausing at what could be the Baron's table where Crysael is still seated.  Then it returns to Cam, "But I do not think that part interests you so much, not the detail of it."  More subtle humor colors the words as Cam may well be curious to no end about the convoluted realities of making a profit on the seas in uncertain times, "We are doing well and thank you for the curiosity.  How are your fortunes?"

`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 rp reply 5

Jenalla is finding some entertainment talking to the man but his interest is a hair too forward as well as obviously knowing how he has been gifted by the fortune of birth and having some confidence in it opening opportunities.  None of that is unexpected nor uncommon so the seamstress is far from offended, but such things do not help with attraction, or at least not hers.  All the same he is more than a passable dancer so time passes pleasantly.  Crysael, smile remaining in place, replies, "Very good.  It is starting to feel a bit warm in the tavern and a breeze would be most welcome."  Outside it will not take too much time for her to become overly cool but even the variety of change can be appreciated.  The current dance is perhaps halfway through when Crysael asks, "What have you been doing?  Have you been traveling much?  If so, where have you gone?"
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp one

(still using the website connection, afkish much of the morning and afk part of the afternoon) pemote "I have a hope I will see you again soon, even if you are not able to return here in the next two days."  He wants to ask on the necklace he gave her, or tell her to wear it as often as possible, but it may be it is gone already, and it is not that important --not to him.  To him, it is a bit of metal he might attune to his self with Spirit and Earth, though her care of it would be flattering.  Asking if there is somewhat else she carries often would be telling, and so he does not.  Channeling would perhaps alarm Brailon, though the reason is easily discerned.  "Light's blessing, Crysael."  Interest encroaches upon the Void and reason wins without contest.  A display of affection now would be inappropriate while Jenalla is perhaps preparing to leave for home and the baron is about to gather his family for the same.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 rp reply 2

Gust is staring towards the door and standing a bit stiffly while Karna is speaking quietly by his ear, trying to keep him from being concerned.  It is not this night the young man is concerned about, not overly, and not even the time he is in Falme, but the months he is gone.  Gust is fairly sure he could run the man through at need, physically and mentally, and perhaps Karna could as well.  Relaxing slightly the young sailor lets out a breath and smiles at Karna.  Jenalla has spent the last minute wishing the man she has shared much of the night with a good remainder of the night in what is meant to see him on his way.  Eventually it is accepted in the spirit meant, that being grateful for the dance and conversation but without the possibility of more, before she has to resort to blunt speech.  He bows low over her hand and turns away to go and recover an overcoat.  On the way towards the entrance the man stops to see what Jenalla is doing, not with ill intent but curious.  The seamstress is gliding to where Cam is with a comfortable smile, nodding as she comes to a stop, "This has been a wonderful evening.  Thank you."  Apparently guileless she adds, "Is there to be more?"  An eyebrow raised, the handsome man looks over Cam appraisingly, then with a mental shrug begins the walk home.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp four

Telen chuckles.  He tells her, still smiling, "The short answer to that, mistress, is yes! Certainly, they do."  Since Gust and Karna have obligingly drifted closer, he indicates them with a nod, feeling they will know they are included, and must be, for any invitation he implies or extends to the seamstress.  "The players are awake longer than I am each night, and they often gather beside a fire on a outside ledge."  He watches Karna for any clue he should withdraw the invitation he is making.  "I sometimes explore the Grotto's mysteries," which phrase is completely without innuendo, "though I do not expect to do so now that I am no longer employed here."
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 rp fix?

There is no sign of the younger man in the common room though he is close, and if the finder is used, can be guessed to be at the ledge already though the twisting nature of the passages could make it difficult to know the actual location of the ledge from the common room.  From the first time he was on the ledge, there is possibly one of the performers who invited him, one or more of the servers he danced with, or he simply asked.  Going without some kind of invitation or permission is unlike anything the pale man would do.  Even him asking is somewhat out of character so it is most likely there was invitation given.  Karna arches a delicate eyebrow that suggests the statement could be taken as a challenge of sorts.  Still, she has other matters to attend to rather than testing Cam's tolerance of her, bluntly expressed, opinions.  Her expression smoothes with a quiet laugh while Gust is grinning but manages to stay silent and the two move from the tavern's common room.  The seamstress is quiet a moment, considering then allowing, "I do not recall him clearly.  Perhaps when I see the man."  She looks around the common room to see if the young man is present, which is apparently not, then falls in besid Cam.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp 7

pemote Karna has not made an entirely unreasonable assumption.  "Oddly enough, I feel grateful for the work, so I may say I am indebted for it.  Productive work is preferable to make work, in this case running from one place to another in the cold and dark," while images fill the darkness and the cold wars with impetus, "though I will abide a few more minutes."  He does not intend to abrade Gust by the last words, the young man is likely aware of Karna's impatience more than anything else, even if he is not yet ceding to it.  "I will work the morning after I escort the seamstress back to her shop, and if it is a late morning, I will work until late afternoon as well.  If I am able, I will return here for the evening meal, late, and then I will take a room nearer to the center of the city."
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 rp reply 1

Brailon stops, blinks a few times and focuses on Cam with a bland expression for a heartbeat before making a gentle grunt in response to the other man's look, "For whatever I slept, I think it was good.  It may have been a few minutes, here and there."  Not having to worry about boots the young man straightens the rest of his clothing, twisted out of normal positioning, then works to lace his shirt back up.  Squinting out into mists he murmurs, "Almost as if we were among the clouds up here, like this.  Making slow progress with his shirt but not choosing to care about the chill the pale Asha'man looks over the makeshift bedding and forms within, something like bemusement forming, "Light's blessings.  If you brought water, juice or milk, I will be in your debt forever."  He already is, for another reason, much more important.
Will be afk for about an hour.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp 1

Telen replies, "You are welcome.  There is salve for your fingers in the Grotto's hospice, or the stables.  Whichever is more convenient to ask on, they are both a moderate walk from here."  He turns to watch Brailon's coat, what he can see of it under a layer or two of blankets.  "Light's blessing."  If Brailon does not then hand him the bowl, Telen says nothing about it and leaves the ledge to see if the seamstress' door is open or unlocked.  He takes his small pack and coat from his room, looking over the furniture and bedding tidied much earlier in the morning.  All seems in good order.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 rp reply 4

Jenalla gives a small curtsey, "The tea if you please Master Corlaeg."  Taking the cup she joins him along the way to the common room and admits, "I did not expect such quality.  Then, I did not know there were rooms for guests."  Everyone has their own preferences, but for getting away without worry over external disturbance, sleeping in any of the Grotto's rooms would be ideal.  Especially if someone were the type to not worry over time so that the body slept to its own needs instead of those imposed by llight and dark, or responsibility.  The luxury must come at impressive cost though so even if she were able to clear her schedule to allow indulgence, she would not likely be able to do so here.  All of the thought passes in little more than the blink of an eye and is then set aside, "Thank you again.  I forget such a place is so close.  It is very nearly another land altogether."  In many ways it is even farther from the norm of her life than being in another land would be.

Jenalla is finished and places a napkin back on the table beside her plate, standing with thanks as Cam helps her with the chair.  "What happened to his hands?"  They did not seem to be injured in the least not many hours ago and the seamstress had not noticed the consequences of the playing the young man performed.  While listening she moves easily, displaying no soreness or aftereffects of the night before- though some are felt.  The most notable consequence is she will be tired all of the day in a way the woman is unaccustomed to so that her jaws may well be aching by the time the business day is complete from the effort to resist yawns. more appealing, Jon may have the honor of seeing to business as she naps at some time.  There is a small detour as she recovers her own, warm outer layers and then she is ready to accompany him to the stables.

From appearances, it is Owen who is held and would be much more content talking about many other topics, even Telen using the power when it may not be exactly necessary.  There is no real way to go into it in the current setting, something that is good and bad.  After partings are given and Cam returns attention to Jenalla, there is no indication she wishes to wait.  It has been a marvelous escape but now she is beginning to feel the weight of responsibility gain power and her thoughts click along what is to be done this day.  There is also the incentive to work quickly in the event more entertainment may present itself over the next couple of days so that her schedule will allow for it.  Once exposed to the breeze and early morning cold, the seamstress may rethink remaining in the kitchen a bit longer, but not in any serious manner.

`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp four

(afk a while) Telen keeps pace with Jenalla, noting the seamstress is in no way lagging her walk.  The same horse is saddled and bridled with a lead, which Telen accepts with sincere thanks --not that he has given thanks in any other manner-- and wishing the stablehand who is present the Light's blessing.  Since Jenalla has a workday ahead of her and comparatively little sleep, at a guess, Telen does not pause at the stables to converse with folk he knows or would like to know better.  It is a short time from stables to gate, and then he is walking outward of the road where the road is tended and the sides brambles and vines, and then switching to inward when the traffic begs a larger obstacle than Jenalla in her long dress.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 RP reply 4

Fortunately the weaponsmaster's daughter is not the one handing over the bridle or there would be some form of conversation, not that the conversation would necessarily be unfortunate biut the time taken might be.  In the interior of the stables she can be seen in snatches, saddling up another of the horses for whatever purpose.  Her ideal would be for exercising the animal.  The morning is chill but the wind is all but absent, as close as it manages to get this close to the coast and what there is grows less as the pair beginning the gentle descent towards the more typical level of the city of Falme.  Jenalla walks quickly at the beginning as a way to get blood flowing and gain more protection from the breezes, then slowing as the woman assumes Cam will match her pace.  Before getting closer to the city and beginning to meld with traffic, she looks up into a sky that is again all but clear of clouds, only high up, ephemeral striations whose undersides are painted orange from the rising sun.  She wears a small smile of simple enjoyment and appreciation of something her schedule very rarely allows.  This lasts until they dip down into mists not yet gone which brings a greater chill.  With much of the beauty of the morning now beyond the gray layer she turns to conversation, "You are back to your research for the day then, trying to fit in time to meet with Gust?"  Even with the mild dampness and greater chill within the fog the seamstress seems comfortable, walking normally with gaze ahead to see what may need to be avoided.

`7From`6:`7 Telen
`7Subj`6:`7 rp 1

pemote Certainly, all need the Creator's protection, but Telen reserves the statement customarily for a certain genre of folk, not often resembling Jenalla in word or deed or social stature.  He gives the seamstress a bow with a flourish as she retreats into her home and workplace, and then he burdens his mount to ride out of the city to the south, heading toward the cheerier of the healers he will call on today, and perhaps only in the earlier hours of it.  The horse is light on its feet and a good height to bear him without looking like a pony under a scarecrow.  He misses the formidable and easy strength of the almost black, and the banked fire of the razor, but this is an able, pleasant animal.  It's shoes are the same as yesterday, which he expected though fortune could have easily had today or tomorrow be the day the hooves are trimmed and new shoes fitted.  He wonders, idly, how much a finder would have to be altered, physically, to become useless as a finder, of if it always was, down to the smallest parts of it, as in, for example, the iron of the shoe remaining a finder if it were melted down and reformed into a window weight.
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Brailon
`7Subj`6:`7 rp reply 6

The responsive is automatic, "Everyone calls me Pat."  Then she gives Cam a mock, stern glare with her hands on her hips, "Almost everyone."  The next few moments are spent going through the same questions and mild disbelief in his project, the lass appearing somewhat distracted at times, suggesting her thoughts are elsewhere.  She also continues to send glances towards the waiting room- reasonable enough for someone who is typically kept busy with those seeking aid.  When the last of her questions is answered she pauses, looking at Cam while thinking for what is a strangely long period before her original, beaming smile returns, "Very well.  I probably do not have time to do much, but I have someone who works with me who might.  Wait here and I will see."  Without much waiting for any reply she whisks off in a rustle of skirts to the other door from the hospice and is gone for a few minutes during which some sounds of conversation and creaking that might indicate someone walking are barely heard.  The door opens abruptly as Pat breezes back in, smile firmly in place and back in an apparent comfort zone, "There is still the matter of coin, but my assistant is willing to give you the names of what we use and the general purpose of each if that suits you Master?"  Her manner is quick and efficient, seeming ready to usher him into the other room on the instant.

Brailon raises an eyebrow at the name of what he supposes is a tavern or inn, smiling faintly then keeps from thanking the man for giving the offer of a shirt for Corey as it is not his place though gratitude is felt distantly.
