`7From`6:`7 Matylena
`7Subj`6:`7 Overcrowding Issues
Okay, I've been giving things some thought, and here's what
I've been coming up with.  Starting the construction on
Elaida's palace has given me an idea for what to do with all
those extra soldiers.  So here is what Maty is going to do:
The lower floor of the palace will be used as a research center,
as planned.  Research designed to encourage cooperation between
Asha'man and Aes Sedai, and mostly under the supervision of
the Red Ajah, who will be required to make regular reports to
Maty of any progress made.  The upper floors of the palace
will be a Tower.  In the books, it says that Elaida was in
fact planning to make her palace taller than the White Tower
itself.  I'm not going to make a bunch of rooms for that. I'm
just going to make it taller, as in, a tower.  A tower in
which to house hundreds of soldiers.  Maty is going to call it
'The Tower of the Night Watch', and the entire palace will be
dedicated to fighting Tarmon Gai'don.  Maty will attempt to
see if she can rally these soldiers to prepare to fight in
the Last Battle, by giving them a place to stay, and giving
them a name: The Night Watch.  The White Tower will also
support their training, and the Tower of the Night Watch will
have its own kitchens, and its own staff, which can be taken
from any other extra people who have come to Tar Valon with
the rebel army.  The new palace will also have training grounds,
rooms dedicated to specific research, as well as gardens and
such.  It will be within the Tower grounds, and will connect
to the White Tower gardens via an elaborate hedge maze, as well
as regular walkways.
To elaborate more on the soldiers, the Tower portion of the
palace will be their home.  Each floor of the Tower will house
bunks for the soldiers, like a huge barracks on three different
levels.  There will be a dining hall on the second floor, where
both soldiers, and researchers can join together to eat.  The
soldiers' duty will be to protect the research palace from any
unwanted visitors, such as darkfriends or worse.  The purpose
of the Tower itself is to act as a watchtower for any major
threats within or without the city.  The soldiers will keep
that watch, and perhaps be assigned missions to investigate
this or that disturbance that might be shadow-related, with
a number of Aes Sedai as well.  That way, not all of the soldiers
are actually in the Tower at the same time, so those who are not
on some mission, can rotate into the bunks of those soldiers who
are.  I'm not sure exactly how many the Tower will be able to
hold all at one time, but I think it will hold a good many if
the description I am remembering is accurate.  It's supposed to
be a huge building, but within the Tower Grounds.  I think it
will work.  What do you think? :)
Maty
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Matylena
`7Subj`6:`7 Overcrowding Issues
Okay, I've been giving things some thought, and here's what
I've been coming up with.  Starting the construction on
Elaida's palace has given me an idea for what to do with all
those extra soldiers.  So here is what Maty is going to do:
The lower floor of the palace will be used as a research center,
as planned.  Research designed to encourage cooperation between
Asha'man and Aes Sedai, and mostly under the supervision of
the Red Ajah, who will be required to make regular reports to
Maty of any progress made.  The upper floors of the palace
will be a Tower.  In the books, it says that Elaida was in
fact planning to make her palace taller than the White Tower
itself.  I'm not going to make a bunch of rooms for that. I'm
just going to make it taller, as in, a tower.  A tower in
which to house hundreds of soldiers.  Maty is going to call it
'The Tower of the Night Watch', and the entire palace will be
dedicated to fighting Tarmon Gai'don.  Maty will attempt to
see if she can rally these soldiers to prepare to fight in
the Last Battle, by giving them a place to stay, and giving
them a name: The Night Watch.  The White Tower will also
support their training, and the Tower of the Night Watch will
have its own kitchens, and its own staff, which can be taken
from any other extra people who have come to Tar Valon with
the rebel army.  The new palace will also have training grounds,
rooms dedicated to specific research, as well as gardens and
such.  It will be within the Tower grounds, and will connect
to the White Tower gardens via an elaborate hedge maze, as well
as regular walkways.
To elaborate more on the soldiers, the Tower portion of the
palace will be their home.  Each floor of the Tower will house
bunks for the soldiers, like a huge barracks on three different
levels.  There will be a dining hall on the second floor, where
both soldiers, and researchers can join together to eat.  The
soldiers' duty will be to protect the research palace from any
unwanted visitors, such as darkfriends or worse.  The purpose
of the Tower itself is to act as a watchtower for any major
threats within or without the city.  The soldiers will keep
that watch, and perhaps be assigned missions to investigate
this or that disturbance that might be shadow-related, with
a number of Aes Sedai as well.  That way, not all of the soldiers
are actually in the Tower at the same time, so those who are not
on some mission, can rotate into the bunks of those soldiers who
are.  I'm not sure exactly how many the Tower will be able to
hold all at one time, but I think it will hold a good many if
the description I am remembering is accurate.  It's supposed to
be a huge building, but within the Tower Grounds.  I think it
will work.  What do you think? :)
Maty
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Sevristh
`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker Sevristh.  Guilding.
`7CC`6: `7Maelyn Balinor I spoke briefly with Maelyn, and we discussed in brief
joining.  As such, I have prepared a BG with the hopes that it meets your
approval for guilding me as a guest so that we may conduct RP that will
eventually see me into the position of a Warder Trainee.  So here goes, please
note that I'm perfectly willing to amend whatever it is you feel needs
changing.
Born in the Town of Sidon, Sevristh Kigali grew up the only child of relatively
wealthy merchants of Alum.  Their estate, though not lavish or grandiose as
many in Jehannah might be, was quite well known amongst the community, as were
Sevristh parents.  Most of his formative years his father was absent seeing
about the family business, and his mother was preoccupied with many functions
within the town.  After a number of small incidents that revolved around his
naturally mischievous nature his parents had decided to send him to Jehannah
where he could stay with aunt and uncle and their sons.
In Jehannah, his aunt tutored him and his cousins: while his uncle, a bit of a
renowned swordsman in those parts, instructed in the basics of swordsmanship
and martial knowledge.  At the time, having no particularly great interest in
the craft Sevristh often found himself observing the city, and the people, or
spending time out on the River Boern.
Shortly after rumour passed of a great battle in the sky Sevristh made a trip
to Sidon to visit his family, only to find that everything had been burned to
the ground.  Shock paralyzed him at first, and the panic set in as he tore
through the ruins of his birth place.  He found bodies, but nothing he
recognized, and somewhere through the bleak horror of it he found an inner
peace.  He believed that his parents were alive, that perhaps something had
come up that required his parents attentions with the business elsewhere and
that they had escaped this awful scene.
Setting out first to Jehannah to let his extended family know what had
transpired, he then traveled South.  Taking fare aboard a ship he sailed down
the River Eldar to Ebou Dar.  In Ebou Dar he sought connections to his parents
company, sought anyone with any information.  Months past, his money used up,
and still no word of encouragement.  The realities of his situation forced him
to find a job in simple labour.  Anything that could be done to earn a few
extra coppers that he could save to help in his search.
Word of the Dragonsworn tearing apart Ghealdan eventually made its way to
Sevristh ears, and after so much work without results he decided to return to
Jehannah and be with his cousins and their parents.  Getting a spot on a ship
headed North up the Eldar he was once again sailing.  The ship docked in So
Harbor, the captain unwilling to travel further North once hearing more news
there, and so Sevristh was stuck for the moment.  Upon taking room and board at
the Golden Barge, a local inn, he was surprised to have ran into his cousins
who themselves had been traveling South.  Drink and dice were had, as his
cousins relayed the events of the Dragonsworn, of the King and his hunting
accident.  Sevristh eventually learns of the fate of his extended family at the
hands of the Dragonsworn, of his uncle falling in with them, and of his aunt
who simply vanished.  Soon after his cousins made for Ebou Dar, hoping they
might find Sevristh there.
After a few days Sevristh and his two cousins chose to stay in So Harbor,
finding wages working for local grain merchants and simple and inexpensive
rooming.  That is until, one day a group of armed men on horses came to the
town.  One of the men bore a top knot, much in the Shienarian fashion, and
another seemed like a smooth talking Andoran.  These men spoke of soldiering,
of working under the finest general in all the lands.  Sevristh cousins were
eager to join, they wanted to strike back at the Dragonsworn, they wanted
adventure, and they wanted to move on from hauling grain.  Soon enough they
were recruited to follow Gareth Bryne and his soldiers under the control of the
rebel Aes Sedai.
It was here, that Sevristh really learned the basics of soldiering, the
requirements of the physical labour, and the discipline involved.  And so, like
many other men, he found himself on the move with this great host, all the way
to Tar Valon.  It was here, amongst these men, that he heard the stories of the
world beyond his small life.  It was here, that he first glimpsed an Aes Sedai,
or so at least he believes, and though he was not close to her, he thought only
an Aes Sedai would ride such a fine horse in such clothing with so many
soldiers about her and the Lord Gareth Bryne in her company

`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Runen's Request
I made you trust 98 on BP, so you should be able to edit
any zone you want.  If you do get permission errors, just grant yourself
access to the zone using the 'olc' command:
olc grant <player> <zone> <type> <level>
For now, the 'level' is always 2, we haven't coded other levels yet.
You can also grant other builders zone access as needed.
-Duren

`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Your NPCs
Sorry, I was mostly afk.  You need to edit the zones in the rooms
you want your mobs to load, so that they will load automatically.
Just type zedit in the room you want the mob to automatically load
in, then choose the 'New Command' option.  After that, choose the
'load mob to room' option.  Enter the vnum of the mob when asked.
How many should exist in the game?  1.  How many should load in
the room?  1.  Save.  If there are already other commands, you
might have to answer a question of 'Is this command dependant on
previous commands?"  Just say no.  Hope this helps.  That's why
your mobs don't show.  If the zone is copied over or the mud crashes,
your mobs will not remain unless you edit the zone as explained
above.  Then they will automatically reload when the zone resets.
That's why I gave you access to edit the Caemlyn zones. :)
If you have any questions, just ask!
Ayasha
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Your NPCs
Sorry, I was mostly afk.  You need to edit the zones in the rooms
you want your mobs to load, so that they will load automatically.
Just type zedit in the room you want the mob to automatically load
in, then choose the 'New Command' option.  After that, choose the
'load mob to room' option.  Enter the vnum of the mob when asked.
How many should exist in the game?  1.  How many should load in
the room?  1.  Save.  If there are already other commands, you
might have to answer a question of 'Is this command dependant on
previous commands?"  Just say no.  Hope this helps.  That's why
your mobs don't show.  If the zone is copied over or the mud crashes,
your mobs will not remain unless you edit the zone as explained
above.  Then they will automatically reload when the zone resets.
That's why I gave you access to edit the Caemlyn zones. :)
If you have any questions, just ask!
Ayasha

`7From`6:`7 Allec
`7Subj`6:`7 Building standards
`7CC`6: `7Duren Ayasha
Greetings, I'm going to try and get into some building while I have the
time. That being said, I was looking at starting to flesh out the
ubermap a bit. Assigning names, room-types, etc. and then starting to
add descriptions. So far, have there been any standards set for room
naming conventions or descriptions, as well as room types? For instance,
when coloring room names, do you want simple colors or something more
flashy. I generally prefer one color per word and no more than one or
two colors per room name, but that's just me. I've seen both as I've
walked around, and just wanted to know if there was an established
standard.
Also, as far as room types go, do we want rivers to be swimable or
non-swimable? Or should there be a variation of both? Has there been
any insight in the ubermap as to which is which? Right now I could
build them all one way, and just change them individually as it's decided
which rooms should be which. However, are most going to be swim or no swim?
I know mobprogs are probably a higher priority right now, but fleshing
out the map seems like it will fit into my schedule a bit better. I hope
to come on and add descriptions a few rooms at a time as I'm able. I figure
if I can even knock out 3-5 rooms a night, in addition to adding room names
to zones around that map, that would at least be some help.
Thanks,
James aka Allec

`7From`6:`7 Maelyn
`7Subj`6:`7 RE OOC Aes Sedai
First thing you need is a background. Write it up and either send it by mudmail to me,
or you can send it to my email address:
maelynsedai@gmail.com
Have you played an Aes Sedai before? If not, you'll need to start as a Novice and go through the lessons.
If you have, then let me know what experience you have so I can place you where you should be.
I am normally around on the weekends (I have Friday and Saturday off of work) but
if you need me, best thing to do is send me an email letting me know when you're
available, then I can try to be here when you are.
Right now, I just replaced my harddrive, and I am having trouble getting my client
reinstalled (I am connecting right now through the website) so I'm having a ittle trouble being here regularly.
I should have that straight soon, though.
Welcome!
Mae

`7From`6:`7 Lydandria
`7Subj`6:`7 Sorry! and...
I'd like to appologize for not being around for a little while.  Going
through a Navy hell-like school.  Things are a -little- hectic at times.
About my background.  I was wondering if there was an active (semi-active)
sister of the green ajah that I might be able to use in my idea (which might
need some corrections or help).  Here's the jist of it, though
Lydandria was born in Fal Dara, to a fairly well-to-do family.  Her father
was a warrior, and her mother a seamstress.  Her childhood was spent getting
scolded because of her tendency to climb trees, play with sticks, throw rocks
and other "boy-like" games, at least until her mother forced her into the hands
of a nanny.
Mistress al'Mairan was strict, but kind, and taught Lydandria how to behave as a
proper woman.  Instead of climbing trees, she learned history.  Instead of playing
at combat with sticks, she was taught sewing.  And last and most tradgic (in her
eyes) her stone-throwing days were replaced with dancing and etiquette.
Not too long after the raid on Fal Dara keep, Lydandria's ability to channel was
discovered by a visiting Aes Sedai.  By now, Lydandria was extatic to do anything
that did not involve stitching, or learning about a new spoon (though she would
never admit it to Mistress al'Mairan, she had grown to love reading and learning
about history).  Her parents were proud to learn that their daughter might one
day learn to Channel and become an Aes Sedai
So, with much assistance (and a bit of good-natured grumbling from her nanny)
she began to pack what little she would need as a Novice in the White Tower.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Leara
`7Subj`6:`7 State of the Aiel Guild
Ok..hereiswhatIproposefortheAielGuild.
The main group of Aiel have returned to the Three-Fold Land.
However, Wise Ones can travel now, and this should not impede
excursions into the Wetlands because I do not believe in
sealing all of the Aiel off and not being able to RP with
the rest of the MUD.
I would like to set up a camp outside of Andor that is not
generally known about. Possibly a few hundred spears living
somewhere between Caemlyn and Alindaer. This would be the
spot that Wise Ones would gate back and forth from, giving
them a base in which to return should the Dragon Reborn need
them again in the Wetlands.
Ill need to build a small Three-fold Land. Ill leave it
unconnected for the time being, just a few RPable rooms..
a Wise Ones tent, a Sweat Tent, and one hold.. Just until
I have the time to build a larger Waste.
The Shaido are in Ghaeldan. I would like for any Aiel to
be able to NPC a Shaido should the need arise. The Shaido
are raping and pillaging Ghaeldan, picking fights with
Whitecloaks, but I don't see the need for any PCs to create
Shaido alts for the time being. However, I would like to
use them as an RP tool and the reason that a small camp has
been left behind in Andor should the need arise to return
and combat them.
I just wanted to run all of this by you so you could ok it
all. Hopefully Haile will return and Ill be able to RP with
her in the coming days.
Leara

`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Test
`6Welcome to A Moment in Tyme!  After a long hiatus, and with the long-
awaited completion of `#A M`3emory of `#L`3ight`6, we appear to be making a big
comeback.  We are in the process of resetting the timeline.  There is
some work to be done, but we welcome any help from anyone willing to
bring Tyme back to life!
`&Update`6:  A Moment in Tyme is currently undergoing a Timeline
Overhaul.  Spoiler Alert: `&This means that we are starting
from scratch at the end of Winter's Heart`6.  From there, A Moment
in Tyme will be a mirror world, where we write our own story.  Character
backgrounds will need to be re-written to exclude much of what has gone
before in the game, though original character concepts and backgrounds
can be worked into the new timeline.  `!Weaponmastery and Channeling
Mastery are a thing of the past.`6  The Imms are currently in the process
of reviewing the policies of the game.  Player input is welcome and
encouraged.  We have new guild leaders for Band of the Red Hand, the
Black Tower, Wolfkin, Children of the Light and Council.  There are still
guild leader spots to be filled.
`&Code and Building`6:  We need help with the code, and with building.
We will have a new turn-based combat system, auto-quests for quest
points, and a large Ubermap to explore, with all kinds of secrets
to uncover.  Tyme is currently an evolving work in progress, and RP
is going to be our major means of earning experience and levels until
the combat code is in. Volunteers to help are appreciated!
A current list of code/OOC updates is available under "`6help mitupdate`7".
IC updates and rumors are posted under "`6updates`7".
Visit our webpage at `6http://www.tymemud.com`7
Type "`2help newbie`7" for an essential index to help.
Type "`2timeline`7" for an overview of recent events.
Type "`2recall`7" at any time to return to Caemlyn.
Type "`2help cairhien`7" or "`2help caemlyn`7" for directions.
Vote for us at:
`2http://www.tymemud.com`7
`3Our condolences go out to the friends and family of `&R`7obert `&J`7ordan`3, who
passed away on September 16, 2007.  Without him, Tyme would not exist, and
we thank him for all of the memories that he has given us over the years.
Rest in peace, Robert Jordan.  You will be missed.  We also thank `#Brandon
Sanderson`3 for completing the books for the fans of a much beloved series.`7
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

to previous timelines, and perhaps get it a little less spammy.  I am going to
leave all the stuff about the new code, and the ubermap and stuff alone.  But
things like proj show 17.  Weather update.  That was like... 2 timelines ago. :P I

know if there is a way they can be removed.  Thanks! :)
Ayasha

By the way, not sure how much you all ready know....
We have, actually, 4 guild tags. TT is for everyone connected including
guests and nonmembers seeking membership
WT is for those who are guilded only, no guests or ambassadors and such
WD is Warders
AS is Aes Sedai
Each tag has its own glboard and such
Policies and syllabus listing are on the boards
Read, decide what we need to update, let me know.
Thanks!
Oh, to clarify - any guilded male is in WD, but AS is only for those raised to the shawl
This was to help us when needing to discuss the progress of Novices and Accepted

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Nedjma
`7Subj`6:`7 Growing Up
Growing Up
While her mother's roof was in Shiagi Hold proper, Nedjma spent much of her childhood
accompanying her father, who guided caravan merchants through the Three-Fold Land.  She
enjoyed life on the road, the constantly changing scenery andcompany, the long quiet walks
home with her father, and the deadly, still beauty of her home.  He taught her much about
the resilient plants and creatures that live in the TFL.
Always At Home
Eyes on the Horizon
Getting Started
Nedjma's first trip to Rhuidean was a horrifying experience, as it is for so many apprentice
Wise Ones and Clan Chiefs, but she recovered and, in fact, redoubled her efforts at learning
the ways of the Wise Ones to help her people be strong enough to survive the coming era of
prophecy.  Her second was much worse.  Visions of an inhabited Rhuidean consumed in flame,
friends and a husband and children lost in the smoke, and the choking stench of death visit
her dreams even all these decades later.
Building Strength for Tomorrow
Haunted by the Future
The Crisis
Nedjma has been married twice, both deceased, and given birth to seven children.  Neither of
her husbands  were in her vision from Rhuidean.  However, shortly after leaving the
Three-Fold Land to follow the Car'a'Carn, she saw a man briefly in Cairhien, just a face in
the crowd, who was - and he was not Aiel.  Only years of discipline allowed her to master
the impulse to lift her skirts and run without stopping until she recrossed the Spine.
Nevertheless, she has several times sought him out in Tel'aran'rhiod without success.
Hiding from another Husband
Life is What it Is
On Your Own
Nedjma has traveled to Caemlyn with a large contingent of Aiel to assist Elayne Trakand
cement her hold on the throne.  It seemed important to the Car'a'carn, and Nedjma quietly
enjoys the idea of Rand having a roof-mistress to come back to.  She has made friendly
acquainance with the local herbalists to learn about local plants and animals.  While
initially excited by snow, the endless Winter has begun to weigh heavily on her, and
exacerbated her homesickness.
Makes Friends with Strangers
Tired of Water
Description (minus color codes)
Standing straight and tall, Nedjma is a beautiful woman.  Her thick crimson hair cascades
down her back in waves and curls to the tips of her shoulder blades, with a shock of white
just left of her part-line.  Her tan face is marked by laugh lines at the corners of her
twinkling green eyes and her full, coral lips.  Silver hoop earrings dangle from her
earlobes.
Nedjma is 5'10" tall and is dressed in the typical garb of an Aiel woman. Her algode blouse
is open just slightly at the collar to all the hollow of her throat to show.  A dark brown
skirt, cinched with a colorful sash, falls to her ankles and rustles softly as she walks.
Soft leather boots peak out from beneath th ehem.
Her writsts are adorned with various gold and silver bracelets that clink together pleasantly
Her writsts are adorned with various gold and silver bracelets that clink together pleasantly
when she moves, and a beautiful silver righ set with amethyst adorns her right ring finger.

`7From`6:`7 Heathe
`7Subj`6:`7 BG for Heathe Maerran

Heathe was born in Arafel, summer and winter on the farm, spring and fall in the city of Fal Moran with various relatives.  At the age of two, fourteen summers to the southern folk, his parents, he and his brother and two sisters leave their farm to settle in Far Madding.  There is no longer a farm, only the city and beyond it the grassy plains and gently rolling countryside with its winding rivers.  The reasons for their relocation can only be guessed by the children, and for three years, they make the transition from borderland to southern civilization, and from youth to young adult.

Far Madding is nowhere he wants to be at seventeen, Heathe is excited by the thought of seeing the world, maybe as far away as Tar Valon, or even Arafel, though he ends up traveling north and west, misjudging his coin and stalling in Whitebridge, stuck there for months after several more attempts to gain employ eastward.  From helpful souls in Whitebridge he learns that there is always work in Baerlon and, tempted by the wages mentioned, he reverses direction and once more goes west.  At nineteen years of age, he stands behind a cart filled with iron ore, his canvas smock saturated with fine black powder:  iron dust intermingled with rock powder from the adjacent quarry.

It is hard work, but the pay is more than what he expected from the gossip in Whitebridge.  He assumed then that the wages were an exaggeration, but it was about right, and he is able save some for another attempt at migration east.  The world is changing in leaps and bounds to hear the news, though the news itself comes in as fast as it ever did --not very-- and just as accurately, also not very.  He tries to filter through it and act as though most of it has to be untrue, though Light blast him for a gullible fool, he does believe it.  Traveling east becomes more and less appealing.  He continues to save his coin, shares a room with a friend, then with several friends.  Restlessness makes him miserly one minute, to save enough to leave earlier, and careless the next, wasting coin because of intolerable boredom.  He passes up several opportunities to work his way east as a guard or servant.  He looks the part but isnt qualified with his minimal weapons training, and he hasnt been able to picture himself polishing boots, scraping pots and doing laundry.  It doesnt take him long to decide he isnt going to pretend to know skills he doesnt have.

His friends, the few he keeps, soak up his extra coin one evening that turns into early morning, and he wakes up in an upstairs room at an inn, aching in several places with no idea why and missing a few things.  His boots, the boots he needs to work in the mines, are gone.  He paid good coin for those.  His head is splitting open agony, and his mouth is dry, gritty and tastes bad.  The corner of one side of his mouth twinges, and there is an immediate coppery trickle to explore gingerly with rough fingers.

He discovers he is on the other side of town than his rented space, and it is a long walk back on streets that are basically channels of churned up mud, almost always crowded with men and beasts.  He loses his footing several times to avoid hooves nearly the size of his head stepping too close to his unprotected feet.  Oxen and draft horses both haul wagons piled with bars of steel and lesser metals, the beasts barely straining, thick muscles shaking under healthy hides as they plod steadily forward.

The rest of his belongings he sees before he enters the front door of his house.  They are scattered across the ground, half in the grassy plot next to the steps and half in the mud of a narrow side street, which is cobbled high but muddied many times over by tracks off of the main streets.

He feels too sick to be angry, and his cursing is half-hearted.  He opens the door to go into the house and begins to ask what--? when his friends fist meets his face, knocking him back to stumble down the stairs and wobble another step further from the house, only to slip in the mud and land solidly on his back.  Very painful.  Not going to do that again.  He rolls to his side and blinks back tears.  Light burn them, is his first thought, and then since he is not a completely unreasonable young man, he thinks, what did I do? He hauls himself back on his feet and stares down at the few things he can claim.  A month of work would pay for new, but he needs boots now, for work this afternoon.  Burn them.  Burn me.  He walks out into the mud again and procures coin he has placed in a moneylenders keeping.  He buys boots.  He goes to work, and he tries again to save, full of self pity and too weak for a full tenday to try and salvage friendships.
He gives the rumors and gossip a much closer consideration.  To fi
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Heathe
`7Subj`6:`7 BG for Heathe Maerran

Heathe was born in Arafel, summer and winter on the farm, spring and fall in the city of Fal Moran with various relatives.  At the age of two, fourteen summers to the southern folk, his parents, he and his brother and two sisters leave their farm to settle in Far Madding.  There is no longer a farm, only the city and beyond it the grassy plains and gently rolling countryside with its winding rivers.  The reasons for their relocation can only be guessed by the children, and for three years, they make the transition from borderland to southern civilization, and from youth to young adult.

Far Madding is nowhere he wants to be at seventeen, Heathe is excited by the thought of seeing the world, maybe as far away as Tar Valon, or even Arafel, though he ends up traveling north and west, misjudging his coin and stalling in Whitebridge, stuck there for months after several more attempts to gain employ eastward.  From helpful souls in Whitebridge he learns that there is always work in Baerlon and, tempted by the wages mentioned, he reverses direction and once more goes west.  At nineteen years of age, he stands behind a cart filled with iron ore, his canvas smock saturated with fine black powder:  iron dust intermingled with rock powder from the adjacent quarry.

It is hard work, but the pay is more than what he expected from the gossip in Whitebridge.  He assumed then that the wages were an exaggeration, but it was about right, and he is able save some for another attempt at migration east.  The world is changing in leaps and bounds to hear the news, though the news itself comes in as fast as it ever did --not very-- and just as accurately, also not very.  He tries to filter through it and act as though most of it has to be untrue, though Light blast him for a gullible fool, he does believe it.  Traveling east becomes more and less appealing.  He continues to save his coin, shares a room with a friend, then with several friends.  Restlessness makes him miserly one minute, to save enough to leave earlier, and careless the next, wasting coin because of intolerable boredom.  He passes up several opportunities to work his way east as a guard or servant.  He looks the part but isnt qualified with his minimal weapons training, and he hasnt been able to picture himself polishing boots, scraping pots and doing laundry.  It doesnt take him long to decide he isnt going to pretend to know skills he doesnt have.

His friends, the few he keeps, soak up his extra coin one evening that turns into early morning, and he wakes up in an upstairs room at an inn, aching in several places with no idea why and missing a few things.  His boots, the boots he needs to work in the mines, are gone.  He paid good coin for those.  His head is splitting open agony, and his mouth is dry, gritty and tastes bad.  The corner of one side of his mouth twinges, and there is an immediate coppery trickle to explore gingerly with rough fingers.

He discovers he is on the other side of town than his rented space, and it is a long walk back on streets that are basically channels of churned up mud, almost always crowded with men and beasts.  He loses his footing several times to avoid hooves nearly the size of his head stepping too close to his unprotected feet.  Oxen and draft horses both haul wagons piled with bars of steel and lesser metals, the beasts barely straining, thick muscles shaking under healthy hides as they plod steadily forward.

The rest of his belongings he sees before he enters the front door of his house.  They are scattered across the ground, half in the grassy plot next to the steps and half in the mud of a narrow side street, which is cobbled high but muddied many times over by tracks off of the main streets.

He feels too sick to be angry, and his cursing is half-hearted.  He opens the door to go into the house and begins to ask what--? when his friends fist meets his face, knocking him back to stumble down the stairs and wobble another step further from the house, only to slip in the mud and land solidly on his back.  Very painful.  Not going to do that again.  He rolls to his side and blinks back tears.  Light burn them, is his first thought, and then since he is not a completely unreasonable young man, he thinks, what did I do? He hauls himself back on his feet and stares down at the few things he can claim.  A month of work would pay for new, but he needs boots now, for work this afternoon.  Burn them.  Burn me.  He walks out into the mud again and procures coin he has placed in a moneylenders keeping.  He buys boots.  He goes to work, and he tries again to save, full of self pity and too weak for a full tenday to try and salvage friendships.
He gives the rumors and gossip a much closer consideration.  To fi

`7From`6:`7 Rayenia
`7Subj`6:`7 rayna's dress desc
http://i1343.photobucket.com/albums/o783/tribalbutterfly76/raynaasahunterinred_zps691dfb96.png

Before you stands a woman just an inch or so above average height. Raven black tresses, as though richly dyed threads of midnight, tumble in lush disarray across her slender soulders.  Eyes blue as the sea setting gently within a face that carries both slender enchantment as well as the dulcet charm of a woman.  Reaching further down her graceful figure provides the watcher an ample view of a dynamic and youthful form while displaying hints of her manner.  She wears a gown of rich, bordeaux with a slightly scooping neckline, discreetly hinting at the prominent slopes of her sonsie figure.  Encircling her hips is a delicate linked-chain belt, adding accept over her long and flowing skirts which completely cover tips of her toes.  The sleeves of her gown are fitted, a diaphinous second sleeve falls over her arms from the shoulders acting almost like a split cape.

column7: rayna cormrael bg and desc for Hunters

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Rayna
`7Subj`6:`7 rayna cormrael bg and desc for Hunters
Rayna Cormrael Rayna is the youngest member of her family.  In Saldaea the
family business Ice Peppers.  Her family had a large farm, no plantation would
be a better word, dedicated to Ice Peppers.  They also grew grains to feed
their livestock and any remaining grains would be sold in the capital.  While
her family was not Nobility, they were quite well off as the Ice Pepper trade
is quite lucritive.  As her mother and father grew too old to handle the daily
tasks of ensuring the crops were cared for properly her eldest brother,
Michael, has taken over the position.  This is fine by her, she's not able to
grow a marigold.  Something about a brown thumb.  She talked with her family at
great length and after months of negotiation, and a little disinformation,
Rayna finally convinced them to let her travel.  She had to learn the basics of
the sword, she knew how to use knives but swords require a little more
dedication.  If she has to, she can use it.  She left with money and the
information of what the plantation produced, she did fib a bit to say that
perhaps she could get the nations to the south to perhaps purchase the
delicious peppers.  She made her way south, to Illian where she prayed she'd
not be too late for the swearing in of the Hunters of the Horn.
Descs: http://i1343.  Photobucket.
Com/albums/o783/tribalbutterfly76/raynaasahunterinred_zps691dfb96.  Png Before
you stands a woman just an inch or so above average height.  Raven black
tresses, as though richly dyed threads of midnight, tumble in lush disarray
across her slender soulders.  Eyes blue as the sea setting gently within a face
that carries both slender enchantment as well as the dulcet charm of a woman.
Reaching further down her graceful figure provides the watcher an ample view of
a dynamic and youthful form while displaying hints of her manner.  She wears a
gown of rich bordeaux with a slightly scooping neckline, discreetly hinting at
the prominent slopes of her sonsie figure.  Encircling her hips is a delicate
linked-chain belt, adding accent over her long and flowing skirts which
completely cover tips of her toes.  The sleeves of her gown are fitted, a
diaphinous second sleeve falls over her arms from the shoulders acting almost
like a split cape.  Before you stands a woman just an inch or so above average
height.  Raven black tresses, as though richly dyed threads of midnight, tumble
in lush disarray across her slender soulders.  Eyes blue as the sea setting
gently within a face that carries both slender enchantment as well as the
dulcet charm of a woman.  Reaching further down her graceful figure provides
the watcher an ample view of a dynamic and youthful form while displaying hints
of her manner.  Her attire is far more funtional than fashionable.  A black
blouse peeks out from beneath a bordeaux surcoat, detailed with embroidery.
Encircling her hips is a delicate linked-chain belt, adding accent to the
fitted breeches, matching the shae the blouse, cover her legs.  Upon her feet
is a pair of knee-high soft leather boots.
If you like I can email these to you.
Rayna/Rayenia

Ayasha,
I just wanted to send a mudmail with some ideas for my background, and hopefully some ideas for the future for the wolfkin and myself (as Miniver).

My first question, is a long time ago I got approved, to play ta'varen (or however you spell it, don't have my books with me right now) and more or less, connected to the horn (reborn hero type thing, again, i'm still working on my homework and trying to get back in the lingo).  The storyline was more or less a decision of which side to fight on, which could even lead to betraying the wolves.  A sword was involved, but I can't remember much about that.  if i can find some of my old rp logs, it can be useful heh.

Anyway, would like to still RP along the same lines, that there is a choice for Miniver to make.  I'm not sure if Ruth (lironah) has talked to you about her plans for Miniver and the WK (and tainted wolves) but that comes into play there.
Now I feel like I'm rambling, and prolly should write down what I want to write when I'm thinking about it at work heh.  sorry.
Crap, forgot the rest. anyway, sorry for bothering.
Miniver

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Ta'veren
Hello there,
I got your mudmail regarding ta'veren.  Here are my thoughts:
1.  There are already three ta'veren in the world: Rand, Mat and Perrin.  They
are very closely linked to one another.  I'm not saying players can't be maybe
lesser ta'veren with a role to play, however, this is a very, very rare thing
and we are not handing this talent out lightly.
2.  You also play Perrin.  I am reluctant to see you playing two ta'veren, when
we will be giving these out so lightly to begin with.  Additionally, ta'veren
tend to be tied to one another in the Pattern from what we've seen in the
books, and that might conflict with your alt.  :/
3.  Lastly, regarding being tied to the Horn: If you mean you might be one of
the Heroes of the Horn, reincarnated in this Age, I don't think that would work
with what we know of the books.  The Heroes are all in Tel'aran'rhiod, like
Birgitte, right now, waiting to be reborn.  Until the Horn is blown, they are
needed in tel'aran'rhiod.
So, those points being made, I would like to work with you if you would like
your background to be special.  But your mudmail was kind of vague on what his
background used to be, exactly, and how he has a choice to make, and what it
has to do with betraying the wolves.  If you like, I can help you come up with
something that will be comparable to what you are asking, but given what we
know of the books now compared to when you were approved for those things, I am
not certain it would work.
If you could, is it possible to send me Miniver's background?  Then I will have
a better understanding of what you're asking.  Meanwhile, I'll talk stuff over
with Rissa and see if we can come up with any ideas that might work to replace
these things for the new timeline, without changing Miniver's character
overall.
Does that sound fair?  Let me know, and if you can, please send me your BG.
Aya

Tower as well.  Before the window, sitting on a dainty pedestal is a
small potted `3f`2e`@r`2n`7, it's `@l`2ea`@f`2y `3v`2i`3n`@e`2s`7 reaching ever onward towards the
floor.  Beside the window, as if company to the `3f`2e`@r`2n`7, stands an `3easle`7.
A `&l`!a`1c`3q`7u`3e`1r`!e`&d `3m`1a`!p`1l`3e`8-`3w`1oo`3d`7 desk sits squarely in the middle of the eastern
wall.  High `3shelves`7, at least eight high, line the walls on either side
of the desk.  A `3painting`7 hangs above the desk silently.  Positioned
against the western wall is a canopy bed of `&l`!a`1c`3q`7u`3e`1r`!e`&d `3m`1a`!p`1l`3e`7.  The bed
is hidden by a m`&i`7st of d`&ia`7ph`&i`7n`&ou`7s w`&hit`7e cloth.  The m`&i`7st is parted on
one side by a l`&a`7cey `8black`7 r`8i`7bbon giving a peek to the delicate pillows
and w`&hit`7e l`&a`7ce`8-`7overl`&a`7id comforter set.  On the southern wall, near the
door, stands an `3armoire`7.  Beside the armoire sits a vanity with a large
m`&i`7rr`&o`7r.  A `8s`7i`&lv`7e`8r`7 handled comb and brush set `8g`7l`&i`^s`&t`7e`8n`7 silently beside a
dainty `&j`7e`8w`7e`&l`7r`8y`7 box.  Hanging on either side of the vanity mirror are
two paintings, one of a `3couple`7 and the other of her `3Warder`7.
shelves

The subjects of the `6books`7 vary from `8politics`7 and `4laws`7 of different
nations, to `^Prophecies`7.  There are `6books`7 on `#Healing`7 and other uses of
the `5Power`7 as well as a few on `2war`7 and `1Artur Hawking`7.  Even a few `6books`7
for recreational reading.  Each subject is arranged into it's own section,
giving order to what could have been a very chaotic place.
armoire
Standing near to six feet in height is this `&l`!a`1c`3q`7u`3e`1r`!e`&d `3m`1a`!p`1l`3e`8-`3w`1oo`3d`7
`3armoire`7.  Holding within it's protective depths, should one explore
within, are dresses and gowns in all shades of `2g`@r`2e`7e`2n`7 and `4b`*l`^u`6e`7.  W`&hit`7e
l`&a`7cey scarves hang upon pegs just inside the door.  Soft boots and
slippers line the bottom, giving an array of complete ensembles for
any and all occasions.
warder
Relaxing easily in comfortable, forest-green upholstered chair, the
broad shouldered Kandori man in question has a languid presence of a
lounging wolf.  `3B`1r`3on`1z`3e`7 and `3e`2ar`3th`2e`3n`7 tinged eyes look out from behind an
angular, ruggedly handsome face.  His unfettered, straight `#d`3u`#ne`7 blonde
lengths fall past is shoulders with an intricate braid over his right
ear.  His chest is covered with a fine w`&hit`7e linen tunic which is
unlaced at the neck.  The tunic is paired with an overlapping `8black
vest`7.  A pair of `8dark`7, form-fitting breeches reach into a pair of `8hard
leather boots`7 which are turned down at the ankle.  Propped against the
arm of the chair are two scabbards, one shorter than the other.  In his
hand he holds an open `6book`7 palmed along the spine.  There is a `3pl`#a`3q`#ue`7
along the bottom of the frame, it reads: `&Valaur Brys Trensieni`7.
easle
Several rows of finished and half-finished paintings lean against the
wall.  Some are frightful images in `4dark tones`7 - `8shadowspawn`7 and other
`8n`4i`8ghtm`4a`8r`4i`8sh`7 scenes - while others are of the view right outside the
window or along the vast pathways of `&Tar Valon`7.  A few of the faces are
recognizable, most likely all of those featured in the paintings the
artist knows.  Jars of `1p`2a`3i`4n`5t`7 are neatly lined up near the stack against
the wall.  This stack of paintings seem to hold company with the `3easle`7
and it's current showpiece, the `3f`2e`@r`2n`7.
couple
This painting is of a well dressed Lugardian `3couple`7.  The man has
short `8d`3a`8rk hair`7, broad shoulders and `8d`4a`8rk eyes`7.  He is dressed in
`8dark colors`7 with l`&a`7ce at the cuff and neck.  The woman has `3a`1ub`3u`1r`3n`7 hair
and `2green eyes`7 with slender frame.  She is wearing a modest `2green dress`7
with l`&a`7ce at the neck and cuff.  They both appear to be in their mid-
twenties.  The background is faded and somewhat indistinguishable for
the painting itself has faded and turned `3y`7e`3ll`7o`3w`7 with age.... more than
twenty years from the condition of it.  A small `3g`#o`3ld`#e`3n`7 plaque at the
botto

`7From`6:`7 Rissa
`7Subj`6:`7 Immly issues
`7CC`6: `7Anazail Jaiden Duren Ayasha
Couple things I'd like to put on the table to be solved over the next little while as we work to bring code back and get everything in line:
`!1) `1Code vs RP exp.`7
When code comes back in and exp can be awarded for killing mobs, how will that exp be awarded vs how RP exp will be awarded?

On our drive back from Austin, the three of us talked about several different options, including bringing back the separation of code and RP levels.  The main crux was that code levels could be balanced to effectively eliminate the arbitrary assignment of 100 OCS, giving us the ability to make flowstrengths a scale of 1-100 (rather than a 'high' flowstrength being around 40 like right now).  Whether or not exp is all one system for code and RP or if they're split between code and RP levels, the question remains of how to balance RP exp gain with code exp gain, both overall (i.e., does RP award 100exp per emote and code awards 10exp per mob) and as a composite (i.e., how much RP exp = how much code exp *per emote*).

Anazail could explain it better because he has a better grasp on the math and a better idea how to balance code and RP exps, but while I really don't personally like the concept of code levels, they made some very persuasive arguments for the reintroduction of that system.
`!2) `1Channeling combat.`7

I would like to see a system of channeling combat that is less like D&D spells and more like channeling.  Anazail and I have discussed several options - and I think Anazail and Duren have talked about it a little bit, too - and while I know physical combat and the code combat system (along with econ, etc.) are the priorities, eventually I would like to bring channeling combat up to snuff with the rest of it.
Included here is the necessity of balancing chan/non-chan combat, including the requirement that the ambush be respected by the code.
`!3) `1Multiguilds and Guildskills.`7

Last week, Zach and I had a discussion regarding the multiguild system we have right now.  He pointed out that code-wise, a multiguild system is somewhat unbalancing with regard to guildskills - should the two be incorporated.  Basically, having code guildskills available to characters in multiple guilds is unfair.  If guildskills are to be re-introduced (as specific coded GUILDskills), we need to figure out how to restrict them in a way that does not limit PC creativity (Gleeman Sedai advisor to a Queen in DD?  Sure, be in all those guilds!) but that does not reward cheesing the system (Warder-trained Aiel Wolfkin? Uh... Signal Veil Wofldream Goldeneyes?  No... thank you...)

The old guild system made it impossible to have multiple guildskills, and while I prefer allowing players to be in as many guilds at a time as they can justify, I certainly don't want people having half the guildskills in the game on one character just because they wrote a neat background.
`!4) `1Imm trust.`7

Zach brought up the point that we, as Imms, have a lot of trust to regain with the players.  Though none of our current (active) staff has really ever abused that trust as far as I know, there is a long history of staff distrust that we have to overcome, because a lot of our players have long memories.  It isn't necessarily fair that we will be held to a standard based on the actions of previous Imms, but we will be, and missteps will serve to reinforce bad feelings on behalf of the playerbase.

Overcoming this is simple, but not easy.  First and foremost, we need to say what we mean and mean what we say - basically make promises and keep them.  Secondly, we should be as transparent as possible without endangering plots or player characters.  Third, we should be clear about our boundaries: our immranks should mean what they say and we should each respect the domains of the others - Ayasha is HEAD Building and Story, and has the final say on zones and plotlines, Anazail is HEAD Shadow and has final say on Shadowy stuffs, I've got Guilds and would like final say on Human Resources - but we should all be sharing our (non-secret) stuff with each other because none of it is totally independent.

For example, and just because it's a recent one, Ayasha has complete control over who gets bookies (aside from Forsaken), but a head's up to the rest of us so we know that the bookie's taken and by whom lets us look like we're all on the same page - and lets us be prepared to include them.  Doing what we do within our own purviews shouldn't require 'permission' from the others, but we should include each other in our decisions.  So far, this has not been any kind of issue - but it is something to keep in mind, since hoarding domains caused previous Imm staffs a lot of problems with playe
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

`7Subj`6:`7 Immly issues
`7CC`6: `7Anazail Jaiden Duren Ayasha
Couple things I'd like to put on the table to be solved over the next little while as we work to bring code back and get everything in line:
`!1) `1Code vs RP exp.`7
When code comes back in and exp can be awarded for killing mobs, how will that exp be awarded vs how RP exp will be awarded?

On our drive back from Austin, the three of us talked about several different options, including bringing back the separation of code and RP levels.  The main crux was that code levels could be balanced to effectively eliminate the arbitrary assignment of 100 OCS, giving us the ability to make flowstrengths a scale of 1-100 (rather than a 'high' flowstrength being around 40 like right now).  Whether or not exp is all one system for code and RP or if they're split between code and RP levels, the question remains of how to balance RP exp gain with code exp gain, both overall (i.e., does RP award 100exp per emote and code awards 10exp per mob) and as a composite (i.e., how much RP exp = how much code exp *per emote*).

Anazail could explain it better because he has a better grasp on the math and a better idea how to balance code and RP exps, but while I really don't personally like the concept of code levels, they made some very persuasive arguments for the reintroduction of that system.
`!2) `1Channeling combat.`7

I would like to see a system of channeling combat that is less like D&D spells and more like channeling.  Anazail and I have discussed several options - and I think Anazail and Duren have talked about it a little bit, too - and while I know physical combat and the code combat system (along with econ, etc.) are the priorities, eventually I would like to bring channeling combat up to snuff with the rest of it.
Included here is the necessity of balancing chan/non-chan combat, including the requirement that the ambush be respected by the code.
`!3) `1Multiguilds and Guildskills.`7

Last week, Zach and I had a discussion regarding the multiguild system we have right now.  He pointed out that code-wise, a multiguild system is somewhat unbalancing with regard to guildskills - should the two be incorporated.  Basically, having code guildskills available to characters in multiple guilds is unfair.  If guildskills are to be re-introduced (as specific coded GUILDskills), we need to figure out how to restrict them in a way that does not limit PC creativity (Gleeman Sedai advisor to a Queen in DD?  Sure, be in all those guilds!) but that does not reward cheesing the system (Warder-trained Aiel Wolfkin? Uh... Signal Veil Wofldream Goldeneyes?  No... thank you...)

The old guild system made it impossible to have multiple guildskills, and while I prefer allowing players to be in as many guilds at a time as they can justify, I certainly don't want people having half the guildskills in the game on one character just because they wrote a neat background.
`!4) `1Imm trust.`7

Zach brought up the point that we, as Imms, have a lot of trust to regain with the players.  Though none of our current (active) staff has really ever abused that trust as far as I know, there is a long history of staff distrust that we have to overcome, because a lot of our players have long memories.  It isn't necessarily fair that we will be held to a standard based on the actions of previous Imms, but we will be, and missteps will serve to reinforce bad feelings on behalf of the playerbase.

Overcoming this is simple, but not easy.  First and foremost, we need to say what we mean and mean what we say - basically make promises and keep them.  Secondly, we should be as transparent as possible without endangering plots or player characters.  Third, we should be clear about our boundaries: our immranks should mean what they say and we should each respect the domains of the others - Ayasha is HEAD Building and Story, and has the final say on zones and plotlines, Anazail is HEAD Shadow and has final say on Shadowy stuffs, I've got Guilds and would like final say on Human Resources - but we should all be sharing our (non-secret) stuff with each other because none of it is totally independent.

For example, and just because it's a recent one, Ayasha has complete control over who gets bookies (aside from Forsaken), but a head's up to the rest of us so we know that the bookie's taken and by whom lets us look like we're all on the same page - and lets us be prepared to include them.  Doing what we do within our own purviews shouldn't require 'permission' from the others, but we should include each other in our decisions.  So far, this has not been any kind of issue - but it is something to keep in mind, since hoarding domains caused previous Imm staffs a lot of problems with playe

column7: Ragnar, son of Lir, son of Cor, from a tiny hamlet called Hasroth Hall high in the World's End Mountains. Also known as Ragnar Bloodaxe. His childhood was unremarkable for one of his clan, spent mostly helping about with odd jobs, getting in fights and pulling pranks. His mischievous streak was quickly detected and soon became well known in the community. Semi-harmless pranks, pointless fights, drinking and debauchery became a way of life for him, but did not endear him to his neighbors.  Restle

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Gwain

`7Subj`6:`7 Ragnar, son of Lir, son of Cor, from a tiny hamlet called Hasroth Hall high in the World's End Mountains. Also known as Ragnar Bloodaxe. His childhood was unremarkable for one of his clan, spent mostly helping about with odd jobs, getting in fights and pulling pranks. His mischievous streak was quickly detected and soon became well known in the community. Semi-harmless pranks, pointless fights, drinking and debauchery became a way of life for him, but did not endear him to his neighbors.  Restless and adventurous in nature, he left Hasroth hall in the spring of his fifteenth year to make what fortunes for himself as he could.

Rags travelled widely and tried his hand at a number of professions and tasks before always moving on to something else soon after beginning.  Roughly four years after starting, he finally came to settle down at the White Tower with the notion of becoming a famed warrior.   The fighting he excelled at, although the lack of discipline significantly hindered his training, find him in hot water more often than not.
Even so, Ragnar's training progressed, and by his twenty third year he had completed training at the white tower and found himself bonded to Ealasaid Sedai of the Blue Ajah.

The arrangement worked for roughly two years. Although his flighty and undisciplined nature made him rather unsuitable as a warder in the long term, it was a task he took seriously and excelled at in the short term. Or at least, his Aes Sedai didn't die.

After three years, though, Ragnar's feet itched to wander again and he and Ealasaid parted ways. Though still bonded, and often silently watching over her from the dream, they have spent the last five years tentatively avoiding one another.

It was in the first year of the absence that he began noticing the wolves.  Most of Ragnar's life was spent on the outer edge of society, preferring the lack of laws and lawmen, and upon the road while travelling, and it was here in the woods that he began exploring his connection to the wolves.

At first as a flight of fancy, the man had always imagined himself as part bear, akin to the berserkers of old, Ragnar began to track and observe a local wolf pack. It was with this pack that the wolf slowly awakened and grew, and introduced him to others nearby.

He has passed through the braem pack on several occasions (perhaps even offering to keep an eye on Liro's niece whenever he's in the White Tower), most recently wintering with them during the long months, but always he eventually moves on.
BreezeChaser

A lumbering brown wolf cappers and plays amid the dancing shadows cast by a trickster's moon.  Around him, scent and sight blur in confused, disjointed signals around him, his demeanor often at odds with the truth of his scent beneath. A new scent arrives, brought into the glade on a light breeze. The wolf's nose twitches and raises to catch the foreign scent, and soon he is darting off, into the woods, abandoning his play to chase the breeze that carried the new smell.
Aethen al'cab or cab'sorei, I figure.

I may alter up his wolfsend when I have more time to work with it. It hits the aspects of his personality, of putting on a show of being a fool, and always chasing after the next horizon, but it could do with abit more eloquence.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Tiernan
`7Subj`6:`7 Cathbad blockbreak cont'd.

Cathbad is forced down further with that last question, "I...," willing in breath, "My knowledge, is what drives me," he says through extreme pain.  "Knowledge you will never have.  Knowledge that this age has all but forgotten, save me and mine," a small victory that.  "Though I may die, it will live on," he says with a sweet smile, but, setting his teeth, "It and my people are why I do drive myself forward."  Pulling Saidin to him, he draws of it to push himself up, simple flows of air made as columns assisting him in pushing upwards slightly, enough to tilt his head up and eye Tiernan.  "I have knowledge you will never know," he says through gritted teeth, a crazed smile on his face.

Flows of Air?  No.  Cathbad gets enough of the One Power to taste the sweet bitterness of life in the back of his throat and not a molecule more before Tiernan slams the shield down so hard into the connection between the Illuminator and Saidin that it is a small wonder that barrier didn't carve itself into place with an audible ring of power.  Without releasing Cathbad from his pressure against the floor, Tiernan stands with a sigh and walks all the way back around the desk to the throne-like chair, dropping himself into it with a slight huff.  "Light you would be one of those.  Look, kid," on the word 'kid', the Earth weave lifts, allowing the wilder to breathe as he will once more, and even get up if he wishes.  "Everyone has knowledge someone else will never know.  Maybe yours is even super special secret knowledge.  But if you think that even holding the secret to blowing stuff up is in any way impressive to most of the people around here, you need to take a long hard look around and think again."    [Tiernan]

Lifting his heels back up to the desktop again, Tiernan seems perfectly at ease in this ostentatious room, though it doesn't really fit his casual mannerisms.  "There are men here who know things that would make your brain run out your ears, men who know things about how to literally melt a man's heart in his chest, men who have endured more torture, pain, solitude, sickness, madness, and desolation than any twenty men who know things no human should ever -have- to know."  Earnestly, if flatly, he continues, "Your knowledge may be important to you - maybe even the Pattern itself - but it doesn't impress anyone but you.  Thinking otherwise is more arrogant than half the Asha'man in a room together.  You can't even eat without someone's permission right now, and I'm a little concerned that you're going to stop getting that if you keep up like this."  He sits up once more and leans forward intently.  "We. Are not. Your enemy.  You are.  Shape up and get over yourself or you won't leave this humble farm alive."  [Tiernan]

Cathbad draws in breath, through pain and suffering, at being shielded a second time.  He glances up where the shield cut him off, gritting his teeth.  Stretching his shoulders square, Cathbad draws himself more upright, though remains in the kneeling position.  His eyes shift to his staff, then back to Tiernan as he is lectured to.  "And you have to realize that my only wish here is to not have the bloody Power try to drowned me in it when I'm annoyed."  Taking a breath he calms down and states, "Everything else, is secondary."  With that, he leans on his staff to draw him up as far as the chair, and reseats himself upon it.

Tiernan listens actively to Cathbad's response, then shakes his head.  "That's where you're wrong.  You might -think- that's your only wish, but it isn't.  You've got too much pride, too much ego, too much of yourself wrapped up who you are outside of here."  The Dedicated does not release the Power, and certainly doesn't release the thick shield he has firmly in place on the wilder.  "Starting right now, if you think you really want to learn, you need to forget your life away from the Black Tower.  -This- is your life.  You were born here, you will live here, you will die here.  This isn't no ride through the country.  We're not going to break your block for you and just let you go.  Even if some rules have been bent in keeping you alive, we're not here to set a bunch of untrained, irresponsible children out into the world with the power to break it."

His tone softens just a touch, but his hard, flat eyes continue staring at Cathbad.  "You're ours now.  You belong to the Dragon Reborn.  Any life you think you are getting back to?  Forget that life.  The person you were before you got here?  That person is dead now.  There is one way out of this, and that way is death."  Without a hint of threat, Tiernan adds, "If that option suits you better, I can oblige.  But I'm offering you the choice of either the purposeful life we can prov

Knowledge that this age has all but forgotten, save me and mine," a small victory that.  "Though I may die, it will live on," he says with a sweet smile, but, setting his teeth, "It and my people are why I do drive myself forward."  Pulling Saidin to him, he draws of it to push himself up, simple flows of air made as columns assisting him in pushing upwards slightly, enough to tilt his head up and eye Tiernan.  "I have knowledge you will never know," he says through gritted teeth, a crazed smile on his face.

Flows of Air?  No.  Cathbad gets enough of the One Power to taste the sweet bitterness of life in the back of his throat and not a molecule more before Tiernan slams the shield down so hard into the connection between the Illuminator and Saidin that it is a small wonder that barrier didn't carve itself into place with an audible ring of power.  Without releasing Cathbad from his pressure against the floor, Tiernan stands with a sigh and walks all the way back around the desk to the throne-like chair, dropping himself into it with a slight huff.  "Light you would be one of those.  Look, kid," on the word 'kid', the Earth weave lifts, allowing the wilder to breathe as he will once more, and even get up if he wishes.  "Everyone has knowledge someone else will never know.  Maybe yours is even super special secret knowledge.  But if you think that even holding the secret to blowing stuff up is in any way impressive to most of the people around here, you need to take a long hard look around and think again."    [Tiernan]

Lifting his heels back up to the desktop again, Tiernan seems perfectly at ease in this ostentatious room, though it doesn't really fit his casual mannerisms.  "There are men here who know things that would make your brain run out your ears, men who know things about how to literally melt a man's heart in his chest, men who have endured more torture, pain, solitude, sickness, madness, and desolation than any twenty men who know things no human should ever -have- to know."  Earnestly, if flatly, he continues, "Your knowledge may be important to you - maybe even the Pattern itself - but it doesn't impress anyone but you.  Thinking otherwise is more arrogant than half the Asha'man in a room together.  You can't even eat without someone's permission right now, and I'm a little concerned that you're going to stop getting that if you keep up like this."  He sits up once more and leans forward intently.  "We. Are not. Your enemy.  You are.  Shape up and get over yourself or you won't leave this humble farm alive."  [Tiernan]

Cathbad draws in breath, through pain and suffering, at being shielded a second time.  He glances up where the shield cut him off, gritting his teeth.  Stretching his shoulders square, Cathbad draws himself more upright, though remains in the kneeling position.  His eyes shift to his staff, then back to Tiernan as he is lectured to.  "And you have to realize that my only wish here is to not have the bloody Power try to drowned me in it when I'm annoyed."  Taking a breath he calms down and states, "Everything else, is secondary."  With that, he leans on his staff to draw him up as far as the chair, and reseats himself upon it.

Tiernan listens actively to Cathbad's response, then shakes his head.  "That's where you're wrong.  You might -think- that's your only wish, but it isn't.  You've got too much pride, too much ego, too much of yourself wrapped up who you are outside of here."  The Dedicated does not release the Power, and certainly doesn't release the thick shield he has firmly in place on the wilder.  "Starting right now, if you think you really want to learn, you need to forget your life away from the Black Tower.  -This- is your life.  You were born here, you will live here, you will die here.  This isn't no ride through the country.  We're not going to break your block for you and just let you go.  Even if some rules have been bent in keeping you alive, we're not here to set a bunch of untrained, irresponsible children out into the world with the power to break it."

His tone softens just a touch, but his hard, flat eyes continue staring at Cathbad.  "You're ours now.  You belong to the Dragon Reborn.  Any life you think you are getting back to?  Forget that life.  The person you were before you got here?  That person is dead now.  There is one way out of this, and that way is death."  Without a hint of threat, Tiernan adds, "If that option suits you better, I can oblige.  But I'm offering you the choice of either the purposeful life we can prov
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Stuff
Of course, you're more than welcome to work Jezz into the upcoming event.  :)
The two Sedai rooms is fine.  We are building a barracks for Unbonded Warders
and for the Tower Guard, but Sedai are welcome to have their Gaidin link a room
to their rooms if they wish.  Makes IC sense.
As for the secret exits, I am thinking this would not be very realistic.  Every
Sitter room would need a secret exit into the Sitter halls, and this would just
be too many exits linking to the same rooms.  So, my answer on this is that the
Sitters will need to make do with their separate offices, without secret
entrances.
The best I could do is maybe do like what was done with the secret ways into
the basements, and do a statue or an orb with a teleporter leading up to the Sitter
floor, but it would be in the hallways, not from the inividual Sitter rooms.
Aya

`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Wolfie Quest
`7CC`6: `7Tarem Jaiden Anazail Rissa
When Eli tore the top off the hill during the quest, I guild-echoed a wolf
sending to the wolfies in the area about the incident, in order to provide them
a means of getting some RP.
They want to do their investigation of the scene on Saturday at 8pm EST.  I'll
need to know any details you think might be important, and of course, if the AM
guild wants to get involved, they are more than welcome.  I am re-descing the
entire south-eastern part of zone 640 for the occasion, since it should be
hills, and not farmlands.  Then I will link the BT to room 64064, which is just
north of the Illuminator Chapterhouse.
Thanks. :)
Ayasha

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jezz
`7Subj`6:`7 Paintings
Hi Jai-butt

I have some paintings that you can use around the tower.  They're both from my Jezz website, not sure if I gave you the link or not. You can color them in, and what not. Now that Jezz is back, she'll start painting again and I'll send you what I come up with. I have one that was commissioned to Phaedra, but I need to make an adjustment to it. The one given to her, Sabs and Kinje conspired to make a slight adjustment to it. I need to remove the adjustment.
Maelyn as an accepted:

A small framed painting is clearly of an Altaran lass, her prominent features are her large, dark eyes and pouty pink lips. Her dark hair flows just to shoulder-length with shadings of an afternoon sun kissing her features. The painting itself has aged some while the young woman herself wears the dress of an accepted. Hanging from a leather thong around her neck is a pierced Illianer coin which casts a glint from a ray of sun touching the edge. A small blossom rests in her hands which she seems preoccupied with while around her are the blurred images of a garden. In the corner, the artist squiggle is JJaeyen
The plaque along the bottom of the frame reads: Maelyn Da'nell
Benoit when he was still a trainee:

A small framed painting of a tower trained gent and a bushy, brown wolfhound with doleful brown eyes. The Murandian-dressed fellow is seated in a plush, red chair with a book in one hand and his sword laying across his lap, the background is faded out which could be construed as a library. A lamp light highlights the side of his clean shaven features.  At his feet, the large wolfhound is resting its chin on the man's knee. In the corner, the artist squiggle is JJaeyen
The plaque along the bottom of the frame reads: Benoit deMott and Drinian
Jezz has one very similar to this in her bedroom (or will when Ayasha updates it), so, if someone really looks at it, it's a version 2.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Kagari
`7Subj`6:`7 Seeking the Band
CC: Maethir Mat
Heyas, I've been thinking about joining the Band for a while now, but
here's my official application.
Kagari Yurehl was born on a ranch near Four Kings. Her mother having
died when she was young, Kagari was raised by her father, with a little
help from a neighboring widow. Never properly learning a woman's ways,
Kagari became quite a tomboy. She helped her father with the horses
until a barnyard fire left him crippled. They sold the breeding stock
to make it through the harsh winter, and in the spring, Kagari began
working as a courrier instead, taking messages and packages sometimes
as far as Aringill.
While travelling through the woods one day, Kagari was attacked by a
lone trolloc which had somehow made its way south. She was rescued by
a pair of wolves, who spoke in her mind and told her to fight. She
was frightened at first, but has come to accept her connection to the
wolves and the abilities she now has. (Guilded Wolfkin, rank Young.)
Through her interactions with the wolves and occasional encounters
with the Dragon Reborn's Asha'man, Kagari has become convinced that
she must ready herself to fight in the Last Battle. She has minimal
sword training (WM1 on the old code) and can ride a horse like she
was born on one. Additionally, she has all the unique abilities of
a slightly experienced Wolfkin. She would probably make a fine scout,
though her dream is to join the cavalry.

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Last Time
You cannot have both of your alts involved in the same RP.  Period.
Perrin is in GHEALDAN.  Miniver was lucky to have heard that Sending.  Granted,
wolves may have spread the word of the incident, but Perrin is hunting for HIS
KIDNAPPED WIFE.
In the books, Perrin is obsessed with finding Faile.  If anything, he would be
using the wolf dream to scout out the Shaido camp, NOT some hill way far away
southeast of Caemlyn.
Please review POLICY BOOKIE.  One of the points I made there when updating that
file is that players who take on book characters are expected to play their
characters in accordance with the characters from the books.
Do you really think Perrin would leave Faile to certain death and torture, to
go off chasing rumors about something else?
The books say no.  Perrin is nearly insane with terror for what is going to
happen to Faile, and is very near to losing himself to the wolf.  He's so
obsessed with it that everything else is secondary.
Finally, like I said, I am going to be running a very large event JUST FOR
PERRIN.  I am going through a lot of trouble to do so.  Please be patient, and
you'll reap the rewards.  We will get Perrin on the grid eventually.  But you
can't violate our policies by having two alts involved in the same storyline,
and doing something that would be out of character for Perrin.
I'm sorry if I'm getting upset, but you just don't seem to understand, and I
don't know how to get through to you.
This is the final word on the matter.  Perrin cannot be involved in the
investigation of the hill.  Miniver is more than welcome to investigate in TAR
with Wyl and Ragnarr, and whoever else you want.  But not Perrin.
Ayasha

can't violate our policies by having two alts involved in the same storyline,
and doing something that would be out of character for Perrin.
I'm sorry if I'm getting upset, but you just don't seem to understand, and I
don't know how to get through to you.
This is the final word on the matter.  Perrin cannot be involved in the
investigation of the hill.  Miniver is more than welcome to investigate in TAR
with Wyl and Ragnarr, and whoever else you want.  But not Perrin.
Ayasha
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Rissa
`7Subj`6:`7 Channeling syllabi
`7CC`6: `7Jezz Tarem Rayenia
`&Tower`7/`8Tower`7 GLS:

I want to give you a head's up that in the next few days I will be providing you revision notes for your syllabi.  I have your weave lists for lessons and advancement and simply based on current `&and future`7 code requirements, some of the weaves you have will need to be adjusted.  It won't be a `&huge`7 difference, but - for example - there are some weaves which will have restricted/limited access based on talents which should not be included as standard requirements since not all your guildies will have the talents necessary.
Where changes need to be made, I will include replacement suggestions when possible.

I will also be giving a very basic description of the "standard" way in which the weave should be formed so that teaching and use will be relatively consistent across the board.  On this, they will be `&very`7 basic and should in no way limit the expression of any given channeler's emotive ability, and I will happily accept suggestions from you about weave structure if the form provided is not in line with how you feel the weave should be woven.  (I don't foresee this being an issue, but I didn't want you to be surprised or think I am trying to 'change' the way you do things.)

If any current character already has knowledge of any restricted/limited access weave ICly, adjustments will need to be made, and I will be more than happy to help construct that adjustment if you need it.

I'll repeat most of this when my corrections are sent, I just didn't want to take you by surprise or make you feel like I'm "forcing" changes on you.  These alterations will be `&very`7 minor, all things considered, and will prevent confusion in future when IC and code become linked more firmly again.
Of course I will leave it totally up to you to provide the updated information to your guilds/adjust your syllabi when the changes are made.
Let me know if you have any questions in the meantime!
-R
