`7From`6:`7 Aalaryn
`7Subj`6:`7 templates?
Warder Template #1 - The Righteous
The Righteous "For the Light against the Dark"
These are the more common types of candidates seeking to train with
the warders. These are people with high ideals and goals for themselves
and their own place in the Wheel. At some point or another they have
decided that they wish to fight against the Dark One: even though some
of the more erratic of these seek themselves to the Children of the Light,
those without prejudice finds themselves in Tar Valon.
These people feel that the best way to fight against the Shadow is by
the Aes Sedai's side. The Last Battle requires the use of the One Power,
and Tar Valon is the obvious fortress of justice in these regards. They
are blindly devoted to the cause, and trust in the cause whatever means
are used along the way.
The Righteous makes a good Warder. He believes in what he does
without question. This may even be his flaw: without questioning the
mind gets no room for growth. Yet for the purpose of Tar Valon a man
of this devotion would serve quite well.
Warder Template # 2 - The Romantic
The Romantic "I want to be a hero too!"
Dazzled by old stories of heroism against the battle of evil, the
Romantic dwells within all the elaborated myths about the Gaidin. This
one wants to be a hero first and foremost. Naturally with this comes a
degree of wishing to contribute, though often this trait is overshadowed
by the urge to be special and important.
This kind of person is often grandiose in nature. He is more
self-preserved than The Righteous, more concerned with his own
progression and faith rather than those around him. He may even be
somewhat naive, and could also fail to comprehend the full extent of
what being a Warder entails. By no means a selfish person, he may on
occasion find himself too engrossed with his own self and maybe not
contributing in the way other people might expect. Still, these men's
bravery often matches that of The Righteous', and makes a good
contribution to the ranks.
Warder Template # 3 - The Dutiful
The Dutiful "My Duty is My Life"
Even though all Warders are supposed to live by their duty, many of
them apply this in various ways from person to person. This one lives
only for his Duty. There is a small urge to be a part of something large,
yet in the end, be it for the Light or personal reasons, the Duty is what
counts.
These men often arrive at the White Tower completely clear and
confident in what they wish to do, and what role they are to partake in.
There is little passion outside the cold brim of duty, and these are in
truth the "Cold, Leashed Dogs" of the Gaidin that most people hear
about. They often see themselves more as tools than maybe the Aes
Sedai does, not caring much for their own value and often quite morbid
in nature.
Warder Template # 4 - The Cryptic
The Cryptic "I do what I do for my own reasons"
Many kinds of people fit into this category, yet what all of these are
bound to have in common is the fact that at one point or another,
something happened in their lives that made them feel like repaying it
in a way by joining the Gaidin. Maybe some Aes Sedai helped this one
in the past in a way, and as compensation, he decided to repay this
favor by becoming a Gaidin. As all personal experience, the event that
led their path to the Shining walls varies as the colors of the rainbow.
Their personalities are a very mixed lot: there is hardly one that is the
other alike. But driven by personal reasons to pursue extensive training,
others may be suspicious of their true potential as Gaidin. They are
sometimes very unpredictable.
TG Template #1 - The Devoted
The Devoted "To Defend the Shining Walls till my last breath"
Aside from the regular Warder-candidates there are those who seek a
more structured life-style in the army instead. The guidance of the army
is like a beacon for these, clear

Warder Template #1 - The Righteous
These are the more common types of candidates seeking to train with
the warders. These are people with high ideals and goals for themselves
and their own place in the Wheel.
Warder Template # 2 - The Romantic
Dazzled by old stories of heroism against the battle of evil, the
Romantic dwells within all the elaborated myths about the
Warder Template # 3 - The Dutiful
There is little passion outside the cold brim of duty, and these are in
truth the "Cold, Leashed Dogs" of the Gaidin that most people hear
about. They often see themselves more as tools than maybe the Aes
Sedai does, not caring much for their own value and often quite morbid
in nature.
Warder Template # 4 - The Cryptic
Many kinds of people fit into this category, yet what all of these are
bound to have in common is the fact that at one point or another,
something happened in their lives that made them feel like repaying it
in a way by joining the Gaidin.
TG\Army Template #1 - The Devoted
Aside from the regular Warder-candidates there are those who seek a
more structured life-style, the Tower Guard or the Army instead. The
guidance to this service is like a beacon for these, clearing the path
and allowing the person to tread upon the lane of Light within the ranks.
TG\Army Template #2 - The Unemployed
These men are often rather simple in terms of personality.  They are often
unhindered by glorious desires to become something special, like heroes or
high-ranking officers: they merely wish to earn a living by the means available.
TG\Army Template #3 - The Obligated (Honor and Tradition, Nobles)
The Nobility are often in the habit of sending their sons to be trained
at the White Tower. These sons are sometimes the heirs of their
families and thus never intend to bond.  Some remain as Tower Guard
while others may return home to their families.
*IMPORTANT NOTE*
You MUST submit your background to the Daes GL for approval of
the noble connection BEFORE sending it to the Tower GLs.
If you would like more information on a template please mail the
Tower GLs.

`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Shops
Can we just delete all the shops?  Since I have to do the ones I did over
anyway, I might as well start from scratch.  I don't know how to delete the
ones I did.  They got ported over when you changed your room, because they are
in zone 0 so now they are all on the main port and they weren't ready to be
ported.
It won't take me long to re-do them in their proper zones.  It will be easier
if I can just sedit <vnum> as I go along, instead of relying on that
ridiculously long list in show shops.  Most of those 'shops' aren't even shops
anyway, as we discussed earlier on the wiz channel.
Once we find a way to get all the shops deleted, I can make shops match up with
room numbers, and then hopefully show shops will only show shops that are
actual shops, instead of a bunch of random vnums.
I hope this makes sense.
Aya

column7: new possible desc, for formal things.

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Rayenia
`7Subj`6:`7 new possible desc, for formal things.
http://i1343.photobucket.com/albums/o783/tribalbutterfly76/RayeniainGray_zps2524d533.png
Before you stands a maiden just an inch or so above average height.
Vibrantly auburn tresses, as though finespun threads of fire, tumble
in lush disarray across her slender soulders.  Her fiery locks are
drawn back into an intricate crown with pearls as adornment, two loose
ringlet curls frame her smooth complexioned face.  An ageless wisdom
coupled with a mysterious spark can be seen in her velvety tawny eyes,
setting gently within a face that carries both slender enchantment as
well as the dulcet charm of a woman.  Reaching further down her graceful
figure provides the watcher an ample view of a dynamic and youthful form
while displaying hints of her manner.  She wears a silken gown dyed a
deep hematite with layered skirts of a softer, paler gray.  The neckline
of her gown is squared, a wide band of black silk set with pearls and
golden beads meets up with the same style of adornment at her shoulders,
creating the illusion that her bell sleeves are shorter than they may
be.  Encircling her waist is delicate belt of pearls, a single strand of
pearls hangs from the belt down to the hem of her skirts.

No, I don't need a report on every room that doesn't have an actual desc.
There are zones that were ported over incomplete back when Nicodemus was in
charge of the Ubermap.  Only the rooms directly surrounding the major cities
were desc'd, and all the others were left as 'The Open World'.  I definitely
don't need reports on those.
We are still working those zones.  If you would really like to help, I would be
more than happy to set you up on the builder port as a mort builder, and you
can help me take a crack at them.  It is a huge project, and I've been working
at it, but there have been other priorities, such as getting Ghealdan set up
for very immediate war RP needs, and getting the shop code to work properly.
Right now, I've just finished Ghealdan, and am working on a couple of towns.
After that, it will be linked up with the old Two Rivers zone, Baerlon,
Whitebridge and Four Kings.  This will probably happen within the next week or
so.
If you would like to help, let me know and I will set you up.  :)
Ayasha

`7From`6:`7 Rissa
`7Subj`6:`7 Surien cont'd
`7CC`6: `7Rissa Raeda Rasim

Surien tells you, 'As for the Blacksmiths, We have a group of people who have lived their life by the spear. The blacksmiths themselves were by far the people amongst them who perpetuated the oathbreaking the most, albeit ignorantly, however that doesn't make it less so in their eyes. I feel that the sense of their honor, would take precedent in their thoughts, causing them to wanting to break ties with that job. My character would have been one based on his own inner struggles more so than a normal character would. That may not be the best for a group RP setting, but would have been one, I would have identified with the most. That being said, once again, Rand's coming brought about a change in the way Aiel society was thought, and not just by the Aiel as a people, but with the Aiel as individual human beings. I just can't see an entire group going to a preset group of options, and staying within those bounds as far as the choices they make. I believe that a small percentage chose their own path, and followed it in their fashion.'

Surien tells you, 'Readers digest condensed version, (since i'm tired of retyping it) We have 2 different theories on the Aiel themselves, and due to your position of power, and having final matter in the say, I understand mine doesn't matter. (Nowhere near as bitchy as it sounds, just exasperation to being disconnected again. Is there any way to fix that in coding? I'm sure that gets annoying in some of the RP)'

Surien tells you, 'As far as leaving, He didn't leave on his own. he left with the group to chase down the Shaido, as did thousands of other Aiel. It was during this time that he was still dealing with the bleakness, and subsequently came across Aes Sedai in their travels. There were an abundance around the camp of the Car'a'carn, even if they weren't specifically with Rand. It's not too much of a stretch for him to have been able to present himself to one at their camp. As for helping the dragon, Isee the wording is wrong, but regardless, the sentiment is there. The last battle is coming, and they wanted people to be able to fight. I would think a green would think strategically, and want an Aiel to be fighting, and not being Gai'shain to them.'

Surien tells you, 'And channeling, to be honest, I stated I would like for him to be able to at some point. If it doesn't happen in a game mechanic fashion, then I understand. but everone has a place where they would like to see a character go. I would like for my guy to be able to make Powerwrought spears. No super deathgates, no lightning strikes, or a churning of the earth to grind his enemies. Just a blacksmith making a line of legendary spears. '

`6Rowena's petite form can not be mistaken for a child's today.  The youthful `3g`#l`&o`7w`6 of
`6her skin stands out from above the wide scooped neckline of the `7c`&la`^ss`6y, e`^le`&ga`7nt`6 dress
`6she wears. The fine, `7cr`3e`7a`&m-`7c`&o`7lo`3r`7ed`6 silk is `7lu`&s`7t`8r`7o`&u`7s`6 and clearly tailored to fit the
`6girl's slender frame, and the lines add subtle womanly `1wo`!ma`&nl`7y c`&ur`!ve`1s`6 that her usual jerkin,
`6vest and trousers diminish. The front panel hugs her slim waist and extends down in
`6a '`&V`6', beginning at her hips on the sides and ending in line with her upper thighs.
`6From beneath the top panel, the skirts - made with the same `7r`&a`7d`8i`7a`&n`7t`6, `7c`3r`7e`&a`7m`3y`6 silk -
`6flow out and down to the floor, enhancing her slight hips and leaving a compact train
`6behind her.

`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Peace Shield Research
Total:1
Total:17
Total:17
Total:6
As you and your nine researchers begin the process of deciphering the
Old Tongue in the library text regarding the Shain'vadin, other possibly
familiar words stand out, namely numerous references to the 'tia avende
alentin'.  In other words, it is pretty easy to assume that the Peace
Shield is an early reference to the Ogier steddings.  There are also references
to the Nym, who cultivated the farmlands and gardens of the Age of Legends,
and who worked alongside the Ogier and the Da'shain Aiel.  The book goes
on to discuss the Nym, and describes them as constructs who were designed
to assist with growing things.  There are numerous arguments detailed in
the discussion, namely about the ethics of creating such sentient creatures,
and whether or not it is appropriate to refer to them as people or things.
Eventually, they were given into the care of the Ogier, who fiercely wanted
to protect them from potential exploitation for monetary gain.
The article goes into great detail about how the steddings were created,
and why.  Apparently the Ogier were discomfited by the growth of human
population, and they were becoming increasingly worried about the effects
the One Power was having on the earth.  They wanted assurances that some
places would remain untouched by the One Power, and that they would be
allowed to live in peace and tend to the land, and to protect the Nym.
The Aes Sedai of the Age of Legends built the stedding as a sort of treaty
with the Ogier. It was apparently a great endeavor which took many years to
perfect, using both halves of the True Source, both Saidar and Saidin with
great circles of linked channelers along with the singing of a song.  The
lyrics of the song are not mentioned in the text.
Some of this translation is true, and some of it is not translated
correctly due to the 1 you rolled on your last week's research roll.
Some of it is from actual references in the Wheel of Time books,
and some of it I made up, because this is a mirror world, and we
really don't know a whole lot about the Age of Legends.  Just because
I made something up, doesn't mean it isn't true. :)
Ayasha

`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Regarding Tuon
First of all, I would like to start this off by saying that at this time, I
am not approving anyone to play Tuon, and here are the reasons why:
1.  Tuon is the Daughter of the Nine Moons, and Heir to the Crystal Throne.
She is destined to become the Empress of Seanchan when her mother dies, and is
therefore, one of the three most powerful characters in the books (next to
Rand, and the Amyrlin Seat.)  So we can't give her out lightly.
2.  Tuon is motivated by a number of subtle omens and prophecies, and this
requires a strong knowledge of what those omens and prophecies are.  Reading
the books is vital to understanding Tuon, and whoever ends up playing her needs
to be familiar with these things.
This is not to say that I will never approve anyone, or you, to play Tuon.
It's just that we need to be very discriminating, due to her importance.  My
main concern is knowing that I can feel she is being played accurately and true
to character.
So, with that in mind, here are the answers to your questions:
1.  Mat and Tuon's marriage.  As of right now, Mat and Tuon are not technically
married in accordance with Seanchan custom.  Mat has told Tuon three times that
she is his wife.  But, the marriage is not complete until Tuon reciprocates in
kind.  She has to tell him in return that he is her husband in order for them
to be properly married.
2.  Flirting.  Tuon does flirt with Mat, but her manner of flirting is very
odd.  Usually when Mat does something to make her mad, she does vindictive
little things like telling the entire camp that they are under her
protection...  Except Mat.  Or, she calls him Toy, or she makes veiled threats
that she doesn't really mean.  For Tuon, this is flirting.  But at the same
time, one gets the sense that she could really do him harm if she really wanted
to.  (She is an expert martial artist in hand fighting, and she nearly bested
Mat with only her hands and feet when they first met.)
3.  Friendly relationships.  I would never call the relationship between Mat
and Tuon 'friendly'.  There is always some underlying threat beneath her words
and actions, which always makes Mat nervous in the books.  It's very hard to
tell.  But Tuon does seem pleased when Mat says that she is his wife three
times, and enjoyed a kiss she gave him while checking to see if he had a fever.
So there is some kind of affection going on between them.
4.  Leaving the wagon.  Trying to tell Tuon she isn't 'allowed' to do something
is likely to end up with bad results.  Mat may have kidnapped her, but never
forget that Tuon is motivated by omens and prophecy.  Nothing she does
(including allowing Mat to carry her off) is without a purpose.  If she wanted
to leave the wagon, she would do so, and there really isn't much Mat could do
to stop her if she really set her mind to it.  But she never tries to escape,
because she doesn't consider herself a prisoner.  She is waiting to see how
the prophecy unfolds.
5.  Personality.  Tuon has a very unique personality.  In many ways, she is a
stickler for proper protocol, but Mat, and the Oathbreakers, tend to ignore
Seanchan protocol and etiquette, and so she has been forced to adjust.
However, as mentioned above, she tends to find other little manipulative and
vindictive methods to get what she wants.  Once she returns to her people, very
likely she will revert to her usual adherence to etiquette and protocol.
6. Description.  Tuon will come with a desc, if I approve her to be played.  I set up
all of the book characters before giving the temp password to the player.  However, the
desc can be changed to suit.  Here is the desc I used when I played her:
This slender young woman stands perhaps no taller than a mere five feet
in height, and surely cannot be older than sixteen summers. She may never
be considered imposing, due to her height and youthful appearance, yet she
carries herself with a calm, quiet grace, her expression almost always
composed into a stern mask. Expressive, liquid brown eyes gaze out from
beneath a pair of elegantly arched eyebrows of raven black. Those eyes
are strangely cool and calculating, despite the apparent youth of the young
lady's face, and seem to miss very little. Fringed with dark lashes, those
eyes are likely the most alluring of this young woman's features. Her skin
is an exotic shade of dark bronze, smooth and flawless, accentuating her
deep brown eyes. High, proud cheekbones and a noble brow, together with a
small but elegant nose in a heart-shaped face give her a regal, yet youthful
beauty. A pair of delicate, bow-shaped lips seem to soften her features
somewhat deceptively. The young woman's beauty cannot be meas
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

column7: the letter she sends to Rowena in a few days

column1: `7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Asrah
`7Subj`6:`7 the letter she sends to Rowena in a few days
*given to Kindra at the Merry Company*
*whom was asked to deliver this to Rowena*
*written in a neat and flowing hand*
Dearest Rowena,
I pray that this letter finds you well.  I have been worried about you since the
attack.  The strength that you posess is inspiring.  I can only hope that I can
learn the kind of strength that you display.  I know that Thrain would be quite
happy if I did.
Thrain.  The man confounds me.  Part of me is angry with him for every thing that
has happened while the other part of me is not.  I know I was a fool for rushing
off with him when he found me in Tanchico.  I was scared, and younger, not that I
am so old now, naiive would be a more appropriate word I think.  I thank the Light
that he was not the man who ended Dahmot's life.  I do not know if the man who had
attacked us, Saita, is alive or dead.  I do not have the courage to ask.  I also
do not feel that Thrain would tell me if he remained alive.
Thrain insists that I attempt to rebuild my life, to start anew, here, in Andor.
I know that is for the best but the aspect of this frightens me terribly.  I have
never been exactly independant or alone before and so I am still taking help from
Thrain.  I have moved from the Crown of Roses to a different Inn, The Lion Banner.
It's proximity to the Palace and consequently the Queen's Guard seemed to be the
safest place.  I do not know where he is staying, he felt it would be better for
me to not know.
There has been discussion that I should learn to use a blade, a small one of course
as I do not think I could manage anything larger than a dagger.  I did find a job.
Yes you may laugh.  I know as I write this I am amused that the spoiled child of
noble merchants is now working for a seamstress.  At least I might finally begin
to understand Andoran fashion.
Respectfully yours,
Asrah

And drop me down to the dream below
'Cause I'm only a crack in this castle of glass
Hardly anything there for you to see

Through the secrets that I have seen
Wash the sorrow from off my skin
And show me how to be whole again
'Cause I'm only a crack in this castle of glass
Hardly anything there for you to see

'Cause I'm only a crack in this castle of glass

`7From`6:`7 Duren
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: your mud
`6Dude,`7
Forgive me, but you start this rant off by addressing me "Dude"? Really?

`6I have logged this character into your
mud for a couple of weeks now.`7
You realize I have logs right?  You created June 13th at 22:19:05 central time.
So your account has existed for less than one week, it will be one week tonight
at 22:19:05.  So your very first sentence to me is false.

`6Never once have I seen somebody in rp. The
wotmud listing for this mud says the
mud is coming back and 20 to 25 people
are consistently on. I've never seen
more than a dozen characters at a time
since starting this character`7
When that was posted that was true, and in the past 20 days we have hit 23
characters connected.  It tells you this everytime you type "who".  Summer time
is usually slower for us.  People tend to go outside and spend less time in
front of a computer.  Myself included.

`6and considering you allow multiplay I doubt
that you have more than four or five
people on at a time and three or four
of those are you and your imms.`7
I love how you draw this conclusion without having any factual evidence to
support it whatsoever.  Very few players actually take advantage of the multi-
play capability.  It's generally only used by imms and GLs so that the imm and
GL can also have their regular player connected at the same time.  Of the 23
players we had online, there were 17 unique IP addresses connected, only a
handful were multiplaying.

`6I log in today and your head story
imm is leaving because this is too
stressful.
`7
What is so stressful and where did
all your people go?`7
First of all, she never said she was "leaving".  She's taking a break.  Why is
it stressful?  Lets see, we have to deal with people like you who after playing
for not even a full week log in and make false accusations and feel entitled to
have us wait on you hand and foot even though we volunteer our time here.  Plus
she's having *major* surgery, she's having all sorts of issues paying for that
surgery and dealing with assholes like you is just not something she needs in
her life right now.  She'll be back once she's recovered.

`6My advice, ask your players not your
imms what is up. Something/somebody/
somewhat is pushing your people
away and it is killing your mud.`7
Really?  That's ironic because based on your earlier logic since we're all
multiplaying and it's only 5 of us anyhow then all my players are also imms...

`6Please let me know if you get this
message.`7
I got it, dude.
-Duren

`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Band Camp
Heya,
You are more than welcome to build a camp for the Band.  In fact,
I encourage it, since there will soon be some major Band-related story
stuff going on, and a camp will be needed.  I have actually been
thinking about this, but don't have the time to do it myself, and haven't
really got a good idea on what you guys might want.
So, if you want to build it, I can set up a zone for you to build it in,
give you access to the builder port, and show you the ropes of how to build.
Or, you can just email me the descs again like you did with the Embassy,
and I can do the work needed on the builder port.
Tell me how many rooms you think you will need, and I'll get a zone set up
for it either way.  And let me know if you want to build it yourself,
or if you just want to send me the descs.  Ideally, it would be better
if you did the building on the builder port.  I'm happy to show you how. :)
Aya's player

`7From`6:`7 Isadora
`7Subj`6:`7 Skills/weaves and other codely things
Hi!
So I have finally gotten my brain back into gear (and out of first gear, because you need to
eventually shift to second if you're going further than a block) and remembered to mail in
when people need their skills set!  I know it's amazing Isa's player remembered something!
(fanfare can be heard, lovely little colored flags also dance in the wind!)
So here's the first two characters who may need things set as I tried to teach them with
the lesson code and it wouldn't let me, how fun is that?
Kieryn, Aes Sedai, Blue Ajah (I forgot to ask her what her talents were, bad on me)
skills - weave, grasp, release, tie, link, and read/write old tongue
weaves - basic as grouping plus what she's learned via rp - slice weave, shield source,
bond, gate, plant growth, create food, attract insects, refresh, light, dome of air,
lightining, protection, water, gag, wrap, still, air blindness, project voice.
(fairly certain that this is all of them for Kieryn.)
Second character - Alika Chienar - Instructor for Warders Guild, Tower Guard
talents -
talent endurance....100%
talent fast healer..100%
talent affinity for weapons.100%
As for skills I know she's got dagger on her char but she should also have
sneak, hide, search, sword, staff, bow - at the least.
oh sorry there's another WD Char, Jaager.  He's also an Instructor but I haven't been
able to talk to him to see if he needs to be set.
that's all the business, I hope it helps.
Thank you for doing all that you do!
Isa's player,
Tina

bond, gate, plant growth, create food, attract insects, refresh, light, dome of air,
lightining, protection, water, gag, wrap, still, air blindness, project voice.

talents -
talent endurance....100%
talent fast healer..100%
talent affinity for weapons.100%

sneak, hide, search, sword, staff, bow - at the least.
oh sorry there's another WD Char, Jaager.  He's also an Instructor but I haven't been

that's all the business, I hope it helps.

`7From`6:`7 Cathbad
`7Subj`6:`7 Soldier goings on
So, since I've not had much Soldier RP as far as lessons,
there are a few questions which would have come up
during the >Month?< of time that Cath's been a Soldier.
1.  Is there a way for many Asha'man to link their power together to accomplish even greater tasks?
2.  Can one begin maintaining a tied-off weave again, and retie the not to extend the duration it is carried?
3.  How would I funnel air from one area to another?  ( move steam / smoke from where you are to location further away)
4.  How would I gate to a location you can't see and don't know well, like the inside of a building?
5.  May I have a small area at the edge of camp, away from most, to make some destructive items based on my Illuminator
knowledge?
A.  If so, I will need to gather supplies?  Can a gate for me be made,
and a wagon be made available for my use?
B.  I'll need to be the only one to handle them for now,
as they'll be quite dangerous for the untrained.
Also, Cath probably could make a Shield Source weave, as he was repeatedly subjected to it
for a long while after he arrived at the Farm.  (Some of the initial blockbreak attempsts
were releasing from his shield, making him angry, with instructions not to grasp...
and he was shielded when that failed.)
I'd really like to have some lessons with Cath, too,
but until that occurs, these will have to do.
Hoping for more Asha RP,
- Cathbad's player

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Cathbad
`7Subj`6:`7 Ongoing things from Cathbad
These are questions that Cath has brought up to Ryn:
1.  Could we try linking?  If we're ever going to,
it'd be best to practice, so we know what we're doing
when the situation is dire.
2.  Do you think the reason for Saidin and Saidar
behave so different is unchanging, or could it be due
to the Dark One's Taint having affected it
all these years?
3.  On the blueprints for weaves:
Do any of these seem familiar?
A.  Drawing of:
A sphere of a flow of air, wrapped up in a sphere,
with the end of a fire flow inside.
Also, an indication of knotting it off.
B.  Drawing of:
A fire flow being split time and again to thin strands,
at right angles, forming a mesh net over a surface,
or wrapping an object.
C.  A sharpened tip of air, with a heavily twisted
coil of air behind it, with the coil then seperated,
with the tip flying forward with great force.
D.  A lattice of Spirit, the forward edge a blunted
shape.
Well, there goes.  Hope some of these inspire
RP, but if not, at least we're getting some of these
questions out of the way. :p
- Cathbad's player

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
`7Subj`6:`7 Phase 1: Results
`7CC`6: `7Aldor Larissa
These are the results of your 'feeling out' which Houses are loyal
to Rand, plus some extra information.  Use it as you see fit.  Let me
know when you want to start Phase 2.  I am willing to NPC any nobles you
might wish to try to convince to join your cause.
`2House Damodred`7
Currently, Caraline Damodred is the High Seat of House Damodred.
She is currently in Tear, assisting Lord Darlin Sisnera with his
rebellion against Rand.  Caraline Damodred has sworn allegience
to Rand, as has Darlin Sisnera, but things become complicated here
because the people of Tear want Darlin as their King, and this is
the source of the rebellion in Tear. It is said that Darlin Sisnera
is currently trying to woo Caraline, but she has thus far refused his
advances.  She has left Larissa 'in charge' while she is away, but
this does not make Larissa the official head of the House in all
matters. Caraline could return at any time to reclaim her rights
as High Seat.
`2House Riatin`7
Toram Riatin was the High Seat of House Riatin.  It is said that
before he disappeared, he had hired the remnants of the White
Lions from Andor to fill out the ranks of his rebel army during
the civil war, before Rand restored order to Cairhien.  This
army was either dispersed or killed in the midst of some strange,
unnatural fog south of Cairhien. Toram's whereabouts are currently
unknown, and so his sister, Ailil Riatin, has taken charge of the
House for now.  It is said that she is loyal to Rand, unlike her
brother, but one never knows with House Riatin.
`2House Saighan`7
Bertome Saighan is currently the High Seat of House Saighan, and
he is one of the most powerful men in Cairhien.  He is cousin to
the late Lady Colavaere Saighan, who's attempt to take the Sun
Throne ended with Rand expelling her to a farm, and her subsequent
suicide.  Bertome considers his cousin to have been overly ambitious.
He doesn't like Rand, because of what he did to Colavaere, but he is,
however, currently neutral on the matter of who should rule
Cairhien.  Cautious might be a better word.  Bertome is a patriot,
and ultimately loyal to Cairhien above all else.
`2House Taborwin`7
One of the major Houses in Cairhien, House Taborwin is led by Dobraine,
who is also currently Rand's Steward over Cairhien.  He is loyal to
Rand, and one of the Dragon's most trusted advisors.  He is holding
the Sun Throne for Elayne with the help of several Aes Sedai, the
support of a number of minor Houses, and the Aiel?  He led the
Cairhienin in the Battle of Dumai's Wells.  It is said that Dobraine
believes in keeping to the letter of his oaths, and he cannot be
swayed from his loyalty to Rand and his duty to see Elayne set on
the Sun Throne.  Not all are happy with Dobraine ruling Cairhien.
Some might support Toram Riatin if he returns.
`2House Annallin`7
House Annallin is a minor House, and was in support of Colavaer when
she tried to take the Sun Throne.  However, the House's loyalties are
dubious in that they also begged assistance from the Dragon Reborn
for aid against the Shaido.
`2House Chuliandred`7
A House of middling power in Cairhien, they could cause trouble
for Elayne in her bid for the Sun Throne.  High Seat Doressin
Chuliandred supported Colavaere in her attempt to gain the Sun
Throne, but it is said that he has bent the knee to the Lord Dragon.
He and Dobraine Saighan were boyhood friends, so it is likely that
he will side with his boyhood friend in any conflicts regarding
the Sun Throne.  Another member of House Chuliandred, Lady Alaine,
is said to run around dressed in boy's clothing (like Min).  She
is married, and yet is rumored to have tried to seduce Rand.
`2House Darengil`7
This is a fairly minor House, and it it loyal to Rand.  Most
probably, it will side with Elayne when the time comes. (OOC: One of
its members, Lady Selande, is currently in Ghealdan with Perrin
and Faile, and she is the leader of the Cha Faile society that
pretends to act like Aiel.)
`2House Delovinde`7
Loyal to Rand.  Talmanes Delovinde serves in the Band of the Red
Hand under Mat, and is currently in Murandy bringing King Roedran
into Rand's fold.  House Delovinde is a fairly major House, though
not as great as Taborwin or Saighan.
`2House Dagonred`7
Loyal to Rand.  Merisin Dagonred is a member of the Band of
the Red Hand.
`2House Dhulaine`7
This House is said to have strong connections with the White Tower,
and therefore, it is likely to side with Elayne when the time comes.
Lady Arilyn Dhulaine is said to occasionally house some of the Aes
Sedai loyal to Rand.
`2House Hamarashle`7
`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

however, currently neutral on the matter of who should rule
Cairhien.  Cautious might be a better word.  Bertome is a patriot,
and ultimately loyal to Cairhien above all else.
`2House Taborwin`7
One of the major Houses in Cairhien, House Taborwin is led by Dobraine,
who is also currently Rand's Steward over Cairhien.  He is loyal to
Rand, and one of the Dragon's most trusted advisors.  He is holding
the Sun Throne for Elayne with the help of several Aes Sedai, the
support of a number of minor Houses, and the Aiel?  He led the
Cairhienin in the Battle of Dumai's Wells.  It is said that Dobraine
believes in keeping to the letter of his oaths, and he cannot be
swayed from his loyalty to Rand and his duty to see Elayne set on
the Sun Throne.  Not all are happy with Dobraine ruling Cairhien.
Some might support Toram Riatin if he returns.
`2House Annallin`7
House Annallin is a minor House, and was in support of Colavaer when
she tried to take the Sun Throne.  However, the House's loyalties are
dubious in that they also begged assistance from the Dragon Reborn
for aid against the Shaido.
`2House Chuliandred`7
A House of middling power in Cairhien, they could cause trouble
for Elayne in her bid for the Sun Throne.  High Seat Doressin
Chuliandred supported Colavaere in her attempt to gain the Sun
Throne, but it is said that he has bent the knee to the Lord Dragon.
He and Dobraine Saighan were boyhood friends, so it is likely that
he will side with his boyhood friend in any conflicts regarding
the Sun Throne.  Another member of House Chuliandred, Lady Alaine,
is said to run around dressed in boy's clothing (like Min).  She
is married, and yet is rumored to have tried to seduce Rand.
`2House Darengil`7
This is a fairly minor House, and it it loyal to Rand.  Most
probably, it will side with Elayne when the time comes. (OOC: One of
its members, Lady Selande, is currently in Ghealdan with Perrin
and Faile, and she is the leader of the Cha Faile society that
pretends to act like Aiel.)
`2House Delovinde`7
Loyal to Rand.  Talmanes Delovinde serves in the Band of the Red
Hand under Mat, and is currently in Murandy bringing King Roedran
into Rand's fold.  House Delovinde is a fairly major House, though
not as great as Taborwin or Saighan.
`2House Dagonred`7
Loyal to Rand.  Merisin Dagonred is a member of the Band of
the Red Hand.
`2House Dhulaine`7
This House is said to have strong connections with the White Tower,
and therefore, it is likely to side with Elayne when the time comes.
Lady Arilyn Dhulaine is said to occasionally house some of the Aes
Sedai loyal to Rand.
`2House Hamarashle`7

`7Subj`6:`7 Phase 1: Results
`7CC`6: `7Aldor Larissa
These are the results of your 'feeling out' which Houses are loyal
to Rand, plus some extra information.  Use it as you see fit.  Let me
know when you want to start Phase 2.  I am willing to NPC any nobles you
might wish to try to convince to join your cause.
`2House Damodred`7
Currently, Caraline Damodred is the High Seat of House Damodred.
She is currently in Tear, assisting Lord Darlin Sisnera with his
rebellion against Rand.  Caraline Damodred has sworn allegience
to Rand, as has Darlin Sisnera, but things become complicated here
because the people of Tear want Darlin as their King, and this is
the source of the rebellion in Tear. It is said that Darlin Sisnera
is currently trying to woo Caraline, but she has thus far refused his
advances.  She has left Larissa 'in charge' while she is away, but
this does not make Larissa the official head of the House in all
matters. Caraline could return at any time to reclaim her rights
as High Seat.
`2House Riatin`7
Toram Riatin was the High Seat of House Riatin.  It is said that
before he disappeared, he had hired the remnants of the White
Lions from Andor to fill out the ranks of his rebel army during
the civil war, before Rand restored order to Cairhien.  This
army was either dispersed or killed in the midst of some strange,
unnatural fog south of Cairhien. Toram's whereabouts are currently
unknown, and so his sister, Ailil Riatin, has taken charge of the
House for now.  It is said that she is loyal to Rand, unlike her
brother, but one never knows with House Riatin.

he is one of the most powerful men in Cairhien.  He is cousin to
the late Lady Colavaere Saighan, who's attempt to take the Sun
Throne ended with Rand expelling her to a farm, and her subsequent
suicide.  Bertome considers his cousin to have been overly ambitious.

`7From`6:`7 Eala
`7Subj`6:`7 Second demand!! :-)
What -I- wanted!!
Eala's throat is encased in a thick and
apparently heavy collar made of
dark, yet glittering metal. Possibly
steel, or even pure silver. It wraps
around the woman's otherwise delicate
and smooth neck, the dark metal
contrasting sharply with her pale
skin. It's rather wide, perhaps two
inches, yet she seems not to notice
the weight or thickness of it. Or
at least be hindered openly by such
a thing. Spaced evenly along each side
of her neck are dark, nearly black
stones set in thin metal prongs.
To match, at th center of her delicate
throat, is a much larger version of the
same dark stone, that catches the light
quite nicely despite it's pitch. Her
long darl hair usually hides whats
beneath, but on occassion
the lock of the collar, complete
with its own silver-linked chain
handily attached, can be seen dangling down between
her shoulderblades.

`7From`6:`7 Hayden
`7Subj`6:`7 Ter'angrel
As requested here is my background, and my proposal for what I would like to do with ter'angrel talents.

My name is Hayden Velin. I was born the youngest of 3 siblings to Jorik Velin and Merilla Velin. The owners of the Dancing Cartman Tavern in Whitebridge. As the youngest child of 3. My sister Portia is the oldest. My brother Kellan is the middle child. I am the youngest child.

As a family, we were not poor yet by no means at all were we rich in any way, shape or form. I would say that we were middle class to well off family due to the size of our tavern and the popularity it had in Whitebridge. Everyone knew the Velin family from the nobles to the peddlers who would stay in our tavern many a night listening to the resident Gleeman.

As children, we were all expected to learn the daily activities of what it mean to run a successful tavern. However, as we got to a certain age and my parents saw where our talents were leading us. My mother made a point to get my father to support us and guide us in the direction the pattern was being woven before us. My sister, she became a seamstress and in time, the wife of the local Magisterate.

My brother, a fighter felt his calling was to join the Whitebridge Guards, and later the pull of the Light where he decided to become a Child of the Light. My father was very proud of him when he joined the Whitecloaks. I on the other hand felt uneasy by his choice for some odd reason.

I showing a talent for talking, my father began to expect that I would one day take over the tavern until I asked if I could start attending history classes with the Gleeman. I began to learn all the tales of Legends. I loved learning, and before I knew it at the age of 11, I got mother and father to start building a library in the back of the Tavern. I would use my allowance and but a book a week on any subject I could get my hands on to learn of the world.

My future was still unclear to me at the age of 15. I was still at the tavern, cleaning, cooking, serving, chopping wood, and making ale all he while reading a book. The locals would make fun of me for being a book worm. As the years began to pass, I expected that I would only see the world through books and never experience what the world would be like as a man. That all changed when I was 17 years old one night when my brother and a few of his "friends" came home to visit.

While in the main hall of the Tavern, a pair of men all in black came in and the Whitecloaks went all tense. I had heard rumors that the Dragon Reborn had in fact been found and was massing an army. The Whitecloaks began to call these men Darkfriends and tensions began to rise. A scuffle started to happen when mother was knocked down by one of the Whitecloaks and I yelled so loudly at him that it distracted everyone from the fact I had caused the beam over the group of Whitecloaks to break and snap in half with an impact of Air, I had channeled.

The Whitecloaks paid for the damages of the broken beam because they thought it happened in the scuffle where as I in fact did it. I remember getting so sick that night when the two men in black returned to speak to my parents. My mother white as a ghost walked in and began to hug and kiss me, where my father threw my clothes in a bag. I was told I would be going with these men and that I would was never to return back to Whitebridge to see my parents.
(Background by two coming up)

`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
`7From`6:`7 Jezz
`7Subj`6:`7 response
Tell me what you think

First, I think Policy Roleplay as a whole is meant for a larger playerbase of 50+. We do not have those numbers and the policy should fit for the amount of players we currently have. We have multiple players who play various characters so there is more enrichment and wordly events, otherwise, everyone would be hanging out in the White Tower.

If Events/Guild Departments are running an event than all in the room should be IC. It avoids passive aggressive emotes by those participating to those who are not and makes it more fun for those attending the event.

I generally don't mind ooc idlers watching public RP since if they see something interesting they might join in. If we want to reduce the confusion of who is IC or OOC, than a there should be a toggle IC/OOC that can be seen in a LOOK. (It's also something I've seen on MUSH's and since Tyme is a faux MUD, it should be considered.)

General public RP should be fun, but by restricting mention of pop culture references in general rp is a passive-aggressive attack on those who do use those references to make their rp more fun by linking what they see someone doing to something everyone can relate to. However, if the Event/Guild Departments want a more stringent rp atmosphere, especially for rechecking logs later for discrepencies, than the policy should reflect that, allowing a more carefree RP atmosphere other times.
We don't have the player base for this list of rules and stifling of RP styles. It will only serve to drive people away.

`7From`6:`7 Jezz
`7Subj`6:`7 Aya
`7CC`6: `7Ayasha Cerrim Syrah Acral
Aya
I think there is a misunderstanding somewhere.
Last Thursday you told me you were excited about getting the Rescue Sabine
plot line done and we would talk about it on Friday after your interview.
You also told me you would be on over the weekend. You didn't show up on
Friday, Saturday, or Sunday. Sunday evening I wrote my email. I still
didn't see you on Tyme on Monday, hence the nudge. Imagine how I felt
being told one thing, and being flaked on. If there was a verbal "I need a
break" message, it was never told to me.
I added you to the Google docs of recent rp and the rp that had been done
from Jezz and Cerrim leading up to our stuck spot. You wanted logs. I sent
them to you. Please do not give me shit for doing exactly what you asked
of me. I sent one more email giving you the heads-up about what the logs
were about (since I wasn't able to comment on the Google doc link). I let
you know about the email on FB because I remember you telling me once
that you don't check that account  very often. Or maybe it was the other
account. Hmm. I hate getting old.
I added Savina, despite knowing Savina couldn't do anything, because I was
drawing Wyl into it for TAR help in finding Sabine. Jezz knows Wyl, but
not on a personal friendship level yet. I know he can't reach the place
where dreamers are ('Gap of Infinity' is the Theoryland name for the place
Egwene goes to find dreams.), but once we have a bead on a location, or
a building, he could help narrow it down from clues within TAR. He's also
got the wolves, and could help with tracking - which might come in more
useful than anything they did in TAR.
We discussed Tear. At no point did I ever say I was doing two different
things on the same day or in the same hour, or at the same moment between
two or three cities. Ever. I've set out a timeline for Jezz (accounting
student and all-I budget my time), I know it can be frustrating for others
but this is how my brain works.
The timeline for Tear is as follows:
`^-`7Go to Tear for no more than 2 days.
Allow Vaelin to rest and give him things to do to gain his bearings and
wits about him. Listen for rumors. Get rental. Leave for Caemlyn -- Done.
Rumors I'm looking for are if there are Aiel or Aes Sedai in Tear. Period.
According to the end of Book 10, Rand is still in Tear, or just outside. I
would assume some Aiel are still around. Even old rumors of Aiel would be
fine. Jezz gives zero fucks other than finding out about Aiel and Aes
Sedai. She is in Tear to plan an assassination, not a picnic. The common
room rp wasn't necessary. Sorry if you felt it was.
If you need help determining the rumors I need, here's a suggestion.
Roll the dice.
1-5: no useful information found in the 2 days in Tear.
6-10: Only felt and/or seen Aes Sedai in Tear -or- Definitely no Aes Sedai.
11-15: Only saw Aiel occasionally -or- Absolutely no Aiel in Tear.
16-20 Saw both Aiel and Aes Sedai -or- Definitely saw neither.
Bam. Done.
`^-`7Caemlyn. Save Sabine. - In progress
However long this takes IC time. Jezz wont focus on anything else than
saving Sabine, now that they are in Caemlyn.
This includes trying to find Sabine's dream.
Here is my research on warded dreams:
Warding dreams, according to this source, is based on the OP, and needs to
be channeled. http://wot.wikia.com/wiki/Ward
According to Moiraine, she wards her dreams each night without thinking:

Aes Sedai learn to shield their dreams. I do it without thinking, when I 
sleep. Warders are given something much the same in the bonding. The 
Gaidin could not do what they must if the Shadow could steal into their 
dreams. We are all vulnerable when we sleep, and the Shadow is strong 
in the night.
TDR
Interview:
SHARON PERDUE
Did Egwene as Amyrlin happen to be watching people's dreams while Rand was
shielded?
ROBERT JORDAN
I'm not quite sure I understand the question. Again?
SHARON PERDUE
Since Rand was shielded and couldn't form any wards on his dreams could
Egwene have spied out that he was in trouble while in Tel'aran'rhiod?
ROBERT JORDAN
Ah. Yes, she could have. The problem is, when you've learned that
something is impossible, you have a tendency to stop trying it. She just
didn't try to spy during the period in question.
http://www.theoryland.com/intvmain.php?i=26
Extinguishing her lamps, she wove a ward to keep her dreams from affecting
anyone else's - that could happen with those who could channel: others
nearby could find themselves sharing your dreams - and crawled beneath her
blankets.
-New Spring, The Human Heart, pg 93
http://books.google.com/book

`7From`6:`7 Jezz
`7Subj`6:`7 Aya
`7CC`6: `7Ayasha Cerrim Syrah Acral
Aya
I think there is a misunderstanding somewhere.
Last Thursday you told me you were excited about getting the Rescue Sabine
plot line done and we would talk about it on Friday after your interview.
You also told me you would be on over the weekend. You didn't show up on
Friday, Saturday, or Sunday. Sunday evening I wrote my email. I still
didn't see you on Tyme on Monday, hence the nudge. Imagine how I felt
being told one thing, and being flaked on. If there was a verbal "I need a
break" message, it was never told to me.
I added you to the Google docs of recent rp and the rp that had been done
from Jezz and Cerrim leading up to our stuck spot. You wanted logs. I sent
them to you. Please do not give me shit for doing exactly what you asked
of me. I sent one more email giving you the heads-up about what the logs
were about (since I wasn't able to comment on the Google doc link). I let
you know about the email on FB because I remember you telling me once
that you don't check that account  very often. Or maybe it was the other
account. Hmm. I hate getting old.
I added Savina, despite knowing Savina couldn't do anything, because I was
drawing Wyl into it for TAR help in finding Sabine. Jezz knows Wyl, but
not on a personal friendship level yet. I know he can't reach the place
where dreamers are ('Gap of Infinity' is the Theoryland name for the place
Egwene goes to find dreams.), but once we have a bead on a location, or
a building, he could help narrow it down from clues within TAR. He's also
got the wolves, and could help with tracking - which might come in more
useful than anything they did in TAR.
We discussed Tear. At no point did I ever say I was doing two different
things on the same day or in the same hour, or at the same moment between
two or three cities. Ever. I've set out a timeline for Jezz (accounting
student and all-I budget my time), I know it can be frustrating for others
but this is how my brain works.
The timeline for Tear is as follows:
`^-`7Go to Tear for no more than 2 days.
Allow Vaelin to rest and give him things to do to gain his bearings and
wits about him. Listen for rumors. Get rental. Leave for Caemlyn -- Done.
Rumors I'm looking for are if there are Aiel or Aes Sedai in Tear. Period.
According to the end of Book 10, Rand is still in Tear, or just outside. I
would assume some Aiel are still around. Even old rumors of Aiel would be
fine. Jezz gives zero fucks other than finding out about Aiel and Aes
Sedai. She is in Tear to plan an assassination, not a picnic. The common
room rp wasn't necessary. Sorry if you felt it was.
If you need help determining the rumors I need, here's a suggestion.
Roll the dice.
1-5: no useful information found in the 2 days in Tear.
6-10: Only felt and/or seen Aes Sedai in Tear -or- Definitely no Aes Sedai.
11-15: Only saw Aiel occasionally -or- Absolutely no Aiel in Tear.
16-20 Saw both Aiel and Aes Sedai -or- Definitely saw neither.
Bam. Done.
`^-`7Caemlyn. Save Sabine. - In progress
However long this takes IC time. Jezz wont focus on anything else than
saving Sabine, now that they are in Caemlyn.
This includes trying to find Sabine's dream.

`7From`6:`7 Jezz
`7Subj`6:`7 mpd/did
The leap of logic in this article which supposedly debunks "mental
health fiction" is amazing. From the fact that the alter personalities of
people with dissociative disorders are connected in some way, the authors
jump to the conclusion that such people would therefore be better
diagnosed with borderline or bipolar disorders, as though dissociative
disorders do not exist! All diagnoses are, in a way, fiction - therapists'
or researchers' conclusions based on their experience. Dissociative
Identity Disorder has sound evidence for its existence, plus clear theory
to explain it, unlike those other supposed disorders. Those of us who
specialize in dissociative disorders have never argued that the different
part-selves are separate people and should be judged separately in court.
We regard them more as different circuits in the same brain, each circuit
being activated separately. Severe developmental trauma prevented the
direct connection of these circuits, resulting in relatively independent
part-selves, each representing a particular emotional state or set of
memories.
Alison Miller, Ph.D., Psychologist
A comment from this: http://www.scientificamerican.com/article.cfm?id=can-people-have-multiple-personalities&page=2
Thought I'd pass it on.
Jezz
